translated: whose stanzas he wanted to recite he extols by way of their common characteristics in name, clan, and virtue, saying, “Those of such a name” and so on.

original: vuttaṃ. Asādhāraṇato pana tattha tattha gāthāsveva āvibhavissati. Tattha yathānāmāti
analyzed: vuttam asādhāraṇato pana tattha tattha gāthāsu eva āvi bhavissati tattha yathānāmā ti
translated: But their uncommon characteristics will be shown in the stanzas themselves.

original: yaṃyaṃnāmā, subhūti mahākoṭṭhikotiādinā nayena nāmadheyyena paññātāti attho. Yathāgottāti
analyzed: yaṃ yaṃnāmā subhūti mahākoṭṭhikā uti ādinā nayena nāmadheyyena paññātā ati atthaḥ yathāgottā ti
translated: Herein, “Those of such a name” means those who are known by this or that name, in the manner of Subhuti, Maha Kotthita, and so on.

original: yaṃyaṃgottā, gotamo kassapotiādinā nayena kulapadesena yāya yāya jātiyā paññātāti
analyzed: yaṃ yaṃ gottā gotamo kassapaḥ iti ādinā nayena kula padesena yāya yāya jātiyā paññātā ati
translated: “Of such a clan” means those who are known by this or that clan, in the manner of Gotama, Kassapa, and so on.

original: attho. Yathādhammavihārinoti yādisadhammavihārino, pariyattiparamatāyaṃ aṭṭhatvā
analyzed: atthaḥ yathā dhamma vihārino ti aṭṭhatvā
translated: “Of such a way of life” means those who live in such a way, not by the extreme of indulgence in sense pleasures,

original: yathānurūpaṃ samāpattivihārino hutvā vihariṃsūti attho. Atha vā yathādhammavihārinoti
analyzed: yathānurūpam samāpatti vihārinaḥ hutvā vihariṃsu iti atthaḥ atha vā yathā dhamma vihārino ti
translated: Or else, “they lived in accordance with the Dhamma” means

original: yathādhammā vihārino ca, yādisasīlādidhammā dibbavihārādīsu abhiṇhaso viharamānā🔽yādisavihārā cāti attho. Yathādhimuttāti yādisaadhimuttikā saddhādhimuttipaññādhimuttīsu
analyzed: yathā dhammāḥ vihārino ca yādisa sīla ādi dhammāḥ dibba vihāra ādīsu viharamānā  ca ati atthaḥ yathā adhimuttā ati yādisa adhimuttikā saddhā adhimutti paññā adhimuttīsu
translated: that they lived in the way that accords with the Dhamma of virtue, etc., and that they lived frequently in the divine abidings, etc.🔽“They lived in accordance with their respective attainments” means that they lived in the way that accords with their respective attainments of virtue, etc., and that they lived in the way that accords with their respective abidings in the divine abidings, etc.

original: yaṃyaṃadhimuttikā suññatamukhādīsu vā yathā yathā nibbānaṃ adhimuttāti yathādhimuttā.
analyzed: yaṃ yaṃ adhimuttikā suññata mukha ādīsu vā yathā yathā nibbānam adhimuttā ati yathā adhimuttā
translated: Or else, “they lived in accordance with their respective attainments” means that they lived in the way that accords with their respective inclinations to faith, etc., or to the emptiness of self, etc., and that they lived in the way that accords with their respective inclinations to Nibbāna.

original: “Nibbānaṃ adhimuttānaṃ, atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā”ti hi vuttaṃ. Ubhayañcetaṃ pubbabhāgavasena
analyzed: nibbānam adhimuttānam attham gacchanti āsavā ti hi vuttam ubhayam ca etam pubba bhāga vasena
translated: For it is said: “For those who are inclined to Nibbāna, the cankers come to an end” .🔽And both of these should be understood as pertaining to the earlier stage,

original: veditabbaṃ. Arahattappattito pubbeyeva hi yathāvuttamadhimuccanaṃ, na parato. Tenāha bhagavā –
analyzed: veditabbam arahatta ppattitaḥ pubbe iya iva hi yathāvuttam adhimuccanam na paratas tena āha bhagavā
translated: for the inclination mentioned is to the attainment of the noble paths, not to the attainment of the fruit of arahantship. Hence the Blessed One said:

original: “Assaddho akataññū ca, sandhicchedo ca yo naro”tiādi..
analyzed: assaddhaḥ a kataññū ca sandhi chedaḥ ca yaḥ nara uti ādi
translated: “The faithless, the ingrates, and those who break their word,

original: “Yathāvimuttā”ti vā pāṭho, paññāvimuttiubhatobhāgavimuttīsu yaṃyaṃvimuttikāti attho.
analyzed: yathā vimuttā iti vā pāṭho paññā vimutti ubhatobhāga vimuttīsu yaṃ yaṃ vimuttikā ati attho
translated: “They lived in accordance with their respective liberations” is another reading. The meaning is: they lived in the way that accords with their respective liberations, that is, with the liberation of wisdom and the double liberation .

original: Sappaññāti tihetukapaṭisandhipaññāya pārihārikapaññāya bhāvanāpaññāya cāti tividhāyapi
analyzed: sappaññā ti ti hetuka paṭisandhi paññāya pārihārika paññāya bhāvanā paññāya ca ati tividhāya api
translated: “Wise” : they were wise by the three kinds of wisdom, namely, the wisdom of the rebirth-linking, the wisdom of the life-continuum, and the wisdom of the process of development.

original: paññāya paññavanto. Vihariṃsūti tāya eva sappaññatāya yathāladdhena phāsuvihāreneva
analyzed: paññāya paññavantaḥ vihariṃsu iti tāya eva sappañña tāya yathā laddhena phāsu vihārena iva
translated: “They lived” : they lived by that very wisdom, by the comfort of living according to their attainment.

original: vasiṃsu. Atanditāti analasā, attahitapaṭipattiyaṃ yathābalaṃ parahitapaṭipattiyañca🔽uṭṭhānavantoti attho.
analyzed: vasiṃsu a tandita ati analasāḥ atta hita paṭipattiyam yathābalam para hita paṭipattiyam ca  uṭṭhānavanto ti attho
translated: “Unwearied” : they were not lazy; they were energetic in the practice of self-help and in the practice of helping others according to their ability.

original: Ettha ca pana nāmagottaggahaṇena tesaṃ therānaṃ pakāsapaññātabhāvaṃ dasseti. Dhammavihāraggahaṇena🔽sīlasampadaṃ samādhisampadañca dasseti. “Yathādhimuttā sappaññā”ti iminā paññāsampadaṃ.🔽“Atanditā”ti iminā sīlasampadādīnaṃ kāraṇabhūtaṃ vīriyasampadaṃ dasseti. “Yathānāmā”ti
analyzed: ettha ca pana nāma gotta ggahaṇena tesam therānam pakāsa paññāta bhāvam dasseti dhamma vihāra ggahaṇena  sīla sampadam samādhi sampadam ca dasseti yathā adhimuttā sappaññā ti iminā paññā sampadam  a tanditā iti iminā sīla sampad ādīnam kāraṇa bhūtam vīriya sampadam dasseti yathānāmā iti
translated: This is the meaning. And here the mention of their names and clans shows the fame of those elders.🔽The mention of their “dwelling in the Dhamma” shows their perfection of virtue and their perfection of concentration. The phrase “wise according to their understanding” shows their perfection of wisdom.🔽The phrase “unwearied” shows their perfection of energy, which is the cause of the perfections of virtue, etc. The phrase “each one by his name”

original: iminā tesaṃ pakāsananāmataṃ dasseti. “Yathāgottā”ti iminā saddhānusārīdhammānusārīgottasampattisamudāgamaṃ,
analyzed: iminā tesam pakāsana nāma tam dasseti yathā gottā iti iminā saddhā anusārī dhamma anusārī gotta sampatti samudāgamam
translated: shows their well-known names. The phrase “each one by his clan” shows the attainment of the clans of the faith-liberated and the Dhamma-follower.

original: “yathādhammavihārino”tiādinā sīlasamādhipaññāvimuttivimuttiñāṇadassanaṃ sampattisamudāgamaṃ,
analyzed: yathā dhamma vihārino ti ādinā sīla samādhi paññā vimutti vimutti ñāṇa dassanam sampatti samudāgamam
translated: “Dwelt in line with the Dhamma” shows the attainment of the excellence of virtue, concentration, wisdom, freedom, and knowledge and vision of freedom.

original: “atanditā”ti iminā evaṃ attahitasampattiyaṃ ṭhitānaṃ parahitapaṭipattiṃ dasseti.
analyzed: a tanditā iti iminā evam atta hita sampattiyam ṭhitānam para hita paṭipattim dasseti
translated: “Not lazy” shows the practice of benefitting others for those who are established in the excellence of benefitting themselves.

original: Atha vā “yathānāmā”ti idaṃ tesaṃ therānaṃ garūhi gahitanāmadheyyadassanaṃ samaññāmattakittanato.🔽“Yathāgottā”ti idaṃ kulaputtabhāvadassanaṃ kulāpadesa kittanato. Tena nesaṃ saddhāpabbajitabhāvaṃ
analyzed: atha vā yathā nāma ati idam tesam therānam garūhi gahita nāmadheyya dassanam samaññā matta kittanato  yathāgottā iti idam kula putta bhāva dassanam kula apadesa kittanato tena nesam saddhā pabbajita bhāvam
translated: Or else, “By such a name” shows the names by which those Elders were addressed by their teachers, and it shows their fame as mere conventional expressions.🔽“By such a clan” shows that they were sons of good families, and it shows their fame as the designation of their families. translated: In the time of the Supremely Enlightened One Kassapa he went forth again and lived as a forest dweller, fulfilling the duties of going and coming.

original: mahāsāvakabhāvaṃ pāpuṇantā nāma natthi. Gatapaccāgatavattaṃ pana āgamaṭṭhakathāsu🔽vuttanayeneva veditabbaṃ. So vīsativassasahassāni gatapaccāgatavattaṃ pūretvā kālaṅkatvā
analyzed: mahāsāvaka bhāvam pāpuṇantā nāma natthi gata paccāgata vattam pana āgama aṭṭhakathāsu  vutta nayena iva veditabbam saḥ vīsati vassa sahassāni gata paccāgata vattam pūretvā kālaṅkatvā
translated: For it is said that there is no one who has attained the state of a great disciple without fulfilling this duty.🔽But the duty of going and coming should be understood in the way stated in the commentaries.🔽After fulfilling the duty of going and coming for twenty thousand years, he died and was reborn in the Tāvatiṃsa heaven in the sense-sphere heavenly world.

original: kāmāvacaradevaloke tāvatiṃsabhavane nibbatti. Vuttañhetaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: kāmāvacara deva loke tāvatiṃsa bhavane nibbatti vuttam ha etam apadāne
translated: For this is said in the Apadāna:🔽“Not far from the Himalayas

original: “Himavantassāvidūre, nisabho nāma pabbato;
analyzed: himavantassa avidūre nisabhaḥ nāma pabbataḥ
translated: is a mountain named Nisabha;🔽My hermitage was well laid out,

original: Assamo sukato mayhaṃ, paṇṇasālā sumāpitā.
analyzed: assamaḥ su kataḥ mayham paṇṇa sālā su māpitā
translated: my leaf hut well constructed.🔽“My name was Kosiya,

original: “Kosiyo nāma nāmena, jaṭilo uggatāpano;
analyzed: kosiyaḥ nāma nāmena jaṭilaḥ uggatāpanaḥ
translated: I was a matted-haired ascetic, a fire-worshipper;🔽Alone, without a companion,

original: Ekākiyo adutiyo, vasāmi nisabhe tadā.
analyzed: ekākiyaḥ adutiyaḥ vasāmi nisabhe tadā
translated: I lived then on Nisabha.

original: “Phalaṃ mūlañca paṇṇañca, na bhuñjāmi ahaṃ tadā;
analyzed: phalam mūlam ca paṇṇam ca na bhuñjāmi aham tadā
translated: “I did not eat roots or leaves,

original: Pavattaṃva supātāhaṃ, upajīvāmi tāvade.
analyzed: su pātā aham upajīvāmi tāvade
translated: but lived on what I had gathered.

original: “Nāhaṃ kopemi ājīvaṃ, cajamānopi jīvitaṃ;
analyzed: na aham kopemi ājīvam cajamānaḥ api jīvitam
translated: “I did not give up my livelihood, even when giving up my life;

original: Ārādhemi sakaṃ cittaṃ, vivajjemi anesanaṃ.
analyzed: ārādhemi sakam cittam vivajjemi an esanam
translated: I pleased my own mind, and abandoned the search for sensual pleasures.

original: “Rāgūpasaṃhitaṃ cittaṃ, yadā uppajjate mama;
analyzed: rāgū upasaṃhitam cittam yadā uppajjate mama
translated: “When a mind connected with lust arose in me,

original: Sayaṃva paccavekkhāmi, ekaggo taṃ damemahaṃ.
analyzed: sayam va paccavekkhāmi ekaggaḥ tam damemaham
translated: I myself reviewed it, and being one-pointed, I controlled it.

original: “Rajjase rajjanīye ca, dussanīye ca dussase;
analyzed: rajjase rajjanīye ca dussanīye ca dussase
translated: “You are excited by what is exciting, and angered by what is angering;

original: Muyhase mohanīye ca, nikkhamassu vanā tuvaṃ.
analyzed: muyhase mohanīye ca nikkhamassu vanā tuvam
translated: You are deluded by what is deluding—get out of the forest!

original: “Visuddhānaṃ ayaṃ vāso, nimmalānaṃ tapassinaṃ;
analyzed: visuddhānam ayam vāsaḥ nimmalānam tapassinam
translated: “This is the dwelling of the pure, of those free from defilements, of the ascetics;

original: Mā kho visuddhaṃ dūsesi, nikkhamassu vanā tuvaṃ.
analyzed: mā kho visuddham dūsesi nikkhamassu vanā tuvam
translated: Do not defile the pure—get out of the forest!

original: “Agāriko bhavitvāna, yadā puttaṃ labhissasi;
analyzed: agārikaḥ bhavitvāna yadā puttam labhissasi
translated: “Having become a householder, when you get a son,

original: Ubhopi mā virādhesi, nikkhamassu vanā tuvaṃ.
analyzed: ubhau api mā virādhesi nikkhamassu vanā tuvam
translated: do not disappoint both of them—get out of the forest!

original: “Chavālātaṃ yathā kaṭṭhaṃ, na kvaci kiccakārakaṃ;
analyzed: chava alātam yathā kaṭṭham na kvacid kicca kārakam
translated: “Like a piece of wood from a pyre, useless anywhere,

original: Neva gāme araññe vā, na hi taṃ kaṭṭhasammataṃ.
analyzed: na iva gāme araññe vā na hi tam kaṭṭha sammatam
translated: neither in the village nor in the forest is it considered wood.

original: “Chavālātūpamo tvaṃ si, na gihī nāpi saññato;
analyzed: tvam si na gihī na api saññato
translated: “You are like a piece of wood from a pyre, neither a householder nor a monk;

original: Ubhato muttako ajja, nikkhamassu vanā tuvaṃ.
analyzed: ubhatas muttakaḥ ajja nikkhamassu vanā tuvam
translated: You are free from both, so leave the forest today.

original: “Siyā nu kho tava etaṃ, ko pajānāti te idaṃ;
analyzed: siyāḥ nu khalu tava etam kaḥ u pajānāti te idam
translated: “Might it be that you don’t know this:

original: Saddhādhuraṃ vahisi me, kosajjabahulāya ca.
analyzed: saddhā dhuram vahisi me kosajja bahulāya ca
translated: You carry my burden of faith, but you are full of laziness.

original: “Jigucchissanti taṃ viññū, asuciṃ nāgariko yathā;
analyzed: jigucchissanti tam viññū asucim nāgarikaḥ yathā
translated: “The discerning will be disgusted with you, like a townsman with filth.

original: Ākaḍḍhitvāna isayo, codayissanti taṃ sadā.
analyzed: ākaḍḍhitvānaḥ isayaḥ codayissanti tam sadā
translated: The seers will drag you away and constantly reproach you.

original: “Taṃ viññū pavadissanti, samatikkantasāsanaṃ;
analyzed: tam viññū pavadissanti samatikkanta sāsanam
translated: “The discerning will criticize you, who have gone beyond the teaching.

original: Saṃvāsaṃ alabhanto hi, kathaṃ jīvihisi tuvaṃ.
analyzed: saṃvāsam a labhantaḥ hi katham jīvihisi tuvam
translated: Not getting to live together, how will you live?

original: “Tidhāpabhinnaṃ mātaṅgaṃ, kuñjaraṃ saṭṭhihāyanaṃ;
analyzed: tidhā apabhinnam mātaṅgam kuñjaram saṭṭhihāyanam
translated: “The elephant Mātaṅga, split into three, with sixty tusks,

original: Balī nāgo upagantvā, yūthā nīharate gajaṃ.
analyzed: balī nāgaḥ upagantvā yūthā nīharate gajam
translated: the powerful elephant, having approached, leads the herd away from the herd.

original: “Yūthā vinissaṭo santo, sukhaṃ sātaṃ na vindati;
analyzed: sukham sātam na vindati
translated: “Having been expelled from the herd, he finds no happiness or bliss.

original: Dukkhito vimano hoti, pajjhāyanto pavedhati.
analyzed: dukkhitaḥ vimanaḥ hoti pajjhāyantaḥ pavedhati
translated: Distressed and dejected, he wanders around.

original: “Tatheva jaṭilā tampi, nīharissanti dummatiṃ;
analyzed: tathā iva jaṭilā tam pi nīharissanti dummatim
translated: “In the same way, the ascetics will lead you away, you of evil mind.

original: Tehi tvaṃ nissaṭo santo, sukhaṃ sātaṃ na lacchasi.
analyzed: tehi tvam nissaṭaḥ santaḥ sukham sātam na lacchasi
translated: Expelled by them, you will find no happiness or bliss.

original: “Divā vā yadi vā rattiṃ, sokasallasamappito;
analyzed: divā vā yadi vā rattim soka salla samappito
translated: “Whether by day or by night, afflicted by the dart of sorrow,

original: Dayhati pariḷāhena, gajo yūthāva nissaṭo.
analyzed: dayhati pariḷāhena gajaḥ nissaṭaḥ
translated: you burn with fever, like the elephant expelled from the herd.”

original: “Jātarūpaṃ yathā kūṭaṃ, neva jhāyati katthaci;
analyzed: jātarūpam yathā kūṭam na iva jhāyati katthacid
translated: “Just as a lump of gold does not burn, though it be in fire,

original: Tathā sīlavīhino tvaṃ, na jhāyissasi katthaci.
analyzed: tathā sīlavīhinaḥ tvam na jhāyissasi katthaci
translated: So, lacking in virtue, you will not shine anywhere.

original: “Agāraṃ vasamānopi, kathaṃ jīvihisi tuvaṃ;
analyzed: agāram vasamānaḥ upi katham jīvihisi tuvam
translated: “How will you live, even while living in a house?

original: Mattikaṃ pettikañcāpi, natthi te nihitaṃ dhanaṃ.
analyzed: mattikam pettikam ca api na atthi te nihitam dhanam
translated: You have no stored-up wealth, no earthenware or wicker vessels.

original: “Sayaṃ kammaṃ karitvāna, gatte sedaṃ pamocayaṃ;
analyzed: sayam kammam karitvāna gatte sa idam pamocayam
translated: “Having done the work yourself, you will wash your limbs in sweat.

original: Evaṃ jīvihisi gehe, sādhu te taṃ na ruccati.
analyzed: evam jīvihisi gehe sādhu te tam na ruccati
translated: Thus you will live in the house. It is good that you do not like it.

original: “Evāhaṃ tattha vāremi, saṃkilesagataṃ manaṃ;
analyzed: eva aham tattha vāremi saṃkilesa gatam manam
translated: “Thus I restrained my mind, which was given to corruption.

original: Nānādhammakathaṃ katvā, pāpā cittaṃ nivārayiṃ.
analyzed: nānā dhamma katham katvā pāpā cittam
translated: Having told various stories, I turned the mind away from evil.

original: “Evaṃ me viharantassa, appamādavihārino;
analyzed: evam me viharantassa appamāda vihārino
translated: “Thus, while I was living thus, living heedfully,

original: Tiṃsavassasahassāni, vipine me atikkamuṃ.
analyzed: tiṃsa vassa sahassāni vipine me atikkamun
translated: Thirty thousand years passed by in the forest.

original: “Appamādarataṃ disvā, uttamatthaṃ gavesakaṃ;
analyzed: appamāda ratam disvā uttamattham gavesakam
translated: “Seeing me delighting in heedfulness, seeking the supreme goal,

original: Padumuttarasambuddho, āgacchi mama santikaṃ.
analyzed: padumuttara sambuddhaḥ āgacchi mama santikam
translated: The Sambuddha Padumuttara came to me.

original: “Timbarūsakavaṇṇābho, appameyyo anūpamo;
analyzed: timbarūsaka vaṇṇa ābhaḥ appameyyaḥ anūpamaḥ
translated: “Having the colour of a timbaru flower, immeasurable, incomparable,

original: Rūpenāsadiso buddho, ākāse caṅkamī tadā.
analyzed: rūpena asadisaḥ buddhaḥ ākāse caṅkamī tadā
translated: The Buddha, who had no equal in looks, walked in the air then.

original: “Suphullo sālarājāva, vijjūvabbhaghanantare;
analyzed: suphullaḥ
translated: “Like a flowering sāl-tree king, between flashes of lightning,

original: Ñāṇenāsadiso buddho, ākāse caṅkamī tadā.
analyzed: ñāṇena asadisaḥ buddhaḥ ākāse caṅkamī tadā
translated: The Buddha, unequalled in knowledge, walked in the air.

original: “Sīharājāvasambhīto, gajarājāva dappito;
analyzed: sīha rājā avasambhītaḥ gaja rājā ava dappitaḥ
translated: “Like a fearless lion-king, like an elephant-king in full rut,

original: Lāsīto byaggharājāva, ākāse caṅkamī tadā.
analyzed: ākāse caṅkamī tadā
translated: Like a peacock-king in full cry, he walked in the air.

original: “Siṅghīnikkhasavaṇṇābho, khadiraṅgārasannibho;
analyzed: siṅghī nikkhasa vaṇṇa ābho khadira aṅgāra sannibhaḥ
translated: “Golden-hued like a golden reed, like a charcoal-black acacia tree,

original: Maṇi yathā jotiraso, ākāse caṅkamī tadā.
analyzed: maṇi yathā ākāse caṅkamī tadā
translated: Like the radiance of a gem, he walked in the air.

original: “Visuddhakelāsanibho, puṇṇamāyeva candimā;
analyzed: visuddha kelāsa nibhaḥ puṇṇa māyā iva candimā
translated: “Shining like a pure crystal, like the full moon,

original: Majjhanhikeva sūriyo, ākāse caṅkamī tadā.
analyzed: majjhanhikā iva sūriyaḥ ākāse caṅkamī tadā
translated: Like the sun at midday, he walked in the air.

original: “Disvā nabhe caṅkamantaṃ, evaṃ cintesahaṃ tadā;
analyzed: disvā nabhe caṅkamantam evam cintesaham tadā
translated: “Having seen him walking in the sky, I thought thus at that time:

original: Devo nu kho ayaṃ satto, udāhu manujo ayaṃ.
analyzed: devaḥ nu khalu ayam sattaḥ udāhu manujaḥ ayam
translated: ‘Is this a god or a human being?’

original: “Na me suto vā diṭṭho vā, mahiyā ediso naro;
analyzed: na me sutaḥ vā diṭṭhaḥ vā mahiyā edisaḥ naraḥ
translated: “I have never heard of or seen such a man on earth;

original: Api mantapadaṃ atthi, ayaṃ satthā bhavissati.
analyzed: api manta padam atthi ayam satthā bhavissati
translated: Perhaps he is a teacher who possesses the words of the mantra.

original: “Evāhaṃ cintayitvāna, sakaṃ cittaṃ pasādayiṃ;
analyzed: eva aham cintayitvāna sakam cittam
translated: “Having thought thus, I delighted in my own mind;

original: Nānāpupphañca gandhañca, sannipātesahaṃ tadā.
analyzed: nānā puppham ca gandham ca sannipātesaham tadā
translated: I then gathered various flowers and fragrances.

original: “Pupphāsanaṃ paññāpetvā, sādhucittaṃ manoramaṃ;
analyzed: puppha āsanam paññāpetvā sādhu cittam manoramam
translated: “Having prepared a flower seat, with a good mind and delight,

original: Narasārathinaṃ aggaṃ, idaṃ vacanamabraviṃ.
analyzed: nara sārathinam aggam idam vacanam abravim
translated: I spoke these words to the foremost of men and charioteers:

original: “Idaṃ me āsanaṃ vīra, paññattaṃ tavanucchavaṃ;
analyzed: idam me āsanam vīra paññattam tava anucchavam
translated: “This seat is yours, O Hero, prepared for you, O Blessed One.

original: Hāsayanto mamaṃ cittaṃ, nisīda kusumāsane.
analyzed: hāsayantaḥ mamam cittam nisīda kusumāsane
translated: Please sit on this flowery seat and gladden my mind.”

original: “Nisīdi tattha bhagavā, asambhītova kesarī;
analyzed: nisīdi tattha bhagavā asambhītaḥ uva kesarī
translated: The Blessed One sat down on that seat, fearless like a lion,

original: Sattarattindivaṃ buddho, pavare kusumāsane.
analyzed: satta rattindivam buddhaḥ pavare kusumāsane
translated: and the Buddha sat on that excellent flowery seat for seven days and nights.

original: “Namassamāno aṭṭhāsiṃ, sattarattindivaṃ ahaṃ;
analyzed: namassamānaḥ aṭṭhāsim satta rattindivam aham
translated: For seven days and nights I stood there in reverence,

original: Vuṭṭhahitvā samādhimhā, satthā loke anuttaro;
analyzed: vuṭṭhahitvā samādhimhā satthā loke anuttaro
translated: and when the Buddha emerged from his concentration, the unsurpassed Teacher,

original: Mama kammaṃ pakittento, idaṃ vacanamabravi.
analyzed: mama kammam pakittentaḥ idam vacanam abravi
translated: he spoke these words, pointing out my deed:

original: “Bhāvehi buddhānussatiṃ, bhāvanānamanuttaraṃ;
analyzed: bhāvehi buddha anussatim bhāvanānam anuttaram
translated: “Develop the recollection of the Buddha, the unsurpassed development,

original: Imaṃ satiṃ bhāvayitvā, pūrayissasi mānasaṃ.
analyzed: imam satim bhāvayitvā pūrayissasi mānasam
translated: and by developing this mindfulness you will fulfill your wish.”

original: “Tiṃsakappasahassāni, devaloke ramissasi;
analyzed: tiṃsa kappa sahassāni deva loke ramissasi
translated: For twenty-one thousand eons you will delight in the heavenly world,

original: Asītikkhattuṃ devindo, devarajjaṃ karissasi;
analyzed: devindaḥ deva rajjam karissasi
translated: and eighty times you will be the lord of the gods, the king of the gods,

original: Sahassakkhattuṃ cakkavattī, rājā raṭṭhe bhavissasi.
analyzed: sahassa kkhattum cakkavattī rājā raṭṭhe bhavissasi
translated: and a thousand times you will be a universal monarch, a king in the realm.

original: “Padesarajjaṃ vipulaṃ, gaṇanāto asaṅkhiyaṃ;
analyzed: padesa rajjam vipulam gaṇanātaḥ asaṅkhiyam
translated: You will experience extensive dominion over a region, incalculable in number,

original: Anubhossasi taṃ sabbaṃ, buddhānussatiyā phalaṃ.
analyzed: anubhossasi tam sabbam buddha anussatiyā phalam
translated: all of this will be yours, the fruit of the recollection of the Buddha.

original: “Bhavābhave saṃsaranto, mahābhogaṃ labhissasi;
analyzed: bhava abhave saṃsarantaḥ mahā bhogam labhissasi
translated: Wandering in existence, you will obtain great wealth,

original: Bhoge te ūnatā natthi, buddhānussatiyā phalaṃ.
analyzed: bhoge te ūna tā natthi buddha anussatiyā phalam
translated: You will have no lack of enjoyments, this is the fruit of recollecting the Buddha.

original: “Kappasatasahassamhi, okkākakulasambhavo;
analyzed: kappa sata sahassamhi okkāka kula sambhavaḥ
translated: “In a period of a thousand koṭis of world-cycles, you will be born in the family of Okkāka.

original: Gotamo nāma gottena, satthā loke bhavissati.
analyzed: gotamaḥ nāma gottena satthā loke bhavissati
translated: You will be called Gotama by clan, and will become a Teacher in the world.

original: “Asītikoṭiṃ chaḍḍetvā, dāse kammakare bahū;
analyzed: asīti koṭim chaḍḍetvā dāse kammakare bahū
translated: “Having abandoned eighty koṭis of slaves and servants,

original: Gotamassa bhagavato, sāsane pabbajissasi.
analyzed: gotamassa bhagavato sāsane pabbajissasi
translated: you will go forth in the Dispensation of the Lord Gotama.

original: “Ārādhayitvā sambuddhaṃ, gotamaṃ sakyapuṅgavaṃ;
analyzed: ārādhayitvā sambuddham gotamam sakya puṅgavam
translated: “Having pleased the Sambuddha, Gotama, the Foremost of Sakyan clan,

original: Subhūti nāma nāmena, hessasi satthu sāvako.
analyzed: subhūti nāma nāmena hessasi satthu sāvakaḥ
translated: you will be called Subhūti, a disciple of the Teacher.

original: “Bhikkhusaṅghe nisīditvā, dakkhiṇeyyaguṇamhi taṃ;
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅghe nisīditvā dakkhiṇeyya guṇamhi tam
translated: “While you are seated in the Community of monks, you will be worthy of offerings in the matter of the special qualities.

original: Tathāraṇavihāre ca, dvīsu agge ṭhapessasi.
analyzed: tathā araṇa vihāre ca dvīsu agge ṭhapessasi
translated: And in the monastery of Tathāraṇa, you will be placed in the foremost position in two things.

original: “Idaṃ vatvāna sambuddho, jalajuttamanāmako;
analyzed: idam vatvāna sambuddhaḥ jalajuttama nāmakaḥ
translated: “Having spoken thus, the Sambuddha, the one called Jalajutta,

original: Nabhaṃ abbhuggamī vīro, haṃsarājāva ambare.
analyzed: nabham abbhuj gamī vīraḥ ambare
translated: the Hero, rose up into the sky like a king of swans in the sky.

original: “Sāsito lokanāthena, namassitvā tathāgataṃ;
analyzed: sa āsitaḥ lokanāthena namassitvā tathāgatam
translated: “Having been instructed by the Lord of the World, having paid homage to the Tathāgata,

original: Sadā bhāvemi mudito, buddhānussatimuttamaṃ.
analyzed: sadā bhāvemi muditaḥ buddha anussatim uttamam
translated: I always joyfully develop the supreme recollection of the Buddha.

original: “Tena kammena sukatena, cetanāpaṇidhīhi ca;
analyzed: tena kammena su katena cetanā paṇidhīhi ca
translated: “By that good deed, by the intention and the vow,

original: Jahitvā mānusaṃ dehaṃ, tāvatiṃsaṃ agacchahaṃ.
analyzed: jahitvā mānusam deham tāvatiṃsam agaccha aham
translated: having abandoned the human body, I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.

original: “Asītikkhattuṃ devindo, devarajjamakārayiṃ;
analyzed: devindaḥ deva rajjam akārayim
translated: For eighty times I was Sakka, king of the gods,

original: Sahassakkhattuṃ rājā ca, cakkavattī ahosahaṃ.
analyzed: sahassakkhattum rājā ca cakkavattī ahosaham
translated: And a thousand times I was a king, a monarch of the law.🔽I have enjoyed extensive local kingship,

original: “Padesarajjaṃ vipulaṃ, gaṇanāto asaṅkhiyaṃ;
analyzed: padesa rajjam vipulam gaṇanātaḥ asaṅkhiyam
translated: Incalculable times, by count; I have experienced great prosperity,

original: Anubhomi susampattiṃ, buddhānussatiyā phalaṃ.
analyzed: anubhomi su sampattim buddha anussatiyā phalam
translated: The fruit of recollecting the Buddha.🔽Wandering in the round of rebirths in the world of becoming,

original: “Bhavābhave saṃsaranto, mahābhogaṃ labhāmahaṃ;
analyzed: bhava abhave saṃsarantaḥ mahā bhogam labhām aham
translated: I have obtained great wealth; I have no lack of wealth,

original: Bhoge me ūnatā natthi, buddhānussatiyā phalaṃ.
analyzed: bhoge me ūna tā natthi buddha anussatiyā phalam
translated: The fruit of recollecting the Buddha.

original: “Satasahassito kappe, yaṃ kammamakariṃ tadā;
analyzed: kappe yam kammam akarim tadā
translated: For a hundred thousand cycles of time,

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhānussatiyā phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha anussatiyāḥ phalam
translated: I do not recall any bad destination, the fruit of recollecting the Buddha.

original: “Paṭisambhidā catasso, vimokkhāpi ca aṭṭhime;
analyzed: paṭisambhidā catasso vimokkhā api ca aṭṭhime
translated: The four analytical insights, and the eight liberations,

original: Chaḷabhiññā sacchikatā, kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti. –
analyzed: chaṭṭhā abhiññā sacchikatā katam buddhassa sāsanam ti
translated: The six super-knowledges have been realized; the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.

original: Itthaṃ sudaṃ āyasmā subhūtitthero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā subhūti theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus have I heard. These verses were spoken by the Elder Subhūti.

original: Evaṃ pana so tāvatiṃsabhavane aparāparaṃ uppajjanavasena dibbasampattiṃ anubhavitvā
analyzed: evam pana saḥ tāvatiṃsa bhavane apara aparam uppajjana vasena dibba sampattim anubhavitvā
translated: In this way, having experienced divine prosperity by being reborn again and again in the Tāvatiṃsa realm,

original: tato cuto manussaloke anekasatakkhattuṃ cakkavattirājā ca padesarājā ca hutvā uḷāraṃ
analyzed: tatas cutaḥ manussa loke aneka sata kkhattum cakkavatti rājā ca padesa rājā ca hutvā uḷāram
translated: and having passed away from there, he was a wheel-turning monarch and a local king many hundreds of times in the human world, and he enjoyed🔽great prosperity,

original: manussasampattiṃ anubhavitvā atha amhākaṃ bhagavato kāle sāvatthiyaṃ sumanaseṭṭhissa
analyzed: manussa sampattim anubhavitvā atha amhākam bhagavataḥ kāle sāvatthiyam sumanaseṭṭhissa
translated: and after experiencing the happiness of human life, he was reborn in the time of our own Buddha, as the younger brother of Anāthapiṇḍika the treasurer, in the city of Sāvatthi.

original: gehe anāthapiṇḍikassa kaniṭṭho hutvā nibbatti “subhūtī”tissa nāmaṃ ahosi.
analyzed: gehe anāthapiṇḍikassa kaniṭṭhaḥ hutvā nibbatti subhūti itissa nāmam ahosi
translated: His name was Subhūti.

original: Tena ca samayena amhākaṃ bhagavā loke uppajjitvā pavattavaradhammacakko anupubbena
analyzed: tena ca samayena amhākam bhagavā loke uppajjitvā pavatta vara dhamma cakkaḥ anupubbena
translated: At that time our own Buddha, having appeared in the world, having set rolling the wheel of the True Dhamma,

original: rājagahaṃ gantvā tattha veḷuvanapaṭiggahaṇādinā lokānuggahaṃ karonto rājagahaṃ upanissāya
analyzed: rājagaham gantvā tattha veḷuvana paṭiggahaṇa ādinā loka anuggaham karontaḥ rājagaham upanissāya
translated: having gone to Rājagaha, having accepted the Veḷuvana monastery, and so on, and having thus begun to help the world,

original: sītavane viharati. Tadā anāthapiṇḍiko seṭṭhi sāvatthiyaṃ uṭṭhānakabhaṇḍaṃ gahetvā
analyzed: sītavane viharati tadā anāthapiṇḍiko seṭṭhi sāvatthiyam uṭṭhānaka bhaṇḍam gahetvā
translated: was dwelling in the Cool Grove, near Rājagaha. At that time the treasurer Anāthapiṇḍika, having taken his goods and chattels,

original: attano sahāyassa rājagahaseṭṭhino gharaṃ gato buddhuppādaṃ sutvā satthāraṃ sītavane
analyzed: attano sahāyassa rājagaha seṭṭhino gharam gataḥ buddhuppādam sutvā satthāram sītavane
translated: went to the house of his friend, the treasurer of Rājagaha. Having heard of the appearance of the Buddha, he went to the Teacher, who was dwelling in the Cool Grove,

original: viharantaṃ upasaṅkamitvā paṭhamadassaneneva sotāpattiphale patiṭṭhāya satthāraṃ sāvatthiṃ
analyzed: viharantam upasaṅkamitvā paṭhama dassanena iva sotāpatti phale patiṭṭhāya satthāram sāvatthim
translated: and by the first sight of him was established in the Fruit of Conversion. Having asked the Teacher to come to Sāvatthi,

original: āgamanatthāya yācitvā tato pañcacattālīsayojane magge yojane yojane satasahassapariccāgena
analyzed: āgamana tthāya yācitvā tatas pañcacattālīsa yojane magge yojane yojane sata sahassa pariccāgena
translated: he then prepared a road fifty-four leagues in length, giving a hundred thousand pieces of money for every league of the road.

original: vihāre patiṭṭhāpetvā sāvatthiyaṃ rājamānena aṭṭhakarīsappamāṇaṃ jetassa rājakumārassa
analyzed: vihāre patiṭṭhāpetvā sāvatthiyam rājamānena aṭṭhakarīsa ppamāṇam jetassa rāja kumārassa
translated: and having had it built, he had it presented to the Lord of the World.

original: uyyānabhūmiṃ koṭisanthārena kiṇitvā tattha bhagavato vihāraṃ kāretvā adāsi. Vihārapariggahaṇadivase
analyzed: uyyāna bhūmim koṭi santhārena kiṇitvā tattha bhagavataḥ vihāram kāretvā adāsi vihāra pariggahaṇa divase
translated: Having bought the land for the monastery with a koṭi of gold pieces, he had a monastery built there for the Lord of the World and presented it to him. On the day of the presentation of the monastery

original: ayaṃ subhūtikuṭumbiko anāthapiṇḍikaseṭṭhinā saddhiṃ gantvā dhammaṃ suṇanto saddhaṃ
analyzed: ayam subhūti kuṭumbikaḥ anāthapiṇḍika seṭṭhinā saddhim gantvā dhammaṃ suṇanto saddham
translated: this Subhūti householder went with Anāthapiṇḍika the treasurer, and hearing the Dhamma he obtained faith

original: paṭilabhitvā pabbaji. So upasampajjitvā dve mātikā paguṇā katvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ kathāpetvā
analyzed: paṭilabhitvā pabbaji saḥ upasampajjitvā dve mātikā paguṇā katvā kammaṭṭhānam kathāpetvā
translated: and went forth. Having been ordained, he made the two Codes his guide, and having had a meditation subject expounded,

original: araññe samaṇadhammaṃ karonto mettājhānapādakaṃ vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi.
analyzed: araññe samaṇa dhammaṃ karontaḥ mettā jhāna pādakam vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahattam pāpuṇi
translated: he reached Arahantship while doing the ascetic’s duties in the forest, by developing insight preceded by serenity.

original: So dhammaṃ desento yasmā satthārā desitaniyāmena anodissakaṃ katvā dhammaṃ deseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam desentaḥ yasmā satthārā desita niyāmena anodissakam katvā dhammam deseti
translated: When he was expounding the Dhamma, he did so without looking round, in the way taught by the Teacher.

original: Tasmā araṇavihārīnaṃ aggo nāma jāto. Piṇḍāya caranto ghare ghare mettājhānaṃ samāpajjitvā
analyzed: tasmai araṇa vihārīnam aggaḥ nāma jātaḥ piṇḍāya carantaḥ ghare ghare mettā jhānam samāpajjitvā
translated: So he became known as the foremost of those who dwell in solitude. As he went for alms from house to house, he entered upon the attainment of loving-kindness in each house,

original: vuṭṭhāya bhikkhaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti “evaṃ dāyakānaṃ mahapphalaṃ bhavissatī”ti. Tasmā dakkhiṇeyyānaṃ🔽aggo nāma jāto. Tenāha bhagavā – “etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: vuṭṭhāya bhikkham paṭiggaṇhāti evam dāyakānam mahapphalam bhavissati iti tasmā dakkhiṇeyyānam  aggaḥ nāma jātaḥ tena āha bhagavā etat aggam bhikkhave mama sāvakānam bhikkhūnam
translated: and after rising he receives alms, thinking, “Thus there will be great fruit for the givers.” Therefore he is called the foremost of those worthy of offerings.

original: araṇavihārīnaṃ yadidaṃ subhūti, dakkhiṇeyyānaṃ yadidaṃ subhūtī”ti. Evamayaṃ mahāthero
analyzed: yat idam subhūti dakkhiṇeyyānam yat idam subhūti iti evam ayam mahā theraḥ
translated: Therefore the Blessed One said: “Bhikkhus, the most excellent among my bhikkhus’ disciples who dwell in seclusion is Subhuti; among those worthy of offerings is Subhuti.” Thus this great elder,

original: arahatte patiṭṭhāya attanā pūritapāramīnaṃ phalassa matthakaṃ patvā loke abhiññāto
analyzed: arahatte patiṭṭhāya attanā pūrita pāramīnam phalassa matthakam patvā loke abhiññātaḥ
translated: after establishing himself in arahantship, having reached the pinnacle of the fruit of the fulfilled perfections, and having become well known and renowned in the world,

original: abhilakkhito hutvā bahujanahitāya janapadacārikaṃ caranto anupubbena rājagahaṃ agamāsi.
analyzed: abhilakkhitaḥ hutvā bahu jana hitāya janapada cārikam carantaḥ anupubbena rājagaham agamāsi
translated: went on a tour of the country for the benefit of the many, out of compassion for the world, and in the course of time he arrived at Rajagaha.

original: Rājā bimbisāro therassa āgamanaṃ sutvā upasaṅkamitvā vanditvā “idheva, bhante, vasathā”ti
analyzed: rājā bimbisāraḥ therassa āgamanam sutvā upasaṅkamitvā vanditvā idha iva bhante vasatha ati
translated: King Bimbisara, having heard of the elder’s arrival, went to him, paid homage to him, and said: “Venerable sir, please stay here.”

original: vatvā “nivāsanaṭṭhānaṃ karissāmī”ti pakkanto vissari. Thero senāsanaṃ alabhanto abbhokāse
analyzed: vatvā nivāsana ṭṭhānam karissāmi iti pakkantaḥ vissari thero senāsanam a labhantaḥ abbhokāse
translated: After saying: “I will prepare a dwelling place for you,” he departed and forgot about it. The elder, not getting a dwelling place,

original: vītināmesi. Therassa ānubhāvena devo na vassati. Manussā avuṭṭhitāya upaddutā rañño
analyzed: vītināmesi therassa ānubhāvena devaḥ na vassati manussāḥ a vuṭṭhitāya upaddutāḥ rañño
translated: spent the night in the open air. Because of the elder’s power, the rain did not fall. The people, being afflicted by the drought,🔽went to the king and said:

original: nivesanadvāre ukkuṭṭhimakaṃsu. Rājā “kena nu kho kāraṇena devo na vassatī”ti vīmaṃsanto
analyzed: nivesana dvāre ukkuṭṭhim akaṃsu rājā kena nu kho kāraṇena devaḥ na vassati iti vīmaṃsantaḥ
translated: and they made a great noise at the door of the Elder’s cell. The king, wondering why the rain did not fall,

original: “therassa abbhokāsavāsena maññe na vassatī”ti cintetvā tassa paṇṇakuṭiṃ kārāpetvā
analyzed: therassa abbhokāsa vāsena maññe na vassati iti cintetvā tassa paṇṇa kuṭim kārāpetvā
translated: thought to himself, “It is probably because the Elder lives in the open air that the rain does not fall.” So he had a leaf-hut built for the Elder,

original: “imissā, bhante, paṇṇakuṭiyā vasathā”ti vatvā vanditvā pakkāmi. Thero kuṭikaṃ pavisitvā🔽tiṇasanthārake pallaṅkena nisīdi. Tadā pana devo thokaṃ thokaṃ phusāyati, na sammā
analyzed: imissā bhante paṇṇa kuṭiyā vasatha iti vatvā vanditvā pakkāmi theraḥ kuṭikam pavisitvā  tiṇa santhārake pallaṅkena tadā pana devo thokam thokam phusāyati na sammā
translated: saying, “Reverend Sir, live in this leaf-hut.” After paying obeisance to the Elder, he departed. The Elder entered the hut and

original: dhāraṃ anuppavecchati. Atha thero lokassa avuṭṭhikabhayaṃ visamitukāmo attano ajjhattikabāhiravatthukassa🔽parissayassa abhāvaṃ pavedento –
analyzed: dhāram anuppavecchati atha theraḥ lokassa avuṭṭhika bhayam visamitu kāmaḥ attanaḥ ajjhattika bāhira vatthukassa  parissayassa abhāvam pavedentaḥ
translated: sat down cross-legged on a bed of grass. At that time the rain fell in drops as large as mustard-seeds, but the rain-god did not send a continuous downpour. Then the Elder, desiring to remove the fear of famine from the world, and desiring to make known the absence of both internal and external hindrances to himself,

original: “Channā me kuṭikā sukhā nivātā, vassa deva yathāsukhaṃ;
analyzed: channā me kuṭikā sukhā nivātā deva yathāsukham
translated: said, “My hut is well-covered, well-sheltered, well-protected from the wind; let the rain-god rain as he will.

original: Cittaṃ me susamāhitaṃ vimuttaṃ, ātāpī viharāmi vassa devā”ti. –
analyzed: cittam me su samāhitam vimuttam ātāpī viharāmi deva ti
translated: My mind is well-composed, well-liberated; I am zealous; let the rain-god rain as he will.”

original: Gāthamāha.
analyzed: gātham āha
translated: And he pronounced the following Stanza,🔽“My hut is well-covered, well-sheltered, well-protected from the wind; I am zealous; let the rain-god rain as he will.

original: Tattha channa-saddo tāva “channā sā kumārikā imassa kumārakassa” “nacchannaṃ nappatirūpa”ntiādīsu🔽patirūpe āgato. “Channaṃ tveva, phagguṇa, phassāyatanāna”ntiādīsu vacanavisiṭṭhe
analyzed: tattha channa saddaḥ tāva channā sā kumārikā imassa kumārakassa na channam na patirūpan ti ādīsu  pati rūpe channam tu eva phagguṇa phassa āyatana ananti ādīsu vacana visiṭṭhe
translated: Herein, the word channa is found in the sense of suitable in such passages as “That girl is suitable for this boy” and “What is not suitable is not proper” .🔽In the sense of a particular number distinguished by a statement in such passages as “Six bases for contact” .

original: saṅkhyāvisese. “Channamativassati, vivaṭaṃ nātivassatī”tiādīsu gahaṇe. “Kyāhaṃ te
analyzed: saṅkhyā visese channam ativassati vivaṭam na ativassati iti ādīsu gahaṇe te
translated: In the sense of covering in such passages as “What is covered by the rain-cloud, what is uncovered is not covered by the rain-cloud” .🔽In the sense of clothing in such passages as “Though I am not covered, I will do nothing to you” .

original: nacchannopi karissāmī”tiādīsu nivāsanapārupane “āyasmā channo anācāraṃ ācaratī”tiādīsu
analyzed: na channaḥ api karissāmi itiādīsu nivāsana pārupane āyasmā channaḥ anācāram ācarati itiādīsu
translated: In the sense of a rule in such passages as “The venerable Channa is misbehaving” .

original: paññattiyaṃ. “Sabbacchannaṃ sabbaparicchannaṃ, channā kuṭi āhito ginī”ti ca ādīsu🔽tiṇādīhi chādane. Idhāpi tiṇādīhi chādaneyeva daṭṭhabbo, tasmā tiṇena vā paṇṇena
analyzed: paññattiyam sabba channam sabba paricchannam channā kuṭi āhitaḥ ginī iti ca ādīsu  tiṇa ādīhi chādane idha api tiṇa ādīhi chādanā iya iva daṭṭhabbo tasmā tiṇena vā paṇṇena
translated: In the sense of concealing with grass, etc., in such passages as “All concealed, all covered, the hut is concealed, the owner is concealed” .

original: vā channā yathā na vassati vassodakapatanaṃ na hoti na ovassati, evaṃ sammadeva chāditāti attho.🔽Me-saddo “kicchena me adhigataṃ, halaṃ dāni pakāsitu”ntiādīsu karaṇe āgato, mayāti
analyzed: vā channā yathā na vassati vassa udaka patanam na hoti na ovassati evam sammad eva chāditā ati attho 🔽mesaddaḥ kicchena me adhigatam halam dāni pakāsitum ādīsu karaṇe āgataḥ mayā ati
translated: Here it should be regarded as in the sense of concealing with grass, etc., too. So the meaning is that it is well concealed with grass or leaves in such a way that the rain does not fall on it, that it is not flooded.

original: attho. “Tassa me, bhante, bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammaṃ desetū”tiādīsu sampadāne, mayhanti
analyzed: tassa me bhante bhagavā saṃkhittena dhammam desetu uti ādīsu sampadāne mayhanti
translated: In the sense of “meaning” it is used in such passages as “Venerable sir, please teach me the Dhamma in brief” .

original: attho. “Pubbeva me, bhikkhave, sambodhā anabhisambuddhassa bodhisattasseva sato”ādīsu
analyzed: attho pubbā iva me bhikkhave sambodhā an abhisambuddhassa bodhisattassa iva sato ādīsu
translated: In the sense of “accomplishment” it is used in such passages as “Bhikkhus, before my enlightenment, while I was still only an unenlightened Bodhisatta” .

original: sāmiatthe āgato. Idhāpi sāmiatthe eva daṭṭhabbo, mamāti attho. Kiñcāpi khīṇāsavānaṃ
analyzed: sāmi atthe āgataḥ idha api sāmi atthe eva daṭṭhabbaḥ mama ati attho kiñca api khīṇāsavānam
translated: Here it is used in the sense of “ownership” . Here too the meaning is “ownership” .

original: mamāyitabbaṃ nāma kiñci natthi lokadhammehi anupalittabhāvato, lokasamaññāvasena🔽pana tesampi “ahaṃ mamā”ti vohāramattaṃ hoti. Tenāha bhagavā – “kinti me sāvakā dhammadāyādā
analyzed: mamāyitabbam nāma kiñci natthi loka dhammehi an upalitta bhāvataḥ loka samaññā vasena  pana tesam pi aham mama ati vohāra mattam hoti tena āha bhagavā kinti me sāvakā dhamma dāyādā
translated: Although there is nothing that can be called “mine” in the case of those whose cankers are destroyed, because they are not affected by worldly conditions,🔽nevertheless, by way of worldly convention, even in their case there is the mere usage “I” and “mine” .

original: bhaveyyuṃ, no āmisadāyādā”ti.
analyzed: bhaveyyum naḥ āmisa dāya adāti
translated: That is why the Blessed One said: “How can my disciples become heirs of my Dhamma and not heirs of material things? ”

original: Kuṭikāti pana mātukucchipi karajakāyopi tiṇādicchadano patissayopi vuccati. Tathā hi –
analyzed: kuṭikā ati pana mātukucchi karaja kāyaḥ pi tiṇa ādi chadanaḥ patissayaḥ pi vuccati tathā hi
translated: “Hut” is used to mean the mother’s womb, the physical body, and a dwelling made of grass, etc. For it is said:

original: “Mātaraṃ kuṭikaṃ brūsi, bhariyaṃ brūsi kulāvakaṃ;
analyzed: mātaram kuṭikam brūsi bhariyam brūsi kulāvakam
translated: “You call the mother the hut, the wife the hut’s companion;

original: Putte santānake brūsi, taṇhā me brūsi bandhana”nti. –
analyzed: putte santānake brūsi taṇhā me brūsi bandhananti
translated: You call the children the hut’s inmates, craving you call the bond” .

original: Ādīsu mātukucchi “kuṭikā”ti vuttā.
analyzed: ādīsu mātukucchi kuṭikā ati vuttā
translated: Here the mother’s womb is called “hut.”

original: “Aṭṭhikaṅkalakuṭike, maṃsanhārupasibbite;
analyzed: aṭṭhi kaṅkala kuṭike maṃsa nhāru pasibbite
translated: In the first part of the verse the word “body” is to be understood as the physical body consisting of the nine parts beginning with the head, as in the passage: “In the skull-house, smeared with flesh and sinews,

original: Dhiratthu pūre duggandhe, paragatte mamāyasī”ti. –🔽Ādīsu kesādisamūhabhūto karajakāyo. “Kassapassa bhagavato bhagini kuṭi ovassati”
analyzed: dhiratthu pūre duggandhe para gatte mamāyasi iti  ādīsu kesa ādi samūha bhūtaḥ karaja kāyaḥ kassapassa bhagavataḥ bhagini kuṭi ovassati
translated: Filled with urine and excrement, what is there to enjoy?” .🔽In the second part of the verse the word “body” is to be understood as the physical body consisting of the thirty-two parts beginning with the head hairs, as in the passage: “The Blessed One’s sister was the nun Soma” .

original: “kuṭi nāma ullittā vā hoti avalittā vā”tiādīsu tiṇachadanapatissayo. Idhāpi so eva
analyzed: kuṭi nāma ullittā vā hoti avalittā vā ati ādīsu idha api saḥ eva
translated: In the third part of the verse the word “body” is to be understood as a hut made of thatch, as in the passage: “The hut leaks, friend Visākha” .

original: veditabbo paṇṇasālāya adhippetattā. Kuṭi eva hi kuṭikā, apākaṭakuṭi “kuṭikā”ti vuttā.
analyzed: veditabbaḥ paṇṇa sālāya adhippeta ttā kuṭi eva hi kuṭikā apākaṭa kuṭi kuṭikā iti vuttā
translated: Here, however, it should be understood as a hut made of leaves, because a hut made of leaves is intended. For a hut is called a “hut made of leaves” when it is not clearly visible.

original: Sukha-saddo pana “vipiṭṭhikatvāna sukhaṃ dukhañca, pubbeva ca somanassadomanassa”ntiādīsu
analyzed: sukha saddo pana sukham dukham ca pubbā iva ca somanassa domanassa nti ādīsu
translated: The word “happiness” is used in the sense of pleasant feeling, as in the passage: “Having made a separation between happiness and misery, between what is pleasant and unpleasant” .

original: sukhavedanāyaṃ āgato. “Sukho buddhānamuppādo, sukhā saddhammadesanā”tiādīsu sukhamūle.
analyzed: sukha vedanā ayam āgataḥ sukhaḥ buddhānam uppādaḥ sukhā saddhamma desanā ati ādīsu sukha mūle
translated: It is used in the sense of the root of happiness, as in the passage: “The arising of the Buddhas is happiness, the teaching of the true Dhamma is happiness” .

original: “Sukhassetaṃ, bhikkhave, adhivacanaṃ yadidaṃ puññānī”tiādīsu sukhahetumhi. “Yasmā
analyzed: sukhassa itam bhikkhave adhivacanam yat idam puññāni iti ādīsu sukha hetumhi yasmā
translated: It is used in the sense of the cause of happiness, as in the passage: “Monks, this is a designation for merit, namely, ‘happiness’” .

original: ca, kho, mahāli, rūpaṃ sukhaṃ sukhānupatitaṃ sukhāvakkanta”ntiādīsu sukhārammaṇe,
analyzed: ca kho mahāli rūpam sukham sukha anupatitam sukha avakkanta nti ādīsu sukha ārammaṇe

translated: And here the Elder Thera shows his training in the higher virtue, which is of two kinds, mundane and supramundane, with the words, “My hut is sheltered, pleasant, and secluded.” With the words, “My mind is well composed,” he shows his training in the higher thought. Or alternatively, with the words, “My hut is sheltered, pleasant, and secluded,” he shows his dwelling in the signless, since this is the means for warding off the rain of defilements and is the disclosure of the eradication of the signs of permanence, etc. With the words, “My mind is well composed,” he shows his dwelling in the desireless.

original: “Vimutta”nti iminā suññatavihāraṃ. “Ātāpī viharāmī”ti iminā tesaṃ tiṇṇaṃ vihārānaṃ

analyzed: dumassa rukkhassa pattam paṇḍu palāsam mālutaḥ vātaḥ dhunāti bandhanataḥ viyojentaḥ nīharati  evam yathā vutta paṭipattiyam ṭhitaḥ pāpa dhamme attanaḥ santānataḥ nīharati evam ayam

analyzed: therassa aññā apadesena aññā byākaraṇa gāthā api hoti iti veditabbā  ettha ca kāyavacī duccarita ppahāna vacanena payoga suddhim dasseti manaḥ duccarita ppahāna vacanena
translated: so too, when he stands by the aforesaid practice, he shakes off evil states and strips them of their hold in his own continuity. original: arahattaṃ pattā. Te attano pabbajitakiccaṃ matthakappattaṃ ñatvā upajjhāyaṃ upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: arahattam pattā te attanaḥ pabbajita kiccam matthaka ppattam ñatvā upajjhāyam upasaṅkamitvā
translated: attained arahatship. Knowing that their duty of going forth had reached its peak, they approached the preceptor🔽and said: “Venerable Sir, we have reached the peak of the duty of going forth. What else should we do?”

original: āhaṃsu – “bhante, amhākaṃ kiccaṃ matthakappattaṃ, dasannañcamha kathāvatthūnaṃ lābhino,🔽samayo, dāni no dasabalaṃ passitu”nti. Thero tesaṃ vacanaṃ sutvā cintesi – “mama
analyzed: āhaṃsu bhante amhākam kiccam matthaka ppattam kathā vatthūnam lābhinaḥ  samayaḥ dāni naḥ dasa balam passitunti thero tesam vacanam sutvā cintesi mama
translated: and said, “Reverend Sir, our business has been accomplished. We have obtained the ten topics of talk.🔽Now is the time to see the One of Ten Powers.” When the Elder heard their words, he thought to himself, “The Teacher knows that I have obtained the ten topics of talk.

original: dasakathāvatthulābhitaṃ satthā jānāti ahaṃ dhammaṃ desento dasa kathāvatthūni amuñcitvāva🔽desemi, mayi gacchante sabbepime bhikkhū maṃ parivāretvā gacchissanti, evaṃ gaṇasaṅgaṇikāya
analyzed: dasa kathāvatthu lābhitam satthā jānāti aham dhammaṃ desentaḥ dasa kathāvatthūni a muñcitvā ava  desemi mayi gacchante sabbe pi me bhikkhū mam parivāretvā gacchissanti evam gaṇa saṅgaṇikāya
translated: Whenever I preach the Law, I preach it without omitting any of the ten topics of talk.

original: gantvā pana ayuttaṃ mayhaṃ dasabalaṃ passituṃ, ime tāva gantvā passantū”ti te bhikkhū
analyzed: gantvā pana ayuttam mayham dasa balam passituṃ ime tāva gantvā passantu uti te bhikkhū
translated: If I go, all these monks will go with me, and thus I shall be unable to see the One of Ten Powers.

original: āha – “āvuso, tumhe purato gantvā tathāgataṃ passatha, mama vacanena cassa pāde vandatha,
analyzed: āha āvuso tumhe puratas gantvā tathāgatam passatha mama vacanena ca ssa pāde vandatha
translated: Let them go first and see the Teacher.” So he said to the monks, “Brethren, go on ahead and see the Tathāgata. Bow down before his feet in my name,

original: ahampi tumhākaṃ gatamaggenāgamissāmī”ti. Te therā sabbepi dasabalassa jātibhūmiraṭṭhavāsino
analyzed: aham pi tumhākam gata maggena āgamissāmi iti te therā sabbe pi dasabalassa jāti bhūmi raṭṭha vāsino
translated: and say to him, ‘Reverend Sir, we have obtained the ten topics of talk. We are coming by the way you have come.’ I also will come by the way you have gone.” All the monks who were residents of the city of the Buddha’s birth,

original: sabbe khīṇāsavā sabbe dasakathāvatthulābhino attano upajjhāyassa ovādaṃ sampaṭicchitvā
analyzed: sabbe khīṇa āsavā sabbe dasa kathā vatthu lābhinaḥ attanaḥ upajjhāyassa ovādam sampaṭicchitvā
translated: All of them were arahats, all of them had exhausted the corruptions, all of them were endowed with the ten powers, all of them had attained the ten universal insights, all of them had reached the perfection of the ten perfections, all of them had attained the ten powers of the arahat, all of them had attained the ten powers of the great man, all of them had attained the ten powers of the noble one, all of them had attained the ten powers of the disciple, all of them had attained the ten powers of the paccekabuddha, all of them had attained the ten powers of the Buddha.

original: theraṃ vanditvā anupubbena cārikaṃ carantā saṭṭhiyojanamaggaṃ atikkamma rājagahe
analyzed: theram vanditvā anupubbena cārikam carantā saṭṭhi yojana maggam atikkamma rājagahe
translated: Having accepted the advice of their preceptor, they paid homage to the Elder and gradually proceeded on their journey. Having travelled sixty leagues, they reached Rājagaha

original: veḷuvanamahāvihāraṃ gantvā dasabalassa pāde vanditvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
analyzed: veḷuvana mahā vihāram gantvā dasabalassa pāde vanditvā ekamantam nisīdiṃsu
translated: and the Great Monastery in the Bamboo Grove. Having paid homage at the feet of the One of Ten Powers, they sat down to one side.🔽It is the custom of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, to exchange greetings with visiting monks.

original: Āciṇṇaṃ kho panetaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ āgantukehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ paṭisammoditunti🔽bhagavā tehi saddhiṃ – “kacci, bhikkhave, khamanīya”ntiādinā nayena madhurapaṭisanthāraṃ🔽katvā “kuto ca tumhe, bhikkhave, āgacchathā”ti pucchi. Atha tehi “jātibhūmito”ti🔽vutte “ko nu kho, bhikkhave, jātibhūmiyaṃ jātibhūmakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ sabrahmacārīnaṃ
analyzed: āciṇṇam kho pana etam buddhānam bhagavantānam āgantukehi bhikkhūhi saddhim paṭisammoditunti  bhagavā tehi saddhim kacci bhikkhave khamanīya nti ādinā nayena madhura paṭisanthāram  katvā kutas ca tumhe bhikkhave āgacchatha ati pucchi atha tehi jāti bhūmitaḥ ti  vutte kaḥ nu khalu bhikkhave jāti bhūmiyam jāti bhūmakānam bhikkhūnam sabrahmacārīnam
translated: Therefore the Blessed One exchanged friendly greetings with them, saying, “I trust, bhikkhus, that all is well with you,” and so on.🔽Then he asked them, “Where have you come from, bhikkhus?” When they replied, “From the land of our birth,”🔽he asked, “Who is esteemed by the bhikkhus, your companions in the holy life, in the land of your birth as being foremost in virtue, foremost in concentration, foremost in wisdom, foremost in freedom, and foremost in knowledge and vision of freedom?”

original: evaṃ sambhāvito ‘attanā ca appiccho appicchakathañca bhikkhūnaṃ kattā”’ti dasakathāvatthulābhiṃ
analyzed: evam sambhāvitaḥ attanā ca appicchaḥ appiccha katham ca bhikkhūnam kattā ati dasa kathā vatthu lābhiṃ
translated: “Bhikkhus, who is esteemed by the bhikkhus, your companions in the holy life, in the land of your birth as being foremost in virtue … and in knowledge and vision of freedom?”

original: bhikkhuṃ pucchi. Tepi “puṇṇo nāma, bhante, āyasmā mantāṇiputto”ti ārocayiṃsu. Taṃ
analyzed: bhikkhum pucchi te pi puṇṇaḥ nāma bhante āyasmā mantāṇi putto ti ārocayiṃsu tam
translated: The monks asked the venerable Sāriputta, “Venerable sir, there is a venerable named Puṇṇa Mantāṇiputta.”

original: kathaṃ sutvā āyasmā sāriputto therassa dassanakāmo ahosi. Atha satthā rājagahato
analyzed: katham sutvā āyasmā sāriputto therassa dassana kāmo ahosi atha satthā rājagahato
translated: Hearing this conversation, the venerable Sāriputta desired to see the elder. Then the Teacher went from Rājagaha

original: sāvatthiṃ agamāsi. Puṇṇattheropi dasabalassa tattha āgatabhāvaṃ sutvā – “satthāraṃ
analyzed: sāvatthim agamāsi puṇṇa ttheraḥ api dasabalassa tattha āgata bhāvam sutvā satthāram
translated: to Sāvatthi. The elder Puṇṇa, hearing that the One of Ten Powers had come there, thought, “I will see the Teacher.”

original: passissāmī”ti gantvā antogandhakuṭiyaṃyeva tathāgataṃ sampāpuṇi. Satthā tassa dhammaṃ
analyzed: passissāmi iti gantvā antogandhakuṭiyam yeva tathāgatam sampāpuṇi satthā tassa dhammaṃ
translated: Going, he reached the Tathāgata in the perfumed chamber. The Teacher

original: desesi. Thero dhammaṃ sutvā dasabalaṃ vanditvā paṭisallānatthāya andhavanaṃ gantvā
analyzed: desesi theraḥ dhammam sutvā dasabalam vanditvā paṭisallāna tthāya andhavanam gantvā
translated: preached the Dhamma for him. The elder, having heard the Dhamma, saluted the One of Ten Powers and went to the Blind Men’s Grove to meditate.

original: aññataramhi rukkhamūle divāvihāraṃ nisīdi.🔽Sāriputtattheropi tassāgamanaṃ sutvā sīsānulokiko gantvā okāsaṃ sallakkhetvā taṃ
analyzed: aññataramhi rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisīdi  sāriputta theraḥ api tassa āgamanam sutvā sīsānulokikaḥ gantvā okāsam sallakkhetvā tam
translated: Sitting down at the foot of a certain tree, he entered upon the state of jhāna.

original: rukkhamūle nisinnaṃ upasaṅkamitvā therena saddhiṃ sammoditvā, taṃ sattavisuddhikkamaṃ
analyzed: rukkha mūle nisinnam upasaṅkamitvā therena saddhim sammoditvā tam satta visuddhi kkamam
translated: The elder Sāriputta, hearing of his arrival, went to see him. After surveying the situation, he approached the elder sitting at the foot of the tree. After exchanging friendly greetings with the elder, he asked him, “Friend, what is the name of the state of mental absorption in which you are now absorbed?”

original: pucchi. Theropissa pucchitapucchitaṃ byākaronto rathavinītūpamāya cittaṃ ārādhesi,
analyzed: pucchi theropissa pucchita pucchitam byākarontaḥ rathavinītūpamāya cittam ārādhesi
translated: and the Elder replied to each question. In so doing he pleased the Teacher’s mind with the simile of the chariot-driver.🔽and they rejoiced in each other’s good words. Later the Teacher,

original: te aññamaññassa subhāsitaṃ samanumodiṃsu. Atha satthā aparabhāge bhikkhusaṅghamajjhe
analyzed: te aññamaññassa su bhāsitam samanumodiṃsu atha satthā aparabhāge bhikkhu saṅgha majjhe
translated: while sitting in the midst of the Community of monks,

original: nisinno theraṃ “etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ dhammakathikānaṃ
analyzed: nisinnaḥ theram etat aggam bhikkhave mama sāvakānam bhikkhūnam dhamma kathikānam
translated: said, “Monks, the foremost of those who are preachers of the Dhamma among my monks is the Elder Puṇṇa.”

original: yadidaṃ puṇṇo”ti dhammakathikānaṃ aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapesi. So ekadivasaṃ attano vimuttisampattiṃ
analyzed: yat idam puṇṇaḥ ti dhamma kathikānam aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapesi saḥ eka divasam attanaḥ vimutti sampattim
translated: One day, as he was reflecting on his own attainment of liberation,

original: paccavekkhitvā “satthāraṃ nissāya ahañceva aññe ca bahū sattā saṃsāradukkhato vippamuttā,🔽bahūpakārā vata sappurisasaṃsevā”ti pītisomanassajāto udānavasena pītivegavissaṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: paccavekkhitvā satthāram nissāya aham ca iva aññe ca bahū sattā saṃsāra dukkhataḥ vippamuttā  bahu upakārā vata sappurisa saṃsevā ti pīti somanassa jātaḥ udāna vasena pīti vega vissaṭṭham
translated: he thought, “It is through the Teacher that I and many other beings have been liberated from the suffering of the round of rebirths.🔽How great is the benefit of associating with good people!”🔽and, filled with joy and happiness, he uttered the following exclamation of joy:

original: “sabbhireva samāsethā”ti gāthaṃ abhāsi.
analyzed: sabbhiḥ eva samāsetha iti gātham abhāsi
translated: “Only with good people should one associate, only with good people should one keep company, only with good people should one be devoted.”

original: 4. Tattha sabbhirevāti sappurisehi eva. Santoti panettha buddhādayo ariyā adhippetā.
analyzed: tattha sabbhiḥ eva ati sappurisehi eva santo ti pana ittha buddha ādayaḥ ariyāḥ adhippetā
translated: Herein, only with good people means only with noble ones. But in this context the noble ones are intended to be the Buddhas, etc.

original: Te hi anavasesato asataṃ dhammaṃ pahāya saddhamme ukkaṃsagatattā sātisayaṃ pasaṃsiyattā
analyzed: te hi anavasesataḥ asatam dhammam pahāya saddhamme ukkaṃsa gata ttā sa atisayam
translated: For they are called “virtuous” and “true men” because they have abandoned the unwholesome and have gone to the fore in the wholesome, and because they are praiseworthy in a special sense.

original: ca visesato “santo sappurisā”ti ca vuccanti. Samāsethāti samaṃ āsetha saha vaseyya.
analyzed: ca visesato santo sappurisā ti ca vuccanti samāsetha ati samam āsetha saha vaseyya
translated: “Associate with” means associate with them, live with them.

original: Te payirupāsanto tesaṃ sussūsanto diṭṭhānugatiñca āpajjanto samānavāso bhaveyyāti🔽attho. Paṇḍitehatthadassibhīti tesaṃ thomanā. Paṇḍā vuccati paññā, sā imesaṃ sañjātāti
analyzed: te tesam sussūsantaḥ diṭṭha anugatim ca āpajjantaḥ samāna vāsaḥ bhaveyya iti  tesam thomanā paṇḍā vuccati paññā sā imesam sañjātā ati
translated: The meaning is: “By serving them, by listening to them, and by practicing in accordance with their teachings, you will live with them.”🔽“With the wise who see” is the praise of them. Wisdom is called “wise” .

original: paṇḍitā. Tato eva attatthādibhedaṃ atthaṃ aviparītato passantīti atthadassino. Tehi
analyzed: paṇḍitā tatas eva atta ttha ādi bhedam attham aviparītataḥ passanti iti attha dassinaḥ tehi
translated: They are “wise” because it has arisen in them. Because of that, they see the meaning, which is divided into one’s own benefit, etc., without distortion. They are “seers of meaning.”

original: paṇḍitehi atthadassībhi samāsetha. Kasmāti ce? Yasmā te santo paṇḍitā, te vā sammā🔽sevantā ekantahitabhāvato maggañāṇādīheva araṇīyato atthaṃ, mahāguṇatāya santatāya
analyzed: paṇḍitehi attha dassībhi samāsetha kasmā ati ce yasmā te santaḥ paṇḍitā te vā sammā  sevantā ekanta hita bhāvataḥ magga ñāṇa ādi iha iva araṇīyataḥ attham mahā guṇatāya santatāya
translated: “Associate with” them, the wise seers of meaning. Why? Because they are virtuous and wise.🔽Or else, by serving them properly, you will obtain the meaning, which is to be sought after because it is one’s sole benefit, and which is great because of its great qualities,

original: ca mahantaṃ, agādhabhāvato gambhīrañāṇagocarato ca gambhīraṃ, hīnacchandādīhi daṭṭhuṃ
analyzed: ca mahantam agādha bhāvataḥ gambhīra ñāṇa gocarataḥ ca gambhīram hīna chanda ādīhi daṭṭhum
translated: and profound because of its unfathomable nature and because it is the domain of profound knowledge.

original: asakkuṇeyyattā itarehi ca kicchena daṭṭhabbattā duddasaṃ, duddasattā saṇhanipuṇasabhāvattā
analyzed: a sakkuṇeyya ttā itarehi ca kicchena daṭṭhabba ttā duddasam duddasa ttā saṇha nipuṇa sabhāva ttā
translated: It is hard to see because it is not within the scope of the other kinds of knowledge and because it is difficult to see by means of the other kinds of knowledge.

original: nipuṇañāṇagocarato ca nipuṇaṃ, nipuṇattā evaṃ sukhumasabhāvatāya aṇuṃ nibbānaṃ, aviparītaṭṭhena
analyzed: nipuṇa ñāṇa gocarato ca nipuṇam nipuṇa ttā evam sukhuma sabhāva tāya aṇum nibbānam a viparīta ṭṭhena
translated: It is subtle because it is the province of subtle knowledge. Because it is subtle, it is fine. It is Nibbāna because it is the state of being scattered , that is, of being scattered by the defilements and fires of lust, etc.,🔽or it is Nibbāna because it is the state of being blown out , that is, of being blown out by the fire of lust, etc.,🔽or it is Nibbāna because it is the state of being not abandoned , that is, the state of being not abandoned by the defilements.🔽It is the meaning because it is the state of the ultimate truth.🔽It is great because it is the cause of the greatness of the noble state.

original: vā paramatthasabhāvattā atthaṃ, ariyabhāvakarattā mahattanimittatāya mahantaṃ, anuttānasabhāvatāya
analyzed: vā attham ariya bhāva karattā mahatta nimitta tāya mahantam anuttāna sabhāva tāya
translated: It is profound because it is hard to fathom.🔽It is hard to see because it is not possible to see it easily, that is, with difficulty.

original: gambhīraṃ, dukkhena daṭṭhabbaṃ na sukhena daṭṭhuṃ sakkāti duddasaṃ, gambhīrattā duddasaṃ,
analyzed: gambhīram dukkhena daṭṭhabbam na sukhena daṭṭhum sakkā ati duddasam gambhīra ttā duddasam
translated: It is subtle because it is profound. It is profound because it is hard to see.

original: duddasattā gambhīranti catusaccaṃ, visesato nipuṇaṃ aṇuṃ, nirodhasaccanti evametaṃ
analyzed: duddasa ttā gambhīranti catu saccam visesataḥ nipuṇam aṇum nirodha saccam ti evam etam
translated: It is the four truths. It is subtle because it is profound. It is fine because it is subtle. It is Nibbāna because it is profound.🔽The wise, who are endowed with faith,

original: catusaccaṃ dhīrā samadhigacchanti dhitisampannatāya dhīrā catusaccakammaṭṭhānabhāvanaṃ
analyzed: catusaccam dhīrā samadhigacchanti dhiti sampanna tāya dhīrā catur acca kammaṭṭhāna bhāvanam
translated: attain the four truths by making the meditation subject consisting of the four truths their special province and by striving with energy.

original: ussukkāpetvā sammadeva adhigacchanti. Appamattāti sabbattha satiavippavāsena appamādapaṭipattiṃ
analyzed: ussukkāpetvā sammat eva adhigacchanti appamattā ati sabbattha sati a vippavāsena appamāda paṭipattim
translated: They attain them rightly, by the practice of non-distraction with mindfulness.

original: pūrentā. Vicakkhaṇāti vipassanābhāvanāya chekā kusalā. Tasmā sabbhireva samāsethāti
analyzed: pūrentā vicakkhaṇā ati vipassanā bhāvanāya chekā kusalā tasmai sabbhiḥ eva samāsetha ati
translated: With all who are🔽wise, etc.

original: yojanā. Paṇḍitehatthadassibhīti vā etaṃ nissakkavacanaṃ. Yasmā paṇḍitehi atthadassībhi
analyzed: yojanā paṇḍitehi attha dassibhi iti vā etam nissakka vacanam yasmā paṇḍitehi attha dassībhi
translated: Or else this is a general statement. For the wise, the seers of the meaning,

original: samudāyabhūtehi dhīrā appamattā vicakkhaṇā mahantādivisesavantaṃ atthaṃ samadhigacchanti,🔽tasmā tādisehi sabbhireva samāsethāti sambandho. Evamesā therassa paṭivedhadīpanena
analyzed: samudāya bhūtehi dhīrāḥ appamattāḥ vicakkhaṇāḥ mahanta ādi visesavantam attham samadhigacchanti  tasmā tādisehi sabbhiḥ eva samāsetha ati sambandhaḥ evam esā therassa paṭivedha dīpanena
translated: the wise who are collected together, the heedful, the skillful, attain the great and other kinds of special benefit.🔽Therefore:🔽With all who are wise, etc.

original: aññābyākaraṇagāthāpi ahosīti.
analyzed: aññā a byākaraṇa gāthā api ahosi iti
translated: Thus this verse, too, became an Āññā-Byākaraṇa verse, by the Elder’s showing of his penetration.

original: Puṇṇattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: puṇṇa thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Puṇṇa is finished.

original: 5. Dabbattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: dabbatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: Dabba the Mallian

original: Yo duddamiyoti āyasmato dabbattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi padumuttarabuddhakāle🔽haṃsavatīnagare kulagehe nibbattitvā vayappatto heṭṭhā vuttanayeneva dhammadesanaṃ
analyzed: yaḥ duddamiyaḥ ti āyasmataḥ dabba ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi padumuttara buddha kāle  haṃsavatī nagare kula gehe nibbattitvā vaya pattaḥ heṭṭhā vutta nayena iva dhamma desanam
translated: These are the verses of the venerable Dabba the Mallian. Where did they originate? He, too,🔽when he was a young man, heard a Dhamma talk given by the Teacher in the same way as was described above ,🔽and he saw the Teacher place a certain bhikkhu in the foremost position among those who assign resting places. He then made his aspiration

original: suṇanto satthāraṃ ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ senāsanapaññāpakānaṃ aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapentaṃ disvā adhikārakammaṃ
analyzed: suṇantaḥ satthāram ekam bhikkhum senāsana paññāpakānam aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapentam disvā adhikāra kammaṃ
translated: and went forth.

original: katvā taṃ ṭhānantaraṃ patthetvā satthārā byākato yāvajīvaṃ kusalaṃ katvā devamanussesu
analyzed: katvā tam ṭhāna antaram patthetvā satthārā byākataḥ yāvajīvam kusalam katvā deva manussesu
translated: He made his Earnest Wish for that place, and was declared by the Teacher to have attained it. He did good for the rest of his life, and after he had passed through the round of existences among gods and men,

original: saṃsaritvā kassapadasabalassa sāsanosakkanakāle pabbaji. Tadā tena saddhiṃ apare🔽cha janāti satta bhikkhū ekacittā hutvā aññe sāsane agāravaṃ karonte disvā – “idha
analyzed: saṃsaritvā kassapada sabalassa sāsana usakkana kāle pabbaji tadā tena saddhim apare  cha satta bhikkhū ekacittā hutvā aññe sāsane agāravam karonte disvā idha
translated: he went forth in the dispensation of the Master Kassapa, who was the Buddha of the interval. At that time there were six other men who went forth with him.

original: kiṃ karoma ekamante samaṇadhammaṃ katvā dukkhassantaṃ karissāmā”ti nisseṇiṃ bandhitvā
analyzed: kim karoma eka mante samaṇa dhammam katvā dukkhassantam karissāma ati nisseṇim bandhitvā
translated: These seven monks, having become of one mind, saw other monks who were disrespectful in the dispensation of the Master Kassapa, and said, “What shall we do here? Let us go to one side and practice the life of recluses, and so make an end of suffering.” So they made a covenant with one another,

original: uccaṃ pabbatasikharaṃ āruhitvā, “attano cittabalaṃ jānantā nisseṇiṃ nipātentu, jīvite🔽sālayā otarantu, mā pacchānutappino ahuvatthā”ti vatvā sabbe ekacittā hutvā nisseṇiṃ
analyzed: uccam pabbata sikharam āruhitvā attano citta balam jānantāḥ nisseṇim nipātentu jīvite  sa ālayāḥ otarantu mā pacchā anutappinaḥ ahuvattha ati vatvā sabbe ekacittāḥ hutvā nisseṇim
translated: and climbing to the top of a high mountain peak, said, “Let those who know their own strength let go of the rope; let those who do not know their own strength remain alive.🔽Let them descend to the foot of the mountain and live the life of recluses.” So saying, they all became of one mind, and let go of the rope.

original: pātetvā – “appamattā hotha, āvuso”ti aññamaññaṃ ovaditvā cittarucikesu ṭhānesu nisīditvā🔽samaṇadhammaṃ kātuṃ ārabhiṃsu.

translated: “Be diligent, brethren,” said they, admonishing one another. They sat down in a place that pleased them, and began to practice the life of recluses.

original: Tatreko thero pañcame divase arahattaṃ patvā, “mama kiccaṃ nipphannaṃ, ahaṃ imasmiṃ🔽ṭhāne kiṃ karissāmi”ti iddhiyā uttarakuruto piṇḍapātaṃ āharitvā, “āvuso, imaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ

translated: One of the elder bhikkhus attained Arahantship on the fifth day. He thought, “My task is done. What have I to do here? I shall bring alms food from Uttarakuru by means of my supernormal power and give it to them. Let the duty of going on the alms round be mine. You do your own work.”

original: sacchikaroti, so bhikkhaṃ āharatu, tenābhataṃ sesā paribhuñjitvā samaṇadhammaṃ karissantī”’ti.
analyzed: sacchikaroti saḥ bhikkham āharatu tena abhatam sesā paribhuñjitvā samaṇa dhammam karissanti iti
translated: “Friend, did we ever say to you, ‘You go on the alms round and bring back alms food, and we will enjoy it and do the ascetic’s duties’?”

analyzed: na atthi āvuso ti tumhe attanaḥ pubba hetunā labhittha mayam pi sakkontāḥ vaṭṭassantam

translated: “Dabba is young and has attained a high position.” He gave him Acceptance when he was seven years old.🔽From the time of his Acceptance, the Elder Dabba,

analyzed: a viheṭhita bhāvam pakāsentaḥ yaḥ sītavana nti gātham āha te bhikkhū bhagavantam upasaṅkamitvā  vanditvā sambhūta ttherassa sāsanam sampavedentaḥ āyasmat bhante sambhūtaḥ bhagavataḥ
translated: Those monks went to the Blessed One,🔽paid homage, and reported the message of Venerable Sambhūta.🔽“Venerable Sir, Venerable Sambhūta pays homage with his head at the Blessed One’s feet

analyzed: paṇḍitaḥ bhikkhave sambhūtaḥ bhikkhu paccapādi dhammassa anudhammam na ca mam dhamma adhikaraṇam

analyzed: tattha sītavananti evaṃnāmakam rājagaha samīpe mahantam bheravasu sāna vanam upagāti

original: nivāsanavasena upagacchi. Etena bhagavatā anuññātaṃ pabbajitānurūpaṃ nivāsanaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: nivāsana vasena upagacchi etena bhagavatā anuññātam pabbajita anurūpam nivāsana ṭṭhānam

original: dasseti. Bhikkhūti saṃsārabhayassa ikkhanato bhinnakilesatāya ca bhikkhu. Ekoti adutiyo,
analyzed: dasseti bhikkhū ti saṃsāra bhayassa ikkhanataḥ bhinna kilesa tāya ca bhikkhu ekaḥ ti adutiyaḥ

original: etena kāyavivekaṃ dasseti. Santusitoti santuṭṭho. Etena catupaccayasantosalakkhaṇaṃ🔽ariyavaṃsaṃ dasseti. Samāhitattoti upacārappanābhedena samādhinā samāhitacitto, etena

translated: Content means satisfied. By this he shows the noble heritage of delighting in development, which is the door to the development of mental seclusion.

original: cittavivekabhāvanāmukhena bhāvanārāmaṃ ariyavaṃsaṃ dasseti. Vijitāvīti sāsane sammāpaṭipajjantena

translated: Having conquered means having conquered by rightly practicing the Dispensation.

original: vijetabbaṃ kilesagaṇaṃ vijitvā ṭhito, etena upadhivivekaṃ dasseti. Bhayahetūnaṃ kilesānaṃ
analyzed: vijetabbam kilesa gaṇam vijitvā ṭhitaḥ etena upadhi vivekam dasseti bhaya hetūnam kilesānam
translated: He is “standing” after conquering the multitude of defilements to be conquered. This shows seclusion from acquisitions.

original: apagatattā apetalomahaṃso, etena sammāpaṭipattiyā phalaṃ dasseti. Rakkhanti rakkhanto.
analyzed: apagata ttā apeta lomahaṃsaḥ etena sammā paṭipattiyā phalam dasseti rakkhanti rakkhanto
translated: He is “without quaking” because he has removed the defilements that are the cause of fear. This shows the fruit of right practice.

original: Kāyagatāsatinti kāyārammaṇaṃ satiṃ, kāyagatāsatikammaṭṭhānaṃ paribrūhanavasena avissajjento.
analyzed: kāya gata asatim ti kāya ārammaṇam satim kāya gata asati kammaṭṭhānam paribrūhana vasena a vissajjento
translated: “He guards” the mindfulness occupied with the body, the meditation subject consisting of mindfulness of the body, by not relinquishing it.

original: Dhitimāti dhīro, samāhitattaṃ vijitāvibhāvataṃ vā upādāya paṭipattidassanametaṃ.
analyzed: dhitimā ati dhīraḥ samāhita ttam vijita a vibhāva tam vā upādāya paṭipatti dassanam etam
translated: “The wise one is intent” . This shows practice, taking intentness as the cause of concentration.

original: Ayañhettha saṅkhepattho – so bhikkhu vivekasukhānupekkhāya eko sītavanaṃ upāgami,🔽upāgato ca lolabhāvābhāvato santuṭṭho dhitimā kāyagatāsatikammaṭṭhānaṃ bhāvento tathādhigataṃ🔽jhānaṃ pādakaṃ katvā āraddhavipassanaṃ ussukkāpetvā adhigatena aggamaggena samāhito
analyzed: ayam ha ittha saṅkhepa atthaḥ saḥ bhikkhu viveka sukha anupekkhāya ekaḥ sītavanam upāgami  upāgato ca lola bhāva abhāvato santuṭṭhaḥ dhitimā kāyagata asati kammaṭṭhānam bhāvento tathā adhigatam  jhānam pādakam katvā āraddha vipassanam ussukkāpetvā adhigatena agga maggena samāhitaḥ
translated: This is the meaning in brief: That bhikkhu, by way of equanimity about the pleasure of seclusion, went alone to a cool forest grove.🔽Having gone there, he was content because he was free from greediness. Being intent, he developed the meditation subject consisting of mindfulness of the body.🔽Having made the jhāna he had already obtained a basis, he aroused insight with it. Having reached the path by means of the foremost of the kinds of direct knowledge, he was concentrated.

original: vijitāvī ca hutvā katakiccatāya bhayahetūnaṃ sabbaso apagatattā apetalomahaṃso jātoti.
analyzed: vijitāvī ca hutvā kata kiccatāya bhaya hetūnam sabbasas apagata ttā apeta lomahaṃsaḥ jātaḥ iti
translated: And he was “without quaking” because he had completely removed the cause of fear, since he had done what was to be done.

original: Sītavaniyattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sītavaniya thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Sītavanī is finished.

original: 7. Bhalliyattheragāthāvaṇṇanā

analyzed: gacchanti atikkamanti iti tattha kāraṇam āha sukhe laddhe nirāmisā iti yasmā kāma āmisa loka āmisa vaṭṭa āmisehi  a sammissam santam paṇītam phala samāpatti sukham laddham tasmā ati atthaḥ paccatte ca itaṃ  bhumma vacanam yathā vanappagumbe tena vata re vattabbā iti ca atha vā tatas  rattindivā appa kasirena gacchanti iti vicāraṇāya āha sukhe laddhe nirāmisā iti nirāmise
translated: and they go by, pass on. ” Herein, he gives the reason for this with “When the bliss of the deathless has been found. ” Since the bliss of the fruition attainment, which is peaceful and sublime, is found unadulterated by the sensual-desire element and the element of form and by the element of the round of rebirths,🔽that is why, is the meaning. And this is a locative case in the sense of a reason,🔽like “in the forest grove” and “then, indeed, it would be right to say” .🔽Or alternatively, since from then on day and night go by with little difficulty, he says “When the bliss of the deathless has been found” in order to point out that fact.🔽🔽

original: sukhe laddhe sati tassa laddhakālato paṭṭhāyāti attho.

translated: and they go by, they pass away. ” Herein, he gives the reason: “When the bliss of the deathless has been found,” for the reason is this: since the bliss of the fruition attainment, which is peaceful and sublime, is found unadulterated by the adulteration of sense desires, the adulteration of the world, and the adulteration of the round , therefore, is the meaning. And this is a locative of place in the sense of “in,” like “in the forest grove” and “in that case, surely, it is to be said.” Or alternatively, since from then on day and night go by with little difficulty, he says “When the bliss of the deathless has been found,” considering thus “They go by, they pass away,” for the meaning is: when the bliss of the deathless has been found, then from the time of its finding.

analyzed: adhimuccana vasena patthari pathavinti atta bhāva pathavim atta bhāvaḥ hi idha pathavī iti

analyzed: tam pi sallakkhetvā vihāram pavisitvā kata bhatta kicco patta cīvaram paṭisāmetvā divāvihāre  nisinnaḥ attanā diṭṭha nimittāni upamā bhāvena gahetvā attano citta damane upanentaḥ acetanam

translated: They can make even the insentient wood and stone, etc., straight and bent by means of the grindstone, the wheel, etc.

original: “Nagare bandhumatiyā, ārāmiko ahaṃ tadā;

translated: Having given the fruit to the Buddha, with a serene heart,

translated: I attained rapture then, and the highest bliss.

analyzed: uppajjatā iva ratanam nibbattassa tahim tahim
translated: The jewel arose again and again in the place where I was reborn.

translated: I do not remember any state of woe; this is the fruit of giving the fruit.

original: “Dibbacakkhu visuddhaṃ me, samādhikusalo ahaṃ;
analyzed: dibba cakkhu visuddham me samādhi kusalaḥ aham
translated: My divine eye is purified, I am skilled in concentration.

original: Abhiññāpāramippatto, phaladānassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: abhiññāpārami patto phala dānassa idam phalam
translated: I have attained perfection in the higher knowledge; this is the fruit of giving the fruit.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: My defilements are burned up… I have done the Buddha’s bidding.

original: Evaṃ yāni nimittāni aṅkuse katvā vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi, tehi saddhiṃ attano cittadamanaṃ saṃsanditvā aññaṃ byākaronto “udakañhi nayanti nettikā”ti gāthaṃ abhāsi.🔽19.
