translated: But a ploughman who does the ploughing, etc., shows that those things, such as the ploughing, etc., are crooked in appearance because of his crookedness. That is why it is said, “With three crooked things” .

original: Idāni tāni sarūpato dassento “asitāsu mayā, naṅgalāsu mayā, khuddakuddālāsu mayā”ti
analyzed: idāni tāni sarūpataḥ dassentaḥ asitāsu mayā naṅgalāsu mayā khudda kuddālāsu mayā ati
translated: Now, in order to show them in their individual aspects, he said, “With the ploughs, with the yoking, with the little spades” .

original: āha. Tattha asitāsu mayāti lavittehi mayā muttanti attho. Nissakke cetaṃ bhummavacanaṃ.
analyzed: āha tattha asitāsu mayā ati lavittehi mayā muttam ti atthaḥ nissakke ca itam bhumma vacanam
translated: Herein, with the ploughs, with the yoking means with the ploughs and with the yoking. With the little spades means with the little spades. This is a locative of cause.

original: Sesesupi eseva nayo. Apare pana “asitāsu mayāti lavittehi karaṇabhūtehi mayā khujjita”nti
analyzed: sesesu pi esā iva nayaḥ apare pana asitāsu mayā ati lavittehi karaṇa bhūtehi mayā khujjitanti
translated: But others say that the words “with my ploughs” are in the instrumental case, meaning “with ploughs that are my instruments.”

original: vadanti. Tesaṃ matena karaṇatthe hetumhi vā bhummavacanaṃ. “Naṅgalāsū”ti liṅgavipallāsaṃ🔽katvā vuttaṃ, naṅgalehi kasirehīti attho. Attanā vaḷañjitakuddālassa sabhāvato vaḷañjanena
analyzed: vadanti tesam matena karaṇa atthe hetumhi vā bhumma vacanam liṅga vipallāsam  katvā vuttam naṅgalehi kasirehi iti atthaḥ attanā vaḷañjita kuddālassa sabhāvataḥ vaḷañjanena
translated: On their interpretation, the words “with my ploughs” are in the locative case, meaning “in my ploughs,” or they are in the instrumental case, meaning “with ploughs that are my instruments.”🔽The words “with my small ploughs” are said because the small ploughs are not well known by nature as the large ploughs are,🔽or because they are not well known as instruments of ploughing. The reading “with my broken ploughs” is also given.

original: vā appakatāya vuttaṃ “khuddakuddālāsū”ti “kuṇṭhakuddālāsū”tipi pāḷi. Vaḷañjaneneva
analyzed: vā appaka tāya vuttam khudda kuddālā sūti kuṇṭha kuddālā sūtipi vaḷañjanena iva
translated: The meaning is: with ploughs that are very blunt and so are not fit for ploughing.🔽The word “idha” is a particle that indicates the end of the sentence.

original: atikhiṇakhaṇittesūti attho. Idhamevāti ma-kāro padasandhikaro. Atha vāpīti vā-saddo
analyzed: ati khiṇa khaṇa ittesu iti atthaḥ idham eva ati makāraḥ pada sandhi karaḥ atha vā api iti vā saddaḥ
translated: The word “vāpi” is a particle.

original: nipātamattaṃ. Gāmake ṭhitattā tāni asitādīni kiñcāpi idheva mama samīpeyeva, tathāpi🔽alameva hotīti attho. Turitavasena cetaṃ āmeḍitavacanaṃ. Jhāyāti phalasamāpattijjhānavasena
analyzed: nipāta mattam gāmake tāni asita ādīni kiñca api idhā iva mama tathā api 🔽alam eva hoti iti turita vasena āmeḍita vacanam jhāyāti phala samāpatti jhāna vasena
translated: Although the ploughs, etc., are here, near me, in the village, it is enough.

original: diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāratthaṃ dibbavihārādivasena ca jhāya. Sumaṅgalāti attānaṃ ālapati.
analyzed: diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāra attham dibba vihāra ādi vasena ca jhāya su maṅgala ati attānam ālapati
translated: and for the sake of a pleasant abiding here and now, by means of the divine abidings, etc., he meditates. He addresses himself as “Sumangala.”

analyzed: jhāne pana ādara dassana attham āmeḍitam katam appamattaḥ viharāti sati paññā vepulla ppattiyā
translated: But the repetition is made in order to show respect for meditation. “Be diligent” means

analyzed: sabbatthakam eva appamattaḥ asi tvam tasmai idāni sukham vihara su maṅgala keci pana
translated: “You are diligent everywhere, therefore now abide pleasantly, Sumangala.” But some say

analyzed: arahattam a patvā eva vipassanāya vīthi paṭipannāya sāsane sañjāta abhiratiyā yathā anubhūtam  ghara āvāsa dukkham jigucchantaḥ theraḥ imam gātham vatvā pacchā vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā

analyzed: ukkhepakatavacchassa ati āyasmataḥ ukkhepakatavaccha ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti sā upi
translated: The Elder Ukkhepakatavaccha’s verse. How did it arise?

original: kira purimabuddhesu katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭūpanissayaṃ puññaṃ upacinanto
analyzed: kira purima buddhesu kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭu upanissayam puññam upacinantaḥ
translated: It seems that he too had made his aspiration in the presence of past Buddhas, and in various existences he had accumulated merit, the support for his deliverance.

original: ito catunavute kappe siddhatthassa bhagavato kāle kulagehe nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto
analyzed: itas catunavute kappe siddhatthassa bhagavato kāle kula gehe nibbattitvā viññutam pattaḥ
translated: In the time of the Blessed One Siddhattha, twenty-four eons ago, he was reborn in a good family in this world. When he had reached maturity,

original: satthāraṃ uddissa māḷaṃ karontassa pūgassa ekatthambhaṃ alabhantassa thambhaṃ datvā
analyzed: satthāram uddissa māḷam karontassa pūgassa eka thambham a labhantassa thambham da tvā
translated: he gave a pillar to a group of people who were building a shrine for the Teacher and who could not find a pillar.

original: sahāyakiccaṃ akāsi. So tena puññakammena devaloke nibbattitvā aparāparaṃ puññāni🔽katvā devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde sāvatthiyaṃ aññatarassa brāhmaṇassa
analyzed: sahāya kiccam akāsi saḥ tena puñña kammena deva loke nibbattitvā aparāparam puññāni  katvā deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde sāvatthiyam aññatarassa brāhmaṇassa
translated: He did them a service. By that meritorious deed he was reborn in the world of the gods. He continued to perform meritorious deeds,🔽and passing from one good destiny to another, he was reborn in this dispensation in Savatthi as the son of a brahmin.

original: putto hutvā nibbatti, vacchotissa gottato āgatanāmaṃ. So satthu santike dhammaṃ sutvā
analyzed: puttaḥ hutvā nibbatti vacchotissa gottataḥ āgata nāmam so satthu santike dhammam sutvā
translated: He was named Vaccha, after his clan. He heard the Dhamma in the presence of the Teacher,

original: paṭiladdhasaddho pabbajitvā kosalaraṭṭhe gāmakāvāse vasanto āgatāgatānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: paṭiladdha saddhaḥ pabbajitvā kosala raṭṭhe gāmaka āvāse vasantaḥ āgata āgatānam bhikkhūnam
translated: and he gained faith. He went forth into homelessness and lived in a village monastery in the Kosala country.

original: santike dhammaṃ pariyāpuṇāti. “Ayaṃ vinayo idaṃ suttantaṃ ayaṃ abhidhammo”ti pana
analyzed: santike dhammam pariyāpuṇāti ayam vinayaḥ idam suttantam ayam abhidhammaḥ ti pana
translated: and he learned the Dhamma by heart. But he did not know the divisions, thinking, “This is the Vinaya, this is the Sutta, this is the Abhidhamma.”

original: paricchedaṃ na jānāti. Athekadivasaṃ āyasmantaṃ dhammasenāpatiṃ pucchitvā yathāparicchedaṃ
analyzed: paricchedam na jānāti atha eka divasam āyasmantam dhamma senāpatim pucchitvā yathāparicchedam
translated: One day he asked the Elder Revata, and he came to know the divisions

original: sabbaṃ sallakkhesi. Dhammasaṅgītiyā pubbepi piṭakādisamaññā pariyattisaddhamme vavatthitā🔽eva, yato bhikkhūnaṃ vinayadharādivohāro. So tepiṭakaṃ buddhavacanaṃ uggaṇhanto paripucchanto
analyzed: sabbam sallakkhesi dhammasaṅgītiyā pubbe pi piṭaka ādi samaññā pariyatti saddhamme vavatthitā  eva yatas bhikkhūnam vinayadhara ādi vohāro saḥ tepiṭakam buddha vacanam uggaṇhantaḥ paripucchantaḥ
translated: of the three Piṭakas. Before the Recital the Piṭakas were already established in the scriptures of the True Dhamma,🔽and the bhikkhus had already begun to use the terms “Vinaya-master,” etc. He learned the nine-fold Buddha-word by heart, and he asked questions about it.

original: tattha vutte rūpārūpadhamme sallakkhetvā vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapetvā sammasanto nacirasseva
analyzed: tattha vutte rūpa arūpa dhamme sallakkhetvā vipassanam paṭṭhapetvā sammasantaḥ nacirassa eva
translated: He discerned the material and immaterial dhammas taught in the Buddha-word, and he began insight. Meditating, he soon

original: arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: attained arahatship. Therefore it is said in the Apadana:

original: “Siddhatthassa bhagavato, mahāpūgagaṇo ahu;
analyzed: siddhatthassa bhagavataḥ mahā pūga gaṇaḥ ahu
translated: “The Blessed One Siddhattha had a great following;

original: Saraṇaṃ gatā ca te buddhaṃ, saddahanti tathāgataṃ.
analyzed: saraṇam gatā ca te buddham saddahanti tathāgatam
translated: They had gone for refuge to the Buddha, and they had faith in the Tathāgata.

original: “Sabbe saṅgamma mantetvā, māḷaṃ kubbanti satthuno;
analyzed: sabbe saṅgamma mantetvā māḷam kubbanti satthuno
translated: “Having assembled and consulted together, they made a garland for the Teacher;

original: Ekatthambhaṃ alabhantā, vicinanti brahāvane.
analyzed: ekatthambham a labhantā vicinanti brahā vane
translated: Not finding a single-stalked flower, they searched in the great forest.

original: “Tehaṃ araññe disvāna, upagamma gaṇaṃ tadā;
analyzed: teham araññe disvāna upagamma gaṇam tadā
translated: “Having seen them in the forest, I approached the group at that time;

original: Añjaliṃ paggahetvāna, paṭipucchiṃ gaṇaṃ ahaṃ.
analyzed: añjalim paggahetvāna gaṇam aham
translated: Having raised my hands in respectful salutation, I asked the group:

original: “Te me puṭṭhā viyākaṃsu, sīlavanto upāsakā;
analyzed: te me puṭṭhāḥ viyākaṃsu sīlavantaḥ upāsakā
translated: “They, the virtuous lay followers, answered me when asked:

original: Māḷaṃ mayaṃ kattukāmā, ekatthambho na labbhati.
analyzed: māḷam mayam kattu kāmāḥ ekatthambhaḥ na labbhati
translated: ‘We wish to build a shrine, but a single pillar is lacking.’

original: “Ekatthambhaṃ mamaṃ detha, ahaṃ dassāmi satthuno;
analyzed: detha aham dassāmi satthunaḥ
translated: “‘Give me a single pillar, I will give to the Teacher;

original: Āharissāmahaṃ thambhaṃ, appossukkā bhavantu te.
analyzed: āharissāmaham thambham appa ussukkāḥ bhavantu te
translated: I will bring the pillar, be free from anxiety.’

original: “Te me thambhaṃ pavecchiṃsu, pasannā tuṭṭhamānasā;
analyzed: te me thambham pavecchiṃsu pasannā tuṭṭha mānasā
translated: “They, with faith and joyful minds, gave me the pillar;

original: Tato paṭinivattitvā, agamaṃsu sakaṃ gharaṃ.
analyzed: tatas paṭinivattitvā agamaṃsu sakam gharam
translated: Then, having turned back, they went to their own home.

original: “Aciraṃ gate pūgagaṇe, thambhaṃ ahāsahaṃ tadā;
analyzed: aciram gate pūga gaṇe thambham ahāsaham tadā
translated: “Not long after the group had gone, I brought the pillar at that time;

original: Haṭṭho haṭṭhena cittena, paṭhamaṃ ussapesahaṃ.
analyzed: haṭṭhaḥ haṭṭhena cittena paṭhamam
translated: Joyful with a joyful mind, I first worshipped.

original: “Tena cittappasādena, vimānaṃ upapajjahaṃ;
analyzed: tena citta ppasādena vimānam upapajjaham
translated: “By that faith and confidence, I was reborn in a divine mansion;

original: Ubbiddhaṃ bhavanaṃ mayhaṃ, sattabhūmaṃ samuggataṃ.
analyzed: ubbiddham bhavanam mayham satta bhūmam samuggatam
translated: My divine mansion was filled with light, rising up seven stories.

original: “Vajjamānāsu bherīsu, paricāremahaṃ sadā;
analyzed: vajjamānāsu bherīsu paricāremaham sadā
translated: “While the drums were being beaten, I always attended (the Buddha);

original: Pañcapaññāsakappamhi, rājā āsiṃ yasodharo.
analyzed: pañca paññāsa kappamhi rājā āsim yasodharo
translated: For fifty-five aeons, I was the King named Yasa.

original: “Tatthāpi bhavanaṃ mayhaṃ, sattabhūmaṃ samuggataṃ;
analyzed: tattha api bhavanam mayham satta bhūmam samuggatam
translated: “There too my divine mansion, rose up seven stories;

original: Kūṭāgāravarūpetaṃ, ekatthambhaṃ manoramaṃ.
analyzed: manoramam
translated: Like a mansion with a peaked roof, with a single pillar, delightful.

original: “Ekavīsatikappamhi, udeno nāma khattiyo;
analyzed: ekavīsati kappamhi udenaḥ nāma khattiyo
translated: “For twenty-one eons, I was a warrior named Udeno;

original: Tatrāpi bhavanaṃ mayhaṃ, sattabhūmaṃ samuggataṃ.
analyzed: tatra api bhavanam satta bhūmam samuggatam
translated: There too was my dwelling, rising seven stories.

original: “Yaṃ yaṃ yonupapajjāmi, devattaṃ atha mānusaṃ;
analyzed: yam yam deva ttam atha mānusam
translated: “Whatever womb I entered, whether divine or human,

original: Anubhomi sukhaṃ sabbaṃ, ekatthambhassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: anubhomi sukham sabbam ekattham bhassa idam phalam
translated: I experienced all happiness, the fruit of the single pillar.

original: “Catunnavutito kappe, yaṃ thambhamadadaṃ tadā;
analyzed: catunnavutitaḥ kappe yam thambham adadam tadā
translated: “For ninety-four eons, when I gave the pillar then,

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, ekatthambhassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi ekattham bhassa idam phalam
translated: I do not recall a bad destination, the fruit of the single pillar.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements are destroyed … the Buddha’s teaching has been done.”

original: Arahattaṃ pana patvā katakiccattā akilāsubhāve ṭhito attano santikaṃ upagatānaṃ gahaṭṭhapabbajitānaṃ
analyzed: arahattam pana patvā kata kiccattā akilāsu bhāve ṭhitaḥ attanaḥ santikam upagatānam gaha ṭṭha pabbajitānam
translated: But having attained arahatship, he stood in the state of being free from illness, out of compassion for householders and monks who came to him,🔽and after examining the Tipiṭaka Buddha-word, he taught the Dhamma. And while teaching,

original: anukampaṃ upādāya tepiṭakaṃ buddhavacanaṃ vīmaṃsitvā dhammaṃ desesi. Desento ca ekadivasaṃ
analyzed: anukampam upādāya tepiṭakam buddha vacanam vīmaṃsitvā dhammam desesi desento ca eka divasam
translated: one day,

original: attānaṃ paraṃ viya katvā dassento –
analyzed: attānam param viya katvā dassentaḥ
translated: showing himself as if he were another, he said:

original: “Ukkhepakatavacchassa, saṅkalitaṃ bahūhi vassehi;
analyzed: ukkhepakata vacchassa saṅkalitam bahūhi vassehi
translated: “The accumulated merit of the bull Ukkhepaka over many years,

original: Taṃ bhāsati gahaṭṭhānaṃ, sunisinno uḷārapāmojjo”ti. – gāthaṃ abhāsi;
analyzed: tam bhāsati gaha ṭṭhānam su nisinnaḥ uḷāra pāmojjo ti gātham abhāsi
translated: He recites what he has learned, well-ordered, with great joy.

original: Tattha ukkhepakatavacchassāti kataukkhepavacchassa, bhikkhuno santike visuṃ visuṃ🔽uggahitaṃ vinayapadesaṃ suttapadesaṃ abhidhammapadesañca yathāparicchedaṃ vinayasuttābhidhammānaṃyeva
analyzed: tattha ukkhepa kata vacchassa ati kata okkhepa vacchassa bhikkhuno santike visum visum  uggahitam vinaya padesam sutta padesam abhidhamma padesam ca yathāparicchedam vinaya sutta abhidhammānam eva
translated: Herein, he has been cast out as a calf is, is a calf that has been cast out.

original: upari khipitvā sajjhāyanavasena tattha tattheva pakkhipitvā ṭhitavacchenāti attho
analyzed: upari khipitvā sajjhāyana vasena tattha tattha iva pakkhipitvā ṭhita vacchena ati attho
translated: He has learned the Vinaya, the Suttas, and the Abhidhamma, each in its place, and he has thrown them together, as it were, in one place, by way of recitation, and he stands there, as it were, having put them all together in one place.🔽For this is a word of ownership in the sense of instrument.

original: karaṇatthe hi idaṃ sāmivacanaṃ. Saṅkalitaṃ bahūhi vassehīti bahukehi saṃvaccharehi
analyzed: karaṇa atthe hi idam sāmi vacanam saṅkalitam bahūhi vassehi iti bahukehi saṃvaccharehi
translated: He has collected them over many years, has put them together in his heart over many years.

original: sampiṇḍanavasena hadaye ṭhapitaṃ. “Saṅkhalita”ntipi pāṭho, saṅkhalitaṃ viya kataṃ
analyzed: sampiṇḍana vasena hadaye ṭhapitam saṅkhalitam katam
translated: The reading is also sankhalitam, which means made like a chain.🔽Or it means made to come into the range of speech by way of being bound together into one.

original: ekābaddhavasena vācuggataṃ kataṃ. Yaṃ buddhavacananti vacanaseso. Tanti taṃ pariyattidhammaṃ
analyzed: ekābaddha vasena katam yam tam tam pariyatti dhammam
translated: What is the word of the Buddha? The remainder of the word is this: “He recites what he has learned, well-ordered, with great joy.”🔽He recites, he speaks, that tradition.

original: bhāsati katheti. Gahaṭṭhānanti tesaṃ yebhuyyatāya vuttaṃ. Sunisinnoti tasmiṃ dhamme
analyzed: bhāsati kathā iti gaha ṭṭhānam ti tesam yebhuyyatāya vuttam su nisinnaḥ ti tasmim dhamme
translated: He is well-ordered in that Dhamma.

original: sammā niccalo nisinno, lābhasakkārādiṃ apaccāsīsanto kevalaṃ vimuttāyatanasīseyeva🔽ṭhatvā kathetīti attho. Tenāha “uḷārapāmojjo”ti phalasamāpattisukhavasena dhammadesanāvaseneva
analyzed: sammā niccalaḥ nisinnaḥ lābha sakkāra ādim kevalam vimutta āyatana sīsā iya iva  katheti iti attho tena āha uḷāra pāmojjaḥ iti phala samāpatti sukha vasena dhamma desanā vasena iva
translated: He sat down in the right way, without wavering, not seeking gain, honour, etc., but standing only in the field of liberation.🔽The meaning is that he spoke the Dhamma. Therefore it is said: “He was filled with joy.” He was filled with joy that arose through the bliss of the attainment of fruition and through the teaching of the Dhamma.

original: ca uppannauḷārapāmojjoti. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: ca uppanna oḷāra pāmojjaḥ ti vuttam ha etam
translated: For this is said:

original: “Yathā yathāvuso bhikkhu, yathāsutaṃ yathāpariyattaṃ dhammaṃ vitthārena paresaṃ deseti
analyzed: yathā yathā āvuso bhikkhu yathā sutam yathā pariyattam dhammam vitthārena paresam deseti
translated: “As, friends, a bhikkhu teaches others the Dhamma as he has heard it and learned it in detail,

original: tathā tathā so tasmiṃ dhamme labhati atthavedaṃ, labhati dhammavedaṃ, labhati dhammūpasaṃhitaṃ pāmojja”ntiādi.
analyzed: tathā tathā saḥ tasmin dhamme labhati attha vedam labhati dhamma vedam labhati dhamma upasaṃhitam pāmojjanti ādi
translated: so he gains in that Dhamma understanding, he gains in the Dhamma joy connected with the Dhamma.”

original: Ukkhepakatavacchattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ukkhepakatavaccha thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the verses of the Elder Ukkhepakatavaccha is finished.

original: 6. Meghiyattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: meghiya thera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The verses of the Elder Meghiya

original: Anusāsi mahāvīroti āyasmato meghiyattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: āyasmataḥ meghiya ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: “The great hero, the teacher,” are the verses of the Elder Meghiya. Where was the Elder Meghiya reborn when he was a lay follower? What action did he perform to be reborn in the Tusita heaven?

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave kusalabījāni ropento ito ekanavute kappe vipassissa
analyzed: kata adhikāraḥ tattha tattha bhave kusala bījāni ropentaḥ itas ekanavute kappe vipassissa
translated: This Elder, too, having performed meritorious deeds under former Buddhas, having planted the seeds of good, in this Dispensation, in the dispensation of the Buddha Vipassi,

original: bhagavato kāle kulagehe nibbattitvā viññutaṃ pāpuṇi. Tasmiñca samaye vipassī bhagavā
analyzed: bhagavato kāle kula gehe nibbattitvā viññu tam pāpuṇi tasmin ca samaye vipassī bhagavā
translated: He was reborn in a good family at the time of the Buddha Vipassī.🔽And at that time the Buddha Vipassī, having completed his Buddha-work,

original: buddhakiccassa pariyosānamāgamma āyusaṅkhāraṃ ossajji. Tena pathavīkampādīsu uppannesu
analyzed: buddha kiccassa pariyosānam āgamma āyu saṅkhāram ossajji tena pathavī kampa ādīsu uppannesu
translated: gave up the life-principle. Then, when the earth quaked and so on,🔽the great multitude was frightened and terrified. Then the Great King Vessavaṇa,

original: mahājano bhītatasito ahosi. Atha naṃ vessavaṇo mahārājā tamatthaṃ vibhāvetvā samassāsesi.
analyzed: mahā janaḥ bhīta tasitaḥ ahosi atha nam vessavaṇaḥ mahā rājā tam attham vibhāvetvā samassāsesi
translated: explaining the matter, consoled them.

original: Taṃ sutvā mahājano saṃvegappatto ahosi. Tatthāyaṃ kulaputto buddhānubhāvaṃ sutvā
analyzed: tam sutvā mahā janaḥ saṃvega ppattaḥ ahosi tattha ayam kula puttaḥ buddha anubhāvam sutvā
translated: Having heard that, the great multitude was overcome with emotion. There the young man, having heard of the Buddha’s power,

original: satthari sañjātagāravabahumāno uḷāraṃ pītisomanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedesi. So tena puññakammena
analyzed: satthari sañjāta gārava bahu māno uḷāram pīti somanassam paṭisaṃvedesi saḥ tena puñña kammena
translated: and having developed great respect and reverence for the Teacher, experienced sublime joy and happiness. By that meritorious deed

original: devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde kapilavatthusmiṃ sākiyarājakule nibbatti,
analyzed: deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde kapilavatthusmim sākiya rāja kule nibbatti
translated: he transmigrated among gods and humans, and in this arising of the Buddha he was reborn in the Sākiya royal family at Kapilavatthu,

original: tassa meghiyoti nāmaṃ ahosi. So vayappatto satthu santike pabbajitvā bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: tassa meghiyaḥ iti nāmam ahosi so vaya patto satthu santike pabbajitvā bhagavantam
translated: and his name was Meghiya. He, having reached maturity, went forth in the presence of the Teacher,

original: upaṭṭhahanto bhagavati jālikāyaṃ viharante kimikālāya nadiyā tīre ramaṇīyaṃ ambavanaṃ
analyzed: upaṭṭhahantaḥ bhagavati jālikāyam viharante kimikālāya nadiyā tīre ramaṇīyam ambavanam
translated: and while attending on the Blessed One, while the Blessed One was dwelling at Jālikiyā, on the bank of the river Kimikālā, in a delightful mango grove,

original: disvā tattha viharitukāmo dve vāre bhagavatā vāretvā tatiyavāraṃ vissajjito tattha
analyzed: disvā tattha viharitu kāmaḥ dve vāre bhagavatā vāretvā tatiya vāram vissajjitaḥ tattha
translated: Having seen this, he wished to live there. He asked the Blessed One twice, but was refused. When he asked a third time, he was allowed to go.

original: gantvā micchāvitakkamakkhikāhi khajjamāno cittasamādhiṃ alabhitvā satthu santikaṃ🔽gantvā tamatthaṃ ārocesi. Athassa bhagavā “aparipakkāya, meghiya, cetovimuttiyā pañca🔽dhammā paripākāya saṃvattantī”tiādinā ovādaṃ adāsi. So tasmiṃ ovāde ṭhatvā vipassanaṃ
analyzed: gantvā micchā vitakka makkhikāhi khajjamānaḥ citta samādhim a labhitvā satthu santikam  gantvā tam attham ārocesi atha assa bhagavā aparipakkāya meghiya cetaḥ vimuttiyā pañca  dhammā paripākāya saṃvattanti itiādinā ovādam adāsi saḥ tasmin ovāde ṭhatvā vipassanam
translated: He went there, but was eaten by the flies of wrong thoughts. He could not attain mental concentration. He went to the Teacher🔽and told him the reason. Then the Blessed One gave him this advice: “Meghiya, when the mind-release is not yet mature, five things lead to its maturity.”

original: vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: vaḍḍhetvā arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: He lived by this advice, increased his insight, and attained arahatship. Therefore it is said in the Apadana:

original: “Yadā vipassī lokaggo, āyusaṅkhāramossaji;
analyzed: yadā vipassī lokaggaḥ āyu saṅkhāram ossaji
translated: “When Vipassi, the Foremost in the world,🔽Gave up the life-process,

original: Pathavī sampakampittha, medanī jalamekhalā.
analyzed: pathavī sampakampittha medanī jala mekhalā
translated: The earth shook, and the ocean trembled.🔽“My house was covered with a net,

original: “Otataṃ vitataṃ mayhaṃ, suvicittavaṭaṃsakaṃ;
analyzed: otatam vitatam mayham su vicitta vaṭaṃsakam
translated: And decorated with various ornaments.🔽When the life-process of the Buddha was exhausted,

original: Bhavanampi pakampittha, buddhassa āyusaṅkhaye.
analyzed: bhavanam pi pakampittha buddhassa āyu saṅkhaye
translated: The house shook.🔽“When the house shook,

original: “Tāso mayhaṃ samuppanno, bhavane sampakampite;
analyzed: tāsaḥ mayham samuppannaḥ bhavane sampakampite

translated: “Twelve Wheel-turning Monarchs named Saccakkhu,

translated: “My defilements are destroyed … the Buddha’s teaching is done.”

translated: The round of births is ended, there is no more of this state of being.🔽Herein, defilements are those that arise in a given being’s mental continuity, defile it, disturb it, and torment it, and so they are called defilements . They are greed, etc.,

translated: therefore his round of rebirths is ended. And since there is no more renewed existence for him,

original: pabbajitvā bhagavati pemena, “amhākaṃ buddho, amhākaṃ dhammo”ti mamattaṃ uppādetvā
analyzed: pabbajitvā bhagavati pemena amhākam buddhaḥ amhākam dhammo ti mamattam uppādetvā
translated: and he went forth. Out of love for the Blessed One, he gave rise to the thought, “Our Buddha, our Dhamma,”

original: sinehaṃ chindituṃ asakkonto samaṇadhammaṃ akatvā satthari parinibbute satthārā āṇattavidhinā
analyzed: sineham chinditum a sakkontaḥ samaṇa dhammam a katvā satthari parinibbute satthārā āṇatta vidhinā
translated: and he was unable to cut off his affection. He did not practice the Dhamma of the Master. When the Master had attained final Nibbāna,🔽he was goaded by the staff of Brahmā, as ordered by the Master,

original: katena brahmadaṇḍena santajjito saṃvegappatto hutvā sinehaṃ chinditvā vipassanto
analyzed: katena brahmadaṇḍena santajjitaḥ saṃvega pattaḥ hutvā sineham chinditvā vipassantaḥ
translated: and he became remorseful. He cut off his affection, and he penetrated insight

original: nacireneva arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: nacirena iva arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: and in no long time he attained Arahantship. Therefore it is said in the Apadana:

original: “Siddhatthassa bhagavato, adāsiṃ paṇṇasantharaṃ;
analyzed: siddhatthassa bhagavataḥ adāsim paṇṇa santharam
translated: “I gave a leaf-hut to the Blessed One, Siddhattha,

original: Samantā upahārañca, kusumaṃ okiriṃ ahaṃ.
analyzed: samantā upahāram ca kusumam okirim aham
translated: and I scattered flowers around it.

original: “Pāsādevaṃ guṇaṃ rammaṃ, anubhomi mahārahaṃ;
analyzed: pāsā devam guṇam rammam anubhomi
translated: “I enjoy the lovely, costly Pāsāda,

original: Mahagghāni ca pupphāni, sayanebhisavanti me.
analyzed: mahagghāni ca pupphāni sayanebhisavanti me
translated: and costly flowers come to me of their own accord.

original: “Sayanehaṃ tuvaṭṭāmi, vicitte pupphasanthate;
analyzed: vicitte puppha santhate
translated: “I spread out a bed of leaves,

original: Pupphavuṭṭhi ca sayane, abhivassati tāvade.
analyzed: puppha vuṭṭhi ca sayane abhivassati tāvade
translated: And flowers rained down on the bed.

original: “Catunnavutito kappe, adāsiṃ paṇṇasantharaṃ;
analyzed: catunnavutitaḥ kappe adāsim paṇṇa santharam
translated: “For ninety-four eons,

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, santharassa idaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi santharassa idam phalam
translated: I do not recall any bad destination; this is the fruit of the bed of leaves.🔽“Seventeen wheel-turning monarchs,

original: “Tiṇasantharakā nāma, sattete cakkavattino;
analyzed: tiṇasantharakāḥ nāma sattā ite cakkavattino
translated: known as ‘bed-spreaders,’

original: Ito te pañcame kappe, uppajjiṃsu janādhipā.
analyzed: itas te pañcame kappe uppajjiṃsu janādhipā
translated: appeared in the world during the five eons that followed.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: My defilements were burned up… I have fulfilled the Buddha’s instructions.”

original: Arahattaṃ pana patvā vimuttisukhasantappito pītivegavissaṭṭhaṃ udānaṃ udānento –
analyzed: arahattam pana patvā vimutti sukha santappito pīti vega vissaṭṭham udānam udānento
translated: But after attaining arahatship, he was satisfied with the bliss of deliverance, and he uttered this exclamation of joy, which welled up from within him:

original: “Sutvāna dhammaṃ mahato mahārasaṃ,
analyzed: sutvāna dhammam mahataḥ mahā rasam
translated: “Having heard the Dhamma, so rich and deep,

original: Sabbaññutaññāṇavarena desitaṃ;
analyzed: sabbaññu taññāṇa varena desitam
translated: Taught by the One of Perfect Knowledge,

original: Maggaṃ papajjiṃ amatassa pattiyā,
analyzed: maggam papajjim amatassa pattiyā
translated: I entered upon the path leading to the deathless;

original: So yogakkhemassa pathassa kovido”ti. – gāthaṃ abhāsi;
analyzed: so yogakkhemassa pathassa kovidaḥ ti gātham abhāsi
translated: I am skilled in the path to safety.”

original: Tattha sutvānāti suṇitvā, sotena gahetvā ohitasoto sotadvārānusārena upadhāretvā.
analyzed: tattha sutvāna ati suṇitvā sotena gahetvā ohita soto sota dvāra anusārena upadhāretvā
translated: Herein, having heard means having listened, having received with the ear, having recollected by way of the ear-door.

original: Dhammanti catusaccadhammaṃ. Mahatoti bhagavato. Bhagavā hi mahantehi uḷāratamehi🔽sīlādiguṇehi samannāgatattā, sadevakena lokena visesato mahanīyatāya ca “mahā”ti
analyzed: dhammanti catu sacca dhammam mahataḥ ti bhagavataḥ bhagavā hi mahantehi uḷāratamehi  sīla ādi guṇehi samannāgata ttā sa devakena lokena visesataḥ mahanīya tāya ca
translated: Dhamma: the four noble truths. Great: the Blessed One. For the Blessed One is “great” because he is endowed with great and lofty virtues of morality, etc.,🔽and because he is greatly to be revered by the world with its gods.

original: vuccati, yā tassa mahāsamaṇoti samaññā jātā. Nissakkavacanañcetaṃ “mahato dhammaṃ
analyzed: vuccati yā tassa mahā samaṇaḥ ti samaññā jātā nissakka vacanam ca itam mahataḥ dhammaṃ
translated: Dhamma: the Four Noble Truths. The Great One: the Blessed One. For the Blessed One is called “the Great One” because he is endowed with the great and sublime qualities of virtue, etc., and because he is greatly to be honoured by the world with its gods. This is the significance of the title “Great Man” that has come down to him. And this is a vocative expression: “Having heard the Dhamma of the Great One.”

original: sutvānā”ti. Mahārasanti vimuttirasassa dāyakattā uḷārarasaṃ. Sabbaññutaññāṇavarena🔽desitanti sabbaṃ jānātīti sabbaññū, tassa bhāvo sabbaññutā. Ñāṇameva varaṃ, ñāṇesu
analyzed: sutvāna ati vimutti rasassa dāyaka ttā uḷāra rasam sabbaññuta ññāṇa varena  desitanti sabbam jānāti iti sabbaññū tassa bhāvaḥ sabbaññu tā ñāṇam eva varam ñāṇesu
translated: The great taste: the sublime taste of the taste of liberation, because he is the giver of the taste of liberation.

original: vā varanti ñāṇavaraṃ, sabbaññutā ñāṇavaraṃ etassāti sabbaññutaññāṇavaro, bhagavā.
analyzed: vā varanti ñāṇa varam sabbaññu tā ñāṇa varam etassa ati sabbaññu taññāṇa varaḥ bhagavā
translated: Taught by the Foremost One in Knowledge: the one who knows all is the Omniscient One. The state of the Omniscient One is omniscience. Knowledge is foremost, or the foremost is knowledge, thus it is the Foremost One in Knowledge. The Blessed One is the Foremost One in Knowledge, that is, in omniscient knowledge.

original: Tena sabbaññutaññāṇasaṅkhātaaggañāṇena vā karaṇabhūtena desitaṃ kathitaṃ dhammaṃ
analyzed: tena sabbaññuta ññāṇa saṅkhāta agga ñāṇena vā karaṇa bhūtena desitam kathitam dhammam
translated: Or the Foremost One in Knowledge is the knowledge called omniscience, which is the instrument. The Dhamma taught by him, that is, spoken,

original: sutvānāti yojanā. Yaṃ panettha vattabbaṃ, taṃ paramatthadīpaniyaṃ itivuttakavaṇṇanāyaṃ
analyzed: sutvāna iti yojanā yat pana ittha vattabbam tat paramattha dīpaniyam itivuttaka vaṇṇanāyam
translated: having heard: the construction is this. What should be said here has been said in the commentary on the above-mentioned stanza in the Paramatthadīpanī.

original: vuttanayena veditabbaṃ. Magganti aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ ariyamaggaṃ. Papajjinti paṭipajjiṃ.
analyzed: vutta nayena veditabbam magganti aṭṭhaṅgikam ariya maggam papajjinti paṭipajjim
translated: should be understood in the way already stated. The path: the Noble Eightfold Path. I entered upon: I entered upon it.

original: Amatassa pattiyāti nibbānassa adhigamāya upāyabhūtaṃ paṭipajjinti yojanā. Soti so
analyzed: amatassa pattiyā ati nibbānassa adhigamāya upāya bhūtam paṭipajjinti yojanā saḥ iti so
translated: For the attainment of the deathless: the path is the means for the attainment of Nibbāna. I entered upon it for the attainment of Nibbāna.

original: bhagavā. Yogakkhemassa pathassa kovidoti catūhi yogehi anupaddutassa nibbānassa yo🔽patho, tassa kovido tattha sukusalo. Ayañhettha attho – bhagavato catusaccadesanaṃ
analyzed: bhagavā yogakkhemassa pathassa kovidaḥ ti catūhi yogehi an upaddutassa nibbānassa yo  pathaḥ tassa kovidaḥ tattha su kusalaḥ ayan ha ittha atthaḥ bhagavataḥ catu sacca desanam
translated: He: the Blessed One. Skilled in the path to safety: the path to Nibbāna is free from the four yokes .🔽He is skilled in that, well-versed in that. The meaning here is this:

original: sutvā amatādhigamūpāyamaggaṃ ahaṃ paṭipajjiṃ paṭipajjanamaggaṃ mayā kataṃ, so eva
analyzed: sutvā amata adhigama upāya maggam aham paṭipajjim paṭipajjana maggam mayā katam saḥ eva
translated: having heard the Blessed One’s teaching of the Four Noble Truths, I entered upon the path that is the means for the attainment of the deathless. The path that I entered upon was the path that I made.

original: pana bhagavā sabbathā yogakkhemassa pathassa kovido, parasantāne vā paramanesu kusalo,
analyzed: pana bhagavā sabbathā yogakkhemassa pathassa kovidaḥ para santāne vā para manesu kusalo
translated: But the Blessed One himself is skilled in every way in the path to safety, or he is well-versed in the supreme matters in the mind-streams of others,

original: yassa saṃvidhānamāgamma ahampi maggaṃ paṭipajjinti. Ayameva ca therassa aññābyākaraṇagāthā ahosīti.
analyzed: yassa saṃvidhānam āgamma aham pi maggam paṭipajjinti ayam eva ca therassa aññā byākaraṇa gāthā ahosi iti
translated: having undertaken which I also entered upon the path. And this was the elder’s verse of answering by knowledge .

original: Channattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: channatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the verses of the elder Channa is finished.

original: 10. Puṇṇattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: puṇṇatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The verses of the elder Puṇṇa

original: Sīlamevāti āyasmato puṇṇattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Sopi purimabuddhesu katādhikāro
analyzed: sīlam eva ati āyasmataḥ puṇṇa ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti saḥ api purima buddhesu kata adhikāraḥ
translated: The verse “The virtue” is that of the venerable Elder Puṇṇa.🔽How did it arise? He too had made his aspiration under past Buddhas,

original: tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭūpanissayaṃ kusalaṃ upacinanto ito ekanavute kappe buddhasuññe
analyzed: tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭu upanissayam kusalam upacinantaḥ itas ekanavute kappe buddha suññe
translated: and accumulating profitable action with the support of the right occasion for doing so here and there,🔽when the world was empty of a Buddha for ninety-one aeons,

original: loke brāhmaṇakule nibbattitvā vayappatto brāhmaṇasippesu nipphattiṃ gantvā kāmesu🔽ādīnavaṃ disvā gharāvāsaṃ pahāya tāpasapabbajjaṃ pabbajitvā himavantappadese paṇṇakuṭiṃ
analyzed: loke brāhmaṇa kule nibbattitvā vaya ppattaḥ brāhmaṇa sippesu nipphattim gantvā kāmesu  ādīnavam disvā ghara āvāsam pahāya tāpasa pabbajjam pabbajitvā himavanta ppadese paṇṇa kuṭim
translated: he was reborn in a brahmin family in this world. When he had reached years of discretion, he became proficient in the brahminical lore,🔽and seeing the danger in sense desires, he went forth into homelessness,

original: katvā vāsaṃ kappesi. Tassa vasanaṭṭhānassa avidūre ekasmiṃ pabbhāre paccekabuddho
analyzed: katvā vāsam kappesi tassa vasana ṭṭhānassa avidūre ekasmin pabbhāre paccekabuddho
translated: and he made himself a leaf-hut in the Himalayas and lived there. Not far from his dwelling place a Private Buddha

original: ābādhiko hutvā parinibbāyi, tassa parinibbānasamaye mahā āloko ahosi. Taṃ disvā so,
analyzed: ābādhikaḥ hutvā parinibbāyi tassa parinibbāna samaye mahā ālokaḥ ahosi tam disvā so
translated: who was ill passed into final extinction on a slope. At the time of his final extinction there was a great radiance. Seeing it, he thought,

original: “kathaṃ nu kho ayaṃ āloko uppanno”ti vīmaṃsanavasena ito cito ca āhiṇḍanto pabbhāre
analyzed: katham nu kho ayam ālokaḥ uppannaḥ ti vīmaṃsana vasena itas citas ca āhiṇḍantaḥ pabbhāre
translated: “How is it that this radiance has arisen?” and as a result of his investigation he went here and there,

original: paccekasambuddhaṃ parinibbutaṃ disvā gandhadārūni saṃkaḍḍhitvā sarīraṃ jhāpetvā gandhodakena
analyzed: paccekasambuddham parinibbutam disvā gandha dārūni saṃkaḍḍhitvā sarīram jhāpetvā gandha udakena
translated: and seeing the Private Buddha on the slope who had passed into final extinction, he collected fragrant woods, cremated the body, and sprinkled it with perfumed water,

original: upasiñci. Tattheko devaputto antalikkhe ṭhatvā evamāha – “sādhu, sādhu, sappurisa,
analyzed: upasiñci tattha ekaḥ deva puttaḥ antalikkhe ṭhatvā evam āha sādhu sādhu sappurisa
translated: Then one of the devas, standing in the air, said, “Well done, well done, good man!

original: bahuṃ tayā puññaṃ pasavantena pūritaṃ sugatisaṃvattaniyaṃ kammaṃ tena tvaṃ sugatīsuyeva
analyzed: bahum tayā puññam pasavantena pūritam sugati saṃvattaniyam kammam tena tvam
translated: By the merit you have acquired you have filled the measure of your good deeds. You will be reborn in the World of the Gods.

original: uppajjissasi, ‘puṇṇo’ti ca te nāmaṃ bhavissatī”ti. So tena puññakammena devamanussesu
analyzed: uppajjissasi puṇṇaḥ iti ca te nāmam bhavissati iti saḥ tena puñña kammena deva manussesu
translated: Your name will be Puṇṇa.”

original: saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde sunāparantajanapade suppārakapaṭṭane gahapatikule
analyzed: saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde sunāparanta janapade suppārakapaṭṭane gahapati kule
translated: As a result of this good deed, he passed from the World of the Gods to the World of Men and was reborn in the city of Suppāraka in Sunāparanta, in the household of a certain wealthy householder.

original: nibbatti, puṇṇotissa nāmaṃ ahosi. So vayappatto vāṇijjavasena mahatā satthena saddhiṃ🔽sāvatthiṃ gato. Tena ca samayena bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati. Atha so sāvatthivāsīhi🔽upāsakehi saddhiṃ vihāraṃ gato satthu santike dhammaṃ sutvā paṭiladdhasaddho pabbajitvā
analyzed: nibbatti puṇṇotissa nāmam ahosi saḥ vaya pattaḥ vāṇijja vasena mahatā satthena saddhim  sāvatthim gataḥ tena ca samayena bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati atha saḥ sāvatthi vāsīhi  upāsakehi saddhim vihāram gataḥ satthu santike dhammam sutvā paṭiladdha saddhaḥ pabbajitvā
translated: When he reached years of discretion, he went to Sāvatthi with a large caravan of merchants.🔽At that time the Teacher was dwelling at Sāvatthi. Then he went to the monastery with the lay disciples of Sāvatthi, heard the Law in the presence of the Teacher, and obtained faith. He retired from the world,

original: vattapaṭivattehi ācariyupajjhāye ārādhento vihāsi. So ekadivasaṃ satthāraṃ upasaṅkamitvā,
analyzed: vatta paṭivattehi ācariya upajjhāye ārādhentaḥ vihāsi saḥ eka divasam satthāram upasaṅkamitvā
translated: and by observing the rules of training and by pleasing his teacher and his preceptor, he dwelt in the monastery. One day he approached the Teacher and said to him,🔽“Reverend Sir, I have retired from the world;

original: “sādhu maṃ, bhante bhagavā, saṃkhittena ovādena ovadatu, yamahaṃ sutvā sunāparantajanapade
analyzed: sādhu mam bhante bhagavā saṃkhittena ovādena ovadatu yam aham sutvā
translated: “It were well, Lord, if the Blessed One would give me a brief exhortation on the Law, hearing which I might dwell alone, aloof, zealous, ardent, and self-exerted.”

original: vihareyya”nti āha. Tassa bhagavā, “santi kho, puṇṇa, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā”tiādinā🔽ovādaṃ datvā sīhanādaṃ nadāpetvā vissajjesi. So bhagavantaṃ vanditvā sunāparantajanapadaṃ
analyzed: vihareyyanti āha tassa bhagavā santi kho puṇṇa cakkhu viññeyyāḥ rūpa ati ādinā  ovādam da tvā sīha nādam nadāpetvā vissajjesi saḥ bhagavantam vanditvā sunāparanta janapadam
translated: The Blessed One gave him the exhortation beginning with the words, “There are, Puṇṇa, visible objects cognizable by the eye.”

original: gantvā suppārakapaṭṭane viharanto samathavipassanaṃ ussukkāpetvā tisso vijjā sacchākāsi.
analyzed: gantvā suppārakapaṭṭane viharantaḥ samatha vipassanam ussukkāpetvā tissaḥ vijjāḥ sacchākāsi
translated: Then the Blessed One sent him away, saying, “Go in peace.” The Elder paid obeisance to the Blessed One, went to the country of Sunāparanta, and dwelt at Suppāraka. There he devoted himself to meditation and realized the Three Insights.

original: Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: tena vuttam apadāne
translated: This is the reason why the Elder is mentioned in the Apadāna as follows:

original: “Pabbhārakūṭaṃ nissāya, sayambhū aparājito;
analyzed: pabbhārakūṭam nissāya sayambhū aparājitaḥ
translated: “On the slope of the mountain called Pabbhāra,🔽the Self-becoming One, the Invincible One,

original: Ābādhiko ca so buddho, vasati pabbatantare.
analyzed: ābādhikaḥ ca so buddhaḥ vasati pabbata antare
translated: the Buddha, who was ill, dwelt in the midst of the mountain.

original: “Mama assamasāmantā, panādo āsi tāvade;
analyzed: mama āsi tāvade
translated: “As soon as the sound of the Elder’s voice was heard,

original: Buddhe nibbāyamānamhi, āloko udapajjatha.
analyzed: buddhe nibbāyamānamhi ālokaḥ udapajjatha
translated: the light appeared to me as the Buddha was passing away.

original: “Yāvatā vanasaṇḍasmiṃ, acchakokataracchakā;
analyzed: yāvatā
translated: “As far as the forest extended,

original: Vāḷā ca kesarī sabbe, abhigajjiṃsu tāvade.
analyzed: vāḷā ca kesarī sabbe abhigajjiṃsu tāvade
translated: all the peacocks and all the lions roared.

original: “Uppātaṃ tamahaṃ disvā, pabbhāraṃ agamāsahaṃ;
analyzed: uppātam tam aham disvā pabbhāram agamāsaham
translated: “Seeing this miracle, I went to the mountain slope.

original: Tatthaddasāsiṃ sambuddhaṃ, nibbutaṃ aparājitaṃ.
analyzed: tatthaddasāsim sambuddham nibbutam aparājitam
translated: I saw the Sambuddha there, the one who is extinguished, the unconquered one.

original: “Suphullaṃ sālarājaṃva, sataraṃsiṃva uggataṃ;
analyzed: su phullam uggatam
translated: Like a blossoming royal sāla tree, like a star risen in the sky,

original: Vītaccikaṃva aṅgāraṃ, nibbutaṃ aparājitaṃ.🔽“Tiṇaṃ kaṭṭhañca pūretvā, citakaṃ tatthakāsahaṃ;🔽Citakaṃ sukataṃ katvā, sarīraṃ jhāpayiṃ ahaṃ.
analyzed: aṅgāram nibbutam aparājitam  tiṇam kaṭṭham ca pūretvā citakam  citakam su katam katvā sarīram jhāpayim aham
translated: Like a charcoal pit without embers, extinguished, the unconquered one.🔽Having filled it with grass and sticks, I lit the funeral pyre there.🔽Having made the funeral pyre well-made, I cremated the body.

original: “Sarīraṃ jhāpayitvāna, gandhatoyaṃ samokiriṃ;
analyzed: sarīram jhāpayitvāna gandha toyam
translated: Having cremated the body, I sprinkled it with fragrant water;

original: Antalikkhe ṭhito yakkho, nāmamaggahi tāvade.
analyzed: antalikkhe ṭhitaḥ yakkhaḥ tāvade
translated: A yakkha standing in the sky, immediately took the name.

original: “Yaṃ pūritaṃ tayā kiccaṃ, sayambhussa mahesino;
analyzed: yam pūritam tayā kiccam sayambhussa mahesino
translated: “Whatever duty was fulfilled by you, of the Great Seer, the Self-developed One;

original: Puṇṇako nāma nāmena, sadā hohi tuvaṃ mune.
analyzed: puṇṇakaḥ nāma nāmena sadā hohi tuvam mune
translated: By the name of Puṇṇaka, you were always a sage.

original: “Tamhā kāyā cavitvāna, devalokaṃ agacchahaṃ;
analyzed: tamhā kāyā deva lokam agacchaham
translated: “Having passed away from that body, I went to the deva world;

original: Tattha dibbamayo gandho, antalikkhā pavassati.
analyzed: tattha dibba mayaḥ gandhaḥ antalikkhā pavassati
translated: There a heavenly fragrance rains down from the sky.

original: “Tatrāpi nāmadheyyaṃ me, puṇṇakoti ahū tadā;
analyzed: tatra api nāmadheyyam me tadā
translated: “There too my name was, Puṇṇaka at that time;

original: Devabhūto manusso vā, saṅkappaṃ pūrayāmahaṃ.
analyzed: deva bhūtaḥ manussaḥ vā saṅkappam pūrayāmaham
translated: Whether a deva or a human, I fulfilled my intention.

original: “Idaṃ pacchimakaṃ mayhaṃ, carimo vattate bhavo;

analyzed: bhaveyyam yathā pana vaṃsa kaḷīraḥ a sañjāta sākha bandhaḥ veḷu gumbataḥ su nīharaṇīyā uva 🔽evam aham pi a sañjāta putta dāra ādi bandho su nīharaṇīyaḥ homi tasmai an ānītāya eva 🔽bhariyāya anumañña mam attanā va mama anujānāpetvā pabbajitaḥ amhi dāni iti idāni pana 🔽pabbajitaḥ amhi sādhu suṭṭhu iti attanaḥ nekkhamma abhiratim pakāsesi atha vā anumañña
translated: and could not be pulled out. “Grown from the root” means grown from the root with branches. “With branches and sub-branches” means with branches and sub-branches growing from the branches. “So too, if I were to bring home a wife” means just as the tree, with its top grown high and its branches and sub-branches intertwined with the branches of other trees, would be difficult to pull out from the root, so too, if I were to bring home a wife and have children and so on, I would be difficult to pull out from the household life. “But just as a young sapling” means just as a young sapling, with no branches and sub-branches grown, is easy to pull out from the root, so too, I, with no children, wife, and so on, am easy to pull out from the household life. Therefore, “without bringing home a wife, approve me.” “Approve me” means allow me. “I have gone forth now” means “now I have gone forth, well and good.” He thus expressed his delight in renunciation. Or else, “approve me” means “approve me by yourself.”

original: maṃ pabbajitomhi dānī”ti mātu katheti. Ayañhettha attho – yadipi tāya pubbe nānumataṃ,

original: na vijjatī”ti. Sabbepi hi tebhūmakadhammā kāmanīyaṭṭhena kāmā, tattha pavatto rāgo
analyzed: na vijjati iti sabbe pi hi tebhūmaka dhammā kāmanīya ṭṭhena kāmā tattha pavattaḥ rāgaḥ
translated: Herein, sensual desire is longing for sensual pleasures; or it is desire for sensual pleasures. But here all lust is intended by sensual desire, even that which occurs in the supramundane state, since it is said, “In him no trace is found.” For all states of the three planes are sensual desires in the sense of being desirable . The lust that occurs in regard to them is called sensual desire.

original: kāmacchando, tenāha bhagavā – “āruppe kāmacchandanīvaraṇaṃ paṭicca thinamiddhanīvaraṇaṃ
analyzed: kāmacchandaḥ tena āha bhagavā āruppe kāmacchanda nīvaraṇam paṭicca thinamiddha nīvaraṇam
translated: and lust for sense desires. Hence the Blessed One said: “With the sense-desire-passion hindrance as condition there occurs the torpor-and-drowsiness hindrance,

original: uddhaccanīvaraṇaṃ avijjānīvaraṇaṃ uppajjatī”ti byāpajjati cittaṃ pūtibhāvaṃ gacchati
analyzed: uddhacca nīvaraṇam avijjā nīvaraṇam uppajjati iti byāpajjati cittam pūti bhāvam gacchati
translated: the excitedness-and-remorse hindrance, and the ignorance hindrance” . The mind is corrupted, goes rotten,

original: etenāti byāpādo, “anatthaṃ me acarī”tiādinayappavatto āghāto. Thinaṃ cittassa akalyatā🔽anussāhasaṃhananaṃ, middhaṃ kāyassa akalyatā asattivighāto, tadubhayampi thinañca
analyzed: etena ati byāpādaḥ anattham me acari iti ādi naya ppavattaḥ āghātaḥ thinam cittassa a kalya tā  anussāha saṃhananam middham kāyassa a kalya tā asatti vighāto tat ubhayam pi thinam ca
translated: by that, thus it is ill will . It is resentment that occurs in the way beginning, “He has done me harm, he is doing me harm, he is going to do me harm” . Torpor is unfitness of the mind,

original: middhañca thinamiddhaṃ, kiccāhārapaṭipakkhānaṃ ekatāya ekaṃ katvā vuttaṃ. Uddhatabhāvo
analyzed: middham ca thinamiddham kicca āhāra paṭipakkhānam ekatāya ekam katvā vuttam uddhata bhāvaḥ
translated: a state of mental depression, a state of mental contraction. Drowsiness is unfitness of the body, a state of bodily depression, a state of bodily contraction. Both together are torpor-and-drowsiness . They are stated as one because they have a single function and nutriment, which is the opposite of the function of the four primary elements. Excitedness is the state of being excited,

original: uddhaccaṃ, yena dhammena cittaṃ uddhataṃ hoti avūpasantaṃ, so cetaso vikkhepo uddhaccaṃ.🔽Uddhaccaggahaṇeneva cettha kiccāhārapaṭipakkhānaṃ samānatāya kukkuccampi gahitamevāti
analyzed: uddhaccam yena dhammena cittam uddhatam hoti a vūpasantam saḥ cetasaḥ vikkhepaḥ uddhaccaṃ  uddhacca ggahaṇena iva ca ittha kicca āhāra paṭipakkhānam samāna tāya kukkuccam pi gahitam eva ati
translated: the state of being unquiet, by which the mind is excited and unquiet. It is distraction of consciousness.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Taṃ pacchānutāpalakkhaṇaṃ. Yo hi katākatakusalākusalūpanissayo vippaṭisāro,
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam tam pacchā anutāpa lakkhaṇam yaḥ hi kata akata kusala akusala upanissayaḥ vippaṭisāro
translated: Herein, it should be regarded as included by the word “excitedness” because it has the same function and nutriment as the opposite of the function of the four primary elements. Its characteristic is subsequent remorse. For remorse is the subsequent regret of one who has done or not done something blameable or blameless respectively.

original: taṃ kukkuccaṃ. Vicikicchāti, “evaṃ nu kho na nu kho”ti saṃsayaṃ āpajjati, dhammasabhāvaṃ
analyzed: tam kukkuccam vicikicchāti evam nu kho na nu khoti saṃsayam āpajjati dhamma sabhāvam
translated: that is the uncertainty. Doubt: he falls into doubt, “Is it so or is it not so?” about the nature of things,

original: vā vicinanto kicchati kilamati etāyāti vicikicchā, buddhādivatthuko saṃsayo. Sabbasoti
analyzed: vā vicinantaḥ kicchati kilamati etāya ati vicikicchā buddha ādi vatthuko saṃsayaḥ sabbaso ti
translated: and that is worry. Doubt: he falls into doubt as to whether or not this is the case, or he is doubtful about the individual essences of states. Or alternatively, he is worried and troubled by doubt, thus it is doubt. Doubt is uncertainty about the Buddha, etc. All:

original: anavasesato. Na vijjatīti natthi, maggena samucchinnattā na upalabbhati. Idañca padadvayaṃ🔽paccekaṃ yojetabbaṃ ayañhettha yojanā – yassa bhikkhuno tena tena ariyamaggena samucchinnattā
analyzed: anavasesataḥ na vijjati iti natthi maggena samucchinna ttā na upalabbhati idam ca pada dvayam  paccekam yojetabbam ayam ha ittha yojanā yassa bhikkhuno tena tena ariya maggena
translated: without exception. Does not exist: it is not; it is not found because it has been cut off by the path. And these two terms

original: kāmacchando ca byāpādo ca thinamiddhañca uddhaccakukkuccañca vicikicchā ca sabbasova
analyzed: kāmacchandaḥ ca byāpādaḥ ca thinam iddhañca uddhacca kukkuccañca vicikicchā ca
translated: should be construed separately. Here is the construction: “In the case of a bhikkhu in whom all lust, all hate, all delusion, all restlessness, all worry, and all doubt have been cut off by a certain noble path,

original: na vijjati, tassa na kiñci karaṇīyaṃ, katassa vā paticayoti aññāpadesena aññaṃ byākaroti.
analyzed: na vijjati tassa na kiñci karaṇīyam katassa vā pati cayaḥ ti añña apadesena aññam byākaroti
translated: there is nothing for him to do, nor is there any need for him to build up what has been done, because of the mention of another matter.”

original: Pañcasu hi nīvaraṇesu maggena samucchinnesu tadekaṭṭhatāya sabbepi kilesā samucchinnāyeva
analyzed: pañcasu hi nīvaraṇesu maggena samucchinnesu tad ekaṭṭhatāya sabbe pi kilesā samucchinnāya iva
translated: For when the five hindrances have been cut off by the path, all the defilements have been cut off too, since they are included in those five.

original: honti. Tenāha – “sabbete bhagavanto pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese”ti.
analyzed: honti tena āha sabbe ete bhagavanto pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetasaḥ upakkileseti
translated: Thus he said: “All these Blessed Ones, having abandoned the five hindrances, the corruptions of the mind that weaken wisdom, ”

original: Suyāmanattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: suyāmana thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the verses of the Elder Suyāma is finished.

original: 5. Susāradattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: susāradatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: Exposition of the verses of the Elder Susārada

original: Sādhu suvihitāna dassananti āyasmato susāradattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? So kira
analyzed: sādhu āyasmataḥ susārada therassa gāthā kā uppatti saḥ kira
translated: “Good is the sight of those well-trained” : this verse was spoken by the Elder Susārada. In what way did he attain arahantship?

original: padumuttarassa bhagavato kāle brāhmaṇakule nibbattitvā vijjāpadesu nipphattiṃ gantvā
analyzed: padumuttarassa bhagavato kāle brāhmaṇa kule nibbattitvā vijjāpadesu nipphattim gantvā
translated: In the time of the Blessed One Padumuttara he was reborn in a brahmin family. Having attained proficiency in the branches of knowledge,

original: kāmesu ādīnavaṃ disvā gharāvāsaṃ pahāya tāpasapabbajjaṃ pabbajitvā himavantappadese
analyzed: kāmesu ādīnavam disvā ghara āvāsam pahāya tāpasa pabbajjam pabbajitvā himavanta ppadese
translated: seeing the danger in sensual pleasures, he went forth into homelessness in the ascetic life. He made his dwelling in a forest hermitage in the Himalayas.

original: araññāyatane assamaṃ kāretvā vihāsi. Atha naṃ anuggaṇhanto padumuttaro bhagavā bhikkhācāravelāyaṃ🔽upasaṅkami. So dūratova disvā pasannamānaso paccuggantvā pattaṃ gahetvā madhurāni
analyzed: arañña āyatane assamam kāretvā vihāsi atha nam anuggaṇhantaḥ padumuttaraḥ bhagavā bhikkhā cāra velāyam  upasaṅkami saḥ dūratas iva disvā pasanna mānasaḥ paccuggantvā pattam gahetvā madhurāni
translated: Then the Blessed One Padumuttara, who was going on his alms round,

original: phalāni pakkhipitvā adāsi. Bhagavā taṃ paṭiggahetvā anumodanaṃ katvā pakkāmi. So
analyzed: phalāni pakkhipitvā adāsi bhagavā tam paṭiggahetvā anumodanam katvā pakkāmi so
translated: approached him. Seeing him from afar, he went to meet him with a glad heart, took his bowl, and filled it with sweet fruits. The Blessed One accepted them, pronounced the blessing, and departed.

original: tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde dhammasenāpatino ñātibrāhmaṇakule
analyzed: tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde dhammasenāpatinaḥ ñāti brāhmaṇa kule
translated: Through that meritorious deed, he was reborn in the heavenly worlds and among humans, and in this Buddha-appearance, he was born into the clan of the General of the Dhamma’s relatives as a brahmin.

original: nibbattitvā mandapaññattā susāradoti gahitanāmo aparabhāge dhammasenāpatissa santike
analyzed: nibbattitvā manda paññattā susāradaḥ ti gahita nāmo aparabhāge dhammasenāpatissa santike
translated: As a result of that meritorious deed, he was reborn in the course of his wanderings in the heavenly world and in the human world. In this Buddha era, he was reborn in the family of the maternal uncle of the General of the Dhamma.🔽In the latter part of his life, he heard the Dhamma from the General of the Dhamma,

original: dhammaṃ sutvā paṭiladdhasaddho pabbajitvā vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi.
analyzed: dhammam sutvā paṭiladdha saddhaḥ pabbajitvā vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahattam pāpuṇi
translated: and after gaining faith, he went forth and attained arahatship by developing insight.

original: Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: tena vuttam apadāne
translated: Therefore it is said in the Apadana:

original: “Ajjhāyako mantadharo, tiṇṇaṃ vedāna pāragū;
analyzed: ajjhāyakaḥ manta dharaḥ tiṇṇam vedāna pāragū
translated: I was a reciter and a memorizer, skilled in the three Vedas,

original: Himavantassāvidūre, vasāmi assame ahaṃ.
analyzed: vasāmi assame aham
translated: I lived in a hermitage not far from the Himalayas.

original: “Aggihuttañca me atthi, puṇḍarīkaphalāni ca;
analyzed: aggi huttam ca me atthi puṇḍarīka phalāni ca
translated: I had a fire-sacrifice and lotus seeds,

original: Puṭake nikkhipitvāna, dumagge laggitaṃ mayā.
analyzed: puṭake nikkhipitvāna du magge laggitam mayā
translated: which I put in a bag and hung on a tree.

original: “Padumuttaro lokavidū, āhutīnaṃ paṭiggaho;
analyzed: padumuttaraḥ loka vidū āhutīnam paṭiggahaḥ
translated: Padumuttara, the knower of the world, the receiver of offerings,

original: Mamuddharitukāmo so, bhikkhanto mamupāgami.
analyzed: mam uddharitu kāmo saḥ bhikkhantaḥ mam upāgami
translated: wishing to rescue me, came to me while begging for alms.

original: “Pasannacitto sumano, phalaṃ buddhassadāsahaṃ;
analyzed: pasanna cittaḥ su mano phalam buddhassadā asaham
translated: With a pure mind and a happy mind, I offered the fruit to the Buddha,

original: Vittisañjanano mayhaṃ, diṭṭhadhammasukhāvaho.
analyzed: vitti sañjananaḥ mayham diṭṭhadhamma sukha āvahaḥ
translated: which became a source of wealth for me and brought happiness in this very life.

original: “Suvaṇṇavaṇṇo sambuddho, āhutīnaṃ paṭiggaho;
analyzed: suvaṇṇa vaṇṇaḥ sambuddhaḥ āhutīnam paṭiggahaḥ
translated: The Well-Farer, the Golden-hued One, the receiver of offerings,

original: Antalikkhe ṭhito satthā, imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsatha.
analyzed: antalikkhe ṭhitaḥ satthā imam gātham abhāsatha
translated: Standing in the sky the Teacher spoke this verse:

original: “Iminā phaladānena, cetanāpaṇidhīhi ca;
analyzed: iminā phala dānena ca
translated: “By this gift of fruit and by the will and vow,

original: Kappānaṃ satasahassaṃ, duggatiṃ nupapajjasi.
analyzed: kappānam sata sahassam duggatim nu upapajjasi
translated: For a hundred thousand eons you will not go to a bad destination.

original: “Teneva sukkamūlena, anubhotvāna sampadā;
analyzed: tena iva sukka mūlena anubhotvāna sampadā
translated: “By that very root of merit, having experienced perfection,

original: Pattomhi acalaṃ ṭhānaṃ, hitvā jayaparājayaṃ.
analyzed: acalam ṭhānam hitvā jaya parājayam
translated: I have attained the unshakable state, having abandoned victory and defeat.

original: “Ito sattasate kappe, rājā āsiṃ sumaṅgalo;
analyzed: itas sattasate kappe rājā āsim su maṅgalo
translated: “Seven hundred eons from now, I will be the King Sumangala,

original: Sattaratanasampanno, cakkavattī mahabbalo.
analyzed: satta ratana sampannaḥ cakkavattī mahat balaḥ
translated: Endowed with the seven treasures, a powerful universal monarch.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements are destroyed … the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Arahattaṃ pana patvā sappurisūpanissayānisaṃsakittanāpadesena aññaṃ byākaronto –
analyzed: arahattam pana patvā sappurisa upanissaya anisaṃsa kittana apadesena aññam byākaronto
translated: But after attaining arahatship, in order to praise the benefits of relying on good people, he made this declaration:

original: “Sādhu suvihitāna dassanaṃ, kaṅkhā chijjati buddhi vaḍḍhati;
analyzed: sādhu dassanam kaṅkhā chijjati buddhi vaḍḍhati
translated: “It is good to see the well-behaved, doubt is cut, understanding increases;

original: Bālampi karonti paṇḍitaṃ, tasmā sādhu sataṃ samāgamo”ti. –
analyzed: bālam pi karonti paṇḍitam sādhu satam
translated: Even a fool becomes wise by associating with the wise. Therefore it is good to associate with the good.”

original: Gāthaṃ abhāsi.
analyzed: gātham abhāsi
translated: He spoke this verse.

original: Tattha sādhūti sundaraṃ, bhaddakanti attho. Suvihitāna dassananti suvihitānaṃ dassanaṃ.
analyzed: tattha sādhu uti sundaram bhaddakam ti attho su vihitāna dassanam ti su vihitānam dassanam
translated: Herein, good means beautiful, excellent is the meaning. Seeing the well-behaved means seeing the well-behaved.

original: Gāthāsukhatthaṃ anusvāralopo kato. Sīlādiguṇehi susaṃvihitattabhāvānaṃ parānuddayāya
analyzed: gāthā sukha attham anusvāra lopaḥ kataḥ sīla ādi guṇehi para an uddayāya
translated: The elision of the nasal in the first line is for the sake of the metre.

original: suṭṭhu vihitadhammadesanānaṃ ariyānaṃ dassanaṃ sādhūti yojanā. “Dassana”nti nidassanamattaṃ
analyzed: suṭṭhu vihita dhamma desanānam ariyānam dassanam sādhu iti yojanā dassanam ti nidassana mattam
translated: The meaning is this: “It is good to see Noble Ones who have well-ordered their being by means of the qualities of virtue, etc., and who give teaching in the Dhamma well for the sake of others.”🔽The word “seeing” is used here merely as an example;

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ savanādīnampi bahukārattā. Vuttañhetaṃ bhagavatā –
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam savana ādīnam pi bahu kāra ttā vuttam ha etam bhagavatā
translated: for hearing, etc., are also very helpful. For this is said by the Blessed One:

original: “Ye te bhikkhū sīlasampannā samādhisampannā paññāsampannā vimuttisampannā vimuttiñāṇadassanasampannā
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū sīla sampannā samādhi sampannā paññā sampannā vimutti sampannā vimutti ñāṇa dassana sampannā
translated: “Bhikkhus, those bhikkhus who are perfected in virtue, perfected in concentration, perfected in wisdom, perfected in deliverance, perfected in the knowledge and vision of deliverance,

original: ovādakā viññāpakā sandassakā samādapakā samuttejakā sampahaṃsakā alaṃsamakkhātāro
analyzed: ovādakā viññāpakā sandassakā samādapakā samuttejakā sampahaṃsakā alaṃsamakkhātāro
translated: who are consummate ones, arahants, whose effluents are exhausted, who have reached the true way, done the task, laid down the burden, attained the true goal, destroyed the fetters of being, and are completely liberated through final knowledge—

original: saddhammassa, dassanampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahūpakāraṃ vadāmi, savanaṃ…pe…
analyzed: saddhammassa dassanam pā aham bhikkhave tesam bhikkhūnam bahu upakāram vadāmi savanam pe
translated: for those bhikkhus I say that seeing them is very helpful, hearing them is very helpful, …

original: upasaṅkamanaṃ…pe… payirupāsanaṃ…pe… anussaraṇaṃ…pe… anupabbajjampāhaṃ, bhikkhave,
analyzed: upasaṅkamanaṃ pe payirupāsanaṃ pe anussaraṇaṃ pe an upabbajjam pa aham bhikkhave
translated: approaching them is very helpful, … attending on them is very helpful, …

original: tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahūpakāraṃ vadāmī”ti.
analyzed: tesam bhikkhūnam bahu upakāram vadāmi iti
translated: recollecting them is very helpful, … going forth after them is very helpful.”

original: Dassanamūlakattā vā itaresaṃ dassanamevettha vuttaṃ, kaṅkhā chijjatītiādi tattha
analyzed: dassana mūlaka ttā vā itaresam dassanam eva ittha vuttam kaṅkhā chijjati itiādi tattha
translated: Or else the other kinds are included by the seeing, which is why only seeing is mentioned here. The words “doubt is abandoned” and so on

original: kāraṇavacanaṃ. Tādisānañhi kalyāṇamittānaṃ dassane sati viññujātiko atthakāmo kulaputto
analyzed: kāraṇa vacanam tādisānam hi kalyāṇa mittānam dassane sati viññu jātikaḥ attha kāmaḥ kula putto
translated: are a statement of the reason for that. For when a clansman who is wise and desirous of welfare sees such good friends, he approaches them,

original: te upasaṅkamati payirupāsati “kiṃ, bhante, kusalaṃ, kiṃ akusala”ntiādinā pañhaṃ pucchati.🔽Te cassa anekavihitesu kaṅkhāṭṭhānīyesu kaṅkhaṃ paṭivinodenti, tena vuttaṃ “kaṅkhā
analyzed: te upasaṅkamati payiḥ upāsati kim bhante kusalam kim a kusala nti ādinā pañham pucchati  te ca ssa aneka vihitesu kaṅkhā aṭṭhānīyesu kaṅkham paṭivinodenti tena vuttam kaṅkhā
translated: attends on them, and asks questions such as “What, venerable sir, is wholesome? What is unwholesome? What is blameable? What is blameless? What should be cultivated? What should not be cultivated? What, when it is done,🔽would lead to harm and suffering for a long time? What, when it is done, would lead to welfare and happiness for a long time?”

original: chijjatī”ti. Yasmā ca te dhammadesanāya tesaṃ kaṅkhaṃ paṭivinodetvā pubbabhāge kammapathasammādiṭṭhiṃ
analyzed: chijjati iti yasmā ca te dhamma desanāya tesam kaṅkham paṭivinodetvā pubba bhāge kammapatha sammādiṭṭhim
translated: They dispel his doubts about the various matters that give rise to doubt. Hence it is said that “doubt is abandoned.” And because they dispel his doubts by teaching him the Dhamma, they cause him to generate the right view of the path of action in the preliminary stage

original: vipassanāsammādiṭṭhiñca uppādenti, tasmā tesaṃ buddhi vaḍḍhati. Yadā pana te vipassanaṃ
analyzed: vipassanā sammādiṭṭhiñca uppādenti tasmā tesam buddhi vaḍḍhati yadā pana te vipassanaṃ
translated: and the right view of insight. Hence it is said that “his understanding grows.” When, by developing insight,

original: vaḍḍhetvā saccāni paṭivijjhanti, tadā soḷasavatthukā aṭṭhavatthukā ca vicikicchā🔽chijjati samucchijjati, nippariyāyena paññā buddhi vaḍḍhati. Bālyasamatikkamanato
analyzed: vaḍḍhetvā saccāni paṭivijjhanti tadā soḷasa vatthukā aṭṭha vatthukā ca vicikicchā 🔽chijjati samucchijjati nippariyāyena paññā buddhi vaḍḍhati bālya samatikkamanato
translated: he penetrates the truths, then his sixteenfold or eightfold doubt is abandoned and cut off. His understanding grows in the sense of growing beyond the state of a fool.

original: te paṇḍitā honti. So tehi buddhiṃ vaḍḍheti, bālampi karonti paṇḍitanti. Tasmātiādi
analyzed: te paṇḍitāḥ honti tehi buddhim bālam pi karonti tasmā atiādi
translated: they are wise. He increases their understanding, and they make the fool wise. Therefore, etc.

original: nigamanaṃ, yasmā sādhūnaṃ dassanaṃ vuttanayena kaṅkhā chijjati buddhi vaḍḍhati, te
analyzed: nigamanam yasmā sādhūnam dassanam vutta nayena kaṅkhā chijjati buddhi vaḍḍhati te
translated: The conclusion is this: Because the seeing of the good in the way stated cuts away doubt and increases understanding,

original: bālaṃ paṇḍitaṃ karonti, tasmā tena kāraṇena sādhu sundaraṃ sataṃ sappurisānaṃ ariyānaṃ
analyzed: bālam paṇḍitam karonti tasmai tena kāraṇena sādhu sundaram satam sappurisānam ariyānam
translated: and they make the fool wise, therefore, for that reason, the meeting of the good, the beautiful, the hundred, the true men, the Noble Ones,

original: samāgamo, tehi samodhānaṃ sammā vaḍḍhananti attho.
analyzed: samāgamaḥ tehi samodhānam sammā vaḍḍhana nti attho
translated: is a good thing. The meaning is that the association with them is a good thing.

original: Susāradattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: susāradatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Susāradatthera is finished.

original: 6. Piyañjahattheragāthāvaṇṇanā🔽Uppatantesu nipateti āyasmato piyañjahattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Sopi purimabuddhesu🔽katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭūpanissayaṃ puññaṃ upacinanto ito ekanavute
analyzed: piyañjahatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā  uppatantesu nipata iti āyasmataḥ piyañjaha therassa gāthā kā uppatti saḥ api purima buddhesu  kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭu upanissayam puññam upacinantaḥ itas ekanavute
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Piyañjaha

original: kappe vipassissa bhagavato kāle himavante rukkhadevatā hutvā pabbatantare vasanto
analyzed: kappe vipassissa bhagavato kāle himavante rukkha devatā hutvā pabbata antare vasantaḥ
translated: The Elder Piyañjaha’s verses are given in the first part of the Chapter of the Elders in the Theragatha, and they are spoken by the venerable Piyañjaha. What is the origin of these verses? He too had performed the duties under former Enlightened Ones, and accumulating fresh merit in various existences, in this Thread of the Requisites for Emancipation, in the time of the Blessed One Vipassi, he was a tree-spirit living in a mountain cave in the Himalayas.

original: devatāsamāgamesu appānubhāvatāya parisapariyante ṭhatvā dhammaṃ sutvā satthari paṭiladdhasaddho
analyzed: devatā samāgamesu appa anubhāva tāya parisapariyante ṭhatvā dhammaṃ sutvā satthari paṭiladdha saddho
translated: and he stood at the edge of the assembly, unable to enter because of the great crowd, and listened to the Dhamma.

original: ekadivasaṃ suvisuddhaṃ ramaṇīyaṃ gaṅgāyaṃ pulinappadesaṃ disvā satthu guṇe anussari
analyzed: eka divasam su visuddham ramaṇīyam gaṅgā ayam pulina ppadesam disvā guṇe
translated: One day he saw a very clean and beautiful sandbank in the Ganges River, and he remembered the virtues of the Teacher.

original: – “itopi suvisuddhā satthu guṇā anantā aparimeyyā cā”ti, evaṃ so satthu guṇe ārabbha
analyzed: itas api su visuddhā satthu guṇāḥ anantāḥ aparimeyyā ca ati evam saḥ satthu guṇe ārabbha
translated: “The virtues of the Teacher are even more pure than this,” he thought, and he was filled with joy.

original: cittaṃ pasādetvā tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde vesāliyaṃ🔽licchavirājakule nibbattitvā vayappatto yuddhasoṇḍo aparājitasaṅgāmo amittānaṃ piyahānikaraṇena🔽piyañjahoti paññāyittha. So satthu vesāligamane paṭiladdhasaddho pabbajitvā araññe
analyzed: cittam pasādetvā tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde vesāliyam  licchavi rāja kule nibbattitvā vaya pattaḥ yuddha soṇḍaḥ aparājita saṅgāmaḥ amittānam piya hāni karaṇena  piyañjahoti paññāyittha saḥ satthu vesāli gamane paṭiladdha saddhaḥ pabbajitvā araññe
translated: By the power of that deed, he was reborn in the heavenly worlds and among men. In this present Buddha era, he was reborn in the Licchavi royal family in Vesālī.🔽When he grew up, he was a warrior, invincible in battle, and he was known as Piyaṅkara, “the beloved,” because he made his enemies dear to him.🔽When the Teacher visited Vesālī, he became a lay disciple. He went forth into homelessness and lived in the forest.

original: vasamāno vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –🔽“Pabbate himavantamhi, vasāmi pabbatantare;
analyzed: vasamānaḥ vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne  pabbate himavantamhi vasāmi pabbata antare
translated: Increasing his insight, he attained arahatship.

original: Pulinaṃ sobhanaṃ disvā, buddhaseṭṭhaṃ anussariṃ.
analyzed: pulinam sobhanam disvā buddha seṭṭham anussarim
translated: This is the story of Piyaṅkara. The Elder Piyaṅkara was reborn in the Tusita heaven. The Elder Piyaṅkara was reborn in the Tusita heaven.

original: “Ñāṇe upanidhā natthi, saṅkhāraṃ natthi satthuno;
analyzed: ñāṇe upanidhā natthi saṅkhāram natthi satthuno
translated: “In knowledge there is no equal, no one to compare with the Teacher;

original: Sabbadhammaṃ abhiññāya, ñāṇena adhimuccati.
analyzed: sabba dhammam abhiññāya ñāṇena adhimuccati
translated: Having directly known all things, he is resolved by knowledge.

original: “Namo te purisājañña, namo te purisuttama;
analyzed: namaḥ te purisājañña namaḥ te purisuttama
translated: “Homage to you, O man of knowledge, homage to you, O supreme man;

original: Ñāṇena te samo natthi, yāvatā ñāṇamuttamaṃ.
analyzed: ñāṇena te samaḥ na atthi yāvatā ñāṇam uttamam
translated: There is no one equal to you, as far as the highest knowledge goes.

original: “Ñāṇe cittaṃ pasādetvā, kappaṃ saggamhi modahaṃ;
analyzed: ñāṇe cittam pasādetvā kappam saggamhi
translated: “Having resolved my mind on knowledge, I rejoiced in heaven for an eon;

original: Avasesesu kappesu, kusalaṃ caritaṃ mayā.
analyzed: avasesesu kappesu kusalam caritam mayā
translated: In the remaining eons, I practiced the good.

original: “Ekanavutito kappe, yaṃ saññamalabhiṃ tadā;
analyzed: ekanavutitaḥ kappe yam saññam alabhim tadā
translated: “For ninety-one eons, I obtained the recollection of that ;

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, ñāṇasaññāyidaṃ phalaṃ.🔽“Ito sattatikappamhi, eko pulinapupphiyo;
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi ñāṇa saññāya idam phalam  itas sattati kappamhi ekaḥ pulinapupphiyaḥ
translated: I do not know of any bad destination—this is the fruit of the recollection of knowledge.🔽“For seven hundred eons from now, I will be a garland-maker;

original: Sattaratanasampanno, cakkavattī mahabbalo.
analyzed: satta ratana sampannaḥ cakkavattī mahat balaḥ
translated: Endowed with the seven treasures, I will be a powerful universal monarch.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements are destroyed … I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: Arahattaṃ pana patvā “andhaputhujjanānaṃ paṭipattito vidhurā ariyānaṃ paṭipattī”ti imassa atthassa dassanavasena aññaṃ byākaronto –
analyzed: arahattam pana patvā andha puthujjanānam paṭipattitaḥ vidhurā ariyānam paṭipattī iti imassa atthassa dassana vasena aññam byākarontaḥ
translated: But having attained arahatship, in order to show the meaning of the words, “The path of the noble ones is different from the path of the blind worldlings,” he uttered the following stanza:🔽“When they rise, I fall;

original: “Uppatantesu nipate, nipatantesu uppate;
analyzed: uppatantesu nipate nipatantesu uppate
translated: when they fall, I rise;

original: Vase avasamānesu, ramamānesu no rame”ti. – gāthaṃ abhāsi;
analyzed: vase a vasamānesu ramamānesu naḥ rama iti gātham abhāsi
translated: “When beings are rising up, I do not rise up; when beings are falling down, I do not fall down.”

original: Tattha uppatantesūti uṇṇamantesu, sattesu mānuddhaccathambhasārambhādīhi attukkaṃsanena🔽anupasantesu. Nipateti nameyya, tesaññeva pāpadhammānaṃ parivajjanena nivātavutti
analyzed: tattha uppatantesu iti uṇṇamantesu sattesu mānuddhacca thambha sārambha ādīhi attukkaṃsanena  an upasantesu nipata iti nameyya tesam eva pāpa dhammānam parivajjanena nivāta vutti
translated: Herein, when beings are rising up means when beings are rising up through self-conceit, haughtiness, agitation, and presumption, etc.,🔽do not rise up means do not rise up through the avoidance of those bad qualities, and let my conduct be in conformity with the Dhamma.

original: bhaveyya. Nipatantesūti oṇamantesu, hīnādhimuttikatāya kosajjena ca guṇato nihīyamānesu.🔽Uppateti uṇṇameyya, paṇītādhimuttikatāya vīriyārambhena ca guṇato ussukkeyya. Atha
analyzed: nipatantesu iti oṇamantesu hīna adhimuttika tāya kosajjena ca guṇataḥ nihīyamānesu  uppata iti uṇṇameyya paṇīta adhimuttika tāya vīriya ārambhena ca guṇataḥ ussukkeyya atha
translated: When beings are falling down means when beings are falling down through low resolve and laziness,🔽do not fall down means do not fall down through high resolve and the arousing of energy.

original: vā uppatantesūti uṭṭhahantesu, kilesesu pariyuṭṭhānavasena sīsaṃ ukkhipantesu. Nipateti🔽paṭisaṅkhānabalena yathā te na uppajjanti, tathā anurūpapaccavekkhaṇāya nipateyya,
analyzed: vā uppatantesu iti uṭṭhahantesu kilesesu pariyuṭṭhāna vasena sīsam ukkhipantesu nipata iti  paṭisaṅkhāna balena yathā te na uppajjanti tathā anurūpa paccavekkhaṇāya nipateyya
translated: Or alternatively, when beings are rising up means when defilements are rising up through obsession, lifting up the head;🔽do not rise up means do not rise up through the power of reflection, by falling down, by falling upon, by falling on to, through the appropriate reflection that they may not arise.

original: vikkhambheyya ceva samucchindeyya ca. Nipatantesūti paripatantesu, ayonisomanasikāresu
analyzed: vikkhambheyya ca iva samucchindeyya ca nipatantesu iti paripatantesu a yoniso manasikāresu
translated: When beings are falling down means when wrong reflection is falling down,

original: vīriyapayogamandatāya vā yathāraddhesu samathavipassanādhammesu hāya mānesu. Uppateti
analyzed: vīriya payoga manda tāya vā yathā āraddhesu samatha vipassanā dhammesu hāya mānesu uppata iti
translated: or because of the weakness of his exertion, the states of serenity and insight that he has aroused decline and fail.

original: yonisomanasikārena vīriyārambhasampadāya ca te upaṭṭhāpeyya uppādeyya vaḍḍheyya ca.
analyzed: yoniso manasikārena vīriya ārambha sampadāya ca te upaṭṭhāpeyya uppādeyya vaḍḍheyya ca
translated: He should arouse them by means of right reflection and by perfecting his exertion.

original: Vase avasamānesūti sattesu maggabrahmacariyavāsaṃ ariyavāsañca avasantesu sayaṃ taṃ🔽vāsaṃ vaseyyāti, ariyesu vā kilesavāsaṃ dutiyakavāsaṃ avasantesu yena vāsena te avasamānā🔽nāma honti, sayaṃ tathā vase. Ramamānesu no rameti sattesu kāmaguṇaratiyā kilesaratiyā
analyzed: vase a vasamānesu iti sattesu magga brahmacariya vāsam ariya vāsam ca a vasantesu sayam tam  vāsam vaseyyāti ariyesu vā kilesa vāsam dutiyaka vāsam a vasantesu yena vāsena te avasamānā  nāma honti sayam tathā vase ramamānesu no rameti sattesu kāma guṇa ratiyā kilesa ratiyā
translated: “In those who live the holy life”: in beings who live the holy life, the path, the life of purity, the life of noble ones.🔽“I too will live that life”: I too will live the life of noble ones.🔽“In those who delight in what delights them not”: in beings who delight in the delight of the strands of sensual pleasure and in the delight of defilements.

original: ramantesu sayaṃ tathā no rame naṃ rameyya, ariyesu vā nirāmisāya jhānādiratiyā ramamānesu
analyzed: ramantesu sayam tathā no rame nam rameyya ariyesu vā nirāmisāya jhāna ādi ratiyā ramamānesu
translated: “I will delight not in what delights them”: I will not delight in what delights them. I will not delight in what delights them, or I will not delight in what delights them, the noble ones, in other words, who delight in the delight of jhāna, etc., which is not of the sense sphere.

original: sayampi tathā rame, tato aññathā pana kadācipi no rame nābhirameyya vāti attho.
analyzed: sayam pi tathā rame tatas aññathā pana kadāci pi no rame na abhirameyya vā attho
translated: The meaning is: I will not delight in that at all.

original: Piyañjahattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: piyañjahatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Piyaṅgu is finished.

original: 7. Hatthārohaputtattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: hatthārohaputta thera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The elder Hatthārohaputta’s verses,

original: Idaṃ pure cittamacāri cārikanti āyasmato hatthārohaputtattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti?
analyzed: idam pure cittam acāri cārikanti āyasmataḥ hatthārohaputta therassa gāthā kā uppatti
translated: What was the origin of this verse?

original: So kira purimabuddhesu katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭūpanissayaṃ puññaṃ upacinanto
analyzed: so kira purima buddhesu kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭu upanissayam puññam upacinantaḥ
translated: It seems that in the time of former Buddhas he had performed works of merit, and that in various states of existence he had accumulated the requisites for the attainment of the Paths and the Fruits.

analyzed: vipassissa bhagavato kāle kula gehe nibbattitvā viññutam pattaḥ eka divasam satthāram
