translated: He uttered this stanza.

original: Paramahitānukampinoti paramaṃ ativiya, paramena vā anuttarena hitena satte anukampanasīlassa
analyzed: parama hita anukampino ti paramam ativiya paramena vā anuttarena hitena satte anukampana sīlassa
translated: Herein, surely he who has the highest regard for the welfare of others: surely he who has the highest, the utmost, the supreme, regard for the welfare of others,

original: bhagavato. Rahogatoti rahasi gato, suññāgāragato kāyavivekayuttoti attho. Anuvigaṇetīti
analyzed: bhagavataḥ rahogataḥ ti rahasi gato suññāgāra gataḥ kāya viveka yuttaḥ ti atthaḥ anuvigaṇeti iti
translated: of the Blessed One, who has the habit of having regard for beings with the supreme, the unsurpassed, welfare.

original: ettha “na nūnā”ti padadvayaṃ ānetvā sambandhitabbaṃ “nānuvigaṇeti nūnā”ti, na cintesi
analyzed: ettha na nūna iti pada dvayam ānetvā sambandhitabbam na anuvigaṇeti nūna iti na cintesi
translated: When he has gone into seclusion: when he has gone into seclusion, when he has gone into an empty place, when he is devoted to bodily seclusion, is the meaning. Does not fail to consider the instruction: here the two words surely he who should be brought in and construed thus: “Surely he does not fail to consider”

original: maññe, “nānuyuñjatī”ti takkemīti attho. Sāsananti paṭipattisāsanaṃ, catusaccakammaṭṭhānabhāvananti🔽adhippāyo. Tathā hīti teneva kāraṇena, satthu sāsanassa ananuyuñjanato eva. Ayanti🔽ayaṃ bhikkhu. Pākatindriyoti manacchaṭṭhānaṃ indriyānaṃ yathāsakaṃ visayesu vissajjanato
analyzed: maññe na anuyuñjati iti takkemi iti attho sāsananti paṭipatti sāsanam catu sacca kammaṭṭhāna bhāvananti  adhippāyaḥ tathā hi iti tena iva kāraṇena satthu sāsanassa an anuyuñjanataḥ eva ayanti  ayam bhikkhu pākatindriyaḥ ti manaccha ṭṭhānam indriyānam yathāsakam visayesu vissajjanato
translated: “I think” means “I suppose.” “The Dispensation” is the Dispensation of practice, the development of the meditation subject of the Four Noble Truths.🔽This is the purport. “For that reason”: for the very reason that he does not practice the Dispensation of the Teacher. “This bhikkhu”: this bhikkhu here. “With his faculties unguarded”: with his faculties, i.e., the six faculties beginning with the eye, unguarded, i.e., uncontrolled, in the sense of not being restrained from their objects.

original: sabhāvabhūtaindriyo, asaṃvutacakkhudvārādikoti attho. Yassa taṇhāsaṅgassa acchinnatāya🔽so bhikkhu pākatindriyo viharati, tassa upamaṃ dassento “migī yathā taruṇajātikā
analyzed: sa bhāva bhūta aindriyaḥ asaṃvuta cakkhu dvāra ādiko ti attho yassa taṇhā saṅgassa acchinna tāya  saḥ bhikkhu pākatindriyaḥ viharati tassa upamam dassentaḥ migī yathā taruṇa jātikā
translated: He is a bhikkhu with his faculties unguarded because he has not severed the bond of craving.

original: vane”ti āha. Yathā ayaṃ taruṇasabhāvā migī puttasnehassa acchinnatāya vane dukkhaṃ
analyzed: vana iti āha yathā ayam taruṇa sabhāvā migī putta snehassa acchinna tāya vane dukkham
translated: In order to show a simile for him, the Master said, “Like a young deer in the forest.” Just as this young deer, because of the non-severance of the love for her young, experiences suffering in the forest,

original: anubhavati, na taṃ ativattati, evamayampi bhikkhu saṅgassa acchinnatāya pākatindriyo
analyzed: anubhavati na tam ativattati evam ayam pi bhikkhu saṅgassa acchinna tāya pākatindriyaḥ
translated: and does not get beyond it, so too this bhikkhu, with his faculties unguarded, because of the non-severance of the bond of craving, does not get beyond the suffering of the round. This is the purport.

original: viharanto vaṭṭadukkhaṃ nātivattatīti adhippāyo. “Taruṇavijātikā”ti vā pāṭho. Abhinavappasutā
analyzed: viharantaḥ vaṭṭa dukkham na ativattati iti adhippāyaḥ taruṇa vijātikā iti vā pāṭhaḥ abhinava ppasutā
translated: “Taruṇavijātikā” is another reading.

original: bālavacchāti attho. Taṃ sutvā so bhikkhu sañjātasaṃvego vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā nacirasseva arahattaṃ pāpuṇi.
analyzed: bāla vacchā ati attho tam sutvā saḥ bhikkhu sañjāta saṃvegaḥ vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā nacirassa iva arahattam pāpuṇi
translated: the meaning is, “like a foolish calf.” When the elder heard this, he was deeply moved, and developing insight, he reached Arahantship in no long time.

original: Saṅgharakkhitattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: saṅgharakkhita thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Saṅgharakkhita is finished.

original: 10. Usabhattheragāthāvaṇṇanā🔽Nagā nagaggesu susaṃvirūḷhāti āyasmato usabhattherassa gāthā. Kā uppati? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: usabhatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā  nagāḥ nagaggesu su saṃvirūḍhā ati āyasmataḥ usabha ttherassa gāthā ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: The Elder Usabha’s Verses

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭūpanissayāni puññāni karonto ito ekatiṃse kappe
analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭu upanissayāni puññāni karontaḥ itas ekatiṃse kappe
translated: “The trees on the mountain-tops, the trees in the mountain-valleys, the trees in the mountain-clefts” . These are the verses of the Elder Usabha. In what birth did he make the root of merit that matured in his becoming a monk in the dispensation of the Buddha?

original: sikhissa bhagavato kāle devaputto hutvā nibbatto ekadivasaṃ satthāraṃ disvā pasannamānaso
analyzed: sikhissa bhagavato kāle deva puttaḥ hutvā nibbattaḥ eka divasam satthāram disvā pasanna mānasaḥ
translated: In the dispensation of the Buddha Sikhī he was reborn as a god. One day he saw the Teacher and was filled with joy.

original: dibbapupphehi pūjaṃ akāsi. Sā pupphapūjā sattāhaṃ pupphamaṇḍapākārena aṭṭhāsi. Devamanussānaṃ
analyzed: dibba pupphehi pūjam akāsi sā puppha pūjā sattāham puppha maṇḍapa ākārena aṭṭhāsi deva manussānam
translated: He made an offering of divine flowers. That offering of flowers remained for seven days in the form of a flower-canopy.🔽There was a great gathering of gods and men.

original: mahāsamāgamo ahosi. So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde
analyzed: mahā samāgamaḥ ahosi saḥ tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde
translated: By that root of merit he went on passing from one happy state to another until he was reborn in the dispensation of the present Buddha.

original: kosalaraṭṭhe ibbhakule nibbatti, tassa usabhoti nāmaṃ ahosi. So viññutaṃ patto jetavanapaṭiggahaṇe
analyzed: kosala raṭṭhe ibbha kule nibbatti tassa usabhaḥ iti nāmam ahosi so viññu tam pattaḥ jetavana paṭiggahaṇe
translated: He was born in the Kosala country in a family of cow-herds, and his name was Usabha. When he had attained maturity he received the Doctrine at the time of the acceptance of Jetavana,

original: satthari laddhappasādo pabbajitvā katapubbakicco araññe pabbatapāde viharati. Tena🔽ca samayena pāvusakālameghe abhippavuṭṭhe pabbatasikharesu rukkhagacchalatāya ghanapaṇṇasaṇḍino
analyzed: satthari laddha ppasādaḥ pabbajitvā kata pubba kicco araññe pabbata pāde viharati tena  ca samayena pāvusa kāla meghe abhippavuṭṭhe pabbata sikharesu rukkha gaccha latāya ghana paṇṇa saṇḍino
translated: and after he had received the Doctrine he went forth into homelessness. Having performed the duties of a novice, he dwelt in a forest at the foot of a mountain.🔽Now at that time the sky was covered with rain clouds, and on the tops of the mountains the trees and creepers were covered with thick foliage.

original: honti. Athekadivasaṃ thero leṇato nikkhamitvā taṃ vanarāmaṇeyyakaṃ pabbatarāmaṇeyyakañca🔽disvā yonisomanasikāravasena “imepi nāma rukkhādayo acetanā utusampattiyā vaḍḍhiṃ
analyzed: honti atha eka divasam theraḥ leṇataḥ nikkhamitvā tam vana rāmaṇeyyakam pabbata rāmaṇeyyakam ca  disvā yonisoma nasikāra vasena ime pi nāma rukkha ādayaḥ acetanāḥ utu sampattiyā vaḍḍhim
translated: One day the Elder, coming out of his cave, saw the beauty of the forest and the beauty of the mountain,

original: pāpuṇanti, atha kasmā nāhaṃ utusappāyaṃ labhitvā guṇehi vaḍḍhiṃ pāpuṇissāmī”ti cintento –
analyzed: pāpuṇanti atha kasmā na aham utu sappāyam labhitvā guṇehi vaḍḍhim pāpuṇissāmi iti cintentaḥ
translated: and he thought to himself, “These trees and other objects, though they are inanimate, increase in size when the season is favorable. Why should not I, who am endowed with life, increase in spiritual attainments when I am in a favorable season?”

original: “Nagā nagaggesu susaṃvirūḷhā, udaggameghena navena sittā;
analyzed: nagāḥ nagaggesu su saṃvirūḍhāḥ udagga meghena navena sittā
translated: “The trees on the mountain tops, well grown, are sprinkled by the fresh rain clouds;

original: Vivekakāmassa araññasaññino, janeti bhiyyo usabhassa kalyata”nti. –
analyzed: viveka kāmassa arañña saññinaḥ janeti bhiyyas usabhassa
translated: The thought of the forest increases the virtue of the bull, who is mindful and desires solitude.”

original: Gāthaṃ abhāsi.
analyzed: gātham abhāsi
translated: And he uttered the following Stanza,🔽“The trees on the mountain tops, well grown, are sprinkled by the fresh rain clouds;🔽The thought of the forest increases the virtue of the bull, who is mindful and desires solitude.”

original: Tattha nagāti rukkhā, “nāgā”ti keci vadanti, nāgarukkhāti attho. Nagaggesūti pabbatasikharesu.
analyzed: tattha nagā ati rukkhāḥ nāgā ati keci vadanti nāga rukkhā ati atthaḥ nagaggesu uti pabbata sikharesu
translated: Herein, nagas are trees, some say; the meaning is, trees of the Naga species. In the Naga-peaks: on the summits of mountains.🔽Well grown: the meaning is, well grown in girth all round, with roots well established, and with branches, twigs, and foliage well grown all round above.

original: Susaṃvirūḷhāti suṭṭhu samantato virūḷhamūlā hutvā parito upari ca sammadeva sañjātasākhaggapallavappasākhāti🔽attho. Udaggameghena navena sittāti paṭhamuppannena uḷārena mahatā pāvusameghena🔽abhippavuṭṭhā. Vivekakāmassāti kilesavivittaṃ cittavivekaṃ icchantassa, araññavāsena🔽tāva kāyaviveko laddho, idāni upadhivivekādhigamassa nissayabhūto cittaviveko laddhabboti🔽taṃ patthayamānassa, jāgariyaṃ anuyuñjantassāti attho, tenāha “araññasaññino”ti.
analyzed: su saṃvirūḍhā ati suṭṭhu samantataḥ virūḍha mūlā hutvā paritas upari ca sammad eva sañjāta sākhagga pallava ppasākhā ati  udagga meghena navena sittā ti paṭhama uppannena uḷārena mahatā pāvusa meghena  abhippavuṭṭhā viveka kāmassa ati kilesa vivittam citta vivekam icchantassa arañña vāsena  tāva kāya vivekaḥ laddhaḥ idāni upadhi viveka adhigamassa nissaya bhūto citta viveko laddhabbo ti  tam patthayamānassa jāgariyam anuyuñjantassa ati attho tena āha arañña saññinaḥ ti
translated: Bathed by the fresh rain-cloud: sprinkled by the fresh, newly risen, great, thick rain-cloud.🔽Who longs for solitude: who wants the solitude of the mind that is secluded from defilements; for by living in the forest he has already obtained bodily solitude. Now he must obtain the solitude of the mind, which is the support for obtaining the solitude of the substrata.

original: Araññavāso nāma satthārā vaṇṇito thomito. So ca kho yāvadeva samathavipassanābhāvanāpāripūriyā,
analyzed: araññavāsaḥ nāma satthārā vaṇṇito thomito so ca kho yāvat eva samatha vipassanā bhāvanā pāripūriyā
translated: The meaning is, who is intent on being watchful. Hence it is said in the Paṭisambhidā: ‘Mindful, bhikkhus, a bhikkhu lives, watchful, ’ this is said because of the kind of mindfulness that is circumspection. ‘ Who longs for solitude’ this is said because of the kind of solitude that is seclusion. ‘ In the forest’ this is said because of the kind of resort that is the forest” .🔽Living in the forest is praised and recommended by the Enlightened One, but that is only for the purpose of perfecting serenity and insight.

original: tasmā sā mayā hatthagatā kātabbāti evaṃ araññagatasaññino nekkhammasaṅkappabahulassāti
analyzed: tasmā sā mayā hattha gatā kātabbā ati evam arañña gata saññinaḥ nekkhamma saṅkappa bahulassa ati
translated: Therefore, I will bring her into my power.” The meaning is: he who has the perception of being gone to the forest, who is abundant in the thought of renunciation.

original: attho. Janetīti uppādenti, puthutte hi idaṃ ekavacanaṃ. Keci pana “janentī”ti paṭhanti.
analyzed: atthaḥ janeti iti uppādenti puthutte hi idam ekavacanam keci pana janenti iti paṭhanti
translated: “He generates” means he produces. This is the singular form of the word “he generates” (janati). But some read “he generates” (janenti).

original: Bhiyyoti uparūpari. Usabhassāti attānameva paraṃ viya vadati. Kalyatanti kalyabhāvaṃ
analyzed: bhiyyaḥ iti upari upari usabhassa ati attānam eva param viya vadati kalya tanti kalya bhāvam
translated: “Bhiyyo” means “more and more.” “Usabha” means “bull.” He speaks of himself as if he were another. “Kalyāṇa” means “goodness.”

original: cittassa kammaññataṃ bhāvanāyogyataṃ. Svāyamattho heṭṭhā vuttoyeva. Evaṃ thero imaṃ
analyzed: cittassa kammañña tam bhāvanā yogya tam evam theraḥ imaṃ
translated: The pliability of mind, the fitness for the development of meditation. This meaning has been explained below. Thus,

original: gāthaṃ vadantoyeva vipassanaṃ ussukkāpetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: gātham vadanto yā iva vipassanam ussukkāpetvā arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: the Elder, while speaking this verse, aroused insight and attained arahatship. Therefore it is said in the Apadana:

original: “Devaputto ahaṃ santo, pūjayiṃ sikhināyakaṃ;
analyzed: deva puttaḥ aham santaḥ pūjayim sikhi nāyakam
translated: “I, a devaputta, worshipped the leader Sikhi;

original: Mandāravena pupphena, buddhassa abhiropayiṃ.
analyzed: mandāravena pupphena buddhassa abhiropayiṃ
translated: I offered a mandārava flower to the Buddha.

original: “Sattāhaṃ chadanaṃ āsi, dibbaṃ mālaṃ tathāgate;
analyzed: satta aham chadanam āsi dibbam mālam tathāgate
translated: “For seven days there was a canopy, a divine garland on the Tathāgata;

original: Sabbe janā samāgantvā, namassiṃsu tathāgataṃ.
analyzed: sabbe janā samāgantvā namassiṃsu tathāgatam
translated: All the people gathered together and worshipped the Tathāgata.

original: “Ekatiṃse ito kappe, yaṃ pupphamabhipūjayiṃ;
analyzed: ekatiṃse itas kappe yam puppham abhipūjayiṃ
translated: “In the twenty-ninth eon from now, the flower I worshipped;

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I do not know of a state of woe; this is the fruit of my worship of the Buddha.

original: “Ito ca dasame kappe, rājāhosiṃ jutindharo;
analyzed: itas ca dasame kappe rājā ahosim jutindharo
translated: And in the tenth cycle of time from this, I was a king, a bearer of light;

original: Sattaratanasampanno, cakkavattī mahabbalo.
analyzed: satta ratana sampannaḥ cakkavattī mahat balaḥ
translated: Endowed with the seven treasures, a universal monarch, of great power.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: My defilements have been burned up… I have done the Buddha’s bidding.

original: Ayameva ca therassa aññābyākaraṇagāthā ahosīti.
analyzed: ayam eva ca therassa aññā byākaraṇa gāthā ahosi iti
translated: And this was the verse of the Elder’s declaration of his knowledge.

original: Usabhattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: usabhatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the verses of the Elder Usabha is finished.

original: Ekādasamavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: ekādasama vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the eleventh chapter is finished.🔽CHAPTER XII

original: 12. Dvādasamavaggo🔽1. Jentattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: dvādasama vaggaḥ
translated: Jenta

analyzed: duppabbajjam ve duradhivāsā gehā ti āyasmataḥ jenta ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi  purima buddhesu kata adhikāraḥ tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭu upanissayam kusalam upacinantaḥ
translated: The verse of the venerable Elder Jenta: “It is hard to go forth, it is hard to live at home” . What is the origin of this? This Elder, too,

original: sikhissa bhagavato kāle devaputto hutvā nibbatti. So ekadivasaṃ satthāraṃ disvā pasannacitto
analyzed: sikhissa bhagavato kāle deva puttaḥ hutvā nibbatti saḥ eka divasam satthāram disvā pasanna cittaḥ
translated: in the time of the Lord Buddha Sikhī, was reborn as a god. One day he saw the Teacher and, with a mind full of faith,

original: kiṃkirātapupphehi pūjaṃ akāsi. So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ
analyzed: kiṃkirāta pupphehi pūjam akāsi saḥ tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin
translated: he worshipped him with kiṃkiṇīka flowers. By that meritorious deed he went through rebirths among gods and men and in this generation🔽he was reborn in a good family home in the city of Rājagaha.

original: buddhuppāde magadharaṭṭhe jentagāme ekassa maṇḍalikarājassa putto hutvā nibbatti,
analyzed: buddhuppāde magadha raṭṭhe jentagāme ekassa maṇḍalika rājassa puttaḥ hutvā nibbatti
translated: He was reborn in the time of the Buddha Kassapa in the Magadha country, in the village of Jenta, as the son of a king who was a chief of a district.

original: jentotissa nāmaṃ ahosi. So viññutaṃ patto daharakāleyeva hetusampattiyā codiyamāno
analyzed: jento tissa nāmam ahosi so viññu tam pattaḥ dahara kāleya iva hetu sampattiyā codiyamānaḥ
translated: His name was Jenta. When he grew up and became a youth, he was urged by the excellence of his roots to go forth.

original: pabbajjāninnamānaso hutvā puna cintesi – “pabbajjā nāma dukkarā, gharāpi durāvāsā,
analyzed: pabbajja a ninna mānasaḥ hutvā puna cintesi pabbajjā nāma dukkarā gharā api durāvāsā
translated: He thought, “Going forth is difficult, and it is hard to live at home.

original: dhammo ca gambhīro, bhogā ca duradhigamā, kiṃ nu kho kattabba”nti evaṃ pana cintābahulo🔽hutvā vicaranto ekadivasaṃ satthu santikaṃ gantvā dhammaṃ suṇi. Sutakālato paṭṭhāya
analyzed: dhammo ca gambhīraḥ bhogā ca duradhigamā kim nu kho kattabbanti evam pana cintā bahulo  hutvā vicarantaḥ eka divasam satthu santikam gantvā dhammam suṇi suta kālataḥ paṭṭhāya
translated: The Dhamma is profound, and it is hard to get wealth. What should I do?” He thought thus and wandered about.🔽One day he went to the Teacher and listened to the Dhamma.

original: pabbajjābhirato hutvā satthu santike pabbajitvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā
analyzed: pabbajja abhirataḥ hutvā satthu santike pabbajitvā kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā
translated: From the time he heard the Dhamma, he was devoted to going forth. He went forth in the presence of the Teacher, received the meditation subject, and developed insight.

original: sukhāya paṭipadāya khippābhiññāya arahattaṃ sacchākāsi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: sukhāya paṭipadāya khippa abhiññāya arahattam sacchākāsi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: By the pleasant way of practice and by quick direct knowledge he reached Arahantship. Therefore it is said:

analyzed: deva puttaḥ aham santaḥ pūjayim sikhi nāyakam
translated: “I was a god, and I worshipped the Leader Sikhi;

original: Kakkārupupphaṃ paggayha, buddhassa abhiropayiṃ.
analyzed: kakkāru puppham paggayha buddhassa
translated: I offered a flower of the kakudha tree to the Buddha.

original: “Ekatiṃse ito kappe, yaṃ pupphamabhiropayiṃ;
analyzed: ekatiṃse itas kappe yam puppham abhiropayiṃ
translated: “Thirty-one eons ago, the flower I offered,

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I do not recall any bad destination, this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Ito ca navame kappe, rājā sattuttamo ahuṃ;
analyzed: itas ca navame kappe rājā sattuttamaḥ
translated: “And nine eons ago from now, I was a king, the seventh most excellent,

original: Sattaratanasampanno, cakkavattī mahabbalo.
analyzed: satta ratana sampannaḥ cakkavattī mahat balaḥ
translated: Endowed with the seven treasures, a powerful universal monarch.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements are burned away… the Buddha’s Dispensation is fulfilled.”

original: Arahattaṃ pana patvā attano paṭipattiṃ paccavekkhanto, “asakkhiṃ vatāhaṃ ādito mayhaṃ
analyzed: arahattam pana patvā attanaḥ paṭipattim paccavekkhantaḥ asakkhim vata aham āditas mayham
translated: But having attained arahatship, reflecting on his own practice, “I was able to cut off🔽the thought that arose in me at the beginning,”

original: uppannavitakkaṃ chinditu”nti somanassajāto vitakkassa uppannākāraṃ tassa ca sammadeva
analyzed: uppanna vitakkam chinditunti somanassa jātaḥ vitakkassa uppanna ākāram tassa ca sammad eva
translated: and being filled with joy, showing the way in which the thought arose and how it was

original: chinnataṃ dassento –
analyzed: chinna tam dassentaḥ
translated: completely cut off,

original: “Duppabbajjaṃ ve duradhivāsā gehā, dhammo gambhīro duradhigamā bhogā;
analyzed: duppabbajjam ve duradhivāsāḥ gehāḥ dhammo gambhīraḥ duradhigamāḥ bhogā
translated: “It is hard to go forth, hard to live at home, the Dhamma is deep and hard to see;

original: Kicchā vutti no itarītareneva, yuttaṃ cintetuṃ satatamaniccata”nti. –
analyzed: itarītarena iva yuttam cintetum
translated: It is hard to make a living by any other means than by begging, it is fitting to always think of impermanence.”

original: Gāthaṃ abhāsi.
analyzed: gātham abhāsi
translated: he spoke this verse.🔽Herein, it is hard to go forth means having abandoned a great or small mass of

original: Tattha duppabbajjanti appaṃ vā mahantaṃ vā bhogakkhandhañceva ñātiparivaṭṭañca pahāya
analyzed: tattha duppabbajjanti appam vā mahantam vā bhoga kkhandhañca iva ñāti parivaṭṭañca pahāya
translated: wealth and relatives

original: imasmiṃ sāsane uraṃ datvā pabbajanassa dukkarattā dukkhaṃ pabbajanaṃ, dukkarā pabbajjāti
analyzed: imasmin sāsane uram da tvā pabbajanassa dukkara ttā dukkham pabbajanam dukkarā pabbajjāti
translated: In this Dispensation, the going forth is hard to do because of the difficulty of giving up the body, and the going forth is hard because of the difficulty of the practice,

original: duppabbajjaṃ. Veti nipātamattaṃ, daḷhattho vā “pabbajjā dukkhā”ti. Gehañce āvaseyyaṃ,
analyzed: duppabbajjam vā iti nipāta mattam daḷha atthaḥ vā pabbajjā dukkhā ati geham ce āvaseyyam
translated: thus it is the hard-to-do-and-the-hard-to-practice-going-forth. Ve is merely a particle, or it has the meaning of ‘firm’, thus ‘the going forth is hard’. If I were to live in a house,

original: duradhivāsā gehā, yasmā gehaṃ adhivasantena raññā rājakiccaṃ, issarena issarakiccaṃ,
analyzed: duradhivāsā gehā yasmā geham adhivasantena raññā rāja kiccam issarena issara kiccam
translated: living in a house is hard to live in, because when living in a house, a king must do kingly duties, a lord must do lordly duties,

original: gahapatinā gahapatikiccaṃ kattabbaṃ hoti, parijano ceva samaṇabrāhmaṇā ca saṅgahetabbā,
analyzed: gahapatinā gahapati kiccam kattabbam hoti parijanaḥ ca iva samaṇa brāhmaṇā ca saṅgahetabbā
translated: a householder must do householder duties, and he must gather around him servants and workers, ascetics and brahmins,

original: tasmiṃ tasmiñca kattabbe kariyamānepi gharāvāso chiddaghaṭo viya mahāsamuddo viya
analyzed: tasmin tasmin ca kattabbe kariyamāne pi ghara āvāsaḥ chidda ghaṭaḥ viya mahā samuddaḥ viya
translated: and although he does this and that duty, living in a house is hard to fill up, like a pot with a hole in it, or the great ocean,

original: ca duppūro, tasmā gehā nāmete adhivasituṃ āvasituṃ dukkhā dukkarāti katvā duradhivāsā
analyzed: ca duppūraḥ tasmai gehā nāma ete adhivasitum āvasitum dukkhā dukkarā ati katvā duradhivāsā
translated: thus it is hard to live in, hard to dwell in, because of the difficulty of living in, thus it is hard to live in, hard to dwell in. If I were to practice the going forth,

original: durāvāsāti. Pabbajjañce anutiṭṭheyyaṃ dhammo gambhīro, yadatthā pabbajjā, so pabbajitena
analyzed: durāvāsā ati pabbajjañce anutiṭṭheyyam dhammaḥ gambhīraḥ yadatthā pabbajjā so pabbajitena
translated: the Dhamma is deep, the going forth is for the sake of that, that Dhamma which has been gone forth to🔽should be attained by one who has gone forth, the Dhamma of penetration is deep, it is hard to see, hard to understand,

original: adhigantabbo paṭivedhasaddhammo gambhīro, gambhīrañāṇagocarattā duddaso, duppaṭivijjho
analyzed: adhigantabbaḥ paṭivedha saddhammaḥ gambhīraḥ gambhīra ñāṇa gocara ttā duddasaḥ duppaṭivijjhaḥ
translated: hard to awaken to,

original: dhammassa gambhīrabhāvena duppaṭivijjhattā. Gehañce āvaseyyaṃ, duradhigamā bhogā
analyzed: dhammassa gambhīra bhāvena duppaṭivijjhattā gehañce āvaseyyam duradhigamāḥ bhogāḥ
translated: because of the profundity of the Dhamma, which is hard to penetrate.🔽If I were to live in a house, wealth would be hard to obtain,

original: yehi vinā na sakkā gehaṃ āvasituṃ, te bhogā dukkhena kasirena adhigantabbatāya duradhigamā.
analyzed: yehi vinā na sakkā geham āvasitum te bhogāḥ dukkhena kasirena adhigantabba tāya duradhigamā
translated: because the wealth without which it is impossible to live in a house is hard to obtain because of the difficulty and trouble of earning it.

original: Evaṃ sante gharāvāsaṃ pahāya pabbajjaṃyeva anutiṭṭheyyaṃ, evampi kicchā vutti no
analyzed: evam sante ghara āvāsam pahāya pabbajjam yeva anutiṭṭheyyam evam pi kicchā vutti no
translated: If that is so, I will go forth from the house life,

original: itarītarena idha imasmiṃ buddhasāsane itarītarena yathāladdhena paccayena amhākaṃ
analyzed: itarītarena idha imasmin buddha sāsane itarītarena yathāladdhena paccayena amhākam
translated: and in this Dispensation of the Buddha, with whatever comes by way of requisites,

original: vutti jīvikā kicchā dukkhā, gharāvāsānaṃ duradhivāsatāya bhogānañca duradhigamatāya
analyzed: vutti jīvikā kicchā dukkhā gharā vāsānam duradhivāsa tāya bhogānam ca duradhigama tāya
translated: our livelihood is difficult, hard. It is difficult to live in a house, and wealth is hard to obtain.

original: gehe itarītarena paccayena yāpetabbatāya kicchā kasirā vutti amhākaṃ, tattha kiṃ
analyzed: gehe itarītarena paccayena yāpetabba tāya kicchā kasirā vutti amhākam tattha kim
translated: In a house, one has to live with difficulty, with trouble, with whatever comes by way of requisites. What should be done there?

original: kātuṃ vaṭṭatīti? Yuttaṃ cintetuṃ satatamaniccataṃ sakalaṃ divasaṃ pubbarattāpararattañca
analyzed: kātum vaṭṭati iti yuttam cintetum satatam aniccatam sakalam divasam pubbaratta apararattam ca
translated: It is proper to reflect constantly on the impermanence of all conditioned things, all day and all night,

original: tebhūmakadhammajātaṃ aniccatanti, tato uppādavayavantato ādiantavantato tāvakālikato
analyzed: tebhūmaka dhamma jātam tatas uppāda vayavantataḥ ādi antavantataḥ tāvakālikataḥ
translated: because of their arising and passing away, their beginning and end, and their being only for a short time.

original: ca na niccanti “anicca”nti cintetuṃ vipassituṃ yuttaṃ. Aniccānupassanāya siddhāya
analyzed: ca na niccanti aniccanti cintetum vipassitum yuttam anicca anupassanāya siddhāya
translated: When contemplation of impermanence is accomplished,🔽the other contemplations are easily accomplished.🔽That is why only contemplation of impermanence is mentioned here.

original: itarānupassanā sukheneva sijjhantīti aniccānupassanāva ettha vuttā, aniccassa dukkhānattatānaṃ
analyzed: itarā anupassanā sukhena iva sijjhanti iti anicca anupassanā ā va ettha vuttā aniccassa dukkha ānatta tānam
translated: Because impermanence is invariably associated with pain and not-self,🔽and because it is easily grasped by one who is a disciple of the Buddha.

original: abyabhicaraṇato sāsanikassa sukhaggahaṇato ca. Tenāha – “yadaniccaṃ taṃ dukkhaṃ,
analyzed: abyabhicaraṇato sāsanikassa sukha ggahaṇato ca tena āha yat aniccam tam dukkham
translated: Therefore it is said: “What is impermanent is painful;

original: yaṃ dukkhaṃ tadanattā”ti, “yaṃ kiñci samudayadhammaṃ, sabbaṃ taṃ nirodhadhammaṃ”,
analyzed: yat dukkham tat anattā ati yam kiñci samudaya dhammam sabbam tam nirodha dhammam
translated: what is painful is not-self” . “Whatever has the nature of origination, all that has the nature of cessation” .🔽“All formations are subject to cessation” .

original: “vayadhammā saṅkhārā”ti ca tadaminā evaṃ aññamaññaṃ paṭipakkhavasena aparāparaṃ uppanne
analyzed: vaya dhammā saṅkhārā ti ca tad aminā evam aññam aññam paṭipakkha vasena apara aparam uppanne
translated: By this method, when the opposite thoughts arise one after the other,

original: vitakke niggahetvā aniccatāmukhena vipassanaṃ ārabhitvā idāni katakicco jātoti dasseti.
analyzed: vitakke niggahetvā anicca tā mukhena vipassanam ārabhitvā idāni kata kiccaḥ jātaḥ ti dasseti
translated: he should suppress them and begin insight by way of impermanence.🔽Now he shows that he has accomplished his task.

original: Tena vuttaṃ “attano paṭipatti”ntiādi. Idameva therassa aññābyākaraṇaṃ ahosi.
analyzed: tena vuttam attanaḥ paṭipatti nti ādi idam eva therassa aññā byākaraṇam ahosi
translated: This was the Elder’s declaration of his knowledge.

original: Jentattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: jenta thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the verses of the Elder Jenta is finished.

original: 2. Vacchagottattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
translated: Vacchagotta

original: Tevijjohaṃ mahājhāyīti āyasmato vacchagottattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: mahā jhāyī iti āyasmataḥ vacchagotta ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: How did this come about? He too had made a resolve under former Buddhas,

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭūpanissayaṃ kusalabījaṃ ropento vipassissa
analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭu upanissayam kusala bījam ropentaḥ vipassissa
translated: and had planted the seed of wholesome roots in various states of existence,

original: bhagavato kāle bandhumatīnagare kulagehe nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto ekadivasaṃ raññā
analyzed: bhagavato kāle bandhumatī nagare kula gehe nibbattitvā viññutam pattaḥ eka divasam raññā
translated: in the dispensation of the Exalted Vipassī,

original: nāgarehi ca saddhiṃ buddhapūjaṃ katvā tato paraṃ devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ
analyzed: nāgarehi ca saddhim buddha pūjam katvā tato param deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin
translated: and after passing through the round of existences among gods and men,

original: buddhuppāde rājagahe vibhavasampannassa brāhmaṇassa putto hutvā nibbatti, tassa vacchagottatāya
analyzed: buddhuppāde rājagahe vibhava sampannassa brāhmaṇassa puttaḥ hutvā nibbatti tassa vacchagotta tāya
translated: was reborn in this dispensation in the city of Rājagaha, the son of a wealthy brāhmaṇa, and because he was called Vaccha,

original: vacchagottotveva samaññā ahosi. So viññutaṃ patvā brāhmaṇavijjāsu nipphattiṃ gato🔽vimuttiṃ gavesanto tattha sāraṃ adisvā paribbājakapabbajjaṃ pabbajitvā vicaranto
analyzed: vaccha gottaḥ tu eva samaññā ahosi saḥ viññutam patvā brāhmaṇa vijjāsu nipphattim gataḥ  vimuttim gavesantaḥ tattha sāram a disvā paribbājaka pabbajjam pabbajitvā vicarantaḥ
translated: he was known as Vacchagotta. When he had reached years of discretion, he became proficient in the brāhmaṇa lore,🔽and in search of deliverance, seeing no essence in that lore,🔽went forth into the homeless state of a wanderer, and as he wandered about,

original: satthāraṃ upasaṅkamitvā pañhaṃ pucchitvā tasmiṃ vissajjite pasannamānaso satthu santike
analyzed: satthāram upasaṅkamitvā pañham pucchitvā tasmin vissajjite pasanna mānasaḥ satthu santike
translated: he approached the Teacher, asked him a question, and when the Teacher answered it, he was satisfied, and

original: pabbajitvā vipassanāya kammaṃ karonto nacirasseva chaḷabhiñño ahosi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: pabbajitvā vipassanāya kammam karontaḥ nacirassa iva chaḍabhiññaḥ ahosi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: and after he had gone forth he did the ascetic’s duties and in no long time attained the six kinds of direct knowledge. Hence it is said in the Apadana:

original: “Udentaṃ sataraṃsiṃva, pītaraṃsiṃva bhāṇumaṃ;
analyzed: udentam pītaraṃsiṃva
translated: “Like the sun rising with its thousand rays,🔽Like the moon in the fifteenth night,

original: Pannarase yathā candaṃ, niyyantaṃ lokanāyakaṃ.
analyzed: pannarase yathā candam loka nāyakam
translated: The Leader of the world went forth,🔽“Sixty-eight thousand men,

original: “Aṭṭhasaṭṭhisahassāni, sabbe khīṇāsavā ahuṃ;
analyzed: aṭṭha saṭṭhi sahassāni sabbe khīṇa āsavāḥ ahum
translated: All of them cankers destroyed,🔽Surrounded the Enlightened One,

original: Parivāriṃsu sambuddhaṃ, dvipadindaṃ narāsabhaṃ.
analyzed: sambuddham dvipad indam narāsabham
translated: The Leader of men, the bull of men.

original: “Sammajjitvāna taṃ vīthiṃ, niyyante lokanāyake;
analyzed: sammajjitvāna tam vīthim niyyante loka nāyake
translated: “When the Leader of the world went forth,🔽I swept the road with a pure mind

original: Ussāpesiṃ dhajaṃ tattha, vippasannena cetasā.
analyzed: ussāpesim dhajam tattha vippasannena cetasā
translated: And raised a flag there.

original: “Ekanavutito kappe, yaṃ dhajaṃ abhiropayiṃ;
analyzed: ekanavutitaḥ kappe yam dhajam abhiropayim
translated: “For ninety-one eons🔽I do not recall a state of woe;

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, dhajadānassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi dhaja dānaḥ idam phalam
translated: This is the fruit of the flag offering.🔽“In the fourth future eon

original: “Ito catutthake kappe, rājāhosiṃ mahabbalo;
analyzed: itas catutthake kappe rājā ahosim mahat balo
translated: I was a king of great power,🔽Endowed with every excellence,

original: Sabbākārena sampanno, sudhajo iti vissuto.
analyzed: sabba ākārena sampanno sudhajaḥ iti vissutaḥ
translated: Renowned as Sudhaja.🔽“My defilements are burned up …

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: The Buddha’s dispensation is fulfilled.”

original: Chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā attano paṭipattiṃ paccavekkhitvā somanassajāto udānavasena –
analyzed: chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā attanaḥ paṭipattim paccavekkhitvā somanassa jātaḥ udāna vasena
translated: But after he had attained the six kinds of direct knowledge, he surveyed his own progress and, filled with joy, he uttered the following exalted utterance:

original: “Tevijjohaṃ mahājhāyī, cetosamathakovido;
analyzed: mahā jhāyī cetaḥ samatha kovidaḥ
translated: “I am a triple-knowledge man, a great meditator, skilled in mental tranquillity,

original: Sadattho me anuppatto, kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti. – gāthaṃ abhāsi;
analyzed: sadatthaḥ me anuppatto katam buddhassa sāsananti gātham abhāsi
translated: My own good has been accomplished; the Buddha’s dispensation has been fulfilled.”

original: Tattha tevijjohanti yadipi maṃ pubbe tiṇṇaṃ vedānaṃ pāraṃ gatattā “brāhmaṇo tevijjo”ti🔽sañjānanti, taṃ pana samaññāmattaṃ vedesu vijjākiccassa abhāvato. Idāni pana pubbenivāsañāṇādīnaṃ
analyzed: tattha yadi api mama pubbe tiṇṇam vedānam pāram gata ttā brāhmaṇaḥ tevijja uti  sañjānanti tam pana samaññā mattam vedesu vijjā kiccassa abhāvataḥ idāni pana pubbenivāsa ñāṇa ādīnam
translated: Herein, I am a triple-knowledge man: although formerly people knew me as a brahmin who had gone to the end of the three Vedas,

original: tissannaṃ vijjānaṃ adhigatattā paramatthato tevijjo ahaṃ, mahantassa anavasesassa🔽samudayapakkhiyassa kilesagaṇassa jhāpanato, mahantena maggaphalajhānena mahantassa
analyzed: tissannam vijjānam adhigata ttā paramatthataḥ tevijjaḥ aham mahantassa anavasesassa  samudaya pakkhiyassa kilesa gaṇassa jhāpanataḥ mahantena magga phala jhānena mahantassa
translated: that was only a conventional expression, since there is no such thing as knowledge in the three Vedas. But now I am a triple-knowledge man in the ultimate sense because I have attained the three knowledges, namely, the knowledge of recollection of past lives, the knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings, and the knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: uḷārassa paṇītassa nibbānassa jhāyanato ca mahājhāyī. Cetosamathakovidoti cittasaṅkhobhakarānaṃ
analyzed: uḷārassa paṇītassa nibbānassa jhāyanataḥ ca mahā jhāyī ceto samatha kovidaḥ iti citta saṅkhobha karānam
translated: I am a great meditator because I have burnt up the great mass of defilements that are on the side of origin by the great meditation that is the path and fruition, and because I have meditated on the great, sublime, excellent extinction. Skilled in mental tranquillity: skilled in the mental tranquillity that is the stilling of the mental states that cause agitation.

original: saṃkilesadhammānaṃ vūpasamanena cetaso samādahane kusalo. Etena tevijjabhāvassa kāraṇamāha.
analyzed: saṃkilesa dhammānam vūpasamanena cetasaḥ samādahane kusalaḥ etena tevijja bhāvassa kāraṇam āha
translated: This is the reason for his being a triple-knowledge man.

original: Samādhikosallasahitena hi āsavakkhayena tevijjatā, na kevalena. Sadatthoti sakattho
analyzed: samādhi kosalla sahitena hi āsava kkhayena tevijjatā na kevalena sadattho ti sakatthaḥ
translated: For the state of being a knower of the three knowledges is due to the destruction of the taints together with the skill in concentration, not merely to that.

original: ka-kārassāyaṃ da-kāro kato “anuppattasadattho”tiādīsu viya. “Sadattho”ti ca arahattaṃ
analyzed: kakārassa ayam dakāraḥ kataḥ anuppatta sadattho ti ādīsu viya sadattho ti ca arahattam
translated: The meaning of “self”: the k of the word sakattha is like the d of the word anuppattasadattho in the verse “Anuppattasadattho, etc.” The meaning of “self” should be understood as arahatship.

original: veditabbaṃ. Tañhi attapaṭibandhaṭṭhena attānaṃ avijahanaṭṭhena attano paramatthaṭṭhena
analyzed: veditabbam tat hi atta paṭibandha ṭṭhena attānam a vijahana ṭṭhena attano paramattha ṭṭhena
translated: For that is called “the meaning of self” because it is the meaning of self in the sense of non-abandonment of self, in the sense of the ultimate of self,

original: attano atthattā “sakattho”ti vuccati. Svāyaṃ sadattho me mayā anuppatto adhigato.
analyzed: attanaḥ attha ttā sakatthā iti vuccati svā ayam sadatthaḥ me mayā anuppattaḥ adhigataḥ
translated: in the sense of the good of self. The meaning of “I have attained”: I have attained, I have reached, this meaning of self.

original: Etena yathāvuttaṃ mahājhāyibhāvaṃ sikhāpattaṃ katvā dasseti. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.
analyzed: etena yathā vuttam mahā jhāyi bhāvam sikhā pattam katvā dasseti sesam vutta nayam eva
translated: By this he shows that he has made the state of a great meditator as described above reach completion with the peak . The rest is as already stated.

original: Vacchagottattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vacchagotta thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The story of the elder Vacchagotta is ended.

original: 3. Vanavacchattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: vanavacchatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The story of the elder Vanavaccha

original: Acchodikā puthusilāti āyasmato vanavacchattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: acchodikā āyasmataḥ vanavaccha ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: Acchodikā puthusilā, etc. These are the verses of the venerable elder Vanavaccha. What is their origin? This elder too formed the root of goodness in the time of the former Buddhas,

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭūpanissayaṃ kusalabījaṃ ropento vipassissa
analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭu upanissayam kusala bījam ropentaḥ vipassissa
translated: and in various existences he planted the seed of the wholesome that would be the condition for his deliverance. In the dispensation of the Buddha Vipassī

original: bhagavato kāle kulagehe nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto parassa kammaṃ katvā jīvanto kassaci
analyzed: bhagavato kāle kula gehe nibbattitvā viññu tam patto parassa kammam katvā jīvantaḥ kassaci
translated: He was reborn in a good family at the time of the Buddha, and when he reached maturity he earned his living by working for others.

original: aparādhaṃ katvā maraṇabhayena tajjito palāyanto antarāmagge bodhirukkhaṃ disvā pasannamānaso
analyzed: aparādham katvā maraṇa bhayena tajjitaḥ palāyantaḥ antara āmagge bodhi rukkham disvā pasanna mānasaḥ
translated: One day, through fear of death, he ran away after committing an offence against someone. On the way he saw a Bodhi tree, and with a serene mind

translated: Where is the worth of an ascetic? Where is the worth of an ascetic, for what reason can there be worth of an ascetic, worth of a good ascetic, for a person such as this? But the intention is this: for one who is indifferent to the body and life, who is content with what is just obtained, and who has begun energy, there is worth of an ascetic.

translated: and

analyzed: madhu vassam pavassittha chādayam madhunā mahim

original: “Mayi nikkhantamattamhi, kucchiyā ca suduttarā;
analyzed: mayi nikkhanta mattamhi kucchiyā ca su duttarā
translated: “As soon as I had come out from the womb, and was standing on the ground,

original: Tatrāpi madhuvassaṃ me, vassate niccakālikaṃ.
analyzed: tatra api madhu vassam me vassate niccakālikam
translated: there too a rain of honey fell for me, falling down all the time.

original: “Agārā abhinikkhamma, pabbajiṃ anagāriyaṃ;
analyzed: agārā abhinikkhamma pabbajim anagāriyam
translated: “Having gone forth from the home to homelessness,

original: Lābhī annassa pānassa, madhudānassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: lābhī annassa pānassa madhu dānassa idam phalam
translated: I was a receiver of food and drink, and the fruit of that gift of honey was this:

original: “Sabbakāmasamiddhohaṃ, bhavitvā devamānuse;
analyzed: sabba kāma samiddhaḥ ūham bhavitvā deva mānuse
translated: “Having been satisfied with all my wishes, among gods and humans,

original: Teneva madhudānena, pattomhi āsavakkhayaṃ.
analyzed: tena iva madhu dānena pattomhi āsava kkhayam
translated: by that very gift of honey, I attained the destruction of the pollutants.

original: “Vuṭṭhamhi deve caturaṅgule tiṇe, sampupphite dharaṇīruhe sañchanne;
analyzed: vuṭṭhamhi deve caturaṅgule tiṇe sampupphite dharaṇīruhe sañchanne
translated: “When the gods rained down four finger-breadths of grass, covering the earth with sprouting tender grass,

original: Suññe ghare maṇḍaparukkhamūlake, vasāmi niccaṃ sukhito anāsavo.
analyzed: suññe ghare maṇḍapa rukkha mūlake vasāmi niccam sukhitaḥ anāsavaḥ
translated: I live in an empty house or at the foot of a tree, always happy, free from the corruptions.

original: “Majjhe mahante hīne ca, bhave sabbe atikkamiṃ;
analyzed: majjhe mahante hīne ca bhave sabbe atikkamiṃ
translated: I have passed beyond all states of being, whether high or low;

original: Ajja me āsavā khīṇā, natthi dāni punabbhavo.
analyzed: ajja me āsavā khīṇā natthi dāni punabbhavaḥ
translated: Today my corruptions are destroyed; there is no more renewed existence.

original: “Tiṃsakappasahassamhi, yaṃ dānamadadiṃ tadā;
analyzed: tiṃsa kappa sahassamhi yam dānam adadim tadā
translated: For twenty-one thousand eons, I gave that gift in the past;

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, madhudānassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi madhu dānassa idam phalam
translated: I do not recall any bad destination—this is the fruit of the gift of honey.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: My defilements are destroyed … I have done what had to be done for the Buddha’s teaching.

original: Ayameva ca therassa aññābyākaraṇagāthā ahosīti.
analyzed: ayam eva ca therassa aññā byākaraṇa gāthā ahosi iti
translated: And this was the verse of the Elder’s declaration of his knowledge.

original: Mahānāmattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽6. Pārāpariyattheragāthāvaṇṇanā🔽Chaphassāyatane hitvāti āyasmato pārāpariyattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: mahānāma thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā           chaphassa āyatane hitvā ti āyasmataḥ pārāpariya ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: The commentary on the verses of the Elder Mahānāma is finished.🔽Pārāpariya🔽Having abandoned the six sense bases, these are the verses of the Elder Pārāpariya. Where did they arise? This Elder, too, performed meritorious deeds in various existences in the past under former Buddhas.

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto piyadassissa bhagavato kāle nesādayoniyaṃ
analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinantaḥ piyadassissa bhagavato kāle nesāda yoniyam

original: nibbattitvā tassa viññutaṃ pattassa vicaraṇaṭṭhāne aññatarasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe piyadassī
analyzed: nibbattitvā tassa viññutam pattassa vicaraṇa ṭhāne aññatarasmim vana saṇḍe piya dassī
translated: When he reached maturity, he wandered about in a certain forest grove, which was a place of resort for the Blessed One Piyadassī.

original: bhagavā taṃ anuggaṇhituṃ nirodhasamāpattiṃ samāpajjitvā nisīdi. So ca mige pariyesanto
analyzed: bhagavā tam anuggaṇhitum nirodha samāpattim samāpajjitvā nisīdi saḥ ca mige pariyesantaḥ
translated: The Exalted One sat down in the attainment of cessation in order to favor the deer. The deer-hunter,

original: taṃ ṭhānaṃ gato satthāraṃ disvā pasannamānaso bhagavantaṃ anto katvā kataṃ sākhāmaṇḍapaṃ🔽padumapupphehi kūṭāgārākārena sañchādetvā uḷāraṃ pītisomanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedento sattāhaṃ
analyzed: tam ṭhānam gataḥ satthāram disvā pasanna mānasaḥ bhagavantam antar katvā katam sa ākhāmaṇḍapam  paduma pupphehi kūṭāgāra ākārena sañchādetvā uḷāram pīti somanassam paṭisaṃvedento sattāham
translated: wandering about in search of deer, came to that place. Seeing the Teacher, he was filled with joy. He made a bower of branches,🔽covering it with lotus-blossoms, and stood in adoration of the Teacher for seven days,

original: namassamāno aṭṭhāsi. Divase divase ca milātamilātāni apanetvā abhinavehi chādesi.
analyzed: namassamānaḥ aṭṭhāsi divase divase ca milāta milātāni apanetvā abhinavehi chādesi

original: Satthā sattāhassa accayena nirodhato vuṭṭhahitvā bhikkhusaṅghaṃ anussari. Tāvadeva
analyzed: satthā satta ahassa accayena nirodhataḥ vuṭṭhahitvā bhikkhu saṅgham anussari tāvat eva
translated: When the seven days had passed, the Teacher arose from the attainment of cessation and thought of the company of monks. Immediately

analyzed: asīti sahassa mattāḥ bhikkhū satthāram parivāresuṃ madhura dhamma katham suṇissāma ati

analyzed: devatā sannipatiṃsu mahā samāgamaḥ ahosi satthā anumodanam karontaḥ tassa deva manussesu
translated: The deities also assembled. There was a great concourse. The Teacher, in pronouncing the benediction, declared the future glory of the deer-hunter,

original: bhāviniṃ sampattiṃ imasmiṃ buddhuppāde sāvakabodhiñca byākaritvā pakkāmi. So tena
analyzed: bhāvinim sampattim imasmin buddhuppāde sāvaka bodhim ca byākaritvā pakkāmi saḥ tena

analyzed: puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde rājagahe brāhmaṇa kule nibbattitvā
translated: and in the course of his wanderings through the heavenly and human worlds, he was reborn in Rājagaha in a brahmin family at the time of the Buddha.

translated: The Blessed One named Piyadassī, self-becoming, leader of the world,

analyzed: viveka kāmaḥ sambuddhaḥ samādhi kusalaḥ muni
translated: The fully enlightened one, desiring solitude, the sage skilled in concentration,

analyzed: vana saṇḍam samoggayha piyadassī mahā muni
translated: The great sage Piyadassī, having entered a grove of trees,

translated: Having spread out his rag-robe, sat down, the supreme man.

translated: Formerly I was a hunter, in the forest, in the jungle,

analyzed: pasadam āhiṇḍāmi aham tadā
translated: Seeking to kill deer, I wandered about at that time.

original: “Āharitvāna padumaṃ, satapattaṃ manoramaṃ;
analyzed: āharitvāna padumam sa tapattam manoramam
translated: Having brought the beautiful lotus with a hundred leaves,

analyzed: kūṭāgāram karitvāna chādayim
translated: I made a pavilion and covered it with the lotus.

original: “Anukampako kāruṇiko, piyadassī mahāmuni;
translated: The compassionate, merciful, Piyadassin, the great sage,

analyzed: satta rattindivam buddhaḥ kūṭāgāre vasī jinaḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Victor, stayed seven days and seven nights in the pavilion.

analyzed: purāṇam chaḍḍayitvāna navena chādayim aham

analyzed: añjalim paggahetvāna aṭṭhāsim tāvade aham

analyzed: vuṭṭhahitvā samādhimhā piya dassī mahā muni
translated: Having arisen from his concentration, Piyadassin, the great sage,

analyzed: disam nisīdi loka nāyakaḥ

analyzed: tadā sudassanaḥ nāma upaṭṭhākaḥ mahiddhiko
translated: At that time the one of great power named Sudassana,

translated: surrounded by a retinue of eighty thousand monks,

analyzed: vanante sukham āsīnam upesi loka nāyakam

analyzed: buddhassa cittam aññāya sabbe sannipatum tadā

original: “Samāgatesu yakkhesu, kumbhaṇḍe saharakkhase;
analyzed: samāgatesu yakkhesu kumbhaṇḍe saharakkhase
translated: When the yakkhas, kumbhaṇḍhas, and rākṣasas had gathered,

analyzed: bhikkhu saṅghe ca sampatte gāthā pabyāharī jino
translated: and when the Sangha of monks had assembled, the Victor spoke this verse:

analyzed: thomam sattāham pūjesi āvāsam ca akāsi me
translated: “For seven days he worshipped me, and he built a dwelling for me.

analyzed: tam aham kittayissāmi suṇātha mama bhāsataḥ

analyzed: catubbīse kappa sate vokiṇṇam saṃsarissati
translated: For two hundred and forty eons he will be reborn in the right place.

analyzed: tattha puppha mayam byamham ākāse dhārayissati

analyzed: yathā paduma pattamhi toyam na upalimpati
translated: Just as water does not stick to a lotus leaf,

original: “Tathevīmassa ñāṇamhi, kilesā nopalimpare;

analyzed: manasā vinivaṭṭetvā pañca nīvaraṇe ayam
translated: Having turned away the five hindrances with his mind,

analyzed: cittam janetvā nekkhamme agārā pabbajissati
translated: “Having generated the mind of renunciation, he will go forth from the home life;

analyzed: tatas puppha maye byamhe dhārente nikkhamissati
translated: Then he will go forth, holding a bird-cage made of flowers.

original: “Rukkhamūle vasantassa, nipakassa satīmato;
analyzed: rukkha mūle vasantassa nipakassa satīmataḥ
translated: “Dwelling at the foot of a tree, alert and mindful,

analyzed: tattha puppha mayam byamham matthake dhārayissati  cīvaram piṇḍapātañca paccayam sayana āsanam
translated: There he will hold a bird-cage made of flowers on his head.🔽“Having given to the Community of monks robes, almsfood,

original: Datvāna bhikkhusaṅghassa, nibbāyissatināsavo.
analyzed: datvāna bhikkhu saṅghassa
translated: and the requisite of medicine for the sick, he will be free from defilements.

original: “Kūṭāgārena caratā, pabbajjaṃ abhinikkhamiṃ;
analyzed: kūṭāgārena caratā pabbajjam abhinikkhamiṃ
translated: “Wandering in a peaked dwelling, I went forth;

original: Rukkhamūle vasantampi, kūṭāgāraṃ dharīyati.
analyzed: rukkha mūle vasantam pi kūṭāgāram
translated: Dwelling at the foot of a tree, I still hold the peaked dwelling.

original: “Cīvare piṇḍapāte ca, cetanā me na vijjati;
analyzed: cīvare piṇḍapāte ca cetanā me na vijjati
translated: “I have no desire for robes or almsfood,

original: Puññakammena saṃyutto, labhāmi pariniṭṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: puñña kammena saṃyuttaḥ labhāmi pariniṭṭhitam
translated: I am endowed with meritorious deeds, I obtain my heart’s desire.

original: “Gaṇanāto asaṅkheyyā, kappakoṭī bahū mama;
analyzed: gaṇanātaḥ asaṅkheyyā kappa koṭī mama
translated: “For many millions of eons beyond count,

original: Rittakā te atikkantā, pamuttā lokanāyakā.
analyzed: rittakā te atikkantā pamuttā loka nāyakā
translated: those empty eons have passed by, the leaders of the world have been liberated.

original: “Aṭṭhārase kappasate, piyadassī vināyako;
analyzed: aṭṭhārase kappa sate piya dassī vināyako
translated: “For one hundred and eighteen eons, the leader Piyadassin,

original: Tamahaṃ payirupāsitvā, imaṃ yoniṃ upāgato.
analyzed: tam aham payiḥ upāsitvā imam yonim upāgataḥ
translated: having worshipped him, I have come to this birth.

original: “Idha passāmi sambuddhaṃ, anomaṃ nāma cakkhumaṃ;
analyzed: idha passāmi sambuddham anomam nāma cakkhumaṃ
translated: “Here I see the Sambuddha, the one called Anoma, the eye of the world,

original: Tamahaṃ upagantvāna, pabbajiṃ anagāriyaṃ.
analyzed: tam aham upagantvāna pabbajim anagāriyam
translated: I went to him and went forth into homelessness.

original: “Dukkhassantakaro buddho, maggaṃ me desayī jino;
analyzed: buddhaḥ maggam me desayī jino
translated: The Buddha, the maker of the end of suffering, The Victor taught me the path.

original: Tassa dhammaṃ suṇitvāna, pattomhi acalaṃ padaṃ.
analyzed: tassa dhammam suṇitvāna pattomhi acalam padam
translated: Having heard his Teaching, I attained the immovable state.

analyzed: tosayitvāna sambuddham gotamam sakya puṅgavam
translated: Having satisfied the Sambuddha, The Gotama, the Sakyan bull,

analyzed: sabba āsave pariññāya viharāmi anāsavaḥ
translated: Having fully understood all cankers, I live without cankers.

original: “Aṭṭhārase kappasate, yaṃ buddhamabhipūjayiṃ;
analyzed: aṭṭhārase kappa sate yam buddham abhipūjayiṃ
translated: For one hundred and eighteen eons I worshipped the Buddha.

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I do not know of a bad destination, This is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: My defilements are destroyed … I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: Arahattaṃ pana patvā attano paṭipattiṃ paccavekkhitvā sañjātasomanasso udānavasena –
analyzed: arahattam pana patvā attano paṭipattim paccavekkhitvā sañjāta somanassaḥ udāna vasena
translated: But after attaining arahatship, reflecting on his own progress, and experiencing spiritual joy, he uttered the following exalted utterance:

original: “Chaphassāyatane hitvā, guttadvāro susaṃvuto;
analyzed: chaphassa āyatane hitvā gutta dvāraḥ su saṃvutaḥ
translated: “Having abandoned the six sense bases, The door-keeper well restrained,

translated: Having vomited the root of evil, My cankers have come to an end.”
