analyzed: tattha cha phassa āyatane hitvā ti cakkhu samphassa ādīnam channam samphassānam uppatti ṭṭhāna tāya
translated: Herein, having abandoned the six sense bases means having abandoned the six sense bases, namely, eye-contact, etc., which are the bases for the arising of the six kinds of contact.

original: “phassāyatanānī”ti laddhanāmāni cakkhādīni cha ajjhattikāyatanāni tappaṭibaddhasaṃkilesappahānavasena
analyzed: phassa āyatanāni iti laddha nāmāni cakkha ādīni cha ajjhattika āyatanāni tad paṭibaddha saṃkilesa ppahāna vasena
translated: “The six sense bases” are the six internal sense bases, the eye, etc., which have received the name “sense bases” .🔽Having abandoned them by abandoning the defilements bound up with them.

original: pahāya. Guttadvāro susaṃvutoti tato eva cakkhudvārādīnaṃ guttattā, tattha pavattanakānaṃ
analyzed: pahāya gutta dvāro su saṃvutaḥ ti tatas eva cakkhu dvāra ādīnam gutta ttā tattha pavattanakānam
translated: “With guarded faculties, well-restrained”: because of the guarding of the eye-door, etc.,

original: abhijjhādīnaṃ pāpadhammānaṃ pavesananivāraṇena satikavāṭena suṭṭu pihitattā guttadvāro
analyzed: abhijjhā ādīnam pāpa dhammānam pavesana nivāraṇena sati kavāṭena suṭṭu pihita ttā gutta dvāraḥ
translated: and because of the well-closed fence of mindfulness which prevents the entry of the evil things such as covetousness, etc., that would enter there, he is one with guarded faculties.

original: susaṃvuto. Atha vā manacchaṭṭhānaṃ channaṃ dvārānaṃ vuttanayena rakkhitattā guttadvāro,
analyzed: su saṃvutaḥ atha vā manaccha ṭṭhānam channam dvārānam vutta nayena rakkhita ttā guttadvāraḥ
translated: Or else, he is one with guarded faculties because of the guarding of the six doors of the mind, the sixth of which is the mind-door, in the way stated above;

original: kāyādīhi suṭṭhu saññatattā susaṃvutoti evamettha attho veditabbo. Aghamūlaṃ vamitvānāti
analyzed: kāya ādīhi suṭṭhu saññata ttā su saṃvutaḥ ti evam ettha atthaḥ veditabbaḥ agha mūlam
translated: and he is well-restrained because of the well-controlled body, etc. This is the meaning here.

original: aghassa vaṭṭadukkhassa mūlabhūtaṃ avijjābhavataṇhāsaṅkhātaṃ dosaṃ, sabbaṃ vā kilesadosaṃ
analyzed: aghassa vaṭṭa dukkhassa mūla bhūtam avijjā bhava taṇhā saṅkhātam dosam sabbam vā kilesa dosam
translated: “Having uprooted the root of evil”: the root of evil is ignorance and craving for being, which are the root of the suffering of the round, or else all the evil of the defilements.🔽Having dug it up and removed it from the continuum by means of the medicine called the noble path,

original: ariyamaggasaṅkhātavamanayogapānena uggiritvā santānato bahi katvā, bahikaraṇahetu
analyzed: ariya magga saṅkhāta vamana yoga pānena santānataḥ bahi katvā bahikaraṇa hetu
translated: and having made it the cause for the removal of the defilements,

original: vā. Patto me āsavakkhayoti kāmāsavādayo āsavā ettha khīyanti, tesaṃ vā khayena pattabboti
analyzed: vā pattaḥ me āsava khayoti kāma āsava ādayaḥ āsavāḥ ettha khīyanti tesam vā khayena pattabbo ti
translated: ‘The destruction of the taints is mine’: the taints of sensuality, etc., are destroyed here, or it is to be attained by the destruction of those taints.

original: āsavakkhayo, nibbānaṃ arahattañca. So āsavakkhayo patto adhigatoti udānavasena aññaṃ byākāsi.
analyzed: āsava khayo nibbānam arahattañca so āsava khayaḥ pattaḥ adhigataḥ ti udāna vasena aññam byākāsi
translated: The destruction of the taints is Nibbāna and Arahantship. He has attained, has reached, the destruction of the taints, he has made it his vehicle, is what is said.

original: Pārāpariyattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pārāpariya thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the verses of the elder Pārāpariya is finished.

original: 7. Yasattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
translated: The elder Yasa’s verses

original: Suvilitto suvasanoti āyasmato yasattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: āyasmataḥ yasa ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: Suvilitto suvasano: these are the verses of the venerable elder Yasa. What is their origin? This elder too, having formed his aspiration in the presence of the former Buddhas,

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭūpanissayāni puññāni upacinanto sumedhassa
analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭu upanissayāni puññāni upacinantaḥ sumedhassa
translated: accumulating the requisites of merit and knowledge in the various ways in the various existences through which he passed,🔽in the dispensation of the Master Sumedha, having become a mighty king of the nāgas,

original: bhagavato kāle mahānubhāvo nāgarājā hutvā buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ attano bhavanaṃ
analyzed: bhagavataḥ kāle mahā anubhāvaḥ nāga rājā hutvā buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham attanaḥ bhavanaṃ
translated: having led the Community of Bhikkhus headed by the Buddha to his own abode,

original: netvā mahādānaṃ pavattesi. Bhagavantaṃ mahagghena ticīvarena acchādesi, ekamekañca
analyzed: netvā mahādānam pavattesi bhagavantam mahagghena ti cīvarena acchādesi ekam ekam ca
translated: having made a great offering, he clothed the Blessed One with a very costly triple robe and each bhikkhu

original: bhikkhuṃ mahaggheneva paccekadussayugena sabbena samaṇaparikkhārena acchādesi. So
analyzed: bhikkhum mahagghena iva pacceka dussayugena sabbena samaṇa parikkhārena acchādesi saḥ
translated: with a very costly pair of garments, and he clothed the whole Community of Bhikkhus with the requisites of a monk.

original: tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto siddhatthassa bhagavato kāle seṭṭhiputto
analyzed: tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ siddhatthassa bhagavato kāle seṭṭhi putto
translated: As a result of that meritorious deed, he was reborn in the heavenly world and among men. In the time of the Blessed One Siddhattha he was the son of a treasurer.

original: hutvā mahābodhimaṇḍaṃ sattahi ratanehi pūjesi. Kassapassa bhagavato kāle sāsane pabbajitvā
analyzed: hutvā mahā bodhimaṇḍam sattahi ratanehi pūjesi kassapassa bhagavato kāle sāsane pabbajitvā
translated: He made a lamp of seven jewels and worshipped the great Bodhi Tree. In the time of the Blessed One Kassapa he went forth into the Dispensation

original: samaṇadhammaṃ akāsi. Evaṃ sugatīsuyeva saṃsaranto imasmiṃ amhākaṃ bhagavato kāle
analyzed: samaṇa dhammam akāsi evam sugatīsuyā iva saṃsarantaḥ imasmin amhākam bhagavataḥ kāle
translated: and did the duties of an ascetic. Thus he wandered through the happy realms and in the time of our own Blessed One

original: bārāṇasiyaṃ mahāvibhavassa seṭṭhino putto hutvā nibbatti, yaso nāma nāmena paramasukhumālo.
analyzed: bārāṇasiyam mahā vibhavassa seṭṭhino putto hutvā nibbatti yasaḥ nāma nāmena parama sukhu mālo
translated: he was reborn in Bārāṇasī as the son of a treasurer of great wealth, and he was called Yasa, and he was extremely handsome.

original: “Tassa tayo pāsādā”ti sabbaṃ khandhake āgatanayena veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: tassa tayo pāsādā ti sabbam khandhake āgata nayena veditabbam
translated: “He had three palaces” and so on, all of which should be understood according to the method given in the Khandhakas.

original: So pubbahetunā codiyamāno rattibhāge niddābhibhūtassa parijanassa vippakāraṃ disvā
analyzed: so pubba hetunā codiyamānaḥ ratti bhāge niddā abhibhūtassa parijanassa vippakāram disvā
translated: He was stirred by his previous root of merit. At night he saw the servants sleeping in a state of collapse.

original: sañjātasaṃvego suvaṇṇapādukārūḷhova gehato niggato devatāvivaṭena nagaradvārena nikkhamitvā
analyzed: sañjāta saṃvegaḥ suvaṇṇa pādukā ārūḍhaḥ iva gehataḥ niggataḥ devatā vivaṭena nagara dvārena nikkhamitvā
translated: He was moved by the sight and, putting on his golden slippers, he left the house by the door for the gods and went out of the city gate.

original: isipatanasamīpaṃ gato “upaddutaṃ vata, bho, upassaṭṭhaṃ vata, bho”ti āha. Tena samayena
analyzed: isipatana samīpam gataḥ upaddutam vata bho upassaṭṭham vata bho ti āha tena samayena
translated: He went to the vicinity of the Isipatana and said, “How oppressed they are, how troubled they are.” At that time

original: bhagavatā isipatane viharantena tasseva anuggaṇhanatthaṃ abbhokāse caṅkamantena “ehi,
analyzed: bhagavatā isipatane viharantena tassa iva anuggaṇhana attham abbhokāse caṅkamantena ehi
translated: The Blessed One, while residing at Isipatana, for the purpose of helping him, was walking up and down in the open air, and said, “Come,

original: yasa, idaṃ anupaddutaṃ, idaṃ anupassaṭṭha”nti vutto, “anupaddutaṃ anupassaṭṭhaṃ kira
analyzed: yasaḥ idam anupaddutam idam anupassaṭṭhanti vuttaḥ anupaddutam anupassaṭṭham kira
translated: Yasa, this is not crowded, this is not noisy.” He, being pleased, thinking, “There is a place that is not crowded, that is not noisy,”

original: atthī”ti somanassajāto suvaṇṇapādukā oruyha bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṃ nisinno
analyzed: atthi iti somanassa jātaḥ suvaṇṇa pādukāḥ oruyha bhagavantam upasaṅkamitvā ekamantam nisinnaḥ
translated: taking off his golden slippers, approached the Blessed One, and sat down on one side.

original: satthārā anupubbikathaṃ kathetvā saccadesanāya katāya saccapariyosāne sotāpanno hutvā
analyzed: satthārā anupubbi katham kathetvā sacca desanāya katāya sacca pariyosāne sotāpannaḥ hutvā
translated: The Teacher, after giving him progressive talk, and making him understand the Four Noble Truths, at the conclusion of the Truths, he became a Stream-Enterer.

original: gavesanatthaṃ āgatassa pitu bhagavatā saccadesanāya kariyamānāya arahattaṃ sacchākāsi.
analyzed: gavesana attham āgatassa pitu bhagavatā sacca desanāya kariyamānāya arahattam
translated: After his father, who had come to search for him, had been made to understand the Four Noble Truths by the Blessed One, he experienced the fruit of Liberation.

original: Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: tena vuttam apadāne
translated: Therefore it was said in the Apadana:

original: “Mahāsamuddaṃ oggayha, bhavanaṃ me sunimmitaṃ;
analyzed: mahā samuddam oggayha bhavanam me su nimmitam
translated: “Having gone to the great ocean, my dwelling was well-constructed;

original: Sunimmitā pokkharaṇī, cakkavākapakūjitā.
analyzed: su nimmitā pokkharaṇī cakkavāka pakūjitā
translated: The well-constructed lotus-pond, was resounding with the sound of geese.

original: “Mandālakehi sañchannā, padumuppalakehi ca;
analyzed: mandālakehi sañchannā paduma uppalakehi ca
translated: “Covered with mandārava flowers, and with lotuses and water lilies;

original: Nadī ca sandate tattha, supatitthā manoramā.
analyzed: nadī ca sandate tattha supatitthā manoramā
translated: And a river flowed there, with a good ford, and was delightful.

original: “Macchakacchapasañchannā, nānādijasamotthatā;
analyzed: maccha kacchapa sañchannā nānā ādi ja sama uttha tā
translated: “Covered with fish and turtles, and with various kinds of birds;

original: Mayūrakoñcābhirudā, kokilādīhi vagguhi.
analyzed: kokila ādīhi vagguhi
translated: With peacocks, herons, and cuckoos, and other lovely birds.

original: “Pārevatā ravihaṃsā ca, cakkavākā nadīcarā;
translated: “Pārevatas, sun-geese, and cakkavākas, and those living in rivers;

original: Dindibhā sāḷikā cettha, pammakā jīvajīvakā.
analyzed: dindibhā sāḷikā ca ittha pammakā jīvajīvakā
translated: Dindibhās, sāḷikas, and here pammakas, and jīvajīvakas.

original: “Haṃsā koñcāpi naditā, kosiyā piṅgalā bahū;
translated: “Geese and herons are calling, and many kosiyās and piṅgalas;

original: Sattaratanasampannā, maṇimuttikavālukā.
analyzed: satta ratana sampannā maṇi muttika vālukā
translated: Endowed with the seven treasures, with sand of gems and pearls.

original: “Sabbasoṇṇamayā rukkhā, nānāgandhasameritā;
analyzed: sabba soṇṇa mayāḥ rukkhāḥ nānā gandha sameritā
translated: “Trees made entirely of gold, endowed with various perfumes;

original: Ujjotenti divārattiṃ, bhavanaṃ sabbakālikaṃ.
analyzed: divārattim bhavanam sabbakālikam
translated: Shining by day and night, the dwelling is at all times.

original: “Saṭṭhitūriyasahassāni, sāyaṃ pāto pavajjare;
analyzed: saṭṭhitūriya sahassāni sāyam pāto pavajjare
translated: “Six thousand musical instruments, in the morning and evening they play;

original: Soḷasitthisahassāni, parivārenti maṃ sadā.
analyzed: soḷa sitthi sahassāni parivārenti mamam sadā
translated: Sixteen thousand women, always surround me.

original: “Abhinikkhamma bhavanā, sumedhaṃ lokanāyakaṃ;
analyzed: abhinikkhamma bhavanā sumedham loka nāyakam
translated: “Having gone forth from the dwelling, to Sumedha, the Leader of the World;

original: Pasannacitto sumano, vandayiṃ taṃ mahāyasaṃ.
analyzed: pasanna cittaḥ sumanaḥ vandayim tam mahā āyasam
translated: With a serene mind and a good heart, I worshipped him, the one of great fame.

original: “Sambuddhaṃ abhivādetvā, sasaṅghaṃ taṃ nimantayiṃ;
analyzed: sambuddham abhivādetvā sa saṅgham tam nimantayim
translated: “Having worshipped the Sambuddha, I invited him and the Saṅgha;

original: Adhivāsesi so dhīro, sumedho lokanāyako.
analyzed: adhivāsesi saḥ dhīraḥ su medhaḥ loka nāyakaḥ
translated: The wise one, Sumedha, the Leader of the World, consented.

original: “Mama dhammakathaṃ katvā, uyyojesi mahāmuni;
analyzed: mama dhamma katham katvā uyyojesi mahā muni
translated: “Having given a teaching, the Great Sage sent me away;

original: Sambuddhaṃ abhivādetvā, bhavanaṃ me upāgamiṃ.
analyzed: sambuddham abhivādetvā bhavanam me upāgamin
translated: Having worshipped the Sambuddha, I went to my own dwelling.

original: “Āmantayiṃ parijanaṃ, sabbe sannipatātha vo;
analyzed: āmantayim parijanam sabbe sannipatātha vaḥ
translated: “I called to my retinue, ‘All of you, assemble!

original: Pubbaṇhasamayaṃ buddho, bhavanaṃ āgamissati.
analyzed: pubbaṇha samayam buddhaḥ bhavanam āgamissati
translated: The Buddha will come to the dwelling at dawn.’

original: “Lābhā amhaṃ suladdhaṃ no, ye vasāma tavantike;
analyzed: lābhāḥ su laddham naḥ ye vasāma tava antike
translated: “It is a gain for us, a great gain, that we dwell in your presence.

original: Mayampi buddhaseṭṭhassa, pūjaṃ kassāma satthuno.
analyzed: mayam pi buddha seṭṭhassa pūjam kassāma satthunaḥ
translated: We too will make an offering to the Buddha, the best of teachers.”

original: “Annaṃ pānaṃ paṭṭhapetvā, kālaṃ ārocayiṃ ahaṃ;
analyzed: annam pānam paṭṭhapetvā kālam aham
translated: “Having prepared food and drink, I announced the time:

original: Vasīsatasahassehi, upesi lokanāyako.
analyzed: vasī sata sahassehi upesi loka nāyakaḥ
translated: The Leader of the World came with a hundred thousand attendants.

original: “Pañcaṅgikehi tūriyehi, paccuggamanamakāsahaṃ;
analyzed: pañcaṅgikehi tūriyehi
translated: “With five-piece musical ensembles, I made a welcoming offering.

original: Sabbasoṇṇamaye pīṭhe, nisīdi purisuttamo.
analyzed: sabba soṇṇa maye pīṭhe nisīdi purisuttamaḥ
translated: The Best of Men sat down on a seat entirely made of gold.

original: “Uparicchadanaṃ āsi, sabbasoṇṇamayaṃ tadā;
analyzed: upari chadanam āsi sabba soṇṇa mayam tadā
translated: “There was a canopy above, entirely made of gold,

original: Bījaniyo pavāyanti, bhikkhusaṅghassa antare.
analyzed: bījaniyaḥ pavāyanti bhikkhu saṅghassa antare
translated: and fans were waved among the Saṅgha of monks.

original: “Pahūtenannapānena, bhikkhusaṅghamatappayiṃ;
analyzed: pahūtena anna pānena bhikkhu saṅgham atappayim
translated: “With abundant food and drink, I satisfied the Saṅgha of monks.

original: Paccekadussayugaḷe, bhikkhusaṅghassadāsahaṃ.
analyzed: pacceka dussa yugaḷe bhikkhu saṅghassa dāsaham
translated: I gave a pair of cloths to each monk in the Saṅgha.

original: “Yaṃ vadanti sumedhoti, lokāhutipaṭiggahaṃ;
analyzed: yam vadanti sumedhā iti loka āhuti paṭiggaham
translated: “The one they call ‘the Wise One,’ the one who receives the world’s offerings,

original: Bhikkhusaṅghe nisīditvā, imā gāthā abhāsatha.
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅghe nisīditvā imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāsatha
translated: sat in the Saṅgha of monks and spoke these verses:

original: “Yo me annena pānena, sabbe ime ca tappayiṃ;
analyzed: yaḥ me annena pānena sabbe ime ca tappayim
translated: “Whoever satisfied all of these with food and drink,

original: Tamahaṃ kittayissāmi, suṇātha mama bhāsato.
analyzed: tam aham kittayissāmi suṇātha mama bhāsataḥ
translated: I will extol him, so listen to my words.

original: “Aṭṭhārase kappasate, devaloke ramissati;
analyzed: aṭṭhārase kappa sate deva loke ramissati
translated: For eighteen hundred eons he will delight in the heavenly world;

original: Sahassakkhattuṃ rājā ca, cakkavattī bhavissati.
analyzed: sahassa kkhattum rājā ca cakkavattī bhavissati
translated: And a thousand times he will be a king, a wheel-turning monarch.

original: “Upapajjati yaṃ yoniṃ, devattaṃ atha mānusaṃ;
analyzed: upapajjati yam yonim devattam atha mānusam
translated: “Whatever womb he will enter, whether divine or human,

original: Sabbadā sabbasovaṇṇaṃ, chadanaṃ dhārayissati.
analyzed: sabbadā sabbaso vaṇṇam chadanam dhārayissati
translated: Always and everywhere he will wear a golden covering.

original: “Tiṃsakappasahassamhi, okkākakulasambhavo;
analyzed: tiṃsa kappa sahassamhi okkāka kula sambhavaḥ
translated: “In the course of three thousand eons, born in the Okkāka family,

original: Gotamo nāma gottena, satthā loke bhavissati.
analyzed: gotamaḥ nāma gottena satthā loke bhavissati
translated: The Teacher in the world will be named Gotama by clan.

original: “Tassa dhammesu dāyādo, oraso dhammanimmito;
analyzed: tassa dhammesu dāyādaḥ orasaḥ dhamma nimmito
translated: “He will be an heir to the Dhamma, born from the Dhamma, created by the Dhamma,

original: Sabbāsave pariññāya, nibbāyissatināsavo.
analyzed: sabba asave pariññāya
translated: Having fully understood all the pollutants, he will be extinguished without pollutants.

original: “Bhikkhusaṅghe nisīditvā, sīhanādaṃ nadissati;
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅghe nisīditvā sīha nādam na dissati
translated: “Sitting in the midst of the Saṅgha of bhikkhus, he will utter the lion’s roar:

original: Citake chattaṃ dhārenti, heṭṭhā chattamhi ḍayhatha.
analyzed: citake chattam dhārenti heṭṭhā chattamhi ḍayhatha
translated: ‘Carry the parasol over the pyre, and burn it below the parasol.’

original: “Sāmaññaṃ me anuppattaṃ, kilesā jhāpitā mayā;
analyzed: sāmaññam me anuppattam kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayā
translated: “I have attained the state of a sage; my defilements are destroyed.

original: Maṇḍape rukkhamūle vā, santāpo me na vijjati.
analyzed: maṇḍape rukkha mūle vā santāpaḥ me na vijjati
translated: Whether in a pavilion or at the foot of a tree, I have no anxiety.

original: “Tiṃsakappasahassamhi, yaṃ dānamadadiṃ tadā;
analyzed: tiṃsa kappa sahassamhi yam dānam adadim tadā
translated: “In the course of three thousand eons, the gift I gave then

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, sabbadānassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi sabba dānassa idam phalam
translated: I do not recall any state of deprivation; this is the fruit of giving everything.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements are burned up … The Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Then the Blessed One extended his right arm and said, “Come, bhikkhu.”

original: Atha bhagavā āyasmantaṃ yasaṃ dakkhiṇaṃ bāhuṃ pasāretvā “ehi bhikkhū”ti āha. Vacanasamanantarameva
analyzed: atha bhagavā āyasmantam yasam dakkhiṇam bāhum pasāretvā ehi bhikkhu iti āha vacana samanantaram eva
translated: Immediately,

original: dvaṅgulamattakesamassu aṭṭhaparikkhāradharo vassasaṭṭhikatthero viya ahosi. So attano
analyzed: dvaṅgula matta kesa massu aṭṭha parikkhāra dharaḥ vassasaṭṭhika theraḥ viya ahosi so attano
translated: with hair and beard down to one-half inch, wearing the yellow robe, carrying the eight requisites, he became like a bhikkhu of sixty years’ standing.

original: paṭipattiṃ paccavekkhitvā udānento ehibhikkhubhāvappattito purimāvatthavasena –
analyzed: paṭipattim paccavekkhitvā udānentaḥ ehi bhikkhu bhāva ppattitaḥ purimā vattha vasena
translated: Looking back on his own conduct, he uttered a cry of joy. In the first part of the verse he says:

original: “Suvilitto suvasano, sabbābharaṇabhūsito;
analyzed: su vilittaḥ su vasano sabba ābharaṇa bhūsito
translated: “Well anointed, well clothed, adorned with all my ornaments,

original: Tisso vijjā ajjhagamiṃ, kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti. – gāthaṃ abhāsi;🔽Tattha suvilittoti sundarena kuṅkumacandanānulepanena vilittagatto. Suvasanoti suṭṭhu
analyzed: tissaḥ vijjāḥ ajjhagamim katam buddhassa sāsananti gātham abhāsi  tattha su vilittaḥ ti sundarena kuṅkuma candana anulepanena vilitta gatto su vasanaḥ ti suṭṭhu
translated: I have attained the three true knowledges; the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: mahagghakāsikavatthavasano. Sabbābharaṇabhūsitoti sīsūpagādīhi sabbehi ābharaṇehi
analyzed: mahaggha kāsika vattha vasanaḥ sabba ābharaṇa bhūsito ti sīsūpaga ādīhi sabbehi ābharaṇehi
translated: Herein, well anointed means his body was anointed with beautiful yellow sandalwood ointment. Well clothed means he was well clothed in a very expensive silk robe. Adorned with all my ornaments means he was adorned with all ornaments such as a head-jewel.

original: alaṅkato. Ajjhagaminti adhigacchiṃ. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.
analyzed: alaṅkataḥ ajjhagamin ti adhigacchim sesam vutta nayam eva
translated: I have attained means I have reached. The rest is as already stated.

original: Yasattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: yasatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the verses of the Elder Yasa is finished.

original: 8. Kimilattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: kimilatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The verse of the Elder Kimbila.

original: Abhisattova nipatatīti āyasmato kimilattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu🔽katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni karonto kakusandhassa bhagavato kāle kulagehe
analyzed: abhisattaḥ iva nipatati iti āyasmataḥ kimila ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu  kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni karonto kakusandhassa bhagavato kāle kulagehe
translated: As a bird falls down, so does he fall.

original: nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto parinibbute satthari tassa dhātuyo uddissa saḷalamālāhi🔽maṇḍapākārena pūjaṃ akāsi. So tena puññakammena tāvatiṃse nibbattitvā aparāparaṃ🔽devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde kapilavatthunagare sākiyarājakule nibbatti,
analyzed: nibbattitvā viññutam patto parinibbute satthari tassa dhātuyaḥ uddissa sa ḷala mālāhi  maṇḍapa ākārena pūjam akāsi saḥ tena puñña kammena tāvatiṃse nibbattitvā apara aparam  deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde kapilavatthu nagare sākiya rāja kule nibbatti
translated: This Elder also, having performed meritorious deeds in various states of existence, was reborn in a certain Sakyan family in the city of Kapilavatthu in this dispensation of the Buddha.

original: kimilotissa nāmaṃ ahosi. So vayappatto bhogasampattiyā sampanno viharati. Tassa ñāṇaparipākaṃ
analyzed: kimilotissa nāmam ahosi saḥ vaya pattaḥ bhoga sampattiyā sampannaḥ viharati tassa ñāṇa paripākam
translated: He was called Kimbila. Having attained majority, he lived in the enjoyment of wealth.

original: disvā saṃvegajananatthaṃ anupiyāyaṃ viharanto satthā paṭhamayobbane ṭhitaṃ dassanīyaṃ
analyzed: disvā saṃvega janana attham anupiyāyam viharantaḥ satthā paṭhama yobbane ṭhitam dassanīyam
translated: The Teacher, perceiving that the time was ripe for his conversion, went to Anupiyā and, in order to arouse his emotion, he manifested himself in the form of a young man of twenty-five years of age,

original: itthirūpaṃ abhinimminitvā purato dassetvā puna anukkamena yathā jarārogavipattīhi
analyzed: itthi rūpam abhinimminitvā puratas dassetvā puna anukkamena yathā jarā roga vipattīhi
translated: He created a woman’s form, showed it to the prince, and then gradually made it appear as if it were overcome by old age, disease, and death.

original: abhibhūtā dissati, tathā akāsi. Taṃ disvā kimilakumāro ativiya saṃvegaṃ pakāsento –
analyzed: abhibhūtā dissati tathā tam disvā kimila kumāraḥ saṃvegam pakāsentaḥ
translated: Seeing this, Prince Kimbila became very agitated and spoke this verse:

original: “Abhisattova nipatati vayo, rūpaṃ aññamiva tatheva santaṃ;
analyzed: abhisattaḥ iva nipatati vayaḥ rūpam aññam iva tathā iva santam
translated: “As if struck, youth falls away, and form remains just as it is,

original: Tasseva sato avippavasato, aññasseva sarāmi attāna”nti. –
analyzed: tassa iva sataḥ a vippavasataḥ aññassa iva sarāmi attānanti
translated: but I think it is another, of the same one, who does not depart.

original: Gāthaṃ abhāsi.
analyzed: gātham abhāsi
translated: He spoke this verse.

original: Tattha abhisattovāti “tvaṃ sīghaṃ gaccha mā tiṭṭhā”ti devehi anusiṭṭho āṇatto viya.
analyzed: tattha abhisattā uvāti tvam sīgham gaccha mā tiṭṭhāti devehi anusiṭṭhaḥ āṇatto viya
translated: Here, “as if struck” means as if instructed and ordered by the gods, “Go quickly, do not stand.”

original: “Abhisaṭṭho vā”tipi pāṭho, “tvaṃ lahuṃ gacchā”ti kenaci abhilāsāpito viyāti attho.
analyzed: abhisaṭṭhaḥ vā atipi tvam lahum gacchāti kenaci viya ati attho
translated: There is also the reading “abhisattho va,” meaning “as if urged by someone to go quickly,” the meaning is that.

original: Nipatatīti atipatati abhidhāvati na tiṭṭhati, khaṇe khaṇe khayavayaṃ pāpuṇātīti attho.
analyzed: nipatati iti atipatati abhidhāvati na tiṭṭhati khaṇe khaṇe khaya vayam pāpuṇāti iti attho
translated: “Falls away” means falls away, runs away, does not stand still, the meaning is that it reaches destruction and decay moment by moment.

original: Vayoti bālyayobbanādiko sarīrassa avatthāviseso. Idha panassa yobbaññaṃ adhippetaṃ,
analyzed: vayaḥ ti bālya yobbana ādikaḥ sarīrassa avatthā visesaḥ idha pana assa yobbaññam adhippetam
translated: “Youth” means a particular stage of the body, such as childhood, youth, etc. Here, however, youth is intended,

original: taṃ hissa abhipatantaṃ khīyantaṃ hutvā upaṭṭhitaṃ. Rūpanti rūpasampadāti vadati.🔽Rūpanti pana sarīraṃ “aṭṭhiñca paṭicca nhāruñca paṭicca maṃsañca paṭicca ākāso parivārito
analyzed: tam hissa abhipatantam khīyantam hutvā upaṭṭhitam rūpanti rūpa sampadā iti vadati  rūpanti pana sarīram aṭṭhiñca paṭicca nhāruñca paṭicca maṃsañca paṭicca ākāsaḥ parivārito
translated: for it is present to him as if it were exhausted and worn out by the falling off of the head-hairs, etc.,🔽‘Form’ is the beauty of the figure, he says.🔽But ‘form’ is the body, which is described in such passages as ‘The space element is present inside the body unpunctured and unpuncturable’ .

original: rūpaṃtveva saṅkhaṃ gacchatī”tiādīsu viya. Aññamiva tatheva santanti idaṃ rūpaṃ yādisaṃ,
analyzed: rūpam tu eva saṅkham gacchati itiādīsu viya aññam iva tathā iva idam rūpam yādisam
translated: ‘It is as though it were another, and yet it is just the same’ means that this form, which is of such a kind,

original: sayaṃ tatheva tenevākārena santaṃ vijjamānaṃ aññaṃ viya mayhaṃ upaṭṭhātīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: sayam tathā iva tena iva ākārena santam vijjamānam aññam viya mayham upaṭṭhāti iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: is present to me as though it were another, as though it were not just the same, not just as it is. This is the meaning.🔽Some read ‘Tadeva santa’ .

original: “Tadeva santa”nti ca keci paṭhanti. Tasseva satoti tasseva me anaññassa sato samānassa.
analyzed: tat eva santanti ca keci paṭhanti tassa iva sato ti tassa iva me anaññassa sataḥ samānassa
translated: ‘Of that same being’ means of that same being of mine, of no other.

original: Avippavasatoti na vippavasantassa, ciravippavāsena hi sato anaññampi aññaṃ viya upaṭṭhāti🔽idampi idha natthīti adhippāyo. Aññasseva sarāmi attānanti imaṃ mama attabhāvaṃ aññassa
analyzed: a vippavasato ti na vippavasantassa cira vippavāsena hi sataḥ anaññam pi aññam viya upaṭṭhāti  idam pi idha natthi iti adhippāyaḥ aññassa iva sarāmi attānam ti imam mama atta bhāvam aññassa
translated: ‘Of one who does not keep apart’ means of one who does not keep apart by keeping aloof for a long time, for it is present to one who does not keep apart as though it were another, as though it were not the same.

original: sattassa viya sarāmi upadhāremi sañjānāmīti attho. Tassevaṃ aniccataṃ manasi karontassa
analyzed: sattassa viya sarāmi upadhāremi sañjānāmi iti atthaḥ tassa ivam anicca tam manasi karontassa
translated: The meaning is that this is not so here. ‘I am aware of it as another’s self’ means I am aware of, I attend to, I perceive this my own individual nature as though it were the self of another being.

original: daḷhataro saṃvego udapādi, so saṃvegajāto satthāraṃ upasaṅkamitvā dhammaṃ sutvā paṭiladdhasaddho
analyzed: daḷhataraḥ saṃvegaḥ udapādi saḥ saṃvega jātaḥ satthāram upasaṅkamitvā dhammam sutvā paṭiladdha saddhaḥ
translated: and he was deeply moved. He went to the Teacher, heard the Dhamma, and gained faith.

original: pabbajitvā vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapetvā nacirasseva arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: pabbajitvā vipassanam paṭṭhapetvā nacirassa iva arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: He went forth into homelessness, and after he had practiced insight meditation for only a short time, he reached Arahantship. That is why it was said of him:🔽“When Kakusandha, the Holy One,

original: “Nibbute kakusandhamhi, brāhmaṇamhi vusīmati;
analyzed: nibbute kakusandhamhi brāhmaṇamhi vusīmati
translated: The Enlightened One, had passed away,🔽I made a pavilion and offered

original: Gahetvā saḷalaṃ mālaṃ, maṇḍapaṃ kārayiṃ ahaṃ.
analyzed: gahetvā sa ḷalam mālam maṇḍapam aham
translated: A garland of six flowers.🔽“When I was reborn in the Tavatimsa realm,

original: “Tāvatiṃsaṃ gato santo, labhimha byamhamuttamaṃ;
analyzed: tāvatiṃsam santaḥ labhimha byamham uttamam
translated: I received the most excellent food;🔽I surpassed the other gods—

original: Aññe devetirocāmi, puññakammassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: aññe deva iti rocāmi puñña kammassa idam phalam
translated: This is the fruit of my meritorious deed.

original: “Divā vā yadi vā rattiṃ, caṅkamanto ṭhito cahaṃ;
analyzed: divā vā yadi vā rattim caṅkamantaḥ ṭhitaḥ
translated: “Whether I was walking or standing,🔽I was shaded by the six flowers—

original: Channo saḷalapupphehi, puññakammassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: channaḥ saḷala pupphehi puñña kammassa idam phalam
translated: This is the fruit of my meritorious deed.🔽“In this very same life,

original: “Imasmiṃyeva kappamhi, yaṃ buddhamabhipūjayiṃ;
analyzed: imasmin yeva kappamhi yam buddham abhipūjayiṃ
translated: I worshipped the Buddha;🔽I do not know of any bad destination—

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: This is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.🔽“My defilements are destroyed …

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: I have fulfilled the Buddha’s instructions.”

original: Arahattaṃ pana patvāpi thero attano purimuppannaṃ aniccatāmanasikāraṃ vibhāvento tameva gāthaṃ paccudāhāsi. Tenetaṃ imassa therassa aññābyākaraṇampi ahosi.
analyzed: arahattam pana patvā api theraḥ attano purima uppannam anicca tā manasikāram vibhāvento tam eva gātham paccudāhāsi tena itam imassa therassa aññā byākaraṇam pi ahosi
translated: But when he had attained Arahantship, the Elder, reviewing the reflection on impermanence that had arisen in him previously, repeated the same verse. And so this Elder’s answer to the question was also a declaration of his Arahantship.

original: Kimilattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽9. Vajjiputtattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: kimila thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  vajjiputta thera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the verses of the Elder Kimbila is ended.🔽Vajjiputta

original: Rukkhamūlagahanaṃ pasakkiyāti āyasmato vajjiputtattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi
analyzed: rukkha mūla gahanam pasakkiyā ti āyasmataḥ vajjiputta therassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi
translated: Rukkhamūlagahanaṃ pasakkiya, etc. These are verses of the Elder Vajjiputta. How did this come about?

original: purimabuddhesu katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭūpanissayaṃ puññaṃ upacinanto
analyzed: purima buddhesu kata adhikāraḥ tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭu upanissayam puññam upacinantaḥ
translated: This Elder, too, had formed his aspiration under former Buddhas. Here and there in the round of rebirths he accumulated fresh merit, the fruit of which was to be his support in the future.

original: ito catunavute kappe ekaṃ paccekasambuddhaṃ bhikkhāya gacchantaṃ disvā pasannamānaso
analyzed: itas catunavute kappe ekam paccekasambuddham bhikkhāya gacchantam disvā pasanna mānasaḥ
translated: Twenty-four cycles of time in the past, he saw a Private Buddha going on his alms round. His mind was filled with joy.

original: kadaliphalāni adāsi. So tena puññakammena devaloke nibbattitvā aparāparaṃ puññāni
analyzed: kadali phalāni adāsi saḥ tena puñña kammena deva loke nibbattitvā aparāparam puññāni
translated: He gave him a ripe plantain fruit. By the power of that root of merit he was reborn in the World of the Gods. There he accumulated fresh merit.

original: katvā devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde vesāliyaṃ licchavirājaputto hutvā
analyzed: katvā deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde vesāliyam licchavi rāja puttaḥ hutvā
translated: Passing from one state of existence to another, he was reborn in the dispensation of the present Buddha as the son of a Licchavi king in Vesālī.

original: nibbatti, vajjirājaputtattā vajjiputtotveva cassa samaññā ahosi. So daharo hutvā
analyzed: nibbatti vajji rāja putta ttā vajji putto tvā iva ca ssa samaññā ahosi saḥ daharaḥ hutvā
translated: When he was a youth,

original: hatthisikkhādisikkhanakālepi hetusampannatāya nissaraṇajjhāsayova hutvā vicaranto
analyzed: hatthi sikkhā ādi sikkhana kāle pi hetu sampanna tāya nissaraṇa ajjhāsayā uva hutvā vicarantaḥ
translated: even while he was being trained in elephant-craft, etc., he wandered about with a tendency to escape, because he was endowed with the cause .

original: satthu dhammadesanākāle vihāraṃ gantvā parisapariyante nisinno dhammaṃ sutvā paṭiladdhasaddho
analyzed: satthu dhamma desanā kāle vihāram gantvā parisa pariyante nisinnaḥ dhammam sutvā paṭiladdha saddho
translated: When the Teacher was preaching the Dhamma, he went to the monastery, sat in the outer circle of the congregation, listened to the Dhamma, and gained faith.

original: satthu santike pabbajitvā vipassanāya kammaṃ karonto nacirasseva chaḷabhiñño ahosi.
analyzed: satthu santike pabbajitvā vipassanāya kammam karontaḥ nacirassa iva chaḍabhiññaḥ ahosi
translated: He went forth into homelessness in the presence of the Teacher, and while he was engaged in the practice of insight, he attained the six kinds of direct knowledge in no long time.

original: Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: tena vuttam apadāne
translated: Therefore it is said in the Apadana:

original: “Sahassaraṃsī bhagavā, sayambhū aparājito;
analyzed: sahassaraṃsī bhagavā sayambhū aparājitaḥ
translated: The Blessed One, the thousand-spoked one, the self-becoming one, the unconquered one,

original: Vivekā vuṭṭhahitvāna, gocarāyābhinikkhami.
analyzed: vivekā vuṭṭhahitvāna gocarāya abhinikkhami
translated: arose from his seclusion and went forth to his almsround.

original: “Phalahattho ahaṃ disvā, upagacchiṃ narāsabhaṃ;
analyzed: phalahatthaḥ aham disvā upagacchim narāsabham
translated: I saw him, bearing a fruit in my hand, and I approached the bull among men.

original: Pasannacitto sumano, avaṭaṃ adadiṃ phalaṃ.🔽“Catunnavutito kappe, yaṃ phalaṃ adadiṃ tadā;
analyzed: pasanna cittaḥ sumanaḥ avaṭam adadim phalam  catunnavutitaḥ kappe yam phalam adadim tadā
translated: With a serene mind and a joyful heart, I offered him the fruit.🔽For ninety-four aeons, I do not recall any evil destiny,

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, phaladānassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi phala dānassa idam phalam
translated: this is the fruit of offering the fruit.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: My defilements are destroyed… I have fulfilled the Buddha’s teaching.

original: Chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā aparabhāge aciraparinibbute satthari dhammaṃ saṅgāyituṃ saṅketaṃ🔽katvā mahātheresu tattha tattha viharantesu ekadivasaṃ āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ sekhaṃyeva
analyzed: chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā aparabhāge acira parinibbute satthari dhammam saṅgāyitum saṅketam  katvā mahā theresu tattha tattha viharantesu eka divasam āyasmantam ānandam
translated: After attaining the six kinds of direct knowledge, he made an appointment with the other great elders to recite the Dhamma and the Discipline.🔽While the elders were staying here and there, he saw the venerable Ānanda one day teaching the Dhamma surrounded by a large assembly, and he inspired him to attain the higher paths,

original: samānaṃ mahatiyā parisāya parivutaṃ dhammaṃ desentaṃ disvā tassa uparimaggādhigamāya ussāhaṃ janento –
analyzed: samānam mahatiyā parisāya parivutam dhammam desentam disvā tassa upari magga adhigamāya ussāham janentaḥ
translated: saying:

original: “Rukkhamūlagahanaṃ pasakkiya, nibbānaṃ hadayasmiṃ opiya;
analyzed: rukkha mūla gahanam pasakkiya nibbānam hadayasmiṃ opiya
translated: “Having gone to the forest, to the foot of a tree, or to an empty place,🔽Having set your heart on Nibbāna,🔽Meditate, Gotama, be not heedless:

original: Jhāya gotama mā ca pamādo, kiṃ te biḷibiḷikā karissatī”ti. –
analyzed: jhāya gotama mā ca pamādaḥ kim te biḷibiḷikā karissati iti
translated: What will the babbling of the cranes avail you?”

original: Gāthaṃ abhāsi.🔽Tattha rukkhamūlagahananti rukkhamūlabhūtaṃ gahanaṃ, gahanañhi atthi, na rukkhamūlaṃ,🔽rukkhamūlañca atthi, na gahanaṃ, tesu rukkhamūlaggahaṇena ṭhānassa chāyāsampannatāya
analyzed: gātham abhāsi  tattha rukkha mūla gahananti rukkha mūla bhūtam gahanam gahanam hi atthi na rukkha mūlam  rukkha mūlam ca atthi na gahanam tesu rukkha mūla ggahaṇena ṭhānassa chāyā sampanna tāya
translated: This is the verse he spoke.🔽Herein, the forest, the foot of a tree, and an empty place are the kinds of abode.🔽The word “or” shows that he may live in any one of them.

original: vātātapaparissayābhāvaṃ dasseti. Gahanaggahaṇena nivātabhāvena vātaparissayābhāvaṃ
analyzed: vāta ātapa parissaya abhāvam dasseti gahana ggahaṇena nivāta bhāvena vāta parissaya abhāvam
translated: The word “having gone” shows that he should go there of his own accord, not because he is banished there by a preceptor or teacher, or because he is turned out by abhiññātā, etc., as in Dhp 387.

original: janasambādhābhāvañca dasseti, tadubhayena ca bhāvanāyogyataṃ. Pasakkiyāti upagantvā.
analyzed: jana sambādha abhāvam ca dassa iti tad ubhayena ca bhāvanā yogyatam upagantvā
translated: and the absence of a crowd of people. And by both of these he shows that he is fit for development. Pasakkiyā means having approached.

original: Nibbānaṃ hadayasmiṃ opiyāti “evaṃ mayā paṭipajjitvā nibbānaṃ adhigantabba”nti nibbutiṃ
analyzed: nibbānam hadayasmiṃ opiya ati evam mayā paṭipajjitvā nibbānam adhigantabbanti nibbutim
translated: Nibbānaṃ hadayasmiṃ opiyā means “Having practised in this way, I must attain Nibbāna.”

original: hadaye ṭhapetvā citte karitvā. Jhāyāti lakkhaṇūpanijjhānena jhāya, vipassanābhāvanāsahitaṃ
analyzed: hadaye ṭhapetvā citte karitvā jhāya ati lakkhaṇa upanijjhānena jhāya vipassanā bhāvanā sahitam
translated: Having placed Nibbāna in his heart, having made it in his mind, Jhāyā means meditate by the meditation on the characteristics, develop the meditation that is accompanied by insight,

original: maggabhāvanaṃ bhāvehi. Gotamāti dhammabhaṇḍāgārikaṃ gottena ālapati. Mā ca pamādoti
analyzed: magga bhāvanam bhāvehi gotama ati dhammabhaṇḍāgārikam gottena ālapati mā ca pamādoti
translated: develop the path meditation. Gotamāti he addresses the one who is the treasurer of the Dhamma by his clan name. Mā ca pamādo means

analyzed: sāmaṇerassa patte bhaṇḍikam disvā ayam coraḥ iminā coriyam sāmaṇeram pacchābāham

analyzed: bandhitvā vassakārassa brāhmaṇassa dassesum vassakāraḥ ca tadā raññaḥ vinicchaye niyuttaḥ

analyzed: hutvā chejja bhejjam anusāsati saḥ pubbe mama vacanam na ādiyi suddha pāsaṇḍiyesu pabbajī iti

analyzed: ca baddha āghāta ttā kammam a sodhetvā ava jīvantam eva tam sūle uttāsesi  atha assa bhagavā ñāṇa paripākam oloketvā tam ṭhānam gantvā vipphuranta hattha nakha maṇi mayūkha sambhinna sita ābhatāya
translated: and because of his hatred he did not investigate the matter but had him impaled alive on a stake.

original: paggharantajātihiṅgulakasuvaṇṇarasadhāraṃ viya jālāguṇṭhitamudutalunadīghaṅgulihatthaṃ
analyzed: paggharanta jāti hiṅgulaka suvaṇṇa rasa dhāram viya jāla āguṇṭhita mudu talu nadī ghaṅguli hattham

analyzed: uttarassa sīse ṭhapetvā uttara idam te purima kammassa phalam uppannam tattha

analyzed: tayā paccavekkhaṇa balena adhivāsanā kātabbā iti vatvā ajjhāsayā anurūpam dhammam desesi
translated: “By the power of your reflection you should bear with it.”

analyzed: uttaraḥ amata abhiseka sadisena satthu hattha samphassena sañjāta ppasāda somanassa tāya  uḷāram pīti pāmojjam paṭilabhitvā yathā paricitam vipassanā maggam samārūḍhaḥ ñāṇassa

analyzed: paripākam gata ttā satthu ca desanā vilāsena tāvat eva magga paṭipāṭiyā sabba kilese khepetvā

translated: became one of the perfected ones. Therefore it was said in the Apadana:

translated: “The Sambuddha named Sumedha, who had the thirty-two characteristics,

analyzed: viveka kāmaḥ bhagavā himavantam upāgami
translated: the Fortunate One, who desired solitude, went to the Himalayas.

analyzed: ajjhogāhetvā himavantam aggaḥ kāruṇikaḥ muni

analyzed: pallaṅkam nisīdi

original: “Vijjādharo tadā āsiṃ, antalikkhacaro ahaṃ;
analyzed: vijjādharaḥ tadā āsim antalikkha caraḥ aham
translated: “At that time I was a sky-wanderer, who had attained the (magical) powers,

analyzed: tisūlam sugatam gacchāmi ambare tadā

original: “Pabbatagge yathā aggi, puṇṇamāyeva candimā;
analyzed: pabbatagge yathā aggi puṇṇamāyā iva candimā
translated: “Like a fire on a mountain-top, like the moon on the full moon day,

original: Vanaṃ obhāsate buddho, sālarājāva phullito.
analyzed: vanam obhāsate buddhaḥ sāla rājā ava phullitaḥ
translated: The Buddha shines in the forest, like a blossoming Sāl-tree king.

original: “Vanaggā nikkhamitvāna, buddharaṃsībhidhāvare;
analyzed: vanaggāḥ nikkhamitvāna
translated: “Having gone forth from the forest, to the one who is called the Buddha’s foremost disciple,

original: Naḷaggivaṇṇasaṅkāsā, disvā cittaṃ pasādayiṃ.
analyzed: naḷaggi vaṇṇa saṅkāsā disvā cittam pasādayim
translated: Seeing him like a bamboo’s colour, I was satisfied in mind.

analyzed: vicinam addasam puppham kaṇikāram devagandhikam
translated: “While searching I saw a flower, a Kaṇikāra tree, fragrant like the gods,

analyzed: tīṇi pupphāni ādāya buddha seṭṭham apūjayim
translated: Taking the three flowers, I worshipped the best of the Buddhas.

original: “Buddhassa ānubhāvena, tīṇi pupphāni me tadā;
analyzed: buddhassa ānubhāvena tīṇi pupphāni me tadā
translated: “Through the Buddha’s power, at that time the three flowers,

analyzed: uddhaṃvaṇṭāḥ adhopattāḥ chāyam kubbanti satthuno

original: “Tena kammena sukatena, cetanāpaṇidhīhi ca;
analyzed: tena kammena su katena cetanā paṇidhīhi ca
translated: “Through that good deed, and through my intention and aspiration,

analyzed: jahitvā mānusam deham tāvatiṃsam agaccha aham
translated: Having given up the human body, I went to the Tāvatiṃsa (heaven).

analyzed: tattha me sukatam byamham kaṇikārī iti

analyzed: sata sahassa niyyūhā byamhe pātubhaviṃsu me  soṇṇa mayā maṇi mayā lohitaṅka mayā api ca
translated: With a hundred thousand couches, the (Kaṇikāra) appeared to me.🔽“Made of gold, of gems, and of rubies,

original: Phalikāpi ca pallaṅkā, yenicchakā yadicchakā.
analyzed: phalikā api ca pallaṅkā yenicchakā yadicchakā
translated: And of ivory and couches, wherever I wished, and whenever I wished.

original: “Mahārahañca sayanaṃ, tūlikā vikatīyutaṃ;
analyzed: sayanam tūlikā vikatī yutam
translated: “A bed of great value, with a coverlet of cotton,

original: Uddhalomiñca ekantaṃ, bimbohanasamāyutaṃ.
analyzed: ekantam bimbohana samāyutam

original: “Bhavanā nikkhamitvāna, caranto devacārikaṃ;
analyzed: bhavanā nikkhamitvāna carantaḥ devacārikam
translated: “Having gone out from the dwelling, walking about on my divine walk,

translated: “There, with dancing, singing, and music,

analyzed: bhoge me ūna tā natthi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I never lacked for wealth—this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Duve bhave saṃsarāmi, devatte atha mānuse;
analyzed: duve bhave saṃsarāmi devatte atha mānuse

analyzed: nīce kule na jānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I do not know of a low family—this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Hatthiyānaṃ assayānaṃ, sivikaṃ sandamānikaṃ;
analyzed: hatthi yānam assa yānam sivikam sandamānikam
translated: “I obtain elephant vehicles, horse vehicles, and palanquins;

original: Labhāmi sabbamevetaṃ, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: labhāmi sabbam eva etam buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I obtain all of these—this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

analyzed: dāsī gaṇam dāsa gaṇam nāriyaḥ
translated: “I obtain a group of female slaves, a group of male slaves, and women adorned;

original: Labhāmi sabbamevetaṃ, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: labhāmi sabbam eva etam buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I obtain all of these—this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Koseyyakambaliyāni, khomakappāsikāni ca;
analyzed: koseyya kambaliyāni khoma kappāsikāni ca
translated: “I obtain woolen blankets, linen, cotton, and silk;

original: Labhāmi sabbamevetaṃ, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: labhāmi sabbam eva etam buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I obtain all of these—this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Navavatthaṃ navaphalaṃ, navaggarasabhojanaṃ;
analyzed: nava vattham nava phalam navagga rasa bhojanam
translated: “I obtain new clothes, new fruits, and new delicious food;

original: Labhāmi sabbamevetaṃ, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: labhāmi sabbam eva etam buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I obtain all of these—this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Imaṃ khāda imaṃ bhuñja, imamhi sayane saya;
analyzed: imam khāda imam bhuñja imamhi sayane saya
translated: “Eat this, enjoy this, sleep on this bed;

original: Labhāmi sabbamevetaṃ, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: labhāmi sabbam eva etam buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I have all these things, this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Sabbattha pūjito homi, yaso accuggato mama;
analyzed: sabbattha pūjitaḥ homi yasaḥ accuggataḥ mama
translated: I am worshipped everywhere, my fame has risen high,

original: Mahāpakkho sadā homi, abhejjapariso sadā;

analyzed: ñātīnam uttamaḥ homi buddha pūjāya idam phalam

original: “Sītaṃ uṇhaṃ na jānāmi, pariḷāho na vijjati;
analyzed: sītam uṇham na jānāmi pariḷāhaḥ na vijjati

analyzed: atho cetasikam dukkham hadaye me na vijjati
translated: and I do not know mental suffering, this is not found in my heart.

analyzed: suvaṇṇa vaṇṇaḥ hutvāna saṃsarāmi bhava abhave

original: Vevaṇṇiyaṃ na jānāmi, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: na jānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I do not know ugliness, this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Devalokā cavitvāna, sukkamūlena codito;
analyzed: deva lokā cavitvāna sukka mūlena coditaḥ
translated: Having fallen from the world of the gods, urged on by the root of merit,

analyzed: sāvatthiyam pure jātaḥ mahāsāle suaḍḍhake
translated: I was reborn in the city of Sāvatthī, in a great and wealthy merchant’s family.

original: “Pañca kāmaguṇe hitvā, pabbajiṃ anagāriyaṃ;
analyzed: pañca kāmaguṇe hitvā pabbajim anagāriyam
translated: Having given up the five sense pleasures, I went forth into homelessness,

original: Jātiyā sattavassohaṃ, arahattamapāpuṇiṃ.

original: “Upasampādayī buddho, guṇamaññāya cakkhumā;

translated: The Buddha, who had the eye of wisdom, gave me the full ordination,

original: Taruṇo pūjanīyohaṃ, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: pūjanīyā uham buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: and I, who was young, was worshipped, this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Dibbacakkhu visuddhaṃ me, samādhikusalo ahaṃ;
analyzed: dibba cakkhu visuddham me samādhi kusalaḥ aham
translated: My divine eye is purified, I am skilled in concentration,

original: Abhiññāpāramippatto, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: abhiññāpārami pattaḥ buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I’ve reached perfection in direct knowledge: this is the fruit of honoring the Awakened One.

original: “Paṭisambhidā anuppatto, iddhipādesu kovido;
analyzed: paṭisambhidā anuppatto iddhipādesu kovidaḥ
translated: I’ve reached the discriminations, I’m skilled in the bases of success,

original: Dhammesu pāramippatto, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: dhammesu pārami ppattaḥ buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I’ve reached perfection in the qualities: this is the fruit of honoring the Awakened One.

original: “Tiṃsakappasahassamhi, yaṃ buddhamabhipūjayiṃ;
analyzed: tiṃsa kappa sahassamhi yam buddham abhipūjayiṃ
translated: For 30,000 eons, I honored the Awakened One.

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I don’t recall any bad destinations: this is the fruit of honoring the Awakened One.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: My defilements are ended… I’ve fulfilled the Buddha’s instructions.

original: Chaḷabhiñño puna hutvā sūlato uṭṭhahitvā parānuddayāya ākāse ṭhatvā pāṭihāriyaṃ dassesi.
analyzed: chaḷabhiñño puna hutvā sūlataḥ uṭṭhahitvā ākāse ṭhatvā pāṭihāriyam dassesi
translated: Having become one with the six direct knowledges, he rose from the bowl, stood in the sky for the benefit of others, and displayed a miracle.

original: Mahājano acchariyabbhutacittajāto ahosi. Tāvadevassa vaṇo saṃrūḷhi, so bhikkhūhi,
analyzed: mahā janaḥ acchariya abbhuta citta jātaḥ ahosi tāva devassa vaṇaḥ saṃrūḍhi saḥ bhikkhūhi
translated: The great crowd was amazed and astonished. His wound healed right then and there. The monks asked him,

original: “āvuso, tādisaṃ dukkhaṃ anubhavanto kathaṃ tvaṃ vipassanaṃ anuyuñjituṃ asakkhī”ti
analyzed: āvuso tādisam dukkham anubhavantaḥ katham tvam vipassanam anuyuñjitum asakkhi iti
translated: “Friend, while experiencing such suffering, how were you able to apply insight?”

original: puṭṭho, “pageva me, āvuso, saṃsāre ādīnavo, saṅkhārānañca sabhāvo sudiṭṭho, evāhaṃ
analyzed: puṭṭhaḥ pagā iva me āvuso saṃsāre ādīnavaḥ saṅkhāra anañca sabhāvaḥ su diṭṭhaḥ eva aham
translated: When asked, “Of course, friends, the drawbacks of the round of rebirths and the nature of fabricated things were well seen by me.

original: tādisaṃ dukkhaṃ anubhavantopi asakkhiṃ vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā visesaṃ adhigantu”nti dassento –
analyzed: tādisam dukkham anubhavantaḥ api asakkhim vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā visesam adhigantunti dassento
translated: Although he was experiencing such suffering, he was still unable to increase his insight and reach distinction.🔽There is no permanent existence,

original: “Natthi koci bhavo nicco, saṅkhārā vāpi sassatā;
analyzed: na atthi koci bhavaḥ niccaḥ saṅkhārāḥ vā api sassatā
translated: Nor are there any eternal conditions.🔽The aggregates arise and pass away,

original: Uppajjanti ca te khandhā, cavanti aparāparaṃ.
analyzed: uppajjanti ca te khandhāḥ cavanti apara aparam
translated: One after the other.

original: “Etamādīnavaṃ ñatvā, bhavenamhi anatthiko;
analyzed: etam ādīnavam ñatvā anatthiko
translated: Knowing this danger, I have no desire for existence.🔽I have renounced all sensual pleasures,

original: Nissaṭo sabbakāmehi, patto me āsavakkhayo”ti. –
analyzed: nissaṭaḥ sabba kāmehi pattaḥ me āsava kkhayaḥ ti
translated: And have attained the destruction of the taints.

original: Imaṃ gāthādvayaṃ abhāsi.
analyzed: imam gāthā dvayam abhāsi
translated: He uttered these two verses.

original: Tattha natthi koci bhavo niccoti kammabhavo upapattibhavo kāmabhavo rūpabhavo arūpabhavo
analyzed: tattha natthi koci bhavaḥ niccaḥ iti kamma bhavaḥ upapatti bhavo kāma bhavaḥ rūpa bhavaḥ arūpa bhavo
translated: Herein, there is no permanent existence means that there is no such existence as the kamma-existence, the rebirth-existence, the sensual-existence, the form-existence, the formless-existence,

original: saññībhavo asaññībhavo nevasaññīnāsaññībhavo ekavokārabhavo catuvokārabhavo pañcavokārabhavoti🔽evaṃbhedo, tatthāpi hīno majjhimo ukkaṭṭho dīghāyuko sukhabahulo vomissasukhadukkhoti
analyzed: saññībhavaḥ asaññībhavaḥ nevasaññīnāsaññībhavaḥ eka vokāra bhavaḥ catu vokāra bhavaḥ pañca vokāra bhavaḥ ti  evaṃbhedaḥ tattha api hīnaḥ majjhimaḥ ukkaṭṭhaḥ dīgha āyukaḥ sukha bahulaḥ vā umissa sukha dukkhaḥ ti
translated: the perception-existence, the non-perception-existence, the neither-perception-nor-non-perception-existence, the single-constituent-existence, the four-constituent-existence, the five-constituent-existence,🔽and so on. Even in these, there is no such thing as the inferior, the medium, the superior, the long-lived, the one with much happiness, the one with mixed happiness and suffering,

original: evaṃvibhāgo yokoci nicco dhuvo thiro apalokiyadhammo natthi taṃ taṃ kāraṇaṃ paṭicca
analyzed: evaṃvibhāgaḥ yo koci niccaḥ dhuvaḥ thiraḥ apalokiya dhammaḥ natthi tam tam kāraṇam paṭicca
translated: or the permanent, the stable, the eternal, the peaceful, the truly existent, which is independent of this and that cause.

original: samuppannattā. Yasmā ca etadevaṃ, tasmā saṅkhārā vāpi sassatā natthīti yojanā. Paccayehi
analyzed: samuppanna ttā yasmā ca etat evam tasmā saṅkhārāḥ vā api sassatā natthi iti yojanā paccayehi
translated: and they have arisen. And since this is so, the construction is: “There are no formations that are eternal.”

original: saṅkhatattā “saṅkhārā”ti laddhanāme hi pañcakkhandhe upādāya bhavasamaññāya saṅkhārāva
analyzed: saṅkhata ttā saṅkhārā ati laddha nāme hi pañca kkhandhe upādāya bhava samaññāya
translated: For the five aggregates, which are called “formations” because they are formed by conditions, are called “becoming” in the sense of the continuity of existence.

original: hutvā sambhūtā jarāmaraṇena ca vipariṇamantīti asassatā vipariṇāmadhammā. Tathā hi
analyzed: hutvā sambhūtāḥ jarā maraṇena ca vipariṇamanti iti a sassatā vipariṇāma dhammā tathā hi
translated: They are formed by the formations and they come to be by burning, and they change by aging and death. Thus they are impermanent and subject to change.

original: te “saṅkhārā”ti vuccanti. Tenāha uppajjanti ca te khandhā, cavanti aparāparanti.🔽Te bhavapariyāyena saṅkhārapariyāyena ca vuttā pañcakkhandhā yathāpaccayaṃ aparāparaṃ
analyzed: te saṅkhārāḥ ti vuccanti tena āha uppajjanti ca te khandhāḥ cavanti apara aparanti  te bhava pariyāyena saṅkhāra pariyāyena ca vuttā pañca kkhandhāḥ yathāpaccayam apara aparam
translated: That is why they are called “formations.” Hence it is said: “These aggregates arise, And pass away, one after another.”

original: uppajjanti, uppannā ca jarāya paripīḷitā hutvā cavanti paribhijjantīti attho. Etena
analyzed: uppajjanti uppannā ca jarāya paripīḍitā hutvā cavanti paribhijjanti iti atthaḥ etena
translated: The five aggregates, which are called “becoming” and “formations” in the sense of the continuity of existence and the formations, arise one after another according to conditions. And when they have arisen, they pass away, they are destroyed, being oppressed by aging.

original: “bhavo, saṅkhārā”ti ca laddhavohārā pañcakkhandhā udayabbayasabhāvāti dasseti. Yasmā
analyzed: saṅkhārā ati ca laddha vohārā pañca kkhandhā udaya bbaya sabhāvā ti dasseti yasmā
translated: This shows that the five aggregates, which are called “becoming” and “formations,” have the nature of arising and passing away.

original: tilakkhaṇaṃ āropetvā saṅkhāre sammasantassa tayopi bhavā ādittaṃ viya saṅkhate ādīnavaṃ
analyzed: ti lakkhaṇam āropetvā saṅkhāre sammasantassa tayo pi bhavāḥ ādittam viya ādīnavam
translated: For when he comprehends formations by characterizing them according to the three characteristics, the three kinds of becoming appear to him as a mass of flames.

original: dosaṃ pageva vipassanāpaññāya jānitvā aniccalakkhaṇehi diṭṭhā saṅkhārā dukkhānattā
analyzed: dosam pageva vipassanā paññāya jānitvā anicca lakkhaṇehi diṭṭhāḥ saṅkhārāḥ dukkha anattā
translated: and when he has known ill will by means of insight knowledge, then formations seen as the sign of impermanence appear to him as more fearful still by reason of their painfulness and soullessness.

original: vibhūtatarā upaṭṭhahanti, tenāha bhagavā – “yadaniccaṃ taṃ dukkhaṃ, yaṃ dukkhaṃ tadanattā”ti.
analyzed: vibhūtatarāḥ upaṭṭhahanti tena āha bhagavā yat aniccam tam dukkham yat dukkham tat anattā iti
translated: That is why the Blessed One said: “What is impermanent is painful; what is painful is soulless” .

original: Yasmā tilakkhaṇaṃ āropetvā saṅkhāre sammasantassa tayopi bhavā ādittaṃ viya agāraṃ🔽sappaṭibhayā upaṭṭhahanti, tasmā āha “bhavenamhi anatthiko”ti. Evaṃ pana sabbaso
analyzed: yasmā tilakkhaṇam āropetvā saṅkhāre sammasantassa bhavāḥ ādittam viya agāram  sa paṭibhayāḥ upaṭṭhahanti tasmai āha anatthiko ti evam pana sabbaso
translated: And when he comprehends formations by characterizing them with the three characteristics, then the three kinds of becoming appear to him as fearful with the danger of the three kinds of suffering, like a burning house,

original: bhavehi vinivattiyamānassa kāmesu apekkhāya lesopi na sambhavatiyeva, tenāha “nissaṭo
analyzed: bhavehi kāmesu apekkhāya lesaḥ api na tena āha nissaṭaḥ
translated: so he said “I have no concern for becoming” . But when he is thus turning away from all becoming, then even the slightest expectation of sense desires is impossible for him, so he said “I am released from all sense desires” .

original: sabbakāmehī”ti, amhīti yojanā. Mānusehi viya dibbehipi kāmehi nivattitacittosmīti🔽attho. Patto me āsavakkhayoti yasmā evaṃ suparimajjitasaṅkhāro bhavesu suparidiṭṭhādīnavo
analyzed: sabba kāmehi iti amhi iti yojanā mānusehi viya dibbehi pi kāmehi nivattita cittaḥ asmi iti  atthaḥ pattaḥ me āsava kkhayaḥ ti yasmai evam su parimajjita saṅkhāraḥ bhavesu su paridiṭṭha ādīnavaḥ
translated: The meaning is that I have turned away from sense desires even of the Brahmās, as from those of human beings.🔽I have reached the destruction of taints. Since he has thus well refined away formations, well seen the danger in becoming, and well made his mind free from taint regarding sense desires,

original: kāmesu ca anāsattamānaso tasmā sūlamatthake nisinnenāpi me mayā patto adhigato āsavakkhayo
analyzed: kāmesu ca anāsatta mānasaḥ tasmā sūla matthake nisinnena api me mayā pattaḥ adhigataḥ āsava kkhayo
translated: then the destruction of taints has been reached by me, even though I sit here on the spike.

original: nibbānaṃ arahattañcāti. Aññehi ca sabrahmacārīhi appattamānasehi tadadhigamāya ussāho
analyzed: nibbānam arahattam ca ati aññehi ca sabrahmacārīhi appatta mānasehi tad adhigamāya ussāhaḥ
translated: and Nibbāna and Arahantship. And he exhorted the bhikkhus to make an effort to attain these things, which other fellow-brahmans had not attained.

original: karaṇīyoti bhikkhūnaṃ ovādamadāsi.
analyzed: karaṇīyaḥ ti bhikkhūnam ovādam adāsi
translated: Thus he gave advice to the bhikkhus.

original: Uttarattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: uttara thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Uttara is finished.

original: 2. Piṇḍolabhāradvājattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
translated: Piṇḍolabhāradvāja🔽These verses were spoken by the Elder Piṇḍolabhāradvāja.

original: Nayidaṃ anayenātiādikā āyasmato piṇḍolabhāradvājattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayaṃ
analyzed: anayena ati ādikā āyasmataḥ piṇḍolabhāradvāja therassa gāthā kā uppatti ayaṃ
translated: The story is as follows.

original: kira padumuttarassa bhagavato kāle sīhayoniyaṃ nibbattitvā pabbataguhāyaṃ viharati.🔽Bhagavā tassa anuggahaṃ kātuṃ gocarāya pakkantakāle sayanaguhaṃ pavisitvā nirodhaṃ
analyzed: kira padumuttarassa bhagavataḥ kāle sīha yoniyam nibbattitvā pabbata guhāyam viharati  bhagavā tassa anuggaham kātum gocarāya pakkanta kāle sayana guham pavisitvā nirodham
translated: Once upon a time, it seems, in the dispensation of the Buddha Padumuttara, he was reborn in the womb of a lioness and lived in a mountain cave.🔽The Buddha, in order to help him, entered the cave as he was going out for his almsround, and sat down and attained cessation.

original: samāpajjitvā nisīdi. Sīho gocaraṃ gahetvā nivatto guhādvāre bhagavantaṃ disvā haṭṭhatuṭṭho🔽jalajathalajapupphehi pūjaṃ katvā cittaṃ pasādento bhagavato ārakkhatthāya araññe
analyzed: samāpajjitvā nisīdi sīhaḥ gocaram gahetvā nivattaḥ guhā dvāre bhagavantam disvā haṭṭha tuṭṭhaḥ  jalaja thalaja pupphehi pūjam katvā cittam pasādentaḥ bhagavataḥ ārakkha atthāya araññe
translated: The lion returned from his search for food, saw the Buddha at the door of the cave, and was delighted.🔽He worshipped him with the flowers of the forest, and he made his mind calm and composed. In order to protect the Buddha, he roared three times in the forest to drive away wild beasts and wild spirits.

original: vāḷamige apanetuṃ tīsu velāsu sīhanādaṃ nadanto buddhagatāya satiyā aṭṭhāsi. Yathā
analyzed: vāḷa mige apanetum tīsu velāsu sīha nādam nadantaḥ buddha gatāya satiyā aṭṭhāsi yathā
translated: He stood guard with his mind fixed on the Buddha.

original: paṭhamadivasaṃ, evaṃ sattāhaṃ pūjesi. Bhagavā sattāhaccayena nirodhā vuṭṭhahitvā🔽“vattissati imassa ettako upanissayo”ti tassa passantasseva ākāsaṃ pakkhanditvā vihārameva
analyzed: paṭhama divasam evam sattāham pūjesi bhagavā sattāha cayena nirodhā vuṭṭhahitvā  vattissati imassa ettakaḥ upanissayaḥ ti tassa passantassa iva ākāsam pakkhanditvā vihāram eva
translated: and he worshipped in this way for seven days. The Blessed One, after seven days, arose from his attainment of cessation,

original: gato. Sīho pālileyyakahatthī viya buddhaviyogadukkhaṃ adhivāsetuṃ asakkonto kālaṃ
analyzed: gataḥ sīhaḥ pālileyyaka hatthī viya buddha viyoga dukkham adhivāsetum a sakkonto kālam
translated: and seeing that the Elder was still watching, he flew up into the air and went to the monastery. The Elder, unable to bear the pain of separation from the Buddha, like the lion of Pālileyyaka,

original: katvā haṃsavatīnagare mahābhogakule nibbattitvā vayappatto nagaravāsīhi saddhiṃ vihāraṃ
analyzed: katvā haṃsavatī nagare mahā bhoga kule nibbattitvā vaya pattaḥ nagara vāsīhi saddhim vihāram
translated: died. He was reborn in a very wealthy family in the city of Haṃsavatī. When he reached maturity, he went to the monastery with the citizens of the city.

original: gato dhammadesanaṃ sutvā sattāhaṃ mahādānaṃ pavattetvā yāvajīvaṃ puññāni katvā aparāparaṃ
analyzed: gataḥ dhamma desanam sutvā sattāham mahādānam pavattetvā yāvajīvam puññāni katvā apara aparam
translated: Hearing the Dhamma preached, he made a great offering for seven days, and for the rest of his life he made merit. Transmigrating through the round of rebirths among gods and men,

original: devamanussesu saṃsaranto amhākaṃ bhagavato kāle kosambiyaṃ rañño utenassa purohitaputto🔽hutvā nibbatti bhāradvājo nāma nāmena. So vayappatto tayo vede uggahetvā pañca māṇavakasatāni
analyzed: deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ amhākam bhagavato kāle kosambiyam raññaḥ utenassa purohita putto  hutvā nibbatti bhāradvājaḥ nāma nāmena saḥ vaya pattaḥ tayaḥ vede uggahetvā pañca māṇavaka satāni
translated: in our Blessed One’s day he was reborn as the son of King Udena’s chaplain in Kosambī.🔽He was called Bhāradvāja by name. When he reached maturity, he learned the three Vedas,🔽and he taught the Vedas to five hundred young men. Because of his high fees, they abandoned him. He went to Rājagaha,

original: mante vācento mahagghasabhāvena ananurūpācārattā tehi pariccajjanto rājagahaṃ gantvā
analyzed: mante mahagghasa bhāvena tehi pariccajjantaḥ rājagaham gantvā
translated: and there he lived by teaching the Vedas to young men.

original: bhagavato bhikkhusaṅghassa ca lābhasakkāraṃ disvā sāsane pabbajitvā bhojane amattaññū
analyzed: bhagavataḥ bhikkhu saṅghassa ca lābha sakkāram disvā sāsane pabbajitvā bhojane amattaññū
translated: and seeing the gain and honour of the Community of monks under the Blessed One, he went forth in the Dispensation, and being immoderate in eating,

original: hutvā vicaranto satthārā upāyena mattaññutāya patiṭṭhāpito vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapetvā
analyzed: hutvā vicarantaḥ satthārā upāyena mattaññu tāya patiṭṭhāpitaḥ vipassanam paṭṭhapetvā
translated: wandering about, he was established by the Teacher in moderation through a device, and after setting about insight

original: nacirasseva chaḷabhiñño ahosi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: nacirassa iva chaḍabhiññaḥ ahosi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: he became one of the perfected ones in no long time. Therefore it is said in the Apadana:

original: “Migaluddo pure āsiṃ, vipine vicaraṃ tadā;
analyzed: migaluddaḥ pure āsim vipine vicaram tadā
translated: “In the past I was a hunter, wandering in the forest then;

original: Addasaṃ virajaṃ buddhaṃ, sabbadhammāna pāraguṃ.
analyzed: addasam virajam buddham sabba dhammāna pāragum
translated: I saw the dust-free Buddha, the one who had gone beyond all things.

original: “Piyālaphalamādāya, buddhaseṭṭhassadāsahaṃ;
analyzed: piyāla phalam ādāya buddha seṭṭhaḥ sadāsaham
translated: Taking a piyāla fruit, I approached the best of Buddhas;

original: Puññakkhettassa vīrassa, pasanno sehi pāṇibhi.🔽“Ekatiṃse ito kappe, yaṃ phalaṃ adadiṃ tadā;
analyzed: puññakkhettassa vīrassa pasannaḥ sehi pāṇibhi  ekatiṃse itas kappe yam phalam adadim tadā
translated: I was faithful, and with my own hands I gave it to the hero, the field of merit.

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, phaladānassidaṃ phalaṃ.🔽“Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi phala dānassa idam phalam  kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “In the thirty-first (cycle of) time since then, I do not recall a bad destination, this is the fruit of giving the fruit.🔽My defilements are destroyed … the Buddha’s Dispensation is fulfilled.”

original: Chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā “bhagavato sammukhā yaṃ sāvakehi pattabbaṃ, taṃ mayā patta”nti,
analyzed: chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā bhagavataḥ sammukhāḥ yat sāvakehi pattabbam tat mayā pattanti
translated: But after becoming one of the perfected ones, thinking: “What is to be attained by disciples in the presence of the Blessed One, that has been attained by me,”

original: bhikkhusaṅghe ca “yassa magge vā phale vā kaṅkhā atthi, so maṃ pucchatū”ti sīhanādaṃ🔽nadi. Tena taṃ bhagavā, “etadaggaṃ, bhikkhave, mama sāvakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ sīhanādikānaṃ
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅghe ca yassa magge vā phale vā kaṅkhā atthi saḥ mama pucchatu uti sīhanādam  nadi tena tam bhagavā etat aggam bhikkhave mama sāvakānam bhikkhūnam sīha nādikānam
translated: and in the Community of monks he roared his lion’s roar, saying: “Whoever has doubt about the path or the fruit, let him ask me.”

original: yadidaṃ piṇḍolabhāradvājo”ti etadagge ṭhapesi. So ekadivasaṃ attano santikaṃ upagataṃ🔽gihikāle sahāyabhūtaṃ macchariṃ micchādiṭṭhibrāhmaṇaṃ anukampamāno tassa dānakathaṃ
analyzed: yat idam piṇḍola bhāradvājaḥ ti etat agge ṭhapesi saḥ eka divasam attano santikam upagatam  gihi kāle sahāya bhūtam maccharim micchādiṭṭhi brāhmaṇam anukampamānaḥ tassa dāna katham
translated: Therefore the Fortunate One placed him in the foremost position, saying: “Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja is outstanding amongst those monks who are lion-like roarers.” One day, out of compassion, he preached a discourse on giving to a miserly brahmin, who had been his friend in a previous life as a layman,

original: kathetvā tena ca “ayaṃ mama dhanaṃ vināsetukāmo”ti bhakuṭiṃ katvāpi “tuyhaṃ ekabhattaṃ🔽demī”ti vutte, “taṃ saṅghassa dehi mā mayha”nti saṅghassa pariṇāmesi. Puna brāhmaṇena
analyzed: kathetvā tena ca ayam mama dhanam bhakuṭim katvā api tuyham eka bhattam  demi iti vutte tam saṅghassa dehi mā mayhanti saṅghassa pariṇāmesi puna brāhmaṇena
translated: and who had come into his presence, and who had wrong views. Although the brahmin frowned, thinking: “He wants to destroy my wealth,” and said: “I will give you one meal,”

original: “ayaṃ maṃ bahūnaṃ dāpetukāmo”ti appaccaye pakāsite dutiyadivasaṃ dhammasenāpatinā
analyzed: ayam mam bahūnam dāpetu kāmo ti appaccaye pakāsite dutiya divasam dhamma senāpatinā
translated: he (Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja) said: “Give it to the Community, not to me.” When the brahmin said: “He wants to make me give to many people,” and showed his displeasure, on the second day the General of the Dhamma,

original: saṅghagatāya dakkhiṇāya mahapphalabhāvappakāsanena taṃ pasādetvā, “ayaṃ brāhmaṇo
analyzed: saṅgha gatāya dakkhiṇāya mahat phala bhāva ppakāsanena tam pasādetvā ayam brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: after the brahmin had made an offering to the Community, made him have faith by showing the great fruit of the offering, and said: “This brahmin

original: ‘āhāragedhena maṃ dāne nīyojesī’ti maññati, āhārassa pana mayā sabbaso pariññātabhāvaṃ
analyzed: āhāra gedhena mam dāne nīyojesi iti maññati āhārassa pana mayā sabbaso pariññāta bhāvam
translated: “He thinks that I am leading him to giving by means of the bait of food, but he does not know that I have completely understood the nature of food.

original: na jānāti, handa naṃ jānāpemī”ti –
analyzed: na jānāti handa nam jāna apemi iti
translated: Let me make him understand.”

original: “Nayidaṃ anayena jīvitaṃ, nāhāro hadayassa santiko;
analyzed: na yidam anayena jīvitam na āhāraḥ hadayassa santikaḥ
translated: “This life is not to be lived by wrong means, food is not a friend to the heart;

original: Āhāraṭṭhitiko samussayo, iti disvāna carāmi esanaṃ.
analyzed: āhāra ṭṭhitiko samussayaḥ iti disvāna carāmi esanam
translated: The body is maintained by food, seeing this I go about seeking.

original: “Paṅkoti hi naṃ avedayuṃ, yāyaṃ vandanapūjanā kulesu;
analyzed: hi nam avedayum vandana pūjanā kulesu
translated: “They say it is a mire, this paying of respect and making offerings in families;

original: Sukhumaṃ sallaṃ durubbahaṃ, sakkāro kāpurisena dujjaho”ti. –
analyzed: sukhumam sallam durubbaham sakkāraḥ kāpurisena dujjahoti
translated: A subtle dart is hard to pull out, honour is hard for a bad man to abandon.”

original: Gāthādvayaṃ abhāsi.
analyzed: gāthā dvayam abhāsi
translated: He uttered these two stanzas.

original: Tattha nayidaṃ anayena jīvitanti idaṃ mama jīvitaṃ anayena añāyena veḷudānapupphadānādianesanāya
analyzed: tattha na idam anayena jīvitan ti idam mama jīvitam anayena añāyena veḷu dāna puppha dāna ādi anesanāya
translated: Herein, this life is not to be lived by wrong means: this life of mine is not to be lived by wrong means, by wrong ways, by seeking by means of the giving of creepers, the giving of flowers, and so on.🔽It is not to be lived by means of the seeking of life.

original: na hoti jīvitanikantiyā abhāvato. Nāhāro hadayassa santikoti āhāro ca āhariyamāno
analyzed: na hoti jīvita nikantiyāḥ abhāvataḥ na āhāraḥ hadayassa santikaḥ ti āhāro ca āhariyamāno
translated: Food is not a friend to the heart: food that is being eaten

original: maggaphalañāṇaṃ viya hadayassa cittassa santikaro na hoti, kevalaṃ pana sajjukaṃ
analyzed: magga phala ñāṇam viya hadayassa cittassa santikaraḥ na hoti kevalam pana sajjukam
translated: is not a friend to the heart, to the mind, like the knowledge of the paths and fruits. It is only

original: khudāpaṭighātamattaṃ karotīti adhippāyo. Atha vā nāhāro hadayassa santikoti āhāro
analyzed: khudā paṭighāta mattam karoti iti adhippāyaḥ atha vā na āhāraḥ hadayassa santikaḥ ti āhāro
translated: The meaning is that he does it only to the extent of satisfying hunger and want. Or alternatively, since food is not near to the heart,

analyzed: rasa taṇhā vatthu me hadayassa santikaḥ āsattaḥ na hoti rasa taṇhāya eva abhāvato santikā iti pi  paṭhanti yaḥ hi āhāra giddhaḥ lābha sakkāra ppasutaḥ vicarati tassa āhāraḥ hadayassa santike
translated: the object of craving for tastes is near to the heart, but it is not near to him because of the absence of craving for tastes. “Near” is also read🔽as “dear.” For one who is greedy for food and goes about intent on gain and honour, food is called “near to the heart” because it is frequently

translated: attended to. But one who has fully understood food has abandoned desire and lust for it,🔽and food is not called “near to the heart” for him because there is no

analyzed: abhāvataḥ yadi hi jīvita nikanti āhāra rasa taṇhā ca natthi atha kasmā piṇḍāya carasi iti

original: anuyogaṃ manasi katvā āha “āhāraṭṭhitiko samussayo, iti disvāna carāmi esana”nti.
analyzed: anuyogam manasi katvā āha āhāra ṭṭhitiko samussayaḥ iti disvāna carāmi esananti
translated: Seeing that the world is sustained by food, I go on alms round seeking that.

original: Āhāro bhojanaṃ ṭhiti ṭhānaṃ paccayo etassāti āhāraṭṭhitiko. “Āhārapaṭibaddhavuttiko

analyzed: samussayo kāyo iti disvāna evam ñatvā imam attham buddhiyam ṭhapetvā carāmi esanaṃ

original: bhikkhāpariyesanaṃ karomīti attho.
analyzed: bhikkhā pariyesanam karomi iti attho
translated: I go about seeking alms. The meaning is: I go about seeking food by way of alms.

analyzed: paccaya nimittam kulāni upasaṅkamantaḥ tattha vandana pūjanāhi lābha sakkārehi ca bajjhati iti
translated: Approaching families for the sake of the requisites, I am fettered there by the paying of homage and by the gains and honour.

analyzed: evam mā ādisesu na cintetabbanti dassentaḥ paṅkoti gātham abhāsi tassa atthaḥ yā ayam  paccaya nimittam upagatānam pabbajitānam kulesu gehavāsīsu pavatti ssati guṇa sambhāvanā
translated: Thus showing that such things as these should not be thought of by one like me, he uttered the stanza beginning with the word “paṅka.” Its meaning is this:🔽This honouring and paying of homage that will occur among householders towards those who have gone forth and who have approached families for the sake of the requisites,

original: pūjanā ca, yasmā taṃ abhāvitattānaṃ osīdāpanaṭṭhena malīnabhāvakaraṇena ca paṅko
analyzed: ca ca ca ca
translated: since it is a mud, a mire, in the sense of causing those who are undeveloped to sink down and in the sense of causing them to become defiled,

original: kaddamoti buddhādayo avedayuṃ abbhaññāsuṃ pavedesuṃ vā, tasmā sā sappurisānaṃ bandhāya
analyzed: kaddamā iti buddha ādayaḥ avedayum abbhaññāsum pavedesum vā tasmā sā sappurisānam bandhāya
translated: the Buddhas and the others have declared, have penetrated, have made known,🔽therefore it is not for the binding of the good people,

original: na hoti sakkārāsāya pageva pahīnattā. Asappurisassa pana sakkārāsā duviññeyyasabhāvatāya
analyzed: na hoti sakkārāsāya pagā iva pahīna ttā asappurisassa pana sakkārāsā du viññeyya sabhāva tāya
translated: because of the absence of the desire for honour. But for the bad person, because of the twofold nature of the desire for honour,

original: pīḷājananato anto tudanato uddharituṃ asakkuṇeyyato ca sukhumaṃ sallaṃ durubbahaṃ.
analyzed: pīḷā jananataḥ antar tudanataḥ uddharitum a sakkuṇeyyataḥ ca sukhumam sallam durubbaham
translated: It is hard to draw out because it is subtle, because it causes pain, and because it cannot be drawn out by being pulled from within.

original: Tato eva tena sakkāro kāpurisena dujjaho durubbaheyyo tassa pahānapaṭipattiyā appaṭipajjanato,
analyzed: tatas eva tena sakkāraḥ kāpurisena dujjahaḥ durubbaheyyo tassa pahāna paṭipattiyāḥ a paṭipajjanato
translated: It is hard to abandon because it is hard to give up, and because it is hard to give up by one who does not practice the way of abandoning it.🔽It is abandoned by abandoning the desire for honor.

original: sakkārāsāpahānena pahīno hotīti. Taṃ sutvā brāhmaṇo there abhippasanno ahosi.
analyzed: sakkā rāsa apahānena pahīnaḥ hoti iti tam sutvā brāhmaṇaḥ there abhippasannaḥ ahosi

original: Piṇḍolabhāradvājattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: piṇḍola bhāradvāja tthera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Piṇḍolabhāradvāja is finished.

original: 3. Valliyattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: valliya thera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Valliya🔽The elder named Valliya, whose verses begin “The monkey at the five-gated city,”

analyzed: kula gehe nibbattitvā viññutam pattaḥ eka divasam kenacid eva karaṇīyena araññam gataḥ

original: tattha nāradaṃ nāma paccekasambuddhaṃ rukkhamūle vasantaṃ disvā pasannamānaso naḷehi
analyzed: tattha nāradam nāma paccekasambuddham rukkha mūle vasantam disvā pasanna mānasaḥ naḷehi

original: sālaṃ katvā tiṇehi chādetvā adāsi. Caṅkamanaṭṭhānañcassa sodhetvā vālukā okiritvā
analyzed: sālam katvā tiṇehi chādetvā adāsi caṅkamana ṭṭhānam ca sodhetvā vālukāḥ okiritvā

analyzed: brāhmaṇa mahāsālassa puttaḥ hutvā nibbatti valliyotissa nāmam ahosi saḥ vaya patto

translated: I swept out a place for him to walk up and down in and gave it to Sayambhū.

original: “Tena kammena sukatena, cetanāpaṇidhīhi ca;
analyzed: tena kammena su katena cetanā paṇidhīhi ca
translated: “By that deed of merit well done, by my intention and aspiration,

translated: “Doubt” means uncertainty. He is “omniscient” in the sense of knowing all conditioned and unconditioned things without exception. This is the meaning: “From the time when I heard the Dhamma of the four noble truths being taught by the Teacher with my ear faculty, and when I grasped it by way of the ear door and apprehended it, from that time on I became omniscient, knowing by my own supermundane knowledge all conditioned and unconditioned things without exception. I became the leader, leading beings to be trained out of the desert of greed, etc., and to Nibbāna. I became the great hero, being greatly valiant.
