analyzed: sabba āsavā parikkhīṇā natthi dāni punabbhavaḥ
translated: All my cankers are destroyed. There is no more of this state of being.

original: “Satasahassito kappe, yaṃ bhisaṃ adadiṃ tadā;
analyzed: kappe yam bhisam adadim tadā
translated: “For a hundred thousand cycles of time, I gave medicine then.

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, bhisadānassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi bhisa dānassa idam phalam
translated: I do not know of a bad destination. This is the fruit of giving medicine.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: My defilements are destroyed. … The Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Arahatte pana tena adhigate satthā bhaddiyaseṭṭhiṃ āmantesi – “tava putto alaṅkatapaṭiyatto
analyzed: arahatte pana tena adhigate satthā bhaddiyaseṭṭhim āmantesi tava putto alaṅkata paṭiyatto
translated: But when he had attained perfection, the Teacher addressed the merchant Bhaddhiya: “Your son, adorned with the marks,

analyzed: dhammam suṇantaḥ arahatte patiṭṭhāsi tena assa idānā iva pabbajitum yuttam no ce pabbajati
translated: listening to the Dhamma, has been established in perfection. It is fitting for him to go forth right now. If he does not go forth,

analyzed: parinibbāyissati iti seṭṭhi na mayham puttassa daharassa iva sataḥ parinibbānena kiccam
translated: “He will attain Nibbāna.” The treasurer said, “I have no need of the Nibbāna of my son, who is yet a mere boy.

original: atthi, pabbājetha na”nti āha. Taṃ satthā pabbājetvā upasampādetvā tattha sattāhaṃ🔽vasitvā koṭigāmaṃ pāpuṇi, so ca gāmo gaṅgātīre. Koṭigāmavāsino buddhappamukhassa🔽bhikkhusaṅghassa mahādānaṃ pavattesuṃ. Bhaddajitthero satthārā anumodanāya āraddhamattāya
analyzed: atthi pabbājetha naṃ ti āha tam satthā pabbājetvā upasampādetvā tattha sattāham  vasitvā koṭigāmam pāpuṇi saḥ ca gāmaḥ gaṅgā tīre koṭigāma vāsinaḥ buddha ppamukhassa  bhikkhu saṅghassa mahādānam pavattesum bhaddaji thero satthārā anumodanāya āraddha mattāya
translated: Ordain him not.” The Teacher ordained him and caused him to be admitted to the Brotherhood, and then remained there seven days.🔽Then he went to Koṭigāma, which was situated on the banks of the Ganges. The inhabitants of Koṭigāma made a great feast in honor of the Congregation of Monks presided over by the Buddha.

original: bahigāmaṃ gantvā “gaṅgātīre maggasamīpe satthu āgatakāle vuṭṭhahissāmī”ti samāpattiṃ
analyzed: bahigāmam gantvā gaṅgā tīre magga samīpe satthu āgata kāle vuṭṭhahissāmi iti samāpattim
translated: When the Elder Bhaddajit had heard the Teacher express his thanks, he went outside the village, thinking to himself, “When the Teacher comes this way, I will arise from the trance in which I am about to enter.”

original: samāpajjitvā nisīdi. Mahātheresu āgacchantesupi avuṭṭhahitvā satthu āgatakāleyeva
analyzed: samāpajjitvā nisīdi mahā theresu āgacchantesu pi a vuṭṭhahitvā satthu āgata kāleya iva
translated: Accordingly he sat down and entered into a state of trance. Although many of the great Elders passed by, he did not arise from his trance. But when the Teacher came, he arose from his trance.

original: vuṭṭhahi. Puthujjanabhikkhū, “ayaṃ adhunā pabbajito mahātheresu āgacchantesu mānatthaddho
analyzed: vuṭṭhahi puthujjana bhikkhū ayam adhunā pabbajitaḥ mahā theresu āgacchantesu mānatthaddho
translated: The newly ordained monks said, “This newly ordained monk, who is puffed up with pride,

analyzed: hutvā na vuṭṭhāsi iti ujjhāyiṃsu koṭigāma vāsino satthu bhikkhu saṅghassa ca bahū nāvā saṅghāṭe
translated: did not arise from his trance when the great Elders passed by.” The inhabitants of Koṭigāma gave many boat-loads of robes to the Teacher and to the Congregation of Monks.

original: bandhiṃsu, satthā “handassa ānubhāvaṃ pakāsemī”ti nāvāsaṅghāṭe ṭhatvā, “kahaṃ, bhaddajī”ti🔽pucchi. Bhaddajitthero “esohaṃ, bhante”ti satthāraṃ upasaṅkamitvā añjaliṃ katvā aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: bandhiṃsu satthā handassa ānubhāvam pakāsemi iti nāvā saṅghāṭe ṭhatvā kaham bhaddajī iti  pucchi bhaddaji theraḥ esā uham bhante iti satthāram upasaṅkamitvā añjalim katvā aṭṭhāsi
translated: The Teacher thought to himself, “I will now display his power.” So he stood in the prow of the ship and asked, “Where is Bhaddaji?”🔽The Elder Bhaddaji came to the Teacher, saluted him, and stood before him.

original: Satthā, “ehi, bhaddaji, amhehi saddhiṃ ekanāvaṃ abhiruhā”ti. So uppatitvā satthu
analyzed: satthā ehi bhaddaji amhehi saddhim eka nāvam abhiruhāti saḥ uppatitvā
translated: The Teacher said to him, “Come, Bhaddaji, step into the ship with us.” So Bhaddaji flew up into the air and stood in the ship in which the Teacher was seated.

original: ṭhitanāvāyaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Satthā gaṅgāmajjhaṃ gatakāle, “bhaddaji, tayā mahāpanādarājakāle
analyzed: ṭhita nāvāyam aṭṭhāsi satthā gaṅgāmajjham gata kāle bhaddaji tayā mahāpanāda rāja kāle
translated: When the Teacher had reached the middle of the Ganges, he said to Bhaddaji, “Bhaddaji, where is the jeweled palace which you caused to be built in the time of King Mahāpanāda?”

original: ajjhāvuṭṭharatanapāsādo kaha”nti āha. “Imasmiṃ ṭhāne nimuggo”ti. “Tena hi, bhaddaji,🔽sabrahmacārīnaṃ kaṅkhaṃ chindā”ti. Tasmiṃ khaṇe thero satthāraṃ vanditvā iddhibalena🔽gantvā pāsādathūpikaṃ pādaṅgulantarena sannirumbhitvā pañcavīsatiyojanaṃ pāsādaṃ
analyzed: ajjhāvuṭṭha ratana pāsādaḥ kahanti āha imasmin ṭhāne nimuggaḥ ti tena hi bhaddaji  sabrahmacārīnam kaṅkham chindāti tasmin khaṇe thero satthāram vanditvā iddhi balena  gantvā pāsādathūpikam pād aṅgula antarena san nirumbhitvā pañcavīsati yojanam pāsādam
translated: “It is submerged at this point.” “Well then, Bhaddaji, satisfy the doubts of your fellow-monks.”

original: gahetvā ākāse uppati, uppatanto ca paññāsa yojanāni pāsādaṃ udakato ukkhipi. Athassa
analyzed: gahetvā ākāse uppati uppatantaḥ ca paññāsa yojanāni pāsādam udakataḥ ukkhipi athassa
translated: At that moment the Elder saluted the Teacher and by virtue of his own supernormal power flew through the air, submerged the top of the palace beneath the surface of the water, and taking the palace with him, flew up into the air. As he flew up into the air, he raised the palace fifty leagues above the water.

original: purimabhave ñātakā pāsādagatena lobhena macchakacchapamaṇḍūkā hutvā tasmiṃ pāsāde
analyzed: purima bhave ñātakā pāsāda gatena lobhena maccha kacchapa maṇḍūkāḥ hutvā tasmin pāsāde
translated: In a previous state of existence, his relatives, being fishes, turtles, and frogs, were killed by the greed of a man who was standing on the top of a palace.

analyzed: uṭṭhahante parivattitvā udake patiṃsu satthā te patante disvā ñātakā te bhaddaji
translated: As they were falling into the water, they turned over and over. The Teacher, seeing them fall, said, “Bhaddaji, your relatives are exhausted.”

original: kilamantī”ti āha. Thero satthu vacanena pāsādaṃ vissajjesi. Pāsādo yathāṭhāne eva
analyzed: kilamanti iti āha theraḥ satthu vacanena pāsādam vissajjesi pāsādaḥ yathāṭhāne eva
translated: At the word of the Teacher, the Elder let down the palace. The palace fell into its proper place.

original: patiṭṭhahi. Satthā pāraṅgato bhikkhūhi “kadā, bhante, bhaddajittherena ayaṃ pāsādo
analyzed: patiṭṭhahi satthā pāraṅgataḥ bhikkhūhi kadā bhante bhaddaji therena ayam pāsādaḥ
translated: The Teacher, having crossed over, was asked by the monks, “When, Reverend Sir, was this palace let down by the Elder Bhaddaji?”

original: ajjhāvuṭṭho”ti puṭṭho mahāpanādajātakaṃ kathetvā mahājanaṃ dhammāmataṃ pāyesi. Thero
analyzed: ajjhāvuṭṭhaḥ iti puṭṭhaḥ mahāpanāda jātakam kathetvā mahā janam dhamma amatam pāyesi thero
translated: The Teacher related the Mahāpanāda Jātaka, and caused the multitude to drink the Deathless Truth. The Elder,

analyzed: pana attanaḥ ajjhāvuṭṭha pubbam suvaṇṇa pāsādam dassetvā
translated: having shown the golden palace which he had formerly let down,

original: “Panādo nāma so rājā, yassa yūpo suvaṇṇayo;
analyzed: panādaḥ nāma saḥ rājā yassa yūpaḥ suvaṇṇayaḥ
translated: “That king was named Panāda, whose sacrificial post was of gold,

original: Tiriyaṃ soḷasubbedho, ubbhamāhu sahassadhā.
analyzed: tiriyam ubbham āhu sahassadhā
translated: sixteen cubits in breadth, and a thousand cubits in height.”

original: “Sahassakaṇḍo satageṇḍu, dhajālu haritāmayo;
analyzed: sahassakaṇḍo satageṇḍu dhajālu
translated: “A thousand stories, a hundred stories, with banners of green jade,

original: Anaccuṃ tattha gandhabbā, cha sahassāni sattadhā”ti. –
analyzed: anaccum tattha gandhabbā cha sahassāni sattadhā ati
translated: the Gandhabbas were there, six thousand and seven hundred.”

original: Dvīhi gāthāhi vaṇṇento aññaṃ byākāsi.
analyzed: dvīhi gāthāhi vaṇṇentaḥ aññam byākāsi
translated: Praising the palace with these two stanzas, he made his declaration.

original: Tattha panādo nāma so rājāti atīte panādo nāma so rājā ahosīti attabhāvaantarahitatāya🔽attānaṃ paraṃ viya niddisati. So eva hi rajje ṭhitakālato paṭṭhāya sadā ussāhasampattiādinā
analyzed: tattha panādaḥ nāma saḥ rājā ati atīte panādaḥ nāma saḥ rājā ahosi iti atta bhāva anta rahita tāya  attānam param viya niddisati saḥ eva hi rajje ṭhita kālataḥ paṭṭhāya sadā ussāha sampatti ādinā
translated: Herein, the king called Panada was the king who was called Panada in the past. He refers to himself as if he were another because he is no longer existent.

analyzed: mahatā rāja anubhāvena mahatā ca kitti saddena samannāgata ttā rājā mahāpanādaḥ ti paññāyittha
translated: For it was from the time he became king that he was known as “King Mahapanada” because he was endowed with great success in enterprise and so on and with great majesty and fame.

analyzed: yassa yūpo suvaṇṇayo ti yassa raññaḥ ayam yūpaḥ pāsādaḥ suvaṇṇa mayaḥ tiriyam soḷa subbedhaḥ ti  vitthārato soḷasa kaṇḍapāta ppamāṇo so pana aḍḍha yojana mattaḥ hoti ubbhām āhu sahassadhā ti  ubbham uccam evam assa pāsādassa sahassadhā sahassa kaṇḍa ppamāṇam āhu saḥ pana yojanataḥ
translated: Whose golden palace was sixteen cubits in breadth: whose golden palace was sixteen cubits in breadth across.🔽But it was half a league in extent.🔽They say it was a thousand cubits high: they say that its height was a thousand cubits. But it was twenty-five leagues high.

original: pañcavīsatiyojanappamāṇo hoti. Keci panettha gāthāsukhatthaṃ “āhū”ti dīghaṃ kataṃ.
analyzed: pañcavīsati yojana ppamāṇaḥ hoti keci pana ittha gāthā sukha attham āhūti dīgham katam
translated: But some have written “ahū” with a long vowel for the sake of the metre.

original: Āhu ahosīti atthaṃ vadanti.
analyzed: āhu ahosi iti attham vadanti
translated: They say it was: they say it was so.

original: Sahassakaṇḍoti sahassabhūmiko. Satageṇḍūti anekasataniyyūhako. Dhajālūti tattha tattha
analyzed: sahassakaṇḍoti sahassa bhūmikaḥ satageṇḍu iti aneka sata niyyūhakaḥ dhajālu iti tattha tattha
translated: A thousand-pillared hall: a hall with a thousand pillars. A hundred-gated: having many hundreds of gates. With a surrounding fence: with a surrounding fence.

analyzed: niyyūha sikhara ādīsu patiṭṭhāpitehi yaṭṭhi dhaja paṭāka dhaja ādi dhajehi sampannaḥ
translated: A thousand-spoked: with a thousand levels. A hundred-pinioned: with many hundreds of pinions. With banners flying: furnished with banners of bamboo, flags, and pennants set up here and there on the pinnacles of the pinions, etc.🔽Golden: made of gold alloyed with copper. But some say it was made of the kind of gem called “golden-hued.”

original: cāmīkarasuvaṇṇamayo. Keci pana “haritajātimaṇisarikkhako”ti vadanti. Gandhabbāti🔽naṭā. Cha sahassāni sattadhāti chamattāni gandhabbasahassāni sattadhā tassa pāsādassa
analyzed: keci pana harita jāti maṇi sarikkhakaḥ ti vadanti gandhabbā ti  naṭā cha sahassāni sattadhā ati cha mattāni gandhabba sahassāni sattadhā tassa pāsādassa
translated: Gandhabbas: dancers.

original: sattasu ṭhānesu rañño abhiramāpanatthaṃ nacciṃsūti attho. Te evaṃ naccantāpi rājānaṃ
analyzed: sattasu ṭhānesu raññaḥ abhiramāpana attham nacciṃsu iti te evam naccantā api rājānam
translated: Six thousand: six thousand dancers. In seven ways: in seven places on the palace, for the purpose of amusing the king, they danced. The meaning is that they danced.

original: hāsetuṃ nāsakkhiṃsu. Atha sakko devarājā devanaṭe pesetvā samajjaṃ kāresi, tadā rājā hasīti.
analyzed: hāsetum na asakkhiṃsu atha sakkaḥ devarājā deva naṭe pesetvā sa majjam kāresi tadā rājā hasi iti
translated: But even though they danced thus, they were unable to divert the king. Then Sakka, king of the gods, sent down celestial dancers, and a festival was held, and the king laughed.

original: Bhaddajittheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bhaddaji thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Bhaddajit is finished.

translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Sobhita🔽The verse of the venerable elder Sobhita: “Mindful, possessing insight” .

analyzed: satimā paññavāti āyasmataḥ sobhita ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: What is the origin of this? This elder too, in the time of former Buddhas,

analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinantaḥ padumuttarassa bhagavataḥ kāle
translated: and as he was accumulating merit in various states of existence, in the time of the exalted Padumuttara,

translated: he was reborn in the city of Haṃsavatī in a family of high rank. When he had reached years of discretion, he heard the Teacher preach the Law,

analyzed: ekam bhikkhum pubbenivāsa ñāṇa lābhīnam bhikkhūnam aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapentam disvā sayam pi

analyzed: gantvā nekkhamma adhimuttaḥ ghara āvāsam pahāya tāpasapabbajjam pabbajitvā himavantassa
translated: But being inclined to the life of renunciation, he left his home and retired from the world, and becoming a devotee, he built a hermitage in a forest-region near the Himalayas,

analyzed: samīpe arañña āyatane assamam kāretvā vana mūla phala aphalena yāpentaḥ buddhuppādam sutvā
translated: and living on wild fruits and roots, heard that the Buddha had appeared in the world.

original: sabbattha ekarattivāseneva bhaddavatīnagare satthāraṃ upasaṅkamitvā pasannamānaso
analyzed: sabbattha eka ratti vāsena iva bhaddavatī nagare satthāram upasaṅkamitvā pasanna mānasaḥ
translated: He went to the city of Bhaddavatī, and after spending one night in every place, he approached the Teacher, and with a heart full of faith,

analyzed: tuvam satthā ca ketu ca ati ādīhi chahi gāthāhi satthā ca ssa bhāvinim
translated: and with the six verses beginning with “You are the Teacher, the Ensign,” he extolled the Master. The Master proclaimed his future

analyzed: sampattim pakāsesi saḥ tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde
translated: success. By that meritorious deed he passed from birth to birth in the heavenly world and among men, and in this generation of the Buddha

analyzed: sāvatthiyam brāhmaṇa kule nibbatti sobhita utissa nāmam akaṃsu saḥ aparena samayena
translated: he was reborn in Sāvatthi in a brāhman family. They gave him the name Sobhita. After some time

original: pahāya tāpasapabbajjaṃ pabbajitvā pabbatapāde araññāyatane ekissā nadiyā tīre assamaṃ
analyzed: pahāya tāpasa pabbajjam pabbajitvā pabbata pāde arañña āyatane ekissā nadiyāḥ tīre assamam
translated: and after renouncing the life of an ascetic he went forth into homelessness. He made his dwelling on a mountain slope in a forest thicket on the bank of a river,

original: kāretvā viharanto attano anuggaṇhanatthaṃ upagataṃ satthāraṃ disvā pasannamānaso🔽ajinacammaṃ pattharitvā adāsi. Tattha nisinnaṃ bhagavantaṃ pupphehi ca candanena
analyzed: kāretvā viharantaḥ attanaḥ anuggaṇhana attham upagatam satthāram disvā pasanna mānasaḥ  ajina cammam pattharitvā adāsi tattha nisinnam bhagavantam pupphehi ca candanena
translated: and when he saw the Teacher come to him for the purpose of helping him, he was pleased.🔽He spread out his antelope skin and gave it to him. While the Blessed One was sitting on it, he worshipped him with flowers and sandalwood

original: ca pūjetvā ambaphalāni datvā pañcapatiṭṭhitena vandi. Tassa bhagavā nisinnāsanasampattiṃ
analyzed: ca pūjetvā amba phalāni da tvā pañca patiṭṭhitena vandi tassa bhagavā nisinna āsana sampattim
translated: and gave him mango fruit, and he worshipped him by the fivefold prostration. The Blessed One, showing him the excellence of the seat he was sitting on,

original: pakāsento anumodanaṃ vatvā pakkāmi. So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto
analyzed: pakāsentaḥ anumodanam vatvā pakkāmi so tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ
translated: recited an appropriate commendation and then departed. By that meritorious deed he passed from existence as a god to be reborn in the human world,

original: imasmiṃ buddhuppāde vesāliyaṃ brāhmaṇakule nibbattitvā “kaṇhamitto”ti laddhanāmo
analyzed: imasmin buddhuppāde vesāliyam brāhmaṇa kule nibbattitvā kaṇhamittaḥ ti laddha nāmaḥ
translated: and at the time of the present Buddha he was reborn in a brahmin family at Vesālī and received the name Kaṇha.

original: vayappatto satthu vesāligamane buddhānubhāvaṃ disvā paṭiladdhasaddho mahākaccānattherassa
analyzed: vaya pattaḥ satthu vesāli gamane buddha anubhāvam disvā paṭiladdha saddhaḥ mahākaccāna ttherassa
translated: When he was grown up, he saw the power of the Buddha when the Master visited Vesālī, and he became a believer. He went forth into homelessness under the Elder Mahā Kaccāna,

original: santike pabbaji. So mandapañño dandhaparakkamo ca hutvā ciraṃ kālaṃ viññuṃ sabrahmacāriṃ
analyzed: santike pabbaji saḥ manda paññaḥ dandha parakkamaḥ ca hutvā ciram kālam viññum sabrahmacārim
translated: but he was slow-witted and dull-headed. For a long time he was unable to learn the texts by heart,

original: nissāyeva vasati. Bhikkhū “yathā nāma valli rukkhādīsu kiñci anissāya vaḍḍhituṃ na
analyzed: nissāya iva vasati bhikkhū yathā nāma valli rukkha ādīsu kiñci a nissāya vaḍḍhitum na
translated: and lives depending on them. The monks said, “Just as a creeper can’t grow without depending on a tree,

original: sakkoti, evamayampi kañci paṇḍitaṃ anissāya vaḍḍhituṃ na sakkotī”ti valliyotveva
analyzed: sakkoti evam ayam pi kañci paṇḍitam a nissāya vaḍḍhitum na sakkoti iti
translated: He lived in dependence on the Elder. The bhikkhus called him “the creeper” because he was unable to develop by himself without depending on some wise man, just as a creeper is unable to grow without depending on a tree or something else.

original: samudācariṃsu. Aparabhāge pana veṇudattattheraṃ upasaṅkamitvā tassa ovāde ṭhatvā
analyzed: samudācariṃsu aparabhāge pana veṇudatta theram upasaṅkamitvā tassa ovāde ṭhatvā
translated: Later, however, he approached the Elder Veṇudāthā, and after he had stood firmly in the Elder’s advice,

original: sato sampajāno hutvā viharanto ñāṇassa paripākaṃ gatattā paṭipattikkamaṃ theraṃ pucchanto –
analyzed: sataḥ sampajānaḥ hutvā viharantaḥ ñāṇassa paripākam gata ttā paṭipatti kkamam theram pucchantaḥ
translated: he asked the Elder the order of practice, being mindful and fully aware, and having reached the maturity of knowledge.

original: “Yaṃ kiccaṃ daḷhavīriyena, yaṃ kiccaṃ boddhumicchatā;
analyzed: yam kiccam daḷha vīriyena yam kiccam boddhum icchatā
translated: “What should be done by one of strong energy, what should be done by one who wishes to awaken,

original: Karissaṃ nāvarajjhissaṃ, passa vīriyaṃ parakkamaṃ.
analyzed: karissam na avarajjhissam passa vīriyam parakkamam
translated: I will do, I will not fail. See my energy and my exertion.

original: “Tvañca me maggamakkhāhi, añjasaṃ amatogadhaṃ;
analyzed: tvañca me maggam akkhāhi añjasam amatogadham
translated: “You explain to me the path, the straight way that leads to the deathless.

original: Ahaṃ monena monissaṃ, gaṅgāsotova sāgara”nti. – gāthādvayaṃ abhāsi;
analyzed: aham gaṅgāsotā uva gāthā dvayam abhāsi
translated: I will go forth by the way of the recluse, as the river Ganges goes to the ocean.”

original: Tattha yaṃ kiccaṃ daḷhavīriyenāti daḷhena vīriyena thirena parakkamena, daḷhavīriyena
analyzed: tattha yam kiccam daḷha vīriyena ati daḷhena vīriyena thirena parakkamena daḷha vīriyena
translated: Herein, what should be done by one of strong energy means what should be done by one of strong energy, of firm energy, of energetic exertion, of strong energy.

original: vā purisadhorayhena yaṃ kiccaṃ kātabbaṃ paṭipajjitabbaṃ. Yaṃ kiccaṃ boddhumicchatāti
analyzed: vā purisa dhorayhena yam kiccam kātabbam paṭipajjitabbam yam kiccam boddhum icchatā ati
translated: and what should be done by a man of energy, should be done by one who is energetic.🔽One who wishes to understand what should be understood:

original: cattāri ariyasaccāni nibbānameva vā boddhuṃ bujjhituṃ icchantena paṭivijjhitukāmena
analyzed: cattāri ariya saccāni nibbānam eva vā boddhum bujjhitum icchantena paṭivijjhitu kāmena
translated: one who wishes to penetrate, to awaken to, the four noble truths or to Nibbāna.

original: yaṃ kiccaṃ karaṇīyaṃ. Karissaṃ nāvarajjhissanti tamahaṃ dāni karissaṃ na virādhessaṃ,🔽yathānusiṭṭhaṃ paṭipajjissāmi. Passa vīriyaṃ parakkamanti yathā paṭipajjamāne dhamme
analyzed: yam kiccam karaṇīyam karissam na avarajjhissanti tam aham dāni karissam na virādhessam  yathānusiṭṭham paṭipajjissāmi passa vīriyam parakkamanti yathā paṭipajjamāne dhamme
translated: What should be done: what should be undertaken. I will do it, I will not fail: I will do it now, I will not be a failure.

original: vidhinā īraṇato “vīriyaṃ”, paraṃ paraṃ ṭhānaṃ akkamanato “parakkamo”ti ca laddhanāmaṃ
analyzed: vidhinā īraṇataḥ vīriyam param param ṭhānam akkamanataḥ ca laddha nāmam
translated: See my energy, my endeavour: see my right endeavour, which is called “energy” because of the mode of proceeding by means of the way begun, and “endeavour” because of the going further and further.

original: sammāvāyāmaṃ passa na saddhamevāti attano kattukāmataṃ dasseti.
analyzed: sammāvāyāmam passa na saddham eva ati attanaḥ kattu kāma tam dasseti
translated: I am not a failure: he shows that he is willing to do it.🔽And you: he addresses the good friend who gives him the meditation subject, saying “You” . Me: as regards me.

original: Tvañcāti kammaṭṭhānadāyakaṃ kalyāṇamittaṃ ālapati. Meti mayhaṃ. Maggamakkhāhīti ariyamaggaṃ
analyzed: tvañca ati kammaṭṭhāna dāyakam kalyāṇa mittam ālapati mā iti mayham maggam akkhāhi iti ariya maggaṃ
translated: Explain the path: tell me the noble path,🔽the meditation subject of the four noble truths that leads to the supramundane path.

original: kathehi, lokuttaramaggasampāpakaṃ catusaccakammaṭṭhānaṃ kathehīti attho. Añjasanti
analyzed: kathehi lokuttara magga sampāpakam catu sacca kammaṭṭhānam kathehi iti atthaḥ añjasanti
translated: The straight way: the straight path.

original: ujukaṃ majjhimapaṭipadābhāvena antadvayassa anupagamanato. Amate nibbāne sampāpakabhāvena
analyzed: ujukam majjhima paṭipada abhāvena anta dvayassa an upagamanataḥ amate nibbāne sampāpaka bhāvena
translated: It is the depth of the deathless because it is the deathless Nibbāna that it has reached.

original: patiṭṭhitattā amatogadhaṃ. Monenāti ñāṇena maggapaññāya. Monissanti jānissaṃ nibbānaṃ🔽paṭivijjhissaṃ pāpuṇissaṃ. Gaṅgāsotova sāgaranti yathā gaṅgāya soto sāgaraṃ samuddaṃ
analyzed: patiṭṭhita ttā amatogadham monena ati ñāṇena magga paññāya monissanti jānissam nibbānam  paṭivijjhissam pāpuṇissam gaṅgā sotā uva sāgaranti yathā gaṅgāya soto sāgaram samuddam
translated: I will know: he will know, will penetrate, will reach Nibbāna by means of the knowledge of the path, by means of path-knowledge.

original: avirajjhanto ekaṃsato ogāhati, evaṃ “ahaṃ kammaṭṭhānaṃ anuyuñjanto maggañāṇena nibbānaṃ
analyzed: a virajjhantaḥ ekaṃsataḥ ogāhati evam aham kammaṭṭhānam anuyuñjantaḥ magga ñāṇena nibbānam
translated: Just as the current of the Ganges flows to the ocean, the great ocean, without turning back, in the same way, “I will apply myself to the meditation subject and reach Nibbāna by means of path-knowledge. Therefore please teach me the meditation subject.”

original: adhigamissāmi, tasmā taṃ kammaṭṭhānaṃ me ācikkhathā”ti theraṃ kammaṭṭhānaṃ yāci.
analyzed: adhigamissāmi tasmā tam kammaṭṭhānam me ācikkhatha ati theram kammaṭṭhānam yāci
translated: He asked the elder for the meditation subject.

original: Taṃ sutvā veṇudattatthero tassa kammaṭṭhānaṃ adāsi. Sopi kammaṭṭhānaṃ anuyuñjanto nacirasseva vipassanaṃ ussukkāpetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: tam sutvā veṇudatta thero tassa kammaṭṭhānam adāsi saḥ api kammaṭṭhānam anuyuñjantaḥ nacirassa eva vipassanam ussukkāpetvā arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: The elder gave him the meditation subject. He applied himself to the meditation subject and in no long time aroused insight and reached Arahantship. Hence it is said in the Apadana:

original: “Pañca kāmaguṇe hitvā, piyarūpe manorame;
analyzed: pañca kāma guṇe hitvā piya rūpe manorame
translated: “Abandoning the five strands of sense pleasure,🔽Delightful, pleasing, dear,🔽I went forth into homelessness,

original: Asīti koṭiyo hitvā, pabbajiṃ anagāriyaṃ.
analyzed: asīti koṭiyaḥ hitvā pabbajim anagāriyam
translated: Abandoning eighty koṭis.

original: “Pabbajitvāna kāyena, pāpakammaṃ vivajjayiṃ;
analyzed: pabbajitvāna kāyena pāpa kammam vivajjayiṃ
translated: “Having gone forth, I avoided evil deeds with my body,

original: Vacīduccaritaṃ hitvā, nadīkūle vasāmahaṃ.
analyzed: vacīt uccaritam hitvā nadī kūle vasām aham
translated: Abandoning verbal misconduct, I lived on the bank of a river.

original: “Ekakaṃ maṃ viharantaṃ, buddhaseṭṭho upāgami;
analyzed: ekakam mam viharantam buddha seṭṭhaḥ upāgami
translated: “While I was dwelling alone, the best of Buddhas approached me;

original: Nāhaṃ jānāmi buddhoti, akāsiṃ paṭisanthāraṃ.
analyzed: na aham jānāmi buddha uti akāsim paṭisanthāram
translated: Not knowing he was the Buddha, I offered him hospitality.

original: “Karitvā paṭisanthāraṃ, nāmagottamapucchahaṃ;
analyzed: karitvā paṭisanthāram nāmaga uttama puccha ham
translated: “Having offered hospitality, I asked his name and clan;

original: Devatānusi gandhabbo, adu sakko purindado.
analyzed: gandhabbaḥ adu sakkaḥ purindadaḥ
translated: He is a deity, a gandhabba, Sakka, the giver of men.

original: “Ko vā tvaṃ kassa vā putto, mahābrahmā idhāgato;
analyzed: kaḥ vā tvam kassa vā puttaḥ mahābrahmā idha āgataḥ
translated: “Who are you? Whose son are you? The Great Brahma has come here;

original: Virocesi disā sabbā, udayaṃ sūriyo yathā.
analyzed: virocesi disā sabbā udayam sūriyaḥ yathā
translated: You shine in all directions, like the rising sun.

original: “Sahassārāni cakkāni, pāde dissanti mārisa;
analyzed: sahassārāni cakkāni pāde dissanti mārisa
translated: “Your feet have a thousand spokes, O Lord;

original: Ko vā tvaṃ kassa vā putto, kathaṃ jānemu taṃ mayaṃ.
analyzed: kaḥ vā tvam kassa vā putto katham jānemu tam mayam
translated: Who are you? Whose son are you? How can we know you?

original: “Nāmagottaṃ pavedehi, saṃsayaṃ apanehi me;
analyzed: nāma gottam pavedehi saṃsayam apanehi me
translated: “Declare your name and clan, remove my doubt;

original: Namhi devā na gandhabbo, namhi sakko purindado.
analyzed: namhi devāḥ na gandhabbaḥ namhi sakkaḥ purindadaḥ
translated: I am not a deity, nor a gandhabba, nor Sakka, the giver of men.

original: “Brahmabhāvo ca me natthi, etesaṃ uttamo ahaṃ;
analyzed: brahma bhāvo ca me natthi etesam uttamaḥ aham
translated: “I have no state of Brahmahood, I am the highest of these;

original: Atīto visayaṃ tesaṃ, dālayiṃ kāmabandhanaṃ.
analyzed: atītaḥ visayam dālayim kāma bandhanam
translated: I have transcended their sphere, I have broken the bonds of sensuality.

original: “Sabbe kilese jhāpetvā, patto sambodhimuttamaṃ;
analyzed: sabbe kilese jhāpetvā pattaḥ sambodhim uttamam
translated: “Having burned up all defilements, I have attained supreme enlightenment;

original: Tassa vācaṃ suṇitvāhaṃ, idaṃ vacanamabraviṃ.
analyzed: tassa vācam suṇitvā aham idam vacanam abravim
translated: Having heard his words, I spoke thus:

original: “Yadi buddhosi sabbaññū, nisīda tvaṃ mahāmune;
analyzed: yadi buddhaḥ asi sabbaññū nisīda tvam mahā mune
translated: “If you are the Buddha, the Omniscient One, sit down, O Great Sage;

original: Tamahaṃ pūjayissāmi, dukkhassantakaro tuvaṃ.
analyzed: tam aham pūjayissāmi dukkha ssanta karo tuvam
translated: I will worship you, for you are the one who puts an end to suffering.”

original: “Pattharitvājinacammaṃ, adāsi satthuno ahaṃ;
analyzed: pattharitvā ajina cammam adāsi satthunaḥ aham
translated: Having spread out the hide of a young antelope, I offered it to the Teacher;

original: Nisīdi tattha bhagavā, sīhova girigabbhare.
analyzed: nisīdi tattha bhagavā sīhaḥ uva giri gabbhare
translated: The Blessed One sat down there, like a lion in a mountain cave.

original: “Khippaṃ pabbatamāruyha, ambassa phalamaggahiṃ;
analyzed: khippam pabbatam āruyha ambassa phalam aggahiṃ
translated: Quickly climbing the mountain, I took a fruit of the mango tree;

original: Sālakalyāṇikaṃ pupphaṃ, candanañca mahārahaṃ.
analyzed: sālakalyāṇikam puppham candanam ca mahā raham
translated: And a flower of the Sālakalyāṇī, and very precious sandalwood.

original: “Khippaṃ paggayha taṃ sabbaṃ, upetvā lokanāyakaṃ;
analyzed: khippam paggayha tam sabbam upetvā loka nāyakam
translated: Quickly gathering all that, I approached the Leader of the World;

original: Phalaṃ buddhassa datvāna, sālapupphamapūjayiṃ.
analyzed: phalam buddhassa da tvāna sāla puppham apūjayiṃ
translated: Having given the fruit to the Buddha, I worshipped with the Sāla flower.

original: “Candanaṃ anulimpitvā, avandiṃ satthuno ahaṃ;
analyzed: candanam anulimpitvā avandim satthunaḥ aham
translated: Having anointed with sandalwood, I paid homage to the Teacher;

original: Pasannacitto sumano, vipulāya ca pītiyā.
analyzed: pasanna cittaḥ vipulāya ca pītiyā
translated: With a joyful and delighted mind, and with vast joy.

original: “Ajinamhi nisīditvā, sumedho lokanāyako;
analyzed: nisīditvā sumedhaḥ loka nāyakaḥ
translated: Sitting on the young antelope hide, the Wise One, the Leader of the World;

original: Mama kammaṃ pakittesi, hāsayanto mamaṃ tadā.
analyzed: mama kammam pakittesi hāsayantaḥ mamam tadā
translated: Commended my deed, delighting me at that time.

original: “Iminā phaladānena, gandhamālehi cūbhayaṃ;
analyzed: phala dānena
translated: “By this offering of fruit, and by the incense and garlands,

original: Pañcavīse kappasate, devaloke ramissati.
analyzed: pañcavīse kappa sate deva loke ramissati
translated: For twenty-five hundred eons, he will delight in the heavenly world.

original: “Anūnamanasaṅkappo, vasavattī bhavissati;
analyzed: anūna mana saṅkappaḥ vasavattī bhavissati
translated: “He will be of no mean thought, he will be a lord of the earth,

original: Chabbīsatikappasate, manussattaṃ gamissati.
analyzed: chabbīsati kappa sate manussattam gamissati
translated: For two hundred and sixty times he will go to the human state.

original: “Bhavissati cakkavattī, cāturanto mahiddhiko;
analyzed: bhavissati cakkavattī cāturantaḥ mahiddhikaḥ
translated: “He will be a universal monarch, of great power over the four quarters,

original: Vebhāraṃ nāma nagaraṃ, vissakammena māpitaṃ.
analyzed: vebhāram nāma nagaram vissa kammena māpitam
translated: The city named Vedehi will be built by Vissakamma.

original: “Hessati sabbasovaṇṇaṃ, nānāratanabhūsitaṃ;
analyzed: hessati sabbaso vaṇṇam nānā ratana bhūsitam
translated: “It will be all of gold, adorned with various jewels,

original: Eteneva upāyena, saṃsarissati so bhave.
analyzed: etena iva upāyena saṃsarissati saḥ bhave
translated: By this means he will pass through existences.

original: “Sabbattha pūjito hutvā, devatte atha mānuse;
analyzed: sabbattha pūjitaḥ hutvā devatte atha mānuse
translated: “Everywhere he will be worshipped, by gods and also by men,

original: Pacchime bhave sampatte, brahmabandhu bhavissati.
analyzed: pacchime bhave sampatte brahmabandhu bhavissati
translated: In his last existence he will be a kinsman of Brahma.

original: “Agārā abhinikkhamma, anagārī bhavissati;
analyzed: agārā abhinikkhamma anagārī bhavissati
translated: “Having gone forth from the house life, he will be one who has gone forth,

original: Abhiññāpāragū hutvā, nibbāyissatināsavo.
analyzed: abhiññā pāragū hutvā
translated: Having attained to the perfection of direct knowledge, he will be one who is extinguished, without pollutants.

original: “Idaṃ vatvāna sambuddho, sumedho lokanāyako;
analyzed: idam vatvāna sambuddhaḥ sumedhaḥ loka nāyakaḥ
translated: “Having spoken thus, the Sambuddha, the wise leader of the world,

original: Mama nijjhāyamānassa, pakkāmi anilañjase.
analyzed: mama nijjhāyamānassa pakkāmi anilañjase
translated: Having known my thoughts, departed without delay.

original: “Tena kammena sukatena, cetanāpaṇidhīhi ca;
analyzed: tena kammena su katena cetanā paṇidhīhi ca
translated: “By that deed well done, by the intention and the vow,

original: Jahitvā mānusaṃ dehaṃ, tāvatiṃsamagacchahaṃ.
analyzed: jahitvā mānusam deham tāvatiṃsam agaccha aham
translated: Having given up the human body, I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.

original: “Tusitato cavitvāna, nibbattiṃ mātukucchiyaṃ;
analyzed: tusitataḥ cavitvāna nibbattim mātukucchiyam
translated: “Having fallen from the Tusita heaven, I was conceived in my mother’s womb,

original: Bhoge me ūnatā natthi, yamhi gabbhe vasāmahaṃ.
analyzed: bhoge me ūna tā natthi yamhi gabbhe vasāmaham
translated: while I was living in my mother’s womb.🔽“When I was in my mother’s womb,

original: “Mātukucchigate mayi, annapānañca bhojanaṃ;
analyzed: mātukucchi gate mayi anna pānam ca bhojanam
translated: food and drink and solid food,🔽whatever my mother desired,

original: Mātuyā mama chandena, nibbattati yadicchakaṃ.
analyzed: mātuyāḥ mama chandena nibbattati yadicchakam
translated: was produced at her mere wish.🔽“When I had reached five years,

original: “Jātiyā pañcavassena, pabbajiṃ anagāriyaṃ;
analyzed: jātiyā pañca vassena pabbajim anagāriyam
translated: I went forth into homelessness.🔽When my hair was being cut,

original: Oropitamhi kesamhi, arahattamapāpuṇiṃ.
analyzed: oropitamhi kesamhi
translated: I attained the supreme state.🔽“Searching for my past deeds,

original: “Pubbakammaṃ gavesanto, orena nāddasaṃ ahaṃ;
analyzed: pubba kammam gavesantaḥ orena na addasam aham
translated: I saw nothing before me.🔽For twenty-one thousand eons,

original: Tiṃsakappasahassamhi, mama kammamanussariṃ.
analyzed: tiṃsa kappa sahassamhi mama kammam anussariṃ
translated: I recalled my deeds.

original: “Namo te purisājañña, namo te purisuttama;
analyzed: namaḥ te purisājañña namaḥ te purisuttama
translated: “Homage to you, O Noble One! Homage to you, O Supreme One!🔽Having come to your dispensation,

original: Tava sāsanamāgamma, pattomhi acalaṃ padaṃ.
analyzed: tava sāsanam āgamma pattaḥ amhi acalam padam
translated: I have attained the unshakable state.🔽“For twenty-one thousand eons,

original: “Tiṃsakappasahassamhi, yaṃ buddhamabhipūjayiṃ;
analyzed: tiṃsa kappa sahassamhi yam buddham abhipūjayiṃ
translated: I worshipped the Buddha.

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I do not recall any bad destination. This is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: My defilements are destroyed … The Buddha’s dispensation has been done.”

original: Arahattaṃ pana patvā aññaṃ byākaronto thero imāyeva gāthā abhāsīti.
analyzed: arahattam pana patvā aññam byākaronto theraḥ imāyā iva gāthāḥ abhāsi iti
translated: But after attaining perfection, the Elder recited these same verses in his declaration of his understanding.

original: Valliyattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: valliya thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the verses of the Elder Valliya is finished.

original: 5. Vītasokattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: vītasoka thera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: Verses of the Elder Vītasoka

original: Kese me olikhissantītiādikā āyasmato vītasokattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi🔽purimabuddhesu katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto siddhatthassa bhagavato
analyzed: kese me olikhissanti iti ādikā āyasmataḥ vītasoka ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi  purima buddhesu kata adhikāraḥ tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto siddhatthassa bhagavato
translated: The verse beginning, “Who will shave my head?” was spoken by the Elder Vītasoka.🔽How did this Elder acquire the root of merit?

original: kāle brāhmaṇakule nibbattitvā brāhmaṇānaṃ vijjāsippesu nipphattiṃ gato kāme pahāya
analyzed: kāle brāhmaṇa kule nibbattitvā brāhmaṇānam vijjā sippesu nipphattim gataḥ kāme pahāya
translated: In the dispensation of the Buddha Siddhattha, he was reborn in the family of a brāhmaṇa, and attained perfection in the knowledge and the arts of the brāhmaṇas. He renounced the world and became a seer.

original: isipabbajjaṃ pabbajitvā mahatā isigaṇena parivuto araññe vasanto buddhuppādaṃ sutvā
analyzed: isipabbajjam pabbajitvā mahatā isi gaṇena parivutaḥ araññe vasantaḥ buddhuppādam sutvā
translated: He retired to the forest and lived there with a large company of seers. When he heard that the Buddha had appeared in the world,

original: haṭṭhatuṭṭho “udumbarapupphasadisā dullabhadassanā buddhā bhagavanto, idāneva upagantabbā”ti
analyzed: haṭṭha tuṭṭhaḥ udumbara puppha sadisāḥ dullabha dassanāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ idānā iva upagantabbā ati
translated: he was filled with joy, and said, “The Buddhas are as rare as the flowering of the Uḍumbara tree; I must go and see the Buddha at once.”

original: mahatiyā parisāya saddhiṃ satthāraṃ daṭṭhuṃ gacchanto diyaḍḍhayojane sese byādhiko
analyzed: mahatiyā parisāya saddhim satthāram daṭṭhum gacchantaḥ diyaḍḍha yojane sese byādhiko
translated: So he set out with a large company to see the Teacher. When he had gone two and a half leagues, he was taken ill and died.

original: hutvā buddhagatāya saññāya kālaṅkato devesu uppajjitvā aparāparaṃ devamanussesu saṃsaranto
analyzed: hutvā buddha gatāya saññāya kālaṅkataḥ devesu uppajjitvā apara aparam deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ
translated: He was reborn in the World of the Gods, and passing from one state of existence to another, was finally reborn in the dispensation of the present Buddha.

original: imasmiṃ buddhuppāde aṭṭhārasavassādhikānaṃ dvinnaṃ vassasatānaṃ matthake dhammāsokarañño
analyzed: imasmin buddhuppāde aṭṭhārasa vassa adhikānam dvinnam vassa satānam matthake dhammāsokarañño
translated: When he was eighteen years old, he heard the Teacher preach the Law.

original: kaniṭṭhabhātā hutvā nibbatti, tassa vītasokoti nāma ahosi. So vayappatto khattiyakumārehi
analyzed: kaniṭṭhabhātā hutvā nibbatti tassa vītasokoti nāma ahosi so vaya patto khattiya kumārehi
translated: He was born as the younger brother of the Elder, and his name was Vītasoka. When he grew up he became a layman, and he mastered all the arts and sciences that a prince should learn.

original: sikkhitabbavijjāsippesu nipphattiṃ gato giridattattheraṃ nissāya gihibhūto suttantapiṭake
analyzed: sikkhitabba vijjā sippesu nipphattim gataḥ giridatta theram nissāya gihi bhūtaḥ suttanta piṭake
translated: Under the Elder Giriddatta he became a monk, and he became so proficient in the Sutta Pitaka and the Abhidhamma Pitaka that

original: abhidhammapiṭake ca visārado hutvā ekadivasaṃ massukammasamaye kappakassa hatthato
analyzed: abhidhammapiṭake ca visāradaḥ hutvā eka divasam massu kamma samaye kappakassa hatthato
translated: one day, while he was having his body anointed by a barber, he took a looking-glass in his hand and,

original: ādāsaṃ gahetvā kāyaṃ olokento valitapalitādīni disvā sañjātasaṃvego vipassanāya cittaṃ🔽otāretvā bhāvanaṃ ussukkāpetvā tasmiṃyeva āsane sotāpanno hutvā giridattattherassa
analyzed: ādāsam gahetvā kāyam olokentaḥ valita palita ādīni disvā sañjāta saṃvegaḥ vipassanāya cittam  otāretvā bhāvanam tasmiṃ yeva āsane sotāpannaḥ hutvā giridatta therassa
translated: as he looked at his body, he saw the wrinkles and grey hairs, and his heart was filled with a sense of spiritual urgency. He directed his mind to insight,🔽and he made such rapid progress in meditation that he attained the Fruit of Conversion right where he sat.🔽He then received the Pabbajjā ordination from the Elder Giriddatta, and in no long time he attained Arahatship.

original: santike pabbajitvā nacirasseva arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: santike pabbajitvā nacirassa iva arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: This is the burden of the story of his conversion in the Apadāna:

original: “Ajjhāyako mantadharo, tiṇṇaṃ vedāna pāragū;
analyzed: ajjhāyakaḥ manta dharaḥ tiṇṇam vedāna pāragū
translated: “I was a teacher of the Vedas, a master of the three Vedas,🔽skilled in the science of signs, in the Itihasas,

original: Lakkhaṇe itihāse ca, sanighaṇḍusakeṭubhe.
analyzed: lakkhaṇe itihāse ca sa nighaṇḍu sa keṭubhe
translated: in the Nighaṇṭus, and in the Ketus.

original: “Nadīsotapaṭibhāgā, sissā āyanti me tadā;
analyzed: nadī sota paṭibhāgā sissāḥ āyanti me tadā
translated: “My pupils came to me from all directions,

original: Tesāhaṃ mante vācemi, rattindivamatandito.
analyzed: mante vācemi
translated: and I taught them the Vedas, day and night, without ceasing.

original: “Siddhattho nāma sambuddho, loke uppajji tāvade;
analyzed: siddhatthaḥ nāma sambuddhaḥ loke uppajji tāvade
translated: “The Sambuddha named Siddhattha has appeared in the world.

original: Tamandhakāraṃ nāsetvā, ñāṇālokaṃ pavattayi.
analyzed: tam andhakāram nāsetvā ñāṇa ālokam
translated: He has dispelled the darkness and has caused the light of knowledge to shine.

original: “Mama aññataro sisso, sissānaṃ so kathesi me;
analyzed: mama aññataraḥ sisso sissānam saḥ kathesi me
translated: “He is one of my pupils, and he has told my pupils.

original: Sutvāna te etamatthaṃ, ārocesuṃ mamaṃ tadā.
analyzed: sutvāna te etam attham ārocesum mamam tadā
translated: Having heard this news, they have reported it to me.

original: “Buddho loke samuppanno, sabbaññū lokanāyako;
analyzed: buddhaḥ loke samuppannaḥ sabbaññū loka nāyako
translated: “The Buddha has appeared in the world, the Omniscient One, the Leader of the world.

original: Tassānuvattati jano, lābho amhaṃ na vijjati.
analyzed: tassa anuvattati janaḥ lābhaḥ amham na vijjati
translated: People follow him; we have no gain.

original: “Adhiccuppattikā buddhā, cakkhumanto mahāyasā;
analyzed: adhiccuppattikāḥ buddhāḥ cakkhumantaḥ mahā yasā
translated: “Buddhas appear at long intervals, they are endowed with vision, and they are of great fame.

analyzed: yam nūna aham buddha seṭṭham passeyyam loka nāyakam
translated: Let me now see the Best of Buddhas, the Leader of the world.

original: “Ajinaṃ me gahetvāna, vākacīraṃ kamaṇḍaluṃ;
analyzed: ajinam me vāka cīram kamaṇḍalum
translated: “Having taken my deerskin cloak, bark garments, and water-pot,

original: Assamā abhinikkhamma, sisse āmantayiṃ ahaṃ.
analyzed: assamā abhinikkhamma sisse āmantayim aham
translated: I left the hermitage and addressed my pupils:

original: “Odumbarikapupphaṃva, candamhi sasakaṃ yathā;
analyzed: candamhi sasakam yathā
translated: “Like the flower of the odumbara tree, like the hare in the moon,

original: Vāyasānaṃ yathā khīraṃ, dullabho lokanāyako.
analyzed: yathā khīram dullabhaḥ
translated: like milk to the birds, the Leader of the world is hard to find.

original: “Buddho lokamhi uppanno, manussattampi dullabhaṃ;
analyzed: buddhaḥ lokamhi uppannaḥ manussattam pi dullabham
translated: “The Buddha has appeared in the world; even human birth is hard to obtain.

original: Ubhosu vijjamānesu, savanañca sudullabhaṃ.
analyzed: ubhosu vijjamānesu savanañca su dullabham
translated: Both of these being available, it is very hard to hear the True Dhamma.

original: “Buddho loke samuppanno, cakkhuṃ lacchāma no bhavaṃ;
analyzed: buddhaḥ loke samuppanno cakkhum lacchāma naḥ bhavam
translated: “The Buddha has appeared in the world; we have obtained the eye, good sir.

original: Etha sabbe gamissāma, sammāsambuddhasantikaṃ.🔽“Kamaṇḍaludharā sabbe, kharājinanivāsino;
analyzed: sabbe gamissāma sammāsambuddha santikam  kamaṇḍalu dharā sabbe khara ajina nivāsino
translated: Come, let us all go to the presence of the Fully Enlightened One.🔽All of them were carrying water-pots, and all were clad in garments of rough antelope hide.

original: Te jaṭābhārabharitā, nikkhamuṃ vipinā tadā.
analyzed: te jaṭā bhāra bharitāḥ nikkhamum vipinā tadā
translated: Their hair was matted and they were carrying their bundles of robes.🔽They went forth from the forest.

original: “Yugamattaṃ pekkhamānā, uttamatthaṃ gavesino;
analyzed: yuga mattam pekkhamānāḥ uttamattham gavesinaḥ
translated: Looking a yoke’s length ahead, seeking the supreme goal,

original: Āsattidosarahitā, asambhītāva kesarī.
analyzed: āsatti dosa rahitā kesarī
translated: Free from the fault of intimacy, fearless like a lion.

original: “Appakiccā aloluppā, nipakā santavuttino;
analyzed: appa kiccāḥ a loluppāḥ nipakāḥ santa vuttinaḥ
translated: They were of few wishes, content, alert, living secluded,

original: Uñchāya caramānā te, buddhaseṭṭhamupāgamuṃ.
analyzed: uñchāya caramānā te buddhaseṭṭham upāgamum
translated: Going on alms round for their food, they approached the supreme Buddha.

original: “Diyaḍḍhayojane sese, byādhi me upapajjatha;
analyzed: sese me upapajjatha
translated: When they had gone two and a half leagues, I fell sick.

original: Buddhaseṭṭhaṃ saritvāna, tattha kālaṅkato ahaṃ.
analyzed: buddha seṭṭham saritvāna tattha kālaṅkataḥ aham
translated: Remembering the supreme Buddha, I died there.

original: “Catunnavutito kappe, yaṃ saññamalabhiṃ tadā;
analyzed: catunnavutitaḥ kappe yam tadā
translated: For ninety-four aeons, I did not fall into the nether world,

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhasaññāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi buddha saññāya idam phalam
translated: Because of the fruit of my perception of the Buddha.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: My defilements are destroyed … I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: Arahattaṃ pana patvā aññaṃ byākaronto –
analyzed: arahattam pana patvā aññam byākaronto
translated: But when he had attained arahatship, he made his declaration thus:

original: “Kese me olikhissanti, kappako upasaṅkami;
analyzed: kese me olikhissanti kappakaḥ upasaṅkami
translated: “A barber came to me, saying, ‘I will shave your hair and beard.’

original: Tato ādāsamādāya, sarīraṃ paccavekkhisaṃ.
analyzed: tatas ādāsam ādāya sarīram paccavekkhisam
translated: Then, taking a lamp, I examined my body.

original: “Tuccho kāyo adissittha, andhakāre tamo byagā;
analyzed: tucchaḥ kāyaḥ adissittha andhakāre tamaḥ byagā
translated: “The body’s voidness was seen by me, And in the dark the darkness passed;

original: Sabbe coḷā samucchinnā, natthi dāni punabbhavo”ti. – gāthādvayaṃ abhāsi;🔽Tattha kese me olikhissanti, kappako upasaṅkamīti gihikāle massukammasamaye “mama
analyzed: sabbe coḷā samucchinnā natthi dāni punabbhavo ti gāthā dvayam abhāsi  tattha kese me olikhissanti kappakaḥ upasaṅkamīti gihi kāle massu kamma samaye mama
translated: All garments have been torn away: No more will there be future birth.”

original: kese olikhissaṃ kappemī”ti kesādīnaṃ chedanādivasena kappanato kappako nhāpito maṃ🔽upagacchi. Tatoti kappakato. Sarīraṃ paccavekkhisanti sabbakāyike ādāse palitavalitamukhanimittādidassanamukhena
analyzed: kese olikhissam kappemi iti kesa ādīnam chedana ādi vasena kappanataḥ kappakaḥ nhāpitaḥ mam  upagacchi tatas ti kappakato sarīram paccavekkhisanti sabbakāyike ādāse palita valita mukha nimitta ādi dassana mukhena
translated: Herein, my hair was shaved by the barber who came up means that when he was a layman he used to have his hair cut and so on for the purpose of grooming, thinking, “I shall have my hair cut,” and so he was called a barber . The barber who did this came up to me. Then:🔽means: after the barber. I reviewed the body means that he reviewed his own body, which was overcome by ageing, in the way beginning “My head is overcome by ageing” by seeing the signs of ageing, such as grey hair and wrinkles, in the body as a whole.

original: “abhibhūto vata jarāya me kāyo”ti jarābhibhūtaṃ attano sarīraṃ paccavekkhiṃ. Evaṃ🔽paccavekkhato ca tuccho kāyo adissittha niccadhuvasukhasabhāvādīhi ritto hutvā me
analyzed: abhibhūtaḥ vata jarāya me kāyo ti jarā abhibhūtam attano sarīram paccavekkhiṃ evam  paccavekkhataḥ ca tucchaḥ kāyaḥ adissittha nicca dhuva sukha sabhāva ādīhi rittaḥ hutvā me
translated: And as he reviewed it thus,🔽The body’s voidness was seen by me means that the body was seen by him as void, as lacking any permanent, lasting, eternal, and unchanging core of self or of anything belonging to a self. Why?

original: kāyo adissatha paññāyi. Kasmā? Andhakāre tamo byagā yena ayonisomanasikārasaṅkhātena
analyzed: kāyaḥ adissatha paññāyi kasmai andhakāre tamaḥ byagāḥ yena a yoniso manasikāra saṅkhātena
translated: And in the dark the darkness passed means that the darkness of ignorance was dispelled by the light of knowledge.

original: tamasā attano kāye andhagatā vijjamānampi asubhādisabhāvaṃ apassantā avijjamānaṃ🔽subhādiākāraṃ gaṇhanti, tasmiṃ andhakāre andhakaraṇaṭṭhāne kāye yonisomanasikārasaṅkhātena
analyzed: tamasā kāye andha gatāḥ vijjamānam pi asubha ādi sabhāvam a passantāḥ a vijjamānam  subha ādi ākāram gaṇhanti tasmin andhakāre andha karaṇa ṭṭhāne kāye yoni so manasikāra saṅkhātena
translated: They take as their object a non-existent state of beauty, etc., in the darkness of their own ignorance.

original: ñāṇālokena avijjātamo vigato, tato eva sabbe coḷā samucchinnā corā viya kusalabhaṇḍacchedanato,🔽sādhūhi alātabbato asaṅgahetabbato saṅkārakūṭādīsu chaḍḍitapilotikakhaṇḍaṃ viya issarajanena
analyzed: ñāṇa ālokena avijjātamaḥ vigataḥ tatas eva sabbe coḷā samucchinnā corāḥ viya kusala bhaṇḍa chedanato  sādhūhi saṅkāra kūṭa ādīsu chaḍḍita pilotika khaṇḍam viya issara janena
translated: When the light of knowledge has arisen in them through right reflection on the body in that darkness which is the cause of blindness, then the darkness of ignorance is dispelled, and so all the rags are cut away, like thieves by the king’s men because they have stolen the king’s goods.

original: ariyajanena jigucchitabbatāya coḷā viyāti vā “coḷā”ti laddhanāmā kilesā samucchinnā.
analyzed: ariya janena jigucchitabba tāya coḷā viyāti vā coḷāti laddha nāmā kilesā samucchinnā
translated: And the rags are cut away, that is to say, the defilements that are called “rags” because they are not to be gathered up by the good since they are contemptible, and because they are to be thrown on a rubbish heap, etc., like a piece of rag discarded in a rubbish heap, etc., and because they are despised by the noble people as rags are.

original: Aggamaggena samugghāṭitattā eva ca nesaṃ natthi dāni punabbhavo āyatiṃ punabbhavābhinibbatti natthīti.
analyzed: aggamaggena samugghāṭita ttā eva ca nesam natthi dāni punabbhavaḥ āyatim punabbhava abhinibbatti natthi iti
translated: And because they have been torn up by the supreme path, they will not come into existence again, that is to say, they will not be reborn in the future.

original: Vītasokattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽6. Puṇṇamāsattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: vītasoka thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Vītasoka is finished.🔽Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Puṇṇamāsa

analyzed: pañca nīvaraṇe hitvā ati ādikā āyasmataḥ puṇṇamāsa therassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi
translated: “Having abandoned the five hindrances” , etc., are the verses of the venerable elder Puṇṇamāsa. How did they originate? This elder, it seems,

analyzed: purima buddhesu kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto tissassa bhagavato  kāle kula gehe nibbattitvā viññutam patto eka divasam satthari araññe viharante paṃsukūla cīvaram
translated: Having performed meritorious deeds under former Buddhas, and having stored up merit in various existences, he was reborn in a good family in the time of the Buddha Tissa.🔽When the Teacher was dwelling in the forest, he hung his cast-off robe on a branch of a tree and entered his fragrant chamber.

original: dumasākhāya laggetvā gandhakuṭiṃ paviṭṭhe dhanuhattho gahanaṃ paviṭṭho satthu paṃsukūlaṃ
analyzed: dumasākhāya laggetvā gandhakuṭim paviṭṭhe dhanuhatthaḥ gahanam paviṭṭhaḥ satthu paṃsukūlam
translated: A certain hunter, carrying a bow and arrows, entered the forest, saw the cast-off robe of the Teacher,

original: disvā pasannamānaso dhanuṃ nikkhipitvā buddhaguṇe anussaritvā paṃsukūlaṃ vandi. So
analyzed: disvā pasanna mānasaḥ dhanum nikkhipitvā buddha guṇe anussaritvā paṃsukūlam vandi saḥ
translated: and, filled with faith, laid aside his bow and arrows, called to mind the virtues of the Buddha, and paid obeisance to the cast-off robe.

analyzed: tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde sāvatthiyam kuṭumbiya kule
translated: As the fruit of this meritorious deed, he passed from one state of bliss to another, and in the dispensation of the present Buddha was reborn in Sāvatthi in a certain family of means.

analyzed: tassa kira jāta divase tasmim gehe sabba bhājanāni suvaṇṇa ratana mayehi māsehi
translated: On the day of his birth, it is said, all the vessels in the house were filled with gold and silver coins.

analyzed: ahesum tena assa puṇṇamāso tvā iva nāmam akaṃsu saḥ vaya pattaḥ dāra pariggaham
translated: Therefore they gave him the name Puṇṇamāsa. When he reached years of discretion, he took unto himself a wife and a household.

original: katvā ekasmiṃ putte uppanne gharāvāsaṃ pahāya pabbajitvā gāmakāvāse vasanto ghaṭento
analyzed: katvā ekasmin putte uppanne ghara āvāsam pahāya pabbajitvā gāmaka āvāse vasantaḥ ghaṭentaḥ
translated: After a son had been born to him, he left his home and retired from the world. He dwelt in a village monastery, and striving and struggling,

analyzed: vāyamantaḥ chaḍabhiññaḥ ahosi tena vuttam apadāne

analyzed: tissaḥ nāma asi bhagavā sayambhū agga puggalo
translated: “The Blessed One, named Tissa, self-become, the highest of men,

translated: saw his father sitting in the presence of the Teacher. With a joyful heart, “My father has gone forth,

original: kiṃ nu kho tena pabbajjākiccaṃ matthakaṃ pāpita”nti vīmaṃsanto khīṇāsavabhāvaṃ ñatvā
analyzed: kim nu kho tena pabbajjā kiccam matthakam pāpitanti vīmaṃsantaḥ khīṇāsava bhāvam ñatvā
translated: has he fulfilled the duty of going forth?” examining, knowing his state of being one whose defilements are destroyed,🔽desiring to have him roar the lion’s roar, “It is good that you have gone forth,

original: taṃ sīhanādaṃ nadāpetukāmo, “sādhu, kho tumhehi kataṃ pabbajantehi, pabbajjākiccaṃ
analyzed: tam sīha nādam nada apetu kāmo sādhu kho tumhehi katam pabbajantehi pabbajjā kiccam
translated: the duty of going forth

original: pana matthakaṃ pāpita”nti pucchi. Bhāradvājo puttassa adhigamaṃ dīpento –
analyzed: pana matthakam pāpitanti pucchi bhāradvājaḥ puttassa adhigamam dīpentaḥ
translated: Bharadvaja, in order to show the attainment of his son, spoke two stanzas:

original: “Nadanti evaṃ sappaññā, sīhāva girigabbhare;
analyzed: nadanti evam sappaññā sīhā ava giri gabbhare
translated: “The wise ones roar thus, like lions in mountain caves,

original: Vīrā vijitasaṅgāmā, jetvā māraṃ savāhanaṃ.
analyzed: vīrāḥ vijita saṅgāmāḥ jetvā māram sa vāhanam
translated: The heroes, having won the battle, having conquered Mara and his mount.

original: “Satthā ca pariciṇṇo me, dhammo saṅgho ca pūjito;
analyzed: satthā ca pariciṇṇaḥ me dhammo saṅgho ca pūjito
translated: “The Teacher has been served by me, the Dhamma and the Sangha have been worshipped,

original: Ahañca vitto sumano, puttaṃ disvā anāsava”nti. – gāthādvayaṃ abhāsi;
analyzed: aham ca vittaḥ sumano puttam disvā anāsavanti gāthā dvayam abhāsi
translated: And I, having seen my son without defilements, am rich and happy.”

original: Tattha nadantīti yathābhuccaguṇābhibyāhāravasena abhītanādaṃ nadanti gajjanti. Evanti
analyzed: tattha nadanti iti abhīta nādam nadanti gajjanti
translated: Therein, “roar” means that they roar, they thunder, by way of the proclamation of their own qualities as they are. “Thus”

original: idāni vattabbākāradassanaṃ. Sappaññāti aggamaggapaññādhigamena sabbapaññādhigamena
analyzed: idāni vattabba ākāra dassanam sa paññā ati agga magga paññā adhigamena sabba paññā adhigamena
translated: is the seeing of the mode of expression that is now to be spoken of. “The wise ones” means that they have attained the highest path-wisdom, that they have attained all wisdom,

original: sabbapaññāvepullappattā. Vīrāti catubbidhasammappadhānavīriyasampannatāya vīrā, tato
analyzed: sabba paññā vepulla ppattāḥ vīrā ati catubbidha sammappadhāna vīriya sampanna tāya vīrā tatas
translated: that they have reached the full extent of all wisdom. “The heroes” means that they are heroes because they are endowed with the four right efforts and the energy of striving.

original: eva anavasesasaṃkilesapakkhanimmathanena savāhanaṃ kilesamāraṃ abhisaṅkhāramāraṃ
analyzed: eva anavasesa saṃkilesa pakkha nimmathanena sa vāhanam kilesa māram abhisaṅkhāra māram
translated: Then, because of that, by the complete removal of the side of defilement, they roar, having conquered Mara and his mount, the defilement-Mara, the Mara of formations,

original: devaputtamārañca jetvā sabbaso vijitasaṅgāmā nadanti sappaññāti sambandho.
analyzed: deva putta mārañca jetvā sabbasas vijita saṅgāmāḥ nadanti sappaññā ati sambandho
translated: and the Mara of the Divinities, having won the battle, the wise ones.

original: Evaṃ vijetabbavijayena sīhanādaṃ dassetvā idāni ārādhetabbasamārādhanena icchitabbasiddhiyā
analyzed: evam vijetabba vijayena sīha nādam dassetvā idāni ārādhetabba samārādhanena icchitabba siddhiyā
translated: Having thus shown the lion’s roar with the victory of the conquest to be conquered, now, with the pleasing of the pleasing to be pleased,🔽

original: ca taṃ dassetuṃ, “satthā ca pariciṇṇo me”ti dutiyaṃ gāthamāha. Tattha satthā ca pariciṇṇo
analyzed: ca tam dassetum satthā ca pariciṇṇaḥ mā iti dutiyam gātham āha tattha satthā ca pariciṇṇaḥ
translated: Having thus shown the lion’s roar by the conquest of what is to be conquered, he now shows the success of what is to be desired by the service of what is to be served, and in order to do so he spoke the second stanza: “My Master I have served, the Dhamma and the Order I have honoured, I am rich, my heart is glad, seeing my son without defilement.”

original: meti mama satthā sammāsambuddho yathānusiṭṭhaṃ ovādānusāsanīkaraṇena mayā pariciṇṇo🔽upāsito, na dhammādhikaraṇaṃ visositoti adhippāyo. Dhammo saṅgho ca pūjitoti navavidhopi
analyzed: mā iti mama satthā sammāsambuddhaḥ yathā anusiṭṭham ovāda anusāsanīkaraṇena mayā pariciṇṇaḥ  upāsito na dhamma adhikaraṇam visosito ti adhippāyaḥ dhammo saṅgho ca pūjito ti navavidhaḥ api
translated: Herein, my Master I have served means that my Master, the Perfect One, has been served by me, has been attended on by me, by doing what he told me to do, by carrying out his advice and instruction.

original: lokuttaradhammo, yathāpaṭipattiyāgatamaggānuppattiyā sīladiṭṭhisāmaññagamanena ariyasaṅgho🔽ca mayā pūjito mānito. Ahañca vitto sumano, puttaṃ disvā anāsavanti mama puttaṃ anāsavaṃ
analyzed: lokuttara dhammaḥ yathā paṭipattiyā āgata magga anuppattiyā sīla diṭṭhi sāmañña gamanena ariya saṅgho  ca mayā pūjitaḥ mānitaḥ aham ca vittaḥ sumano puttam disvā anāsavanti mama puttam anāsavam
translated: The intention is that I have not been led away from the True Idea. The Dhamma and the Order I have honoured means that I have honoured, have revered, the ninefold Supramundane True Idea and the Noble Community that has come to the Path by the practice of it, by the Community’s having the same virtue and view.

original: sabbaso khīṇāsavaṃ disvā dassanahetu ahampi vitto nirāmisāya pītiyā tuṭṭho, tatoyeva
analyzed: sabbasas khīṇāsavam disvā dassana hetu aham pi vittaḥ nirāmisāya pītiyā tuṭṭho
translated: I am rich, my heart is glad, seeing my son without defilement means that I am rich, am satisfied, with the satisfaction of the non-material kind, and that I am glad, have gladness, with the gladness of the non-material kind, because I have seen my son, my son who is without defilement,

original: nirāmisena somanassena sumano jātoti attho.
analyzed: nirāmisena somanassena sumanaḥ jātaḥ iti attho
translated: who is all-destroyed as to defilements.

original: Bhāradvājattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Bhāradvāja is finished.

original: 10. Kaṇhadinnattheragāthāvaṇṇanā🔽Upāsitā sappurisāti āyasmato kaṇhadinnattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: kaṇhadinna tthera gāthā vaṇṇanā  upāsitā sappurisā ti āyasmataḥ kaṇhadinna therassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Kaṇhadinna

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto ito catunavute kappe kulagehe🔽nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto ekadivasaṃ sobhitaṃ nāma paccekabuddhaṃ disvā pasannacitto🔽punnāgapupphehi pūjaṃ akāsi. So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ
analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinantaḥ itas catunavute kappe kulagehe  nibbattitvā viññutam pattaḥ eka divasam sobhitam nāma paccekabuddham disvā pasanna citto  punnāga pupphehi pūjam akāsi saḥ tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin
translated: “The good man who has served the good” : this verse was spoken by the Elder Kaṇhadinna. What was its origin? This Elder, too, had performed meritorious deeds under former Buddhas and had accumulated merit in various existences. Twenty-four aeons ago he had been reborn in a good family in this world.

original: buddhuppāde rājagahe brāhmaṇakule nibbattitvā kaṇhadinnoti laddhanāmo vayappatto
analyzed: buddhuppāde rājagahe brāhmaṇa kule nibbattitvā kaṇhadinnaḥ ti laddha nāmaḥ vaya patto
translated: When he had reached the age of discretion, he had seen a Paccekabuddha named Sobhita and had worshipped him with flowers of the punnāga tree. By that meritorious deed he had gone from one happy state of existence to another and had been reborn in the time of the present Buddha in a brahmin family in Rājagaha. He had received the name Kaṇhadinna. When he had reached the age of discretion,

original: upanissayasampattiyā codiyamāno dhammasenāpatiṃ upasaṅkamitvā dhammaṃ sutvā paṭiladdhasaddho
analyzed: upanissaya sampattiyā codiyamānaḥ dhamma senāpatim upasaṅkamitvā dhammam sutvā paṭiladdha saddhaḥ
translated: he had been urged on by the presence of the necessary conditions and had gone to the General of the Dhamma. Having heard the Dhamma, he had become a faithful lay disciple.

original: pabbajitvā vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: pabbajitvā vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: He had gone forth into homelessness and had developed insight, and had attained arahatship. Therefore it is said in the Apadāna:

original: “Sobhito nāma sambuddho, cittakūṭe vasī tadā;
analyzed: sobhitaḥ nāma sambuddhaḥ cittakūṭe vasī tadā
translated: “The Sambuddha named Sobhita, who dwelt on Citta Peak,

original: Gahetvā giripunnāgaṃ, sayambhuṃ abhipūjayiṃ.
analyzed: gahetvā giri punnāgam sayambhum
translated: I took a mountain ginger-lily and worshipped the Self-Brough t.

original: “Catunnavutito kappe, yaṃ buddhamabhipūjayiṃ;
analyzed: catunnavutitaḥ kappe yam buddham abhipūjayiṃ
translated: “For ninety-four aeons I worshipped the Buddha,

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I do not know of a bad destination, this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements are destroyed … the Buddha’s Dispensation is done.”

original: Arahattaṃ pana patvā aññaṃ byākaronto –
analyzed: arahattam pana patvā aññam byākaronto
translated: But after attaining Liberation, he made a declaration:

original: “Upāsitā sappurisā, sutā dhammā abhiṇhaso;
analyzed: upāsitā sappurisā sutā dhammā abhiṇhaso
translated: “Good people have been attended on, the Dhamma has been heard again and again;

original: Sutvāna paṭipajjissaṃ, añjasaṃ amatogadhaṃ.
analyzed: sutvāna paṭipajjissam añjasam amatogadham
translated: Having heard it, I will practice, the straight path that ends in the Deathless.

original: “Bhavarāgahatassa me sato, bhavarāgo puna me na vijjati;
analyzed: bhava rāga hatassa me sataḥ bhava rāgaḥ puna me na vijjati
translated: “For me, who has struck down the passion for becoming, the passion for becoming does not exist for me again;

original: Na cāhu na ca me bhavissati, na ca me etarahi vijjatī”ti. –
analyzed: na ca āhu na ca me bhavissati na ca me etarahi vijjati iti
translated: It did not exist in the past, nor will it exist for me in the future, nor does it exist for me now.”

original: Gāthādvayaṃ abhāsi.🔽Tattha upāsitāti paricaritā paṭipattipayirupāsanāya payirupāsitā. Sappurisāti santehi
analyzed: gāthā dvayam abhāsi  tattha upāsitā ati paricaritā paṭipatti payirupāsanāya payirupāsitā sappurisā ati santehi
translated: He spoke this pair of verses.🔽Herein, attended on means served, attended on by attending with practice. Good people means people who are endowed with the qualities of virtue, etc.,

original: sīlādiguṇehi samannāgatā purisā, ariyapuggalā sāriputtattherādayo. Etena purimacakkadvayasampattimattano
analyzed: sīla ādi guṇehi samannāgatā purisāḥ ariya puggalā sāriputta tthera ādayaḥ etena purima cakka dvaya sampattimattano
translated: who are Noble Persons, Sāriputta the Elder and so on. By this he shows that he himself is endowed with the two previous pairs of conditions.

original: dasseti. Na hi patirūpadesavāsena vinā sappurisūpanissayo sambhavati. Sutā dhammāti
analyzed: dasseti na hi pati rūpa desa vāsena vinā sappurisa upanissayaḥ sambhavati sutā dhammā ti
translated: The Dhamma that is heard:

original: saccapaṭiccasamuppādādipaṭisaṃyuttadhammā sotadvārānusārena upadhāritā. Etena attano
analyzed: sacca paṭiccasamuppāda ādi paṭisaṃyutta dhammā sota dvāra anusārena upadhāritāḥ etena attano
translated: the Dhamma of the noble truths, dependent origination, etc., which is heard by the ear-faculty. By this he shows his own great learning and the possession of the last two factors of the wheel of the Dhamma.

original: bāhusaccaṃ dassento pacchimacakkadvayasampattiṃ dasseti. Abhiṇhasoti bahuso na kālena
analyzed: bāhusaccam dassento pacchima cakka dvaya sampattim dasseti abhiṇhasaḥ iti bahusaḥ na kālena
translated: Abhiṇha: often, not just once in a while.

original: kālaṃ. Idañca padaṃ “upāsitā sappurisā”ti etthāpi yojetabbaṃ. Sutvāna paṭipajjissaṃ,
analyzed: kālam idam ca padam upāsitā sappurisā ati ettha api yojetabbam sutvāna paṭipajjissam
translated: This word should be connected with the previous phrase, “I have served good people.”🔽Having heard, I will practice the straight path that leads to the deathless.

original: añjasaṃ amatogadhanti te dhamme sutvā tattha vuttarūpārūpadhamme salakkhaṇādito pariggahetvā🔽anukkamena vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā amatogadhaṃ nibbānapatiṭṭhaṃ taṃsampāpakaṃ añjasaṃ
analyzed: añjasam te dhamme sutvā tattha vutta rūpa arūpa dhamme sa lakkhaṇa āditaḥ pariggahetvā  anukkamena vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā amatogadham nibbāna patiṭṭham taṃsampāpakam añjasam
translated: Having heard those teachings, I will discern the material and immaterial phenomena described therein by way of their characteristics, etc.,

original: ariyaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ paṭipajjiṃ pāpuṇiṃ.
analyzed: ariyam aṭṭhaṅgikam maggam paṭipajjim pāpuṇim
translated: and gradually increase my insight until I reach the straight path that leads to the deathless, i.e., Nibbāna, the path that is noble and has eight factors and that leads to the attainment of Nibbāna.🔽I am one who has been struck down by the dart of passion for existence:

original: Bhavarāgahatassa me satoti bhavarāgena bhavataṇhāya anādimati saṃsāre hatassa upaddutassa
analyzed: bhava rāga hatassa me sato ti bhava rāgena bhava taṇhāya anādimati saṃsāre hatassa upaddutassa
translated: I have been struck down, afflicted,

original: mama sato samānassa, aggamaggena vā hatabhavarāgassa. Bhavarāgo puna me na vijjatīti
analyzed: mama sataḥ samānassa agga maggena vā hata bhava rāgassa bhava rāgaḥ puna me na vijjati iti
translated: “I have no more lust for existence,”🔽“I have no more lust for existence” means that I have no more lust for existence.

original: tato eva puna idāni bhavarāgo me natthi. Na cāhu na me bhavissati, na ca me etarahi
analyzed: tatas eva puna idāni bhava rāgaḥ me natthi na ca āhu na me bhavissati na ca me etarahi
translated: “Nor will I have in the future” means that I will not have it in the future.

original: vijjatīti yadipi pubbe puthujjanakāle sekkhakāle ca me bhavarāgo ahosi, aggamaggappattito
analyzed: vijjati iti yadi pi pubbe puthujjana kāle sekkha kāle ca me bhava rāgaḥ ahosi aggamagga ppattito
translated: “Nor do I have at present” means that although I had lust for existence in the past, when I was an ordinary man and when I was a disciple,🔽since I attained the path of stream-entry I have not had it, nor will I have it in the future.

original: pana paṭṭhāya na cāhu na ca ahosi, āyatimpi na me bhavissati, etarahi adhunāpi na🔽ca me vijjati na ca upalabbhati, pahīnoti attho. Bhavarāgavacaneneva cettha tadekaṭṭhatāya
analyzed: pana paṭṭhāya na ca āhu na ca ahosi āyatimpi na me bhavissati etarahi adhunā api na  ca me vijjati na ca upalabbhati pahīnaḥ iti atthaḥ bhava rāga vacanena iva ca ittha tad ekaṭṭha tāya
translated: At present, too, I do not have it, I do not find it. The meaning is: it is abandoned.

original: mānādīnampi abhāvo vuttoti sabbaso parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojanataṃ dasseti.
analyzed: māna ādīnam pi abhāvaḥ vuttaḥ ti sabbaso parikkhīṇa bhava saṃyojana tam dasseti
translated: And by the expression “lust for existence,” the absence of conceit, etc., is also stated, since these are included in that. Thus he shows that all the fetters that bind one to existence are completely exhausted.

original: Kaṇhadinnattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kaṇhadinna thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the verses of the Elder Kaṇha-Dinnāga is completed.

original: Tatiyavaggavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: tatiya vagga vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the third chapter is finished.

original: 4. Catutthavaggo
analyzed: catuttha vaggaḥ
translated: Chapter IV

original: 1. Migasirattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: migasiratthera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Elder Migasira’s verses

original: Yato ahaṃ pabbajitoti āyasmato migasirattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: yatas aham pabbajitaḥ ti āyasmataḥ migasira ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: What was the origin of this Elder? He also, in the time of former Buddhas,🔽while he was performing works of merit in various states of existence,

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto kassapassa bhagavato kāle brāhmaṇakule
analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinantaḥ kassapassa bhagavataḥ kāle brāhmaṇa kule
translated: in the dispensation of the Buddha Kassapa, was reborn in the family of a brāhmaṇa.

original: nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto ekadivasaṃ satthāraṃ disvā pasannacitto kusaṭṭhakaṃ adāsi.
analyzed: nibbattitvā viññutam pattaḥ eka divasam satthāram disvā pasanna cittaḥ kusaṭṭhakam adāsi
translated: When he had reached years of discretion, he saw the Teacher and was filled with joy. He gave him a handful of Kusagrass.

original: So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde kosalaraṭṭhe brāhmaṇakule
analyzed: so tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde kosala raṭṭhe brāhmaṇa kule
translated: As the result of that deed of merit, he passed through the round of existences in the heavenly world and the world of men, and was finally reborn in the family of a brāhmaṇa in the dispensation of the present Buddha.

original: paṭisandhiṃ gahetvā migasiranakkhattena jātattā migasiroti laddhanāmo vayappatto
analyzed: paṭisandhim gahetvā migasira nakkhattena jāta ttā migasiraḥ iti laddha nāmaḥ vaya ppatto
translated: He received the name Migasira because he was born under the constellation Migasira. When he had reached years of discretion,

original: brāhmaṇānaṃ vijjāsippesu nipphattiṃ gato chavasīsamantaṃ nāma sikkhi, yaṃ parijappetvā
analyzed: brāhmaṇānam vijjā sippesu nipphattim gataḥ chavasīsamantam nāma sikkhi yam parijappetvā
translated: he became proficient in the sciences and accomplishments of the brāhmaṇas. He learned the spell called Chavasīmanta,

original: tivassamatthake matānampi sīsaṃ nakhena ākoṭetvā “ayaṃ satto asukaṭṭhāne nibbatto”ti jānāti.
analyzed: ti vassa matthake matānam pi sīsam nakhena ākoṭetvā ayam satto asuka ṭṭhāne nibbattaḥ ti jānāti
translated: by reciting which he was able to tap with his fingernail the head of a dead man and tell the place where the deceased was reborn.

original: So gharāvāsaṃ anicchanto paribbājakapabbajjaṃ pabbajitvā taṃ vijjaṃ nissāya lokena
analyzed: saḥ ghara āvāsam an icchantaḥ paribbājaka pabbajjam pabbajitvā tam vijjam nissāya lokena
translated: The young man, not liking the life of a householder, went forth into the homeless life as a wanderer. By means of his knowledge he was able to tell the place of rebirth of any dead person.

original: sakkato garukato lābhī hutvā vicaranto sāvatthiṃ upagato satthu santikaṃ gantvā attano
analyzed: sakkataḥ garukataḥ lābhī hutvā vicarantaḥ sāvatthim upagataḥ satthu santikam gantvā attano
translated: He was honored and revered by the world, and he went about receiving gifts. Finally he came to Sāvatthi, and he went to the Teacher.

original: ānubhāvaṃ pakāsento – “ahaṃ, bho gotama, matānaṃ nibbattaṭṭhānaṃ jānāmī”ti vatvā,
analyzed: ānubhāvam pakāsentaḥ aham bho gotama matānam nibbatta ṭṭhānam jānāmi iti vatvā
translated: He made known his power, saying, “Reverend Gotama, I know the place of rebirth of all who are dead.”

original: “kathaṃ pana tvaṃ jānāsī”ti vutte, “chavasīsāni āharāpetvā mantaṃ parijappetvā nakhena🔽sīsaṃ ākoṭento nirayādikaṃ tehi tehi nibbattaṭṭhānaṃ jānāmī”ti kathesi. Athassa bhagavā
