original: samaṇadhammaṃ akatvā divā saṅgaṇikārāmo sakalarattiṃ niddāyamāno vītināmeti. So ekadivasaṃ
analyzed: samaṇa dhammam a katvā divā saṅgaṇikā ārāmaḥ sakala rattim niddāyamānaḥ vītināmeti saḥ eka divasam
translated: He spent the day in the company of others and slept all night. One day

original: muṭṭhassati asampajāno niddaṃ okkanto supine kesamassuṃ ohāretvā ambapallavavaṇṇaṃ
analyzed: muṭṭhaḥ ati asampajānaḥ niddam okkantaḥ supine kesa massuṃ ohāretvā amba pallava vaṇṇam
translated: he fell asleep, absent-minded and heedless. In a dream he shaved off his hair and beard, put on a yellow robe,

original: cīvaraṃ pārupitvā hatthigīvāyaṃ nisīditvā nagaraṃ piṇḍāya paviṭṭhaṃ tattheva manusse
analyzed: cīvaram pārupitvā hatthi gīvāyam nisīditvā nagaram piṇḍāya paviṭṭham tattha eva manusse
translated: and sat on the neck of an elephant. He entered the city for alms. When people came there,

original: sampatte disvā lajjāya hatthikkhandhato oruyha attānaṃ disvā paṭibuddho, “īdisaṃ
analyzed: sampatte disvā lajjāya hatthi kkhandhataḥ oruyha attānam disvā paṭibuddhaḥ īdisam
translated: he got down from the elephant’s back out of shame. When he saw himself, he woke up and thought, “Such a dream

original: nāma supinaṃ muṭṭhassatinā asampajānena niddāyamānena mayā diṭṭha”nti uppannasaṃvego
analyzed: nāma supinam muṭṭha ssatinā asampajānena niddāyamānena mayā diṭṭhanti uppanna saṃvegaḥ
translated: was seen by me, who am absent-minded and heedless while sleeping.” He was filled with anxiety

original: vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapetvā nacirasseva arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: vipassanam paṭṭhapetvā nacirassa iva arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: and began to practice insight meditation. Before long he reached arahatship. Therefore it is said in the Apadana:

original: “Kakudhaṃ vilasantaṃva, devadevaṃ narāsabhaṃ;
analyzed: kakudham vilasantam iva devadevam narāsabham
translated: “The lord of the gods, the god of gods, the bull among men,

original: Rathiyaṃ paṭipajjantaṃ, kosambaṃ adadiṃ tadā.
analyzed: rathiyam paṭipajjantam kosambam adadim tadā
translated: shining like a crest, I gave him Kosambī on the road as he was going along.”

original: “Ekatiṃse ito kappe, yaṃ phalaṃ adadiṃ tadā;
analyzed: ekatiṃse itas kappe yam phalam adadim tadā
translated: “Thirty-one cycles of eons ago, the fruit I gave then

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, phaladānassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi phala dānassa idam phalam
translated: I do not recall any state of woe; this is the fruit of giving fruit.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements are destroyed … the Buddha’s dispensation is done.”

original: Atha thero yathādiṭṭhaṃ supinaṃ aṅkusaṃ katvā arahattassa adhigatattā tasseva supinassa kittanavasena aññaṃ byākaronto –
analyzed: atha theraḥ yathādiṭṭham supinam aṅkusam katvā arahattassa adhigata ttā tassa iva supinassa kittana vasena aññam byākarontaḥ
translated: Then the Elder, having made his dream into a goad, spoke two verses in praise of the dream, having attained Arahantship:

original: “Ambapallavasaṅkāsaṃ, aṃse katvāna cīvaraṃ;
analyzed: amba pallava saṅkāsam aṃse katvāna cīvaram
translated: “Having placed on my shoulder the robe, which was like a tender mango shoot,

original: Nisinno hatthigīvāyaṃ, gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pāvisiṃ.
analyzed: nisinnaḥ hatthi gīvāyam gāmam piṇḍāya pāvisim
translated: I sat on the neck of the elephant and entered the village for alms.

original: “Hatthikkhandhato oruyha, saṃvegaṃ alabhiṃ tadā;
analyzed: hatthi khandhataḥ oruyha saṃvegam alabhim tadā
translated: “Having descended from the elephant’s back, I was then filled with urgency;

original: Sohaṃ ditto tadā santo, patto me āsavakkhayo”ti. – gāthādvayamāha;🔽Tattha ambapallavasaṅkāsaṃ, aṃse katvāna cīvaranti ambapallavākāraṃ pavāḷavaṇṇaṃ
analyzed: saḥ ham dittaḥ tadā santaḥ pattaḥ me āsava kkhayo ti gāthā dvayam āha  tattha amba pallava saṅkāsam aṃse katvāna amba pallava ākāram pavāḷa vaṇṇam
translated: Then I was satisfied and tranquil; my cankers were destroyed.”

original: cīvaraṃ khandhe karitvā uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā. Gāmanti attano rājadhāniṃ hatthikkhandhe
analyzed: cīvaram khandhe karitvā uttarāsaṅgam karitvā gāmanti attanaḥ rājadhānim hatthi khandhe
translated: Herein, having placed on my shoulder the robe, which was like a tender mango shoot means having placed on my shoulder the robe which was the color of a tender mango shoot, the color of coral. The village means his own capital city. On the neck of the elephant means on the neck of the elephant.

original: nisinno piṇḍāya pāvisiṃ, paviṭṭhamattova mahājanena olokiyamāno hatthikkhandhato
analyzed: nisinnaḥ piṇḍāya pāvisim paviṭṭha mattaḥ iva mahā janena olokiyamānaḥ hatthi kkhandhato
translated: I entered the village for almsfood while seated, and as soon as I had entered, I was observed by a great crowd of people.

original: oruyha ṭhito paṭibujjhiṃ, pabuddhova saṃvegaṃ alabhiṃ tadā “muṭṭhassati asampajāno
analyzed: oruyha ṭhitaḥ paṭibujjhim pabuddhaḥ uva saṃvegam alabhim tadā muṭṭhaḥ sati asampajāno
translated: I awoke while standing after dismounting from the elephant’s back, and as soon as I had awakened, I experienced a sense of spiritual urgency, thinking: ‘This has arisen because of my falling asleep while heedless and inattentive,

original: hutvā niddāyokkamanena etaṃ jāta”nti. Apare pana “rājāva hutvā rattibhāge evarūpaṃ🔽supinaṃ disvā vibhātāya rattiyā hatthikkhandhaṃ āruyha nagaravīthiyaṃ caranto taṃ
analyzed: hutvā niddāya ukkamanena etam apare pana hutvā ratti bhāge evarūpam  supinam disvā vibhātāya rattiyā hatthi kkhandham āruyha nagara vīthiyam carantaḥ tam
translated: after eating and then lying down on my right side.’ But others say: ‘After seeing such a dream during the night as if he were a king,🔽when the night had brightened he mounted the elephant’s back and went around the city streets.

original: supinaṃ saritvā hatthikkhandhato oruyha saṃvegaṃ labhitvā satthu santike pabbajitvā
analyzed: supinam saritvā hatthi kkhandhataḥ oruyha saṃvegam labhitvā satthu santike pabbajitvā
translated: Remembering that dream, he experienced a sense of urgency after dismounting from the elephant’s back. He went forth into the presence of the Teacher,🔽and after attaining arahatship he uttered this inspired utterance.’

original: arahattaṃ patvā udānaṃ udānento imā gāthā abhāsī”ti vadanti. Dittoti tasmiṃ rājakāle
analyzed: arahattam patvā udānam udānentaḥ imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāsi iti vadanti ditto ti tasmin rāja kāle
translated: ‘Ditto’ means ‘at that time.’

original: jātimadabhogamadādiparidappito samāno saṃvegamalabhinti yojanā.
analyzed: jāti mada bhoga mada ādi paridappitaḥ samānaḥ yojanā
translated: ‘I experienced a sense of urgency’ means ‘I experienced a sense of spiritual urgency.’

original: Usabhattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: usabhatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the verses of the Elder Usabha is finished.

original: 10. Kappaṭakurattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
translated: Kappaṭakuratattheragāthāvaṇṇanā

original: Ayamiti kappaṭoti āyasmato kappaṭakurattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti. Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: ayam iti kappaṭaḥ ti āyasmataḥ kappaṭakura ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: His story is as follows. He, too, had rendered service under former Buddhas,

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto vipassissa bhagavato kāle kulagehe
analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinantaḥ vipassissa bhagavato kāle kulagehe
translated: and had accumulated merit in various existences. In the dispensation of the Exalted Vipassī he was reborn in a good family

original: nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto ekadivasaṃ bhagavantaṃ vinatāya nāma nadiyā tīre aññatarasmiṃ
analyzed: nibbattitvā viññutam pattaḥ eka divasam bhagavantam vinatāya nāma nadiyāḥ tīre aññatarasmiṃ
translated: in the city of Bandhumatī. When he had grown up, he saw the Exalted One seated at the foot of a tree on the bank of the river Vantā,

original: rukkhamūle nisinnaṃ disvā pasannamānaso ketakapupphehi pūjaṃ akāsi. So tena puññakammena
analyzed: rukkha mūle nisinnam disvā pasanna mānasaḥ ketaka pupphehi pūjam akāsi saḥ tena puñña kammena
translated: and he worshipped him with ketaka flowers. By reason of that meritorious deed,

original: devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde sāvatthiyaṃ duggatakule nibbattitvā
analyzed: deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde sāvatthiyam duggata kule nibbattitvā
translated: he was reborn in the world of the gods and in the world of men. In the dispensation of the present Buddha he was reborn in a poor family in Sāvatthi.

original: yāva vayappatti, tāva aññaṃ upāyaṃ ajānanto kappaṭakhaṇḍanivāsano sarāvahattho tattha
analyzed: yāva vaya ppatti tāva aññam upāyam a jānanto kappaṭa khaṇḍa nivāsano sarāva hatthaḥ tattha
translated: Until he reached years of discretion, he knew no other means of livelihood than begging. He lived in a hut of grass and leaves, and went about with a basket on his back, seeking for grass.

original: tattha kuraṃ pariyesanto vicari, tena kappaṭakurotveva paññāyittha. So vayappatto
analyzed: tattha kuram pariyesantaḥ tena kappaṭakuro tu eva paññāyittha saḥ vaya ppatto
translated: Therefore he was called Kappaṭa. When he reached years of discretion,

original: tiṇaṃ vikkiṇitvā jīvikaṃ kappento ekadivasaṃ tiṇalāvanatthaṃ araññaṃ gato tattha
analyzed: tiṇam vikkiṇitvā jīvikam kappento eka divasam tiṇa lāvana attham araññam gataḥ tattha
translated: he made a living by selling grass. One day he went to the forest to get grass for thatching. There he saw a certain man who had gone mad from eating poisonous leaves.

original: aññataraṃ khīṇāsavattheraṃ disvā taṃ upasaṅkamitvā vanditvā nisīdi. Tassa thero dhammaṃ
analyzed: aññataram khīṇāsava theram disvā tam upasaṅkamitvā vanditvā nisīdi tassa thero dhammaṃ
translated: and after approaching and worshipping a certain Elder who was a perfected one, he sat down. The Elder

original: kathesi. So dhammaṃ sutvā paṭiladdhasaddho “kiṃ me imāya kicchajīvikāyā”ti pabbajitvā
analyzed: kathesi saḥ dhammam sutvā paṭiladdha saddhaḥ kim me imāya kiccha jīvikāya ati pabbajitvā
translated: preached the Dhamma to him. After hearing the Dhamma he became faithful, and thinking: “What have I to do with this difficult livelihood?” he went forth.

original: attano nivatthakappaṭacoḷaṃ ekasmiṃ ṭhāne nikkhipi. Yadā cassa anabhirati uppajjati,
analyzed: attanaḥ nivattha kappaṭa coḷam ekasmiṃ ṭhāne nikkhipi yadā ca ssa anabhirati uppajjati
translated: and after going forth he put his own robe and bowl in one place. When dissatisfaction arose in him,

original: tadā taṃ kappaṭaṃ olokentassa anabhirati vigacchati, saṃvegaṃ paṭilabhi. Evaṃ karonto
analyzed: tadā tam kappaṭam olokentassa an abhirati vigacchati saṃvegam evam karontaḥ
translated: after looking at the bowl-cover the dissatisfaction disappeared, and he obtained inspiration. Doing it in this way,

original: sattakkhattuṃ uppabbaji. Tassa taṃ kāraṇaṃ bhikkhū bhagavato ārocesuṃ. Athekadivasaṃ
analyzed: satta kkhattum uppabbaji tassa tam kāraṇam bhikkhū bhagavataḥ ārocesuṃ atha eka divasam
translated: he went forth seven times. The monks told the reason for that to the Fortunate One. Then one day

original: kappaṭakuro bhikkhu dhammasabhāyaṃ parisapariyante nisinno niddāyati, taṃ bhagavā codento –
analyzed: kappaṭakuraḥ bhikkhu dhamma sabhāyam parisapariyante nisinnaḥ niddāyati tam bhagavā codentaḥ
translated: the bowl-cover monk was sitting at the end of the assembly in the Dhamma hall, and he fell asleep. The Fortunate One, reproving him, (said this):

original: “Ayamiti kappaṭo kappaṭakuro, acchāya atibharitāya;
analyzed: ayam iti kappaṭaḥ kappaṭa kuro acchāya ati bharitāya
translated: “This is the bowl-cover, the bowl-cover monk, who is overcome by the darkness;

original: Amataghaṭikāyaṃ dhammakaṭamatto, katapadaṃ jhānāni ocetuṃ.
analyzed: amata ghaṭikāyam kata padam jhānāni ocetum
translated: In the Immortal Drum he is a fool in the Dhamma-basket, he has gone beyond the meditation attainments.

original: “Mā kho tvaṃ kappaṭa pacālesi, mā tvaṃ upakaṇṇamhi tāḷessaṃ;
analyzed: mā kho tvam kappaṭa pacālesi mā tvam upakaṇṇamhi tāḷessam
translated: “Do not be anxious, bowl-cover, I will not whisper in your ear;

original: Na hi tvaṃ kappaṭa mattamaññāsi, saṅghamajjhamhi pacalāyamāno”ti. –
analyzed: na hi tvam kappaṭa mattam aññāsi saṅgha majjhamhi pacalāyamāno ti
translated: You are not aware of your own measure, O monkey, in that you are strutting about in the midst of the Order.

original: Gāthādvayaṃ abhāsi.🔽Tattha ayamiti kappaṭo kappaṭakuroti kappaṭakuro bhikkhu “ayaṃ mama kappaṭo, imaṃ
analyzed: gāthā dvayam abhāsi  tattha ayam iti kappaṭaḥ kappaṭakuro ti kappaṭa kuro bhikkhu ayam mama kappaṭaḥ imaṃ
translated: He uttered these two stanzas.

original: paridahitvā yathā tathā jīvāmī”ti evaṃ uppannamicchāvitakko acchāya atibharitāya
analyzed: paridahitvā yathā tathā jīvāmi iti evam uppannam icchā vitakkaḥ acchāya ati bharitāya
translated: Herein, this is the monkey, the monkey-like monk. “This is my monkey,” he thinks, “by exhibiting him I shall live somehow or other.” Thus he has a wrong thought of desire.🔽The rain of the deathless falls in the deathless rain-gauge,

original: amataghaṭikāyaṃ mama amataghaṭe tahaṃ tahaṃ vassante “amatamadhigataṃ ahamanusāsāmi,
analyzed: amataghaṭikā ayam mama amataghaṭe taham taham amatam adhigatam aham anusāsāmi
translated: “I have attained the deathless. I instruct.

original: ahaṃ dhammaṃ desemi”. “Andhībhūtasmiṃ lokasmiṃ, āhañchaṃ amatadundubhi”ntiādinā ghosetvā
analyzed: aham dhammam desemi andhībhūtasmin lokasmin ghosetvā
translated: I teach the True Idea. In the world that has become blind I beat the drum of the Deathless. “

original: mayā dhammāmate pavassiyamāne katapadaṃ jhānāni ocetuṃ lokiyalokuttarajjhānāni upacetuṃ🔽bhāvetuṃ katapadaṃ kaṭamaggavihitabhāvanāmaggaṃ idaṃ mama sāsanaṃ, tathāpi dhammakaṭamatto
analyzed: mayā dhammāmate pavassiyamāne kata padam jhānāni ocetum lokiya lokuttara jhānāni upacetum  bhāvetum kata padam kaṭa magga vihita bhāvanā maggam idam mama sāsanam tathā api dhamma kaṭa matto
translated: When the rain of the True Idea falls from me, the rain-gauge of the jhanas is filled, and the jhanas of the worlds and the supramundane jhanas are filled and developed.

original: mama sāsanadhammato ukkaṇṭhacitto apagatamānaso kappaṭakuroti taṃ codetvā punapissa
analyzed: mama sāsana dhammataḥ ukkaṇṭha cittaḥ apagata mānaso kappaṭa kuroti tam codetvā puna pissa
translated: The rain-gauge of the path is filled, and the path that is the development of the path is made. This is my Dispensation. Still, with a mind disaffected from my Dispensation’s True Idea, with a mind gone away from it, the monkey-like monk

original: sahoḍḍhaṃ coraṃ gaṇhanto viya pamādavihāraṃ dassento “mā kho tvaṃ, kappaṭa, pacālesī”ti gāthamāha.
analyzed: sahoḍḍham coram gaṇhantaḥ viya pamāda vihāram dassentaḥ mā kho tvam kappaṭa pacālesi iti gātham āha
translated: He spoke the verse “Don’t be a nuisance, Kappa” in order to show that he was living heedfully, as if he were catching a thief red-handed.

original: Tattha mā kho tvaṃ, kappaṭa, pacālesīti tvaṃ, kappaṭakura, “mama dhammaṃ suṇissāmī”ti
analyzed: tattha mā kho tvam kappaṭa pacālesi iti tvam kappaṭa kura mama dhammam suṇissāmi iti
translated: Herein, don’t be a nuisance, Kappa: you, Kappa, having sat down thinking “I will listen to the Dhamma,”

original: nisīditvā mā kho pacālesi mā pacalāhi mā niddaṃ upagacchi. Mā tvaṃ upakaṇṇamhi tāḷessanti🔽taṃ niddāyamānaṃ upakaṇṇamhi kaṇṇasamīpe desanāhatthena ahaṃ mā patāḷessaṃ. Yathā
analyzed: nisīditvā mā kho pacālesi mā pacalāhi mā niddam upagacchi mā tvam upakaṇṇamhi tāḷessanti  tam niddāyamānam upakaṇṇamhi kaṇṇa samīpe desanā hatthena aham mā patāḷessam yathā
translated: don’t be a nuisance, don’t be a bother, don’t fall asleep. Don’t let me have to prod you with my staff at the ear.

original: ito paraṃ kilesappahānāya ahaṃ taṃ na ovadeyyaṃ, tathā paṭipajjāhīti attho. Na hi
analyzed: itas param kilesa pahānāya aham tam naḥ ovadeyyam tathā paṭipajjāhi iti atthaḥ na hi
translated: I won’t prod you with the staff of the Teaching at the ear, near the ear, as you are falling asleep. The meaning is: you should practice so that I will not have to advise you further for the purpose of abandoning defilements.

original: tvaṃ, kappaṭa, mattamaññāsīti tvaṃ, kappaṭa, saṅghamajjhamhi pacalāyamāno mattaṃ🔽pamāṇaṃ na vā maññasi, “ayamatidullabho khaṇo paṭiladdho, so mā upajjhagā”ti ettakampi
analyzed: tvam kappaṭa mattam aññāsi iti tvam kappaṭa saṅgha majjhamhi pacalāyamānaḥ mattam  pamāṇam na vā maññasi ayam ati dullabhaḥ khaṇo paṭiladdho saḥ mā upajjhagāti ettakam pi
translated: You don’t know your measure, Kappa: you, Kappa, being a bother in the midst of the Community, don’t know your measure,

original: na jānāsi, passa yāva ca te aparaddhanti codesi.
analyzed: na jānāsi passa yāva ca te aparaddhanti codesi
translated: don’t know your limit, thinking “This opportunity that has been obtained is very hard to obtain, don’t let it slip away,” you don’t even know that much.🔽Look how far you have strayed.

original: Evaṃ bhagavatā dvīhi gāthāhi gāḷhaṃ taṃ niggayha codanāya katāya aṭṭhivedhaviddho
analyzed: evam bhagavatā dvīhi gāthāhi gāḷham tam niggayha codanāya katāya aṭṭhi vedha viddhaḥ
translated: When the Exalted One had thus rebuked him with two verses, the Elder, as if pierced by the goad of the Exalted One,

original: viya caṇḍagajo maggaṃ otaranto viya ca sañjātasaṃvego vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapetvā nacirasseva
analyzed: viya caṇḍagajaḥ maggam otarantaḥ viya ca sañjāta saṃvegaḥ vipassanam paṭṭhapetvā nacirassa eva
translated: and as if descending a path, became remorseful. He set about the practice of insight and in no long time

original: arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: attained arahantship. Therefore it is said in the Apadana:

original: “Vinatānadiyā tīre, vihāsi purisuttamo;
analyzed: vinatā nadiyāḥ tīre vihāsi purisa uttamaḥ
translated: “On the bank of the river Vinatā, the Supreme Man dwelt;

original: Addasaṃ virajaṃ buddhaṃ, ekaggaṃ susamāhitaṃ.
analyzed: addasam virajam buddham ekaggam su samāhitam
translated: I saw the dustless Buddha, one-pointed, well-concentrated.

original: “Madhugandhassa pupphena, ketakassa ahaṃ tadā;
analyzed: madhu gandhassa pupphena ketakassa aham tadā
translated: “With a flower of the Madhu tree, of the Ketaka tree,

original: Pasannacitto sumano, buddhaseṭṭhamapūjayiṃ.
analyzed: pasanna cittaḥ su manaḥ buddha seṭṭham apūjayiṃ
translated: with a pure mind, with a glad mind, I worshipped the Best of Buddhas.

original: “Ekanavutito kappe, yaṃ pupphamabhipūjayiṃ;
analyzed: ekanavutitaḥ kappe yam puppham abhipūjayiṃ
translated: “For ninety-one eons, the flower I worshipped;

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I do not know of a bad destination, this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements are destroyed… I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”

analyzed: a jānantī sāmikam ārādhetvā tena anuññātā bhikkhunīsu pabbajitā tassāḥ gabbhini bhāvam

translated: The last of these, the last to rise,🔽Birth and death’s round now is broken, now there is no more becoming.

original: Jātimaraṇasaṃsāro, natthi dāni punabbhavo”ti. – gāthādvayaṃ abhāsi;
analyzed: jāti maraṇa saṃsāraḥ na atthi dāni punabbhavo ti gāthā dvayam abhāsi
translated: The two verses he spoke.

original: Tattha ahoti acchariyatthe nipāto. Buddhāti sabbaññubuddhā, gāravavasena bahuvacanaṃ,
analyzed: tattha aho ti acchariya atthe nipātaḥ buddhā ati sabbaññu buddhāḥ gārava vasena bahuvacanam
translated: Herein, aho is an exclamation of wonder. Buddha is the all-knowing Enlightened One, the plural form being due to respect.

original: aho acchariyā sambuddhāti attho. Dhammāti pariyattidhammena saddhiṃ nava lokuttaradhammā.
analyzed: aho acchariyā sambuddhā ati attho dhammā ati pariyatti dhammena saddhim nava lokuttara dhammā
translated: The meaning is ‘How wonderful are the Enlightened Ones! ‘ Dhamma is the nine supramundane ideas together with the ideas in the scriptures.

original: Aho no satthu sampadāti amhākaṃ satthu dasabalassa aho sampattiyo. Yatthāti yasmiṃ
analyzed: aho naḥ satthu sampadā ati amhākam satthu dasa balassa aho sampattiyaḥ yattha ati yasmin
translated: Aho no satthu sampada is ‘How perfect is our Master’s ten powers! ‘ Yattha is where.

original: satthari brahmacariyavāsena. Etādisaṃ dhammaṃ, sāvako sacchikāhitīti etādisaṃ evarūpaṃ🔽suvisuddhajjhānābhiññāparivāraṃ anavasesakilesakkhayāvahaṃ santaṃ paṇītaṃ anuttaraṃ
analyzed: satthari brahmacariya vāsena etādisam dhammam sāvakaḥ sacchikāhiti iti etādisam evarūpam  su visuddha jjhāna abhiññā parivāram anavasesa kilesa khaya āvaham santam paṇītam anuttaram
translated: In the Master’s presence, by living the life of purity. Etadisam dhamman ti etadisam evarupan ti etadisam.

original: dhammaṃ sāvakopi nāma sacchikarissati, tasmā evaṃvidhaguṇavisesādhigamahetubhūtā
analyzed: dhammam sāvakaḥ api nāma sacchikarissati tasmai evaṃvidha guṇa visesa adhigama hetu bhūtā
translated: Sāvako sacchikarissati ti even a disciple will realize such a peaceful, sublime, unsurpassed Dhamma, which is accompanied by quite purified meditation and direct-knowledge, and which brings about the exhaustion of all the defilements without remainder. Therefore, being the cause for the acquisition of such a special quality,

original: aho acchariyā buddhā bhagavanto, acchariyā dhammaguṇā, acchariyā amhākaṃ satthu sampattiyoti
analyzed: aho acchariyāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ acchariyāḥ dhamma guṇāḥ acchariyāḥ amhākam satthu sampattiyaḥ ti
translated: How wonderful are the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones! How wonderful are the special qualities of the Dhamma! How wonderful is the prosperity of our Teacher!

original: ratanattayassa guṇādhimuttiṃ pavedesīti. Dhammasampattikittaneneva hi saṅghasuppaṭipatti kittitā hotīti.
analyzed: ratanattayassa guṇa adhimuttim pavedesi iti dhamma sampatti kittanena iva hi saṅgha suppaṭipatti kittitā hoti iti
translated: He proclaims his own conviction in the special qualities of the Triple Gem. For the special qualities of the Sangha are proclaimed by the special qualities of the Dhamma.

original: Evaṃ sādhāraṇavasena dassitaṃ dhammassa sacchikiriyaṃ idāni attupanāyikaṃ katvā dassento
analyzed: evam sādhāraṇa vasena dassitam dhammassa sacchikiriyam idāni attupanāyikam katvā dassento
translated: Having thus shown the realization of the Dhamma in a general way, the Elder now shows it in a personal way, saying:

original: “asaṅkheyyesū”ti gāthamāha. Tattha asaṅkheyyesūti gaṇanapathaṃ vītivattesu mahākappesu.
analyzed: asaṅkheyyesu iti gātham āha tattha asaṅkheyyesu iti gaṇana patham vītivattesu mahā kappesu
translated: In countless eons past, etc. Herein, in countless eons past means in eons that are beyond reckoning.

original: Sakkāyāti pañcupādānakkhandhā. Te hi paramatthato vijjamānadhammasamūhatāya “sakkāyā”ti
analyzed: sakkāya ati pañca upādāna kkhandhāḥ te hi paramatthataḥ vijjamāna dhamma samūha tāya sakkāya ati
translated: Aggregates of personality: the five aggregates as objects of clinging. For these are called “aggregates of personality” because they are a collection of dhammas that exist in the ultimate sense.

original: vuccanti. Ahūti nivattanūpāyassa anadhigatattā anapagatā ahesuṃ. Tesamayaṃ pacchimako
analyzed: vuccanti ahu iti nivatta nu upāyassa an adhigata ttā an apagatāḥ ahesum pacchimako
translated: They were: the means of escape had not yet been discovered. They had not yet departed. This is the last, the final, the highest.

original: carimoyaṃ samussayoti yasmā ayaṃ sabbapacchimako, tato eva carimo, tasmā jātimaraṇasahito
analyzed: carimaḥ ayam samussayaḥ ti yasmai ayam sabba pacchimako tatas eva carimaḥ tasmā jāti maraṇa sahito
translated: Since this is the last, the final, the highest, it is accompanied by birth and death.

original: khandhādipaṭipāṭisaññito saṃsāro idāni āyatiṃ punabbhavābhāvato punabbhavo natthi,
analyzed: khandha ādi paṭipāṭi saññitaḥ saṃsāraḥ idāni āyatim punabbhava abhāvato punabbhavaḥ natthi
translated: Samsara, which is the succession of the aggregates, etc., is now no more, because there is no further becoming.

original: ayamantimā jātīti attho.
analyzed: ayam antimā jātī iti attho
translated: The meaning is: this is the last birth.

original: Kumārakassapattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kumārakassapa thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Kumārakassapa is finished.

original: 2. Dhammapālattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: dhammapāla thera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Verses of the Elder Dhammapāla

original: Yo have daharo bhikkhūti āyasmato dhammapālattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: yaḥ have daharaḥ bhikkhu iti āyasmataḥ dhammapāla ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: “Though young, the monk who has gone forth into homelessness,” etc. These verses were spoken by the Elder Dhammapāla. How did this come about? This elder, too, in the time of the former Buddhas,

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto atthadassissa bhagavato kāle kulagehe
analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinantaḥ atthadassissa bhagavato kāle kulagehe
translated: had fulfilled the perfections and had accumulated much merit in various existences. In the dispensation of the Blessed One, the Visionary, he was reborn in a certain brahmin family

original: nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto kenacideva karaṇīyena vanantaṃ upagato satthāraṃ disvā
analyzed: nibbattitvā viññutam patto kenacid eva karaṇīyena vanantam upagataḥ satthāram disvā
translated: in Avanti. When he had reached maturity, he went to the forest on some business and saw the Teacher.

original: pasannamānaso pilakkhaphalamadāsi. So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto
analyzed: pasanna mānasaḥ pilakkha phalam adāsi saḥ tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ
translated: Delighted in mind, he offered him a pilukka fruit. By that meritorious deed he transmigrated among gods and humans

original: imasmiṃ buddhuppāde satthari parinibbute avantiraṭṭhe brāhmaṇakule nibbattitvā dhammapāloti
analyzed: imasmin buddhuppāde satthari parinibbute avantiraṭṭhe brāhmaṇa kule nibbattitvā dhamma pālo ti
translated: and was finally reborn in the dispensation of the present Buddha in a brahmin family in Avanti.

original: laddhanāmo vayappatto takkasilaṃ gantvā sippaṃ uggahetvā paṭinivattento antarāmagge
analyzed: laddha nāmaḥ vaya pattaḥ takkasilam gantvā sippam uggahetvā paṭinivattentaḥ antarāmagge
translated: When he had reached the age of reason, he went to Takkasilā to learn a craft. On his return journey,🔽

original: ekasmiṃ vihāre aññataraṃ theraṃ disvā tassa santike dhammaṃ sutvā paṭiladdhasaddho
analyzed: ekasmin vihāre aññataram theram disvā tassa santike dhammam sutvā paṭiladdha saddho
translated: When he had reached years of discretion, he went to Takkasilā and learned a craft. On his return journey he saw an elder in a certain monastery. He listened to the Dhamma from his lips, and faith arose within him.

original: pabbajitvā vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā chaḷabhiñño ahosi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: pabbajitvā vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā chaḍabhiññaḥ ahosi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: He received the going forth and the higher ordination, and after developing insight, he attained the six superknowledges. As it is said in the Apadāna:

original: “Vanantare buddhaṃ disvā, atthadassiṃ mahāyasaṃ;
analyzed: vanantare buddham disvā attha dassim mahā āyasam
translated: “In the forest I saw the Buddha, the bestower of welfare, of great glory;

original: Pasannacitto sumano, pilakkhassādadiṃ phalaṃ.🔽“Aṭṭhārase kappasate, yaṃ phalamadadiṃ tadā;
analyzed: pasanna cittaḥ sumanaḥ pilakkhassa adadim phalam  aṭṭhārase kappa sate yam phalam adadim tadā
translated: With serene mind and joyful heart I offered him a fruit of the pilakkha tree.🔽“For eighteen hundred eons I do not recall a state of woe;

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, phaladānassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi phala dānassa idam phalam
translated: This is the fruit of offering the fruit.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.🔽Chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā samāpattisukhena vītināmento ekadivasaṃ tasmiṃ vihāre dve
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti  pana hutvā samāpatti sukhena eka divasam tasmin vihāre dve
translated: “My defilements are destroyed … I have fulfilled the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: sāmaṇere rukkhagge pupphāni ocinante ārūḷhasākhāya bhaggāya patante disvā thero iddhānubhāvena
analyzed: sāmaṇere rukkha agge pupphāni ocinante ārūḷha sākhāya bhaggāya patante disvā theraḥ iddha anubhāvena
translated: Now when he had attained the six superknowledges, he spent his time in the bliss of concentration. One day he saw two novices in that monastery plucking flowers in a tree-top. The branch broke and they fell down. The elder, by his supernormal power,

original: hatthena gahetvā arogeyeva bhūmiyaṃ ṭhapetvā tesaṃ sāmaṇerānaṃ dhammaṃ desento –
analyzed: hatthena gahetvā arogeyā iva bhūmiyam ṭhapetvā tesam sāmaṇerānam dhammaṃ desento
translated: and he placed them on the ground, and he taught the Dhamma to those novices,

original: “Yo have daharo bhikkhu, yuñjati buddhasāsane;
analyzed: yaḥ have daharaḥ bhikkhu yuñjati buddha sāsane
translated: “Whoever, though young, is diligent in the Dispensation of the Buddha,

original: Jāgaro sa hi suttesu, amoghaṃ tassa jīvitaṃ.
analyzed: jāgaraḥ sa hi suttesu amogham tassa jīvitam
translated: He is awake among those who are asleep, his life is not fruitless.

original: “Tasmā saddhañca sīlañca, pasādaṃ dhammadassanaṃ;
analyzed: tasmai saddhañca sīlañca pasādam dhamma dassanam
translated: “Therefore the wise one should be devoted to faith, virtue, serenity, and the vision of the Dhamma,

original: Anuyuñjetha medhāvī, saraṃ buddhāna sāsana”nti. – imā dve gāthā abhāsi;🔽Tattha yoti aniyamavacanaṃ. Haveti daḷhatthe nipāto. Daharoti taruṇo. Bhikkhatīti🔽bhikkhu. Yuñjatīti ghaṭati vāyamati. Jāgaroti jāgaraṇadhammasamannāgato. Suttesūti
analyzed: anuyuñjetha medhāvī saram buddhāna sāsananti imāḥ dve gāthāḥ abhāsi  tattha yaḥ ti aniyama vacanam have iti daḷha atthe nipātaḥ taruṇaḥ bhikkhati iti  bhikkhu yuñjati iti ghaṭati vāyamati jāgaroti jāgaraṇa dhamma samannāgato suttesu iti
translated: The Buddha’s Dispensation is a refuge.”

original: supantesu. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti yo bhikkhu daharova samāno taruṇo “tathāhaṃ pacchā vuḍḍhakāle
analyzed: supantesu idam vuttam hoti yaḥ bhikkhu daharaḥ iva samānaḥ taruṇaḥ tathā aham pacchā vuḍḍhakāle
translated: Herein, yo is a particle of indeclinable class. Have is a word of emphasis. Young means tender. A bhikkhu is one who begs. Is diligent means he strives and exerts himself. Is awake means he is endowed with the state of being awake. Among those who are asleep means among those who are sleeping. This is what is said: Whatever bhikkhu, though young, tender,🔽not thinking “Later, when I am old,

original: jānissāmī”ti acintetvā buddhānaṃ sāsane appamādapaṭipattiyaṃ yuñjati samathavipassanābhāvanāya
analyzed: jānissāmi iti a cintetvā buddhānam sāsane appamāda paṭipattiyam yuñjati samatha vipassanā bhāvanāya
translated: I will know,” is diligent in the Dispensation of the Buddhas in the practice of heedfulness in the development of serenity and insight,

original: yogaṃ karoti, so suttesu avijjāniddāya suttesu pamattesu saddhādijāgaradhammasamannāgamena
analyzed: yogam karoti saḥ suttesu avijjā niddāya suttesu pamattesu saddhā ādi jāgara dhamma samannāgamena
translated: He is watchful in the sense of being awake to the states of faith, etc., which are the opposite of the states of ignorance, etc., in the texts.

original: jāgaro, tato eva attahitaparahitapāripūriyā amoghaṃ avañjhaṃ tassa jīvitaṃ, yasmā
analyzed: jāgaro tatas eva atta hita para hita pāripūriyā amogham avañjham tassa jīvitam yasmā
translated: And because of that he lives a life that is not fruitless, not barren, in that he fulfills his own and others’ welfare.

original: ca etadevaṃ, tasmā saddhañca “atthi kammaṃ atthi kammavipāko”tiādinayappavattaṃ kammaphalasaddhañca,
analyzed: ca etat evam tasmā saddham ca atthi kammaṃ atthi kamma vipākaḥ iti ādi naya ppavattam kamma phala saddham ca
translated: And because he does so, he is endowed with faith that occurs in the mode of the expression “There is action, there is result of action” ,

original: saddhūpanibandhattā sīlassa tadupanissayaṃ catupārisuddhisīlañca, “sammāsambuddho
analyzed: saddhu upanibandha ttā sīlassa tad upanissayam catu pārisuddhi sīlam ca sammāsambuddhaḥ
translated: and with virtue based on that faith, which is a support for virtue, and with the four kinds of purification of virtue,

original: bhagavā, svākhāto dhammo, suppaṭipanno saṅgho”ti evaṃ pavattaratanattayappasādañca,
analyzed: bhagavā su ākhātaḥ dhammo suppaṭipanno saṅghaḥ ti evam pavatta ratana ttaya pasādam ca
translated: and with the confidence born of faith in the Triple Gem, which occurs thus: “The Blessed One is the Arahant, Perfectly Enlightened One … The Dhamma … The Saṅgha … has entered on the good way” ,

original: vipassanāpaññāsahitāya maggapaññāya pariññādivasena catusaccadhammadassanañca medhāvī
analyzed: vipassanā paññā sahitāya magga paññāya pariññā ādi vasena catu sacca dhamma dassanañca medhāvī
translated: and with the seeing of the four noble truths as they actually are with the wisdom of the path accompanied by insight, in the modes of full understanding, etc.,

original: dhammojapaññāya samannāgato bhikkhu buddhānaṃ sāsanaṃ ovādaṃ anusiṭṭhiṃ anussaranto
analyzed: dhammoja paññāya samannāgataḥ bhikkhu buddhānam sāsanam ovādam anusiṭṭhim anussarantaḥ
translated: the wise bhikkhu, endowed with understanding consisting in the knowledge of the Dhamma, recollects the Teacher’s admonition, instruction, and training,

original: ādittampi attano sīsaṃ ajjhupekkhitvā anuyuñjetha, tattha anuyogaṃ ātappaṃ kareyyāti attho.
analyzed: ādittam pi attanaḥ sīsam ajjhupekkhitvā anuyuñjetha tattha anuyogam ātappam kareyya ati attho
translated: and having looked on at his own head being cut off, he should still pursue the matter. The meaning is that he should still pursue the matter and not be slack.

original: Dhammapālattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dhammapāla thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Dhammapāla is finished.

original: 3. Brahmālittheragāthāvaṇṇanā🔽Kassindriyāni samathaṅgatānīti āyasmato brahmālittherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi
analyzed: brahmālitthera gāthā vaṇṇanā  samathaṅgatāni iti āyasmataḥ brahmāli ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi
translated: Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Brahmadatta

original: purimabuddhesu katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭūpanissayaṃ kusalaṃ upacinanto
analyzed: purima buddhesu kata adhikāraḥ tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭu upanissayam kusalam upacinantaḥ
translated: “Whose faculties are stilled” . This verse was spoken by the Elder Brahmadatta. How did it originate? This elder, too, in the time of the former Buddhas, had performed works of merit and had made his resolve in their presence.🔽In the dispensation of the Buddha Vipassi he was reborn in a certain family of Khattiyas. When he had grown up, he went forth in the Dispensation of the Buddha Vipassi to homelessness.

original: vipassissa bhagavato kāle kulagehe nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto ekadivasaṃ satthāraṃ
analyzed: vipassissa bhagavato kāle kula gehe nibbattitvā viññutam pattaḥ eka divasam satthāram
translated: One day, as he was going about on his alms round, he saw the Buddha Vipassi.

original: piṇḍāya carantaṃ disvā pasannamānaso vanditvā pādaphalaṃ adāsi. Satthā anumodanaṃ🔽vatvā pakkāmi. So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde
analyzed: piṇḍāya carantam disvā pasanna mānasaḥ vanditvā pāda phalam adāsi satthā anumodanam  vatvā pakkāmi saḥ tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde
translated: He was filled with joy, paid obeisance to the Buddha, and offered him a handful of rice-grains. The Buddha accepted the offering, pronounced the words of thanksgiving, and departed.🔽As a result of this act of merit, he was reborn in the heavenly worlds and among human beings. In the dispensation of the present Buddha he was reborn in the Brahmana caste in the Kosala country. He received the name Brahmadatta.

original: kosalaraṭṭhe brāhmaṇakule nibbattitvā brahmālīti laddhanāmo viññutaṃ patto hetusampattiyā
analyzed: kosala raṭṭhe brāhmaṇa kule nibbattitvā brahmālī iti laddha nāmaḥ viññutam pattaḥ hetu sampattiyā
translated: When he had grown up, he went forth into the homeless state in the Dispensation of the Buddha. By reason of his former merit, he was endowed with the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: codiyamāno saṃsāre sañjātasaṃvego tādisena kalyāṇamittasannissayena buddhasāsane
analyzed: codiyamānaḥ saṃsāre sañjāta saṃvegaḥ tādisena kalyāṇa mitta sannissayena buddha sāsane
translated: He went forth into homelessness in the Dispensation of the Buddha under the patronage of such a good friend,

original: pabbajitvā patirūpakammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā araññe viharanto ñāṇassa paripākagatattā
analyzed: pabbajitvā patirūpa kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā araññe viharantaḥ ñāṇassa paripāka gata ttā
translated: and while living in the forest he developed insight and attained the six kinds of direct knowledge.

original: nacirasseva vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā chaḷabhiñño ahosi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: nacirassa iva vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā chaḍabhiññaḥ ahosi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: This is how it is said in the Apadāna:

original: “Suvaṇṇavaṇṇaṃ sambuddhaṃ, āhutīnaṃ paṭiggahaṃ;
analyzed: suvaṇṇa vaṇṇam sambuddham āhutīnam paṭiggaham
translated: “The One of Golden Beauty, the Fully Enlightened, the Receiver of Offerings,

original: Rathiyaṃ paṭipajjantaṃ, pādaphalaṃ adāsahaṃ.🔽“Ekanavutito kappe, yaṃ phalaṃ adadiṃ tadā;
analyzed: rathiyam paṭipajjantam pāda phalam adāsaham  ekanavutitaḥ kappe yam phalam adadim tadā
translated: I gave a foot-washing to as he walked along the road.🔽“For ninety-one eons I did not go to a lower realm,

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, phaladānassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi phala dānassa idam phalam
translated: because of the fruit of that gift of a foot-washing.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements are destroyed … and the Buddha’s Dispensation has been done.”

original: Chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā maggasukhena phalasukhena vītināmento ekadivasaṃ padhānapariggāhakena therena tasmiṃ araññāyatane bhikkhū uddissa vuttaṃ padhānānuyogaṃ pariggaṇhanto –
analyzed: chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā magga sukhena phala sukhena vītināmento eka divasam padhāna pariggāhakena therena tasmim arañña āyatane bhikkhū uddissa vuttam padhāna anuyogam pariggaṇhanto
translated: And when he had attained the six kinds of direct knowledge, he spent his time in the bliss of the paths and the bliss of the fruits. One day he was listening to a senior elder who was giving a discourse on the practice of meditation to a number of bhikkhus in that forest abode.

original: “Kassindriyāni samathaṅgatāni, assā yathā sārathinā sudantā;
analyzed: kassindriyāni samathaṅgatāni assā yathā sārathinā su dantā
translated: “Whose faculties are stilled, like horses well tamed by a charioteer?

original: Pahīnamānassa anāsavassa, devāpi kassa pihayanti tādino.
analyzed: pahīna mānassa anāsavassa devāḥ api kassa pihayanti tādinaḥ
translated: Whose pride is abandoned, who is without pollutants: whom do the gods envy?

original: “Mayhindriyāni samathaṅgatāni, assā yathā sārathinā sudantā;
analyzed: mayhi indriyāni samathaṅgatāni assā yathā sārathinā su dantā
translated: “My faculties are stilled, like horses well tamed by a charioteer.

original: Pahīnamānassa anāsavassa, devāpi mayhaṃ pihayanti tādino”ti. –
analyzed: pahīna mānassa anāsavassa devāḥ api mayham pihayanti tādinaḥ ti
translated: My pride is abandoned, I am without pollutants: the gods envy me.”

original: Gāthādvayaṃ abhāsi.
analyzed: gāthā dvayam abhāsi
translated: He spoke these two verses.

original: Tassattho – imasmiṃ araññāyatane vasantesu bhikkhūsu kassa bhikkhuno therassa vā🔽navassa vā majjhimassa vā chekena sārathinā sudantā assā viya manacchaṭṭhāni indriyāni
analyzed: tassa atthaḥ imasmin arañña āyatane vasantesu bhikkhūsu kassa bhikkhuno therassa vā  navassa vā majjhimassa vā chekena sārathinā su dantā assā viya manacchaṭṭhāni indriyāni
translated: Their meaning is this. Among the bhikkhus who dwell in this forest grove, in which elder bhikkhu,

original: samathaṃ dantabhāvaṃ nibbisevanabhāvaṃ gatāni. Kassa navavidhampi mānaṃ pahāya ṭhitattā🔽pahīnamānassa catunnampi āsavānaṃ abhāvena anāsavassa iṭṭhādīsu tādilakkhaṇappattiyā
analyzed: samatham danta bhāvam nibbisevana bhāvam gatāni kassa navavidham pi mānam pahāya ṭhita ttā  pahīna mānassa catunnam pi āsavānaṃ abhāvena anāsavassa iṭṭha ādīsu ta ādi lakkhaṇa ppattiyā
translated: whether senior, junior, or of middle standing, have the faculties, which are the sixth part of the mind, gone to stillness, to the state of being tamed, to the state of being free from wandering, like horses well tamed by a charioteer?

original: tādino devāpi pihayanti manussāpi sammāpaṭipattidassanādinā ca ādarena patthentīti.
analyzed: ta ādinaḥ devā api pihayanti manussā api sammā paṭipatti dassana ādinā ca ādarena patthenti iti
translated: In which bhikkhu, having abandoned the nine kinds of pride, do the gods envy him, and do human beings also envy him, because they long for him with reverence, seeing that he is endowed with right practice, etc.?

original: Tattha ca gāthāyaṃ purimaḍḍhena anāgāmimaggādhigamo puṭṭho, anāgāminopi hi indriyāni
analyzed: tattha ca gāthā ayam purimaḍḍhena anāgāmi magga adhigamaḥ puṭṭhaḥ anāgāminaḥ api hi indriyāni
translated: And here in the verse the first half line answers the question about the attainment of the non-return path, for the faculties of a non-returner

original: pahīnakāmarāgabyāpādatāya samathaṃ nibbisevanataṃ gatāni honti. Itarena arahattamaggapaṭilābho,
analyzed: pahīna kāma rāga byāpāda tāya samatham nibbisevana tam gatāni honti itarena arahatta magga paṭilābho
translated: have gone to the state of being well developed by the abandoning of lust and hatred for sensual desires. The second half line answers the question about the attainment of the Arahant path,

original: arahā hi “pahīnamāno anāsavo tādī”ti ca vuccati.
analyzed: arahā hi pahīna mānaḥ anāsavaḥ tādī iti ca vuccati
translated: for the Arahant is called one who has abandoned conceit and is without cankers.

original: Athāyasmā brahmāli padhānapariggāhakena vuttaṃ “kassindriyānī”ti gāthaṃ paccanubhāsi.
analyzed: atha āyasmai brahmāli padhāna pariggāhakena vuttam kassa indriyāni iti gātham paccanubhāsi
translated: Then the venerable Brahmadatta answered the question asked by Padhanapagg aha with the verse “Whose are the faculties? “

original: Tadatthaṃ attūpanāyikavasena vissajjento “mayhindriyānī”tiādikāya dutiyagāthāya aññaṃ
analyzed: tad attham attu upanāyika vasena vissajjentaḥ mayhi indriyāni iti ādikāya dutiya gāthāya aññam
translated: And in order to answer the question about the meaning of that verse he answered with the second verse beginning “Mine are the faculties”

original: byākāsi, tattha mayhindriyānīti mama cakkhādīni indriyāni. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.
analyzed: tattha mayhindriyāni iti mama cakkha ādīni indriyāni sesam vutta nayam eva
translated: and so on. Herein, mine are the faculties means my eye and the rest are the faculties. The rest is as already stated.

original: Brahmālittheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: brahmāli tthera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the verses of the Elder Brahmadatta is ended.

original: 4. Mogharājattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
translated: The verses of the Elder Mogharaja

original: Chavipāpaka cittabhaddakāti āyasmato mogharājattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi
analyzed: chavipāpaka cittabhaddaka ati āyasmataḥ mogharāja ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi
translated: Chavipāpaka cittabhaddakā . This was said by the Elder Mogharaja.

original: purimabuddhesu katādhikāro padumuttarassa bhagavato kāle kulagehe nibbattitvā viññutaṃ
analyzed: purima buddhesu kata adhikāraḥ padumuttarassa bhagavato kāle kula gehe nibbattitvā viññutam
translated: In the time of the Supremely Enlightened Padumuttara he was reborn in a certain family, and when he grew up he

original: patto ekadivasaṃ satthu santike dhammaṃ suṇanto satthāraṃ ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ lūkhacīvaradharānaṃ
analyzed: patto eka divasam satthu santike dhammaṃ suṇantaḥ satthāram ekam bhikkhum lūkha cīvara dharānam
translated: heard the Dhamma from the Teacher. Seeing the Teacher place a certain monk in the foremost position among those who wore coarse robes,

original: aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapentaṃ disvā taṃ ṭhānantaraṃ ākaṅkhanto paṇidhānaṃ katvā tattha tattha🔽bhave puññāni karonto atthadassissa bhagavato kāle brāhmaṇakule nibbattitvā brāhmaṇānaṃ
analyzed: agga ṭṭhāne ṭhapentam disvā tam ṭhāna antaram ākaṅkhantaḥ paṇidhānam katvā tattha tattha  bhave puññāni karontaḥ atthadassissa bhagavato kāle brāhmaṇa kule nibbattitvā brāhmaṇānam
translated: he desired that very same position for himself, and made his Earnest Wish. Thereafter,🔽making merit in various states of existence, he was reborn in the time of the Supremely Enlightened Atthadassī in a certain Brahman family.

original: vijjāsippesu nipphattiṃ gato brāhmaṇamāṇave vijjāsippāni sikkhāpento ekadivasaṃ atthadassiṃ
analyzed: vijjā sippesu nipphattim gataḥ brāhmaṇa māṇave vijjā sippāni sikkhāpento eka divasam attha dassim
translated: When he had mastered the sciences and accomplishments of the Brahmans, he taught the sciences and accomplishments to Brahman youths. One day he saw the Supremely Enlightened Atthadassī

original: bhagavantaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaparivutaṃ gacchantaṃ disvā pasannamānaso pañcapatiṭṭhitena
analyzed: bhagavantam bhikkhu saṅgha parivutam gacchantam disvā pasanna mānasaḥ pañca patiṭṭhitena
translated: walking along with the company of the Brethren. His heart was filled with joy, and he paid obeisance to the Teacher with the Five Rests,

original: vanditvā sirasi añjaliṃ katvā “yāvatā rūpino sattā”tiādinā chahi gāthāhi abhitthavitvā
analyzed: vanditvā sirasi añjalim katvā yāvatā rūpino sattāti ādinā chahi gāthāhi abhitthavitvā
translated: and with hands clasped above his head, he extolled the Teacher with six stanzas, beginning, “As many beings as there are in the world of men and gods.”

original: bhājanaṃ pūretvā madhuṃ upanāmesi. Satthā madhuṃ paṭiggahetvā anumodanaṃ akāsi.
analyzed: bhājanam pūretvā madhum upanāmesi satthā madhum paṭiggahetvā anumodanam akāsi
translated: Then he filled a vessel with honey and presented it to the Teacher. The Teacher accepted the honey and pronounced a blessing.

original: So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto kassapassa bhagavato kāle kaṭṭhavāhanassa
analyzed: so tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ kassapassa bhagavataḥ kāle kaṭṭhavāhanassa
translated: As a result of that meritorious deed, he passed from birth to birth in the worlds of the gods and men, and in the dispensation of the Master Kassapa he was born as the son of King Kaṭṭhavāhana.

original: nāma rañño amacco hutvā tena satthu ānayanatthaṃ purisasahassena pesito satthu santikaṃ🔽gantvā dhammaṃ sutvā paṭiladdhasaddho pabbajitvā vīsativassasahassāni samaṇadhammaṃ
analyzed: nāma raññaḥ amaccaḥ hutvā tena satthu ānayana attham purisa sahassena pesitaḥ satthu santikam  gantvā dhammam sutvā paṭiladdha saddhaḥ pabbajitvā vīsati vassa sahassāni samaṇa dhammaṃ
translated: He was sent by the king with a thousand men to invite the Master to a meal.🔽He went to the Master, heard the Dhamma, and became a monk.

original: katvā tato cuto ekaṃ buddhantaraṃ sugatīsuyeva parivattento imasmiṃ buddhuppāde brāhmaṇakule
analyzed: katvā tatas cutas ekam buddha antaram sugatīsuyā iva parivattentaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde brāhmaṇa kule
translated: For twenty thousand years he practiced the duties of an ascetic, and after death he passed through the happy destinies for a period of one Buddha interval.🔽In the dispensation of the present Buddha he was reborn in a brahmin family, and received the name Mogharāja.

original: nibbattitvā mogharājāti laddhanāmo bāvarībrāhmaṇassa santike uggahitasippo saṃvegajāto
analyzed: nibbattitvā mogharājā ati laddha nāmaḥ bāvarī brāhmaṇassa santike uggahita sippaḥ saṃvega jāto
translated: He learned the Vedas from the brahmin Bāvari, and then, filled with disgust,

original: tāpasapabbajjaṃ pabbajitvā tāpasasahassaparivāro ajitādīhi saddhiṃ satthu santikaṃ
analyzed: tāpasa pabbajjam pabbajitvā tāpasa sahassa parivāraḥ ajita ādīhi saddhim satthu santikam
translated: he went forth into the homeless state in the ascetic order. He was surrounded by a thousand ascetics, and was sent by Ajita and the others to the Master.

original: pesito tesaṃ pannarasamo hutvā pañhe pucchitvā pañhavissajjanapariyosāne arahattaṃ
analyzed: pesitaḥ tesam pannarasamaḥ hutvā pañhe pucchitvā pañha vissajjana pariyosāne arahattam
translated: He was the fifteenth of the group, and after asking his question, he attained arahatship at the conclusion of the Master’s reply.

original: pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: Therefore it is said in the Apadana:

original: “Atthadassī tu bhagavā, sayambhū aparājito;
analyzed: attha dassī tu bhagavā sayambhū aparājitaḥ
translated: “The Master, the Seer of Truth, the Self-becoming, the Invincible,

original: Bhikkhusaṅghaparibyūḷho, rathiyaṃ paṭipajjatha.
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅgha paribyūḷhaḥ rathiyam paṭipajjatha
translated: You should go forth on the streets,🔽Surrounded by your disciples.

original: “Sissehi samparivuto, gharamhā abhinikkhamiṃ;
analyzed: sissehi samparivutaḥ gharamhā abhinikkhamiṃ
translated: Surrounded by my disciples, I went forth from the house.

original: Nikkhamitvānahaṃ tattha, addasaṃ lokanāyakaṃ.
analyzed: nikkhamitvā an aham tattha addasam loka nāyakam
translated: Having gone forth, I saw the Leader of the world.

original: “Abhivādiya sambuddhaṃ, sire katvāna añjaliṃ;
analyzed: sambuddham sire katvāna añjalim
translated: Having paid homage to the Buddha, raising my joined palms,

original: Sakaṃ cittaṃ pasādetvā, santhaviṃ lokanāyakaṃ.
analyzed: sakam cittam pasādetvā santhavim loka nāyakam
translated: I gladdened the Leader of the world, having delighted my own mind.

original: “Yāvatā rūpino sattā, arūpī vā asaññino;
analyzed: yāvatā rūpino sattāḥ arūpī vā asaññino
translated: As far as there are beings with form, formless, or perceptionless,

original: Sabbe te tava ñāṇamhi, anto honti samogadhā.
analyzed: sabbe te tava ñāṇamhi antar honti samogadhā
translated: All of them are within your knowledge, completely encompassed.

original: “Sukhumacchikajālena, udakaṃ yo parikkhipe;
analyzed: udakam yaḥ parikkhipe
translated: Just as one who would filter water with a fine mesh strainer

original: Ye keci udake pāṇā, antojāle bhavanti te.
analyzed: ye keci udake pāṇāḥ antojāle bhavanti te
translated: would catch whatever living beings there are in the water in the strainer,

original: “Yesañca cetanā atthi, rūpino ca arūpino;
analyzed: yesam ca cetanā atthi rūpino ca arūpino
translated: So too, all those who have intentions, whether with form or formless,

original: Sabbe te tava ñāṇamhi, anto honti samogadhā.
analyzed: sabbe te tava ñāṇamhi antar honti samogadhā
translated: all of them are within your knowledge, completely encompassed.

original: “Samuddharasimaṃ lokaṃ, andhakārasamākulaṃ;
analyzed: samuddharas imam lokam andhakāra samākulam
translated: The world with its mountains and oceans, enveloped in darkness,

original: Tava dhammaṃ suṇitvāna, kaṅkhāsotaṃ taranti te.
analyzed: tava dhammam suṇitvāna kaṅkhā sotam taranti te
translated: having heard your Dhamma, they cross over the flood of doubt.

original: “Avijjānivute loke, andhakārena otthaṭe;
analyzed: avijjānivute loke andhakārena otthaṭe
translated: In the world enveloped in ignorance, shrouded in darkness,

original: Tava ñāṇamhi jotante, andhakārā padhaṃsitā.
analyzed: tava ñāṇamhi jotante andhakārā padhaṃsitā
translated: when your knowledge shines, the darkness vanishes.

original: “Tuvaṃ cakkhūsi sabbesaṃ, mahātamapanūdano;
analyzed: tuvam cakkhūsi sabbesam mahā tama panūdanaḥ
translated: “You are the eye of all, the remover of the great darkness;

original: Tava dhammaṃ suṇitvāna, nibbāyati bahujjano.
analyzed: tava dhammam suṇitvāna nibbāyati bahujjanaḥ
translated: Having heard your Dhamma, many people attain Nibbāna.

original: “Puṭakaṃ pūrayitvāna, madhukhuddamaneḷakaṃ;
analyzed: puṭakam
translated: Having filled a box with honey, molasses, and oil,

original: Ubho hatthehi paggayha, upanesiṃ mahesino.
analyzed: ubho hatthehi paggayha upanesim mahesinaḥ
translated: I raised it with both hands and presented it to the Great Sage.

original: “Paṭiggaṇhi mahāvīro, sahatthena mahā isi;
analyzed: paṭiggaṇhi mahāvīraḥ sa hatthena mahā isi
translated: The Great Hero, the Great Sage, accepted it with his own hands;

original: Bhuñjitvā tañca sabbaññū, vehāsaṃ nabhamuggami.
analyzed: bhuñjitvā tat ca sabbaññū vehāsam nabham uggami
translated: Having eaten it all, the Omniscient One rose up into the sky.

original: “Antalikkhe ṭhito satthā, atthadassī narāsabho;
analyzed: antalikkhe ṭhitaḥ satthā attha dassī narāsabhaḥ
translated: Standing in the sky, the Teacher, the Seer of the Truth, the Best of Men,

original: Mama cittaṃ pasādento, imā gāthā abhāsatha.
analyzed: mama cittam pasādentaḥ imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāsatha
translated: In order to gladden my mind, spoke these verses:

original: “Yenidaṃ thavitaṃ ñāṇaṃ, buddhaseṭṭho ca thomito;
analyzed: yena idam thavitam ñāṇam buddha seṭṭho ca
translated: “By this knowledge that has been developed, and by praising the Best of Buddhas,

original: Tena cittappasādena, duggatiṃ so na gacchati.
analyzed: tena citta ppasādena duggatim saḥ na gacchati
translated: By this gladdening of mind, he will not go to a bad destination.

original: “Catuddasañca khattuṃ so, devarajjaṃ karissati;
analyzed: catuddasam ca khattum saḥ deva rajjam karissati
translated: Fourteen times he will rule the kingdom of the gods;

original: Pathabyā rajjaṃ aṭṭhasataṃ, vasudhaṃ āvasissati.
analyzed: pathabyā rajjam aṭṭhasatam vasudham āvasissati
translated: On earth he will rule for eight hundred years.

original: “Pañceva satakkhattuñca, cakkavattī bhavissati;
analyzed: pañca iva sata khattum ca cakkavattī bhavissati
translated: Five hundred times he will be a wheel-turning monarch;

original: Padesarajjaṃ asaṅkheyyaṃ, mahiyā kārayissati.
analyzed: padesa rajjam asaṅkheyyam mahiyā kārayissati
translated: He will rule over many kingdoms on earth.

original: “Ajjhāyako mantadharo, tiṇṇaṃ vedāna pāragū;
analyzed: ajjhāyakaḥ manta dharaḥ tiṇṇam vedāna pāragū
translated: A reciter, a master of the Vedas, he will perfect the three Vedas;

original: Gotamassa bhagavato, sāsane pabbajissati.
analyzed: gotamassa bhagavato sāsane pabbajissati
translated: will go forth in the Dispensation of the Blessed One Gotama.

original: “Gambhīraṃ nipuṇaṃ atthaṃ, ñāṇena vicinissati;
analyzed: gambhīram nipuṇam attham ñāṇena vicinissati
translated: He will investigate with his knowledge the profound and subtle meaning;

original: Mogharājāti nāmena, hessati satthu sāvako.
analyzed: mogharājā ati nāmena hessati satthu sāvako
translated: he will be a disciple of the Teacher named Mogha-Rajah.

original: “Tīhi vijjāhi sampannaṃ, katakiccamanāsavaṃ;
analyzed: tīhi vijjāhi sampannam kata kiccam anāsavam
translated: Endowed with the three knowledges, his work done, his effluents ended,

original: Gotamo satthavāhaggo, etadagge ṭhapessati.
analyzed: gotamaḥ satthavāha aggaḥ etad agge ṭhapessati
translated: Gotama, the Leader of the Herd, will place him in the foremost position.

original: “Hitvā mānusakaṃ yogaṃ, chetvāna bhavabandhanaṃ;
analyzed: hitvā mānusakam yogam bhava bandhanam
translated: Having abandoned the human yoke, having cut off the fetters of existence,

original: Sabbāsave pariññāya, viharāmi anāsavo.
analyzed: sabba āsave pariññāya viharāmi anāsavaḥ
translated: having fully understood all the effluents, I live effluent-free.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.🔽Arahattaṃ pana patvā satthalūkhaṃ suttalūkhaṃ rajanalūkhanti visesena tividhenapi🔽lūkhena samannāgataṃ paṃsukūlaṃ dhāresi. Tena naṃ satthā lūkhacīvaradharānaṃ aggaṭṭhāne
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti  arahattam pana patvā sattha lūkham sutta lūkham rajana lūkhanti visesena tividhena api  lūkhena samannāgatam paṃsukūlam dhāresi tena nam satthā lūkha cīvara dharānam aggaṭṭhāne
translated: I have burned up my defilements … I have done the Buddha’s bidding.🔽But after attaining arahatship, he wore a rag-robe that was coarse in three ways: coarse in color, coarse in texture, and coarse in being a rag-robe.🔽The Teacher placed him in the foremost position among those who wore coarse robes.

original: ṭhapesi. Aparabhāge purimakammappaccayā parihārassa akaraṇato therassa sarīre daddupīḷakādīni
analyzed: ṭhapesi aparabhāge purima kamma ppaccayā parihārassa a karaṇataḥ therassa sarīre daddu pīḷaka ādīni
translated: Later, because of his past kamma, boils appeared on the Elder’s body,

original: uppajjitvā vaḍḍhiṃsu. So “senāsanaṃ dussatī”ti hemantepi magadhakkhettesu palālasanthārāni
analyzed: uppajjitvā vaḍḍhiṃsu saḥ senāsanam dussati iti hemante pi magadha khettesu palāla santhārāni
translated: and they grew. He thought, “The lodging is dirty,” and so he slept in the fields of Magadha, covering himself with straw.

original: attharitvā seti. Taṃ ekadivasaṃ upaṭṭhānaṃ upasaṅkamitvā vanditvā ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ
analyzed: attharitvā sā iti tam eka divasam upaṭṭhānam upasaṅkamitvā vanditvā ekamantam nisinnam
translated: One day the Teacher came to his attendance, saluted him, and sat down.

original: satthā paṭisanthāravasena “chavipāpakā”tiādinā paṭhamagāthāya pucchi.
analyzed: satthā paṭisanthāra vasena chavi pāpaka ati ādinā paṭhama gāthāya pucchi
translated: The Teacher asked him a question in the way of conversation, with the first stanza, “Whose skin is bad?”

original: 207. Tattha chavipāpakāti daddukacchupīḷakāhi bhinnacchavibhāvato hīnacchavika duṭṭhacchavika.
analyzed: tattha bhinna chavi bhāvataḥ hīna chavika duṭṭha chavika
translated: Herein, whose skin is bad? One whose skin is bad because it is broken by boils and abscesses, whose skin is inferior, whose skin is bad.

original: Cittabhaddakāti anavasesakilesappahānena brahmavihārasevanāya ca bhaddacitta sundaracitta.
analyzed: citta bhaddaka ati anavasesa kilesa pahānena brahmavihāra sevanāya ca bhadda citta sundara citta
translated: Whose mind is good? One whose mind is good, whose mind is beautiful, by the abandoning of all defilements and by the cultivation of the divine abodes.

original: Mogharājāti tassa ālapanaṃ. Satataṃ samāhitoti aggaphalasamādhinā niccakālaṃ abhiṇhaṃ🔽samāhitamānaso. Hemantikasītakālarattiyoti hemantasamaye sītakālarattiyo. Accantasaṃyoge
analyzed: mogha rājā ati tassa ālapanam satatam samāhitaḥ ti agga phala samādhinā nicca kālam  samāhita mānasaḥ hemantika sīta kāla rattiyā iti hemanta samaye sīta kāla rattiyaḥ accanta saṃyoge
translated: Mogharāja is an address. Always concentrated: his mind is always concentrated, often concentrated, by the concentration of the highest fruit.

original: cetaṃ upayogavacanaṃ. “Hemantikā sītakālarattiyo”tipi pāḷi. Tattha hemantikāti hemantogadhā
analyzed: upayoga vacanam hemantikā tattha hemantikā ati hemantogadhā
translated: In the cold weather, in the winter nights: this is a statement of use in the ultimate sense in the compound accanta-saṃyoge. The text has “hemantikā sītakālarattiyo.” Herein, hemantikā means those that occur in the winter.

original: yathāvutte sītakāle kathaṃ attabhāvaṃ pavattesīti satthā pucchi. Evaṃ pana puṭṭho
analyzed: yathā vutte sīta kāle katham atta bhāvam pavattesi iti satthā pucchi evam pana puṭṭhaḥ
translated: The Elder, being asked in this way,

analyzed: palālacchannakaḥ seyyam yathaññe sukha jīvino ti gātham āha  tattha sampanna sassā ati nipphanna sassā magadhā iti magadha raṭṭham vadati magadhā nāma  jānapadinaḥ rāja kumārā tesam nivāsaḥ ekaḥ api janapadaḥ bahuvacanena
translated: ‘A bed covered with straw is as good as another for those who live happily.’ ”

original: vuccati. Kevalāti anavasesā. Iti me sutanti evaṃ mayā sutaṃ. Tattha yo adiṭṭho padeso,
analyzed: vuccati kevalā ati anavasesā iti me sutam ti evam mayā sutam tattha yaḥ a diṭṭhaḥ padeso

Magadhan is said of the Magadhan princes, and the country where they live is called “Magadhan” in the plural by the rule of the “country people” . Without exception means without remainder. I have heard it said means I have heard it said in this way. Herein, the place that is not seen

original: tassa vasena sutanti vuttaṃ. Tena edise kāle magadhesu yattha katthaci mayā vasituṃ🔽sakkāti dasseti. Palālacchannako seyyaṃ, yathaññe sukhajīvinoti yathā aññe sukhajīvino
analyzed: tassa vasena sutanti vuttam tena edise kāle magadhesu yattha katthaci mayā vasitum  sakkā ati dasseti palālacchannako seyyam yathā aññe sukha jīvino ti yathā aññe sukha jīvino
translated: As others live in comfort, so I

analyzed: bhikkhū senāsana sappāyam laddhā sundarehi attharaṇa pāvuraṇehi sukhena sayanti evam

original: 5. Visākhapañcālaputtattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: visākha pañcālaputta thera gāthā vaṇṇanā

analyzed: adhimuccitvā bhiyyosomattāya abhippasannam mahājanam ñatvā evaṃvidhassa dhamma kathikassa
translated: and knowing that the great multitude had become even more confident, said: “A good speaker who is endowed with these qualities

analyzed: vimutta āyatana sannissitassa na nibbānam dullabham atha kho sulabham eva ati dassento

translated: He too had made his resolve under former Buddhas, and in various states of existence had accumulated merit, which was the necessary condition for his future success.

analyzed: tasmin khaṇe pāvusa kāla meghaḥ gambhīra madhura nigghosaḥ sata paṭala sahassa paṭalaḥ
