original: kekāsaddaṃ muñcitvā tattha tattha padese naccantā vicaranti. Therassapi āvāsagabbhe🔽meghavātaphassehi apagatadhammattā passaddhakarajakāye kallataṃ patte utusappāyalābhena
analyzed: kekā saddam muñcitvā tattha tattha padese naccantāḥ vicaranti therassa api āvāsa gabbhe  megha vāta phassehi apagata dhamma ttā passaddhaka raja kāye kalla tam patte utu sappāya lābhena
translated: and with cries of “kekā” they danced and fluttered about here and there. The Elder, in his dwelling place,🔽was sitting in a state of calm, for the wind and rain had removed the heat from his body, and his mind, having obtained that which was suitable to the season,

original: cittaṃ ekaggaṃ ahosi, kammaṭṭhānavīthiṃ otari, so taṃ ñatvā kālasampadādikittanamukhena
analyzed: cittam ekaggam ahosi kammaṭṭhāna vīthim otari saḥ tam ñatvā kāla sampad ādi kittana mukhena
translated: was concentrated. He entered the path of meditation, and knowing this, he praised the excellence of the time, and so forth,

original: attānaṃ bhāvanāya ussāhento –
analyzed: attānam bhāvanāya ussāhentaḥ
translated: and in order to encourage himself in the practice of meditation, he said:

original: “Nadanti morā susikhā supekhuṇā, sunīlagīvā sumukhā sugajjino;
analyzed: nadanti morā susikhā supekhuṇā su nīla gīvā su mukhā
translated: “The peacocks are singing, their cries sweet and clear, their necks of a beautiful blue, their faces lovely, their cries sweet and melodious;

original: Susaddalā cāpi mahāmahī ayaṃ, subyāpitambu suvalāhakaṃ nabhaṃ.
analyzed: susaddalā ca api mahā mahī ayam su byāpi tambu su valāhakam nabham
translated: And this great earth is well-grassed, the water is well-spread, the sky is well-covered with clouds.

original: “Sukallarūpo sumanassa jhāyataṃ, sunikkamo sādhu subuddhasāsane;
analyzed: su kalla rūpaḥ sumanassa su nikkamaḥ sādhu su buddha sāsane
translated: “For one of good conduct, of good mind, of good meditation, of good endeavour, it is good in the Dispensation of the Good One;

original: Susukkasukkaṃ nipuṇaṃ sududdasaṃ, phusāhi taṃ uttamamaccutaṃ pada”nti. –
analyzed: su sukka sukkam nipuṇam su duddasam phusāhi tam uttamam accutam
translated: Touch that supreme, undecaying state, which is very bright, very pure, subtle, and hard to see.”

original: Dve gāthā abhāsi.
analyzed: dve gāthāḥ abhāsi
translated: He spoke two verses.

original: Tattha nadanti morā susikhā supekhuṇā, sunīlagīvā sumukhā sugajjinoti ete matthake🔽uṭṭhitāhi sundarāhi sikhāhi samannāgatattā susikhā, nānāvaṇṇehi anekehi sobhanehi🔽bhaddakapiñchehi samannāgatattā supekhuṇā, rājīvavaṇṇasaṅkāsāya sundarāya nīlavaṇṇāya
analyzed: tattha nadanti morā susikhā supekhuṇā sunīlagīvā sumukhā ete matthake  uṭṭhitāhi sundarāhi sikhāhi samannāgata ttā su sikhā nānā vaṇṇehi anekehi sobhanehi  bhadda kapiñchehi supekhuṇā rājīva vaṇṇa saṅkāsāya sundarāya nīla vaṇṇāya
translated: Herein, the peacocks with good crests, with good eyes, with good necks, with good faces, with good voices,🔽are with good crests because they are endowed with beautiful crests that have arisen on their heads, with good eyes because they are endowed with various-coloured, many, beautiful

original: gīvāya samannāgatattā sunīlagīvā, sundaramukhatāya sumukhā, manuññavāditāya sugajjino,
analyzed: gīvāya su nīla gīvā sundara mukhatāya su mukhā manuñña vāditāya su gajjino
translated: eyes on their wings, with good necks because they are endowed with beautiful necks the colour of a blue lotus, with good faces because they have beautiful faces, with good voices because they have sweet voices,

original: morā sikhaṇḍino chajjasaṃvādī kekāsaddaṃ muñcantā nadanti ravanti. Susaddalā cāpi
analyzed: chajja saṃvādī kekā saddam muñcantā nadanti ravanti ca api
translated: the peacocks with crests, with chakora-like voices, emit the sound of the keka and cry out, make a noise. And this great earth is well-grassed,

original: mahāmahī ayanti ayañca mahāpathavī susaddalā sundaraharitatiṇā. Subyāpitambūti abhinavavuṭṭhiyā🔽tahaṃ tahaṃ vissandamānasalilatāya suṭṭhu byāpitajalā vitatajalā. “Susukkatambū”tipi
analyzed: mahā mahī ayanti ayam ca mahā pathavī su saddalā sundara harita tiṇā abhinava vuṭṭhiyā  taham taham vissandamāna salila tāya suṭṭhu byāpita jalā vitata jalā
translated: “Well-watered” means that the water is spread out well, spread out everywhere, because the water spreads out here and there.🔽The reading “well-grassed and well-watered” is also allowable; the meaning is: “well-purified water.”🔽“Well-clouded” means that the sky, the space, is well-clouded with beautiful clouds that have filled it all around, like the petals of a blue lotus.

original: pāṭho, suvisuddhajalāti attho. Suvalāhakaṃ nabhanti idañca nabhaṃ ākāsaṃ nīluppaladalasannibhehi🔽samantato pūretvā ṭhitehi sundarehi valāhakehi meghehi suvalāhakaṃ.
analyzed: attho su valāhakam nabhanti idam ca nabham ākāsam nīla uppala dala sannibhehi  samantataḥ pūretvā ṭhitehi sundarehi valāhakehi meghehi su valāhakam
translated: “Well-grassed” means that you are well-grassed with the right grass, with the right nature, because of the gain of the right season.🔽“Well-watered” means that your mind is well-watered with the right water, with the right concentration, because of the gain of the right grass.

original: Sukallarūpo sumanassa jhāyatanti idāni utusappāyalābhena suṭṭhu kallarūpo kammaniyasabhāvo🔽tvaṃ, nīvaraṇehi anajjhārūḷhacittatāya sundaramanassa yogāvacarassa yaṃ ārammaṇūpanijjhānavasena
analyzed: su kalla rūpaḥ idāni utu sappāya lābhena suṭṭhu kalla rūpaḥ kamma niya sabhāvo  nīvaraṇehi an ajjhārūḍha citta tāya sundara manassa yogāvacarassa yaṃ ārammaṇa upanijjhāna vasena
translated: “Well-grassed” means that you are well-grassed with the right grass, with the right nature, because of the gain of the right season.🔽“Well-watered” means that your mind is well-watered with the right water, with the right concentration, because of the gain of the right grass.🔽“Well-grassed” means that you are well-grassed with the right grass, with the right nature, because of the gain of the right season.

original: lakkhaṇūpanijjhānavasena ca jhāyataṃ. Sunikkamo…pe… accutaṃ padanti evaṃ jhāyanto
analyzed: lakkhaṇa upanijjhāna vasena ca evam jhāyantaḥ
translated: “Well-watered” means that your mind is well-watered with the right water, with the right concentration, because of the gain of the right grass.

original: ca sādhu subuddhassa sammāsambuddhassa sāsane sundaranikkamo hutvā suparisuddhasīlatāya
analyzed: ca sādhu subuddhassa sammāsambuddhassa sāsane sundara nikkamaḥ hutvā su parisuddha sīla tāya
translated: and the good, the well-proclaimed, the true Dhamma of the well-gone, the fully Self-awakened Buddha, and having made a good escape, by means of the purity of his virtue

original: susukkaṃ, visuddhasabhāvatāya sabbassapi saṃkilesassa gocarabhāvānupagamanato sukkaṃ,
analyzed: su sukkam visuddha sabhāva tāya sabbassa api saṃkilesassa gocara bhāva an upagamanataḥ sukkam
translated: he became pure, and by means of the purity of his nature he became bright, because he did not go into the sphere of influence of any defilement at all,

original: nipuṇañāṇagocaratāya nipuṇaṃ, paramagambhīratāya sududdasaṃ, paṇītabhāvena seṭṭhabhāvena
analyzed: nipuṇa ñāṇa gocara tāya nipuṇam parama gambhīra tāya sududdasam paṇīta bhāvena seṭṭha bhāvena
translated: and because of his subtle knowledge he became subtle, and because of his extreme profundity he became difficult to see, and because of his excellence he became the best,

original: ca uttamaṃ, niccasabhāvatāya accutaṃ padaṃ taṃ nibbānaṃ phusāhi attapaccakkhakaraṇena
analyzed: ca uttamam nicca sabhāva tāya accutam padam tam nibbānam phusāhi atta paccakkha karaṇena
translated: and because of his eternal nature he became the imperishable state, and he touched that Nibbāna with his own heart,

original: sammāpaṭipattiyā sacchikarohīti.
analyzed: sammāpaṭipattiyā sacchikarohi iti
translated: and he realised it by means of right practice.

original: Evaṃ thero attānaṃ ovadantova utusappāyalābhena samāhitacitto vipassanaṃ ussukkāpetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: evam theraḥ attānam ovadantaḥ iva utu sappāya lābhena samāhita cittaḥ vipassanam ussukkāpetvā arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: Thus the Elder, while exhorting himself, with the attainment of the requisites in accordance with the season, with his mind concentrated, he aroused insight, and he reached Arahantship. Therefore it was said in the Apadāna:

original: “Kaṇikāraṃva jalitaṃ, puṇṇamāyeva candimaṃ;
analyzed: kaṇikāram iva jalitam puṇṇa māyā iva candimam
translated: “Like a flowering Kaṇikāra tree, like the moon on the fifteenth day,

original: Jalantaṃ dīparukkhaṃva, addasaṃ lokanāyakaṃ.
analyzed: jalantam dīpa rukkham iva addasam loka nāyakam
translated: Like a burning and blazing fire, I saw the Leader of the World.

original: “Kadaliphalaṃ paggayha, adāsiṃ satthuno ahaṃ;
analyzed: kadali phalam paggayha adāsim satthunaḥ aham
translated: “I raised up a Kadali fruit, and I gave it to the Teacher,

original: Pasannacitto sumano, vanditvāna apakkamiṃ.
analyzed: pasanna cittaḥ sumanaḥ vanditvāna apakkamiṃ
translated: With a confident mind and a happy mind, after worshipping I departed.

original: “Ekatiṃse ito kappe, yaṃ phalamadadiṃ tadā;
analyzed: ekatiṃse itas kappe yam phalam adadim tadā
translated: “Thirty-one cycles since that time, I do not recall a state of woe;

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, phaladānassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi phala dānassa idam phalam
translated: I know no evil state of being, this is the fruit of giving fruit.”

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements are destroyed … I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: Arahattaṃ pana patvā thero attano paṭipattiṃ paccavekkhitvā pītisomanassajāto “nadanti morā”tiādinā tāyeva gāthā paccudāhāsi. Tenassa idameva aññābyākaraṇaṃ ahosīti.
analyzed: arahattam pana patvā theraḥ attanaḥ paṭipattim paccavekkhitvā pīti somanassa jātaḥ nadanti morāti ādinā tāya iva gāthā paccudāhāsi tena assa idam eva aññā byākaraṇam ahosi iti
translated: But when he attained arahatship, the elder surveyed his own progress, and filled with joy and happiness, he repeated the same stanza, beginning, “The peacocks are crying out,” and so he made his own reply. Thus this was his reply to the question.

original: Cūḷakattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽7. Anūpamattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: cūḷakatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  anūpamatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the verses of the Elder Cūḷaka is ended.🔽Anūpama

original: Nandamānāgataṃ cittāti āyasmato anūpamattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu🔽katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭūpanissayaṃ puññaṃ upacinanto ito ekatiṃse
analyzed: nandamāna āgatam cittā ati āyasmataḥ anūpama ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu  kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭu upanissayam puññam upacinantaḥ itas ekatiṃse
translated: The verse of the venerable Anūpama. Where did this Elder Anūpama originate? He also rendered service under former Buddhas,🔽and accumulating merit as a foundation for the attainment of the going forth, was reborn in a good family in this Dispensation.

original: kappe kulagehe nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto ekadivasaṃ padumaṃ nāma paccekabuddhaṃ
analyzed: kappe kula gehe nibbattitvā viññutam pattaḥ eka divasam padumam nāma paccekabuddham
translated: When he had reached years of discretion, he one day saw the Paccekabuddha Paduma

original: piṇḍāya carantaṃ rathiyaṃ disvā pasannamānaso aṅkolapupphehi pūjesi. So tena puññakammena
analyzed: piṇḍāya carantam rathiyam disvā pasanna mānasaḥ aṅkola pupphehi pūjesi saḥ tena puñña kammena
translated: As a result of that meritorious deed,

original: devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde kosalaraṭṭhe ibbhakule nibbattitvā rūpasampattiyā
analyzed: deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde kosala raṭṭhe ibbha kule nibbattitvā rūpa sampattiyā
translated: he was reborn in the various orders of gods and men. In this generation of the Buddha, he was reborn in a family of outcasts in the Kosala country. Because of his perfection of beauty,

original: anūpamoti laddhanāmo vayappatto upanissayasampannatāya kāme pahāya pabbajitvā vipassanāya
analyzed: anūpamaḥ ti laddha nāmaḥ vaya pattaḥ upanissaya sampanna tāya kāme pahāya pabbajitvā vipassanāya
translated: he was called Anuruddha. When he reached the age of maturity, he went forth from the home life into homelessness because he possessed the requisites for enlightenment.🔽He was practicing insight meditation.

original: kammaṃ karonto araññe viharati. Tassa cittaṃ bahiddhā rūpādiārammaṇesu vidhāvati.
analyzed: kammam karontaḥ araññe viharati tassa cittam bahiddhā rūpa ādi ārammaṇesu vidhāvati
translated: While he was living in the forest, his mind ran out after external objects such as forms.🔽His meditation subject was not successful.

original: Kammaṭṭhānaṃ parivaṭṭati. Thero vidhāvantaṃ cittaṃ niggaṇhanto –
analyzed: kammaṭṭhānam parivaṭṭati theraḥ vidhāvantam cittam niggaṇhantaḥ
translated: The Elder, trying to restrain his mind which was running out,

original: “Nandamānāgataṃ cittaṃ, sūlamāropamānakaṃ;
analyzed: nandamāna āgatam cittam sūlam āropamānakam
translated: “The mind, O Anuruddha, is fickle and flighty,🔽It runs hither and thither like a monkey in a forest.

original: Tena teneva vajasi, yena sūlaṃ kaliṅgaraṃ.
analyzed: tena tena iva vajasi yena sūlam kaliṅgaram
translated: It runs hither and thither like a dog tied by a rope to a strong post.

original: “Tāhaṃ cittakaliṃ brūmi, taṃ brūmi cittadubbhakaṃ;
analyzed: tā aham citta kalim brūmi tam brūmi citta dubbhakam
translated: “Therefore I call the mind a thief, I call it a child,

original: Satthā te dullabho laddho, mānatthe maṃ niyojayī”ti. –
analyzed: satthā te dullabhaḥ laddhaḥ mānatthe mamam niyojayi iti
translated: For you have obtained a teacher hard to find, and yet you lead me to conceit.”

original: Imāhi dvīhi gāthāhi ovadi.
analyzed: imāhi dvīhi gāthāhi ovadi
translated: He instructed him with these two verses.

original: Tattha nandamānāgataṃ cittāti nandamāna abhinandamāna citta abhinandamānaṃ āgataṃ
analyzed: tattha nandamāna āgatam citta ati nandamāna abhinandamāna citta abhinandamānam āgatam
translated: Herein, the mind that comes to delight in joy is the mind that delights in, rejoices in, the joy that has arisen.

original: uppannaṃ. Sūlamāropamānakanti dukkhuppattiṭṭhānatāya sūlasadisattā sūlaṃ taṃ taṃ🔽bhavaṃ kammakilesehi ettakaṃ kālaṃ āropiyamānaṃ. Tena teneva vajasi, yena sūlaṃ kaliṅgaranti
analyzed: uppannam sūlam āropamānakam ti dukkha uppatti ṭṭhāna tāya sūla sadisa ttā sūlam tam tam  bhavam kamma kilesehi ettakam kālam āropiyamānam tena tena iva vajasi yena sūlam
translated: It is as if impaled on a stake: because it is the source of the arising of suffering, the stake is like a stake, and it is impaled on the stake for so long by the kamma and defilements of the various kinds of becoming.

original: yattha yattha sūlasaṅkhātā bhavā kaliṅgarasaṅkhātā adhikuṭṭanakā kāmaguṇā ca tena
analyzed: yattha yattha sūla saṅkhātā bhavā kaliṅgara saṅkhātā adhikuṭṭanakā kāmaguṇā ca tena
translated: You go by that, you go to that very place where the stabbings are, where the stabbings called the kinds of becoming and the stabbings called the objects of attachment consisting in the five cords of sense desire are.

original: teneva, pāpacitta, vajasi, taṃ tadeva ṭhānaṃ upagacchasi, attano anatthaṃ na sallakkhesi.🔽Tāhaṃ cittakaliṃ brūmīti taṃ tasmā pamattabhāvato cittakaliṃ cittakālakaṇṇiṃ ahaṃ
analyzed: tena iva pāpa citta vajasi tam tat eva ṭhānam upagacchasi attanaḥ anattham na sallakkhesi  cittakalim brūmi iti tam tasmai pamatta bhāvataḥ cittakalim citta kālakaṇṇim aham
translated: You do not consider your own harm, O evil mind.🔽I call you a mind-demon: I call you a mind-demon, a mind-goblin, because of your heedlessness.

original: kathayāmi. Punapi taṃ brūmi kathemi cittadubbhakaṃ cittasaṅkhātassa attano bahūpakārassa
analyzed: kathayāmi puna api tam brūmi kathemi citta dubbhakam citta saṅkhātassa attanaḥ bahu upakārassa
translated: I say to you again: I say to you again, O child of mind, O mind, you do not consider your own harm.

original: santānassa anatthāvahanato cittadubbhiṃ. “Cittadubbhagā”tipi paṭhanti. Cittasaṅkhātaalakkhikaappapuññāti
analyzed: santānassa anattha avahanataḥ citta dubbhim citta dubbhaga atipi paṭhanti citta saṅkhāta alakkhika appapuññā ti
translated: because it does not bring harm to the stream of existence, it is a “mental thorn.” They also read “cittadubbhagā.” The meaning is: “a mental thorn, a thorn of the mind, a thorn of consciousness.”

original: attho. Kinti brūhīti ce? Āha “satthā te dullabho laddho, mānatthe maṃ niyojayī”ti.
analyzed: attho kinti brūhi iti ce āha satthā te dullabhaḥ laddhaḥ mānatthe mam niyojayi iti
translated: What do you say? He said: “The Teacher is hard to find, having been found, do not employ me in conceit.”

original: Kappānaṃ asaṅkhyeyyampi nāma buddhasuñño loko hoti, satthari uppannepi manussattasaddhāpaṭilābhādayo
analyzed: kappānam asaṅkhyeyyam pi nāma buddha suññaḥ lokaḥ hoti satthari uppanne pi manussatta saddhā paṭilābha ādayaḥ
translated: Even for countless eons the world is empty of Buddhas, and even when a Teacher arises, the attainment of human birth, faith, and so on

original: dullabhā eva, laddhesu ca tesu satthāpi dullabhoyeva hoti. Evaṃ dullabho satthā idāni🔽tayā laddho, tasmiṃ laddhe sampatipi anatthe ahite āyatiñca anatthāvahe dukkhāvahe
analyzed: dullabhāḥ eva laddhesu ca tesu satthā api hoti evam dullabhaḥ satthā idāni  tayā laddhaḥ tasmin laddhe anatthe ahite āyatiñca anattha āvahe dukkha āvahe
translated: are difficult to obtain. Even when they are obtained, the Teacher is also difficult to find. Thus, the Teacher, who is difficult to find, is now🔽found by you. Having found him, do not employ me in what is harmful, what is not beneficial, and what brings harm and suffering in the future,

original: akusale maṃ mā niyojesīti. Evaṃ thero attano cittaṃ ovadanto eva vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā
analyzed: akusale mam mā niyojesi iti evam theraḥ attano cittam ovadantaḥ eva vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā
translated: what is unwholesome.” Thus, the Elder, while admonishing his own mind, increasing his insight,

original: arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: attained arahantship. Therefore it is said in the Apadana:

original: “Padumo nāma sambuddho, cittakūṭe vasī tadā;
analyzed: padumaḥ nāma sambuddhaḥ cittakūṭe vasī tadā
translated: “The Fully Enlightened Paduma, dwelling at that time on Cittakūṭa,

original: Disvāna taṃ ahaṃ buddhaṃ, sayambhuṃ aparājitaṃ.
analyzed: disvāna tam aham buddham sayambhum aparājitam
translated: Having seen that Buddha, the Self-Existent One, the Invincible One,

original: “Aṅkolaṃ pupphitaṃ disvā, ocinitvānahaṃ tadā;
analyzed: aṅkolam pupphitam disvā tadā
translated: Having seen the aṅkola flower, I gathered it then,

original: Upagantvāna sambuddhaṃ, pūjayiṃ padumaṃ jinaṃ.
analyzed: upagantvāna sambuddham pūjayim padumam jinam
translated: And having gone to the Sambuddha, I worshipped the lotus-flower Jina.

original: “Ekatiṃse ito kappe, yaṃ pupphamabhipūjayiṃ;
analyzed: ekatiṃse itas kappe yam puppham abhipūjayiṃ
translated: In the thirty-first eon from now, the flower I worshipped,

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I do not know of any bad destination, this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: My defilements are destroyed … the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.

original: Anūpamattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: anūpama thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Anūpama is finished.

original: 8. Vajjitattheragāthāvaṇṇanā🔽Saṃsaraṃ dīghamaddhānanti āyasmato vajjitattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: vajjitatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā  saṃsaram dīgham addhānam ti āyasmataḥ vajjita therassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Vajjiya

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto ito pañcasaṭṭhime kappe ekasmiṃ🔽paccantagāme nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto vanacarako hutvā vicaranto ekadivasaṃ upasantaṃ
analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinantaḥ itas pañca saṭṭhime kappe ekasmiṃ  paccanta gāme nibbattitvā viññutam pattaḥ vana carakaḥ hutvā vicarantaḥ eka divasam upasantam
translated: Wandering on for a long time … This is the verse of the venerable elder Vajjiya. What is the origin of this? This elder also, having performed meritorious deeds here and there in various births, in the fifth or sixth eon ago,

original: nāma paccekabuddhaṃ pabbataguhāyaṃ viharantaṃ addasa. So tassa upasamaṃ disvā pasannamānaso
analyzed: nāma paccekabuddham pabbata guhāyam viharantam addasa saḥ tassa upasamam disvā pasanna mānasaḥ
translated: was reborn in a border village. Having attained maturity, wandering about as a forester, one day he saw a paccekabuddha named Upasama dwelling in a mountain cave. Seeing his peacefulness, with a serene mind

analyzed: campaka pupphena pūjam akāsi saḥ tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin

original: buddhuppāde kosalaraṭṭhe ibbhakule nibbatto jātadivasato paṭṭhāya mātugāmahatthaṃ
analyzed: buddhuppāde kosala raṭṭhe ibbha kule nibbattaḥ jāta divasataḥ paṭṭhāya mātugāma hattham
translated: In this his last existence, he was reborn in a family of cowherds in the Kosala country. From the day of his birth, he was brought up by women.

original: gato rodati. Brahmalokato kira cavitvā idhāgato yasmā mātugāmasamphassaṃ na sahati,
analyzed: gataḥ rodati brahma lokataḥ kira cavitvā idha āgataḥ yasmai mātu gāma samphassam na sahati
translated: He cried when he was brought into the presence of men. It is said that he was reborn here after passing away from the Brahma-world, and that he could not bear the touch of women.

original: tasmā mātugāmasamphassavajjanato vajjitotveva nāmaṃ jātaṃ. So vayappatto satthu yamakapāṭihāriyaṃ
analyzed: tasmā mātu gāma samphassa vajjanataḥ vajjito tu eva nāmam jātam saḥ vaya pattaḥ satthu yamaka pāṭihāriyam
translated: Therefore, because of his avoidance of the touch of women, he was called Vajji-gotta. When he reached maturity, he saw the Twin Miracle performed by the Teacher.

original: disvā paṭiladdhasaddho pabbajitvā vipassanaṃ paṭṭhapetvā tadaheva chaḷabhiñño ahosi.
analyzed: disvā paṭiladdha saddhaḥ pabbajitvā vipassanam paṭṭhapetvā tad ahā iva chaḍabhiññaḥ ahosi
translated: He obtained faith, went forth, and by developing insight, attained arahatship on that very day.

original: Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: tena vuttam apadāne
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽“The peaceful Sambuddha,

original: “Upasanto ca sambuddho, vasatī pabbatantare;
analyzed: upasantaḥ ca sambuddhaḥ vasati pabbata antare
translated: dwelling in the mountain fastness,🔽I, taking a single campaka flower,

analyzed: eka campakam ādāya naruttamam
translated: went to the Supreme Man.

original: “Pasannacitto sumano, paccekamunimuttamaṃ;
analyzed: pasanna cittaḥ sumanaḥ pacceka munim uttamam
translated: “With a serene mind, joyful,🔽I worshipped the unconquered One, the Supreme Sage,

original: Ubho hatthehi paggayha, pūjayiṃ aparājitaṃ.
analyzed: ubho hatthehi paggayha pūjayim aparājitam
translated: with both hands raised in reverence.

original: “Pañcasaṭṭhimhito kappe, yaṃ pupphamabhipūjayiṃ;
analyzed: kappe yam puppham abhipūjayiṃ
translated: “For five hundred and sixty eons,

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I do not know of any state of deprivation; this is the fruit of my worship of the Buddha.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: My defilements are burned up … the Buddha’s Dispensation has been fulfilled.

original: Chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā attano pubbenivāsaṃ anussaritvā dhammasaṃvegena –
analyzed: chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā attanaḥ pubbenivāsam anussaritvā dhamma saṃvegena
translated: After attaining the six kinds of direct knowledge, he recollected his previous existences and, moved by the Dhamma, he uttered the following two stanzas:

original: “Saṃsaraṃ dīghamaddhānaṃ, gatīsu parivattisaṃ;
analyzed: saṃsaram dīgham addhānam gatīsu
translated: For a long time I wandered on, revolving through the various realms of existence,

original: Apassaṃ ariyasaccāni, andhabhūto puthujjano.
analyzed: apassam ariya saccāni andha bhūtaḥ puthujjanaḥ
translated: Not seeing the Noble Truths, a blind worldling.

original: “Tassa me appamattassa, saṃsārā vinaḷīkatā;
analyzed: tassa me appamattassa saṃsārāḥ vinaḷīkatā
translated: But now that I am diligent, my wanderings have come to an end;

original: Sabbā gatī samucchinnā, natthi dāni punabbhavo”ti. – dve gāthā abhāsi;🔽Tattha saṃsaranti saṃsaranto, tasmiṃ tasmiṃ bhave ādānanikkhepavasena aparāparaṃ🔽sandhāvanto. Dīghamaddhānanti cirakālaṃ anādimati saṃsāre aparimāṇakālaṃ. Gatīsūti
analyzed: sabbā gatī samucchinnā natthi dāni punabbhavaḥ ti dve gāthāḥ abhāsi  tattha saṃsaranti saṃsarantaḥ tasmin tasmin bhave ādāna nikkhepa vasena apara aparam  sandhāvantaḥ cira kālam anādimati saṃsāre aparimāṇa kālam
translated: All my destinations have been cut off; there will be no more renewed existence.

original: sukatadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ vasena sugatiduggatīsu. Parivattisanti ghaṭīyantaṃ viya
analyzed: su kata dukkaṭānam kammānam vasena sugati duggatīsu ghaṭīyantam viya
translated: Herein, he wanders on means he wanders on, going back and forth in the various kinds of becoming by way of taking up and laying down. For a long time means for a long period, for an immeasurable time in the beginningless round of rebirths. Revolving through the various realms of existence means revolving through the good and bad destinations by way of good and bad kamma. Like a waterwheel going round and round.

original: paribbhamanto cavanupapajjanavasena aparāparaṃ parivattiṃ. Tassa pana parivattanassa🔽kāraṇamāha “apassaṃ ariyasaccāni, andhabhūto puthujjano”ti. Dukkhādīni cattāri ariyasaccāni
analyzed: paribbhamantaḥ cavan upapajjana vasena apara aparam parivattim tassa pana parivattanassa  kāraṇam āha apassam ariya saccāni andha bhūto puthujjano ti dukkha ādīni cattāri ariya saccāni
translated: He wandered on, revolving from one existence to another.🔽The reason for this revolving is stated thus: “Not seeing the Noble Truths, the blind worldling” .🔽Not seeing, not penetrating with the eye of knowledge, the four Noble Truths beginning with suffering,

original: ñāṇacakkhunā apassanto appaṭivijjhanto, tato eva avijjandhatāya andhabhūto puthūnaṃ
analyzed: ñāṇa cakkhunā a passantaḥ a paṭivijjhantaḥ tatas eva a vijja andha tāya andha bhūtaḥ puthūnam
translated: and being blind because of the blindness of ignorance, the worldling is so called because of the reasons beginning with his being born among the many people .

original: jananādīhi kāraṇehi puthujjano honto gatīsu parivattisanti yojanā, tenevāha bhagavā –
analyzed: janana ādīhi kāraṇehi puthujjanaḥ gatīsu parivatti santi yojanā tena iva āha bhagavā
translated: The meaning of the words “revolving in the destinies” is to be construed thus: “He revolves in the destinies.” Therefore the Exalted One said:

original: “Catunnaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasaccānaṃ ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṃ dīghamaddhānaṃ sandhāvitaṃ saṃsaritaṃ mamañceva tumhākañcā”ti.
analyzed: catunnam bhikkhave ariya saccānam ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evam idam dīgham addhānam sandhāvitam saṃsaritam mamañca iva tumhākam ca ati
translated: “Bhikkhus, it is through not knowing, through not penetrating four Noble Truths that this long course of birth and death has been passed through by me as well as by you” .

original: Tassa mayhaṃ vuttanayena pubbe puthujjanasseva sato idāni satthārā dinnanayena appamattassa
analyzed: tassa mayham vutta nayena pubbe puthujjanassa iva sataḥ idāni satthārā dinna nayena appamattassa
translated: For me, who formerly was a worldling in the manner stated, now that I am established in heedfulness by the method given by the Teacher,

analyzed: appamāda paṭipattiyā samatha vipassanā bhāvanam matthakam pāpetvā ṭhitassa saṃsārā
translated: and have reached the culmination of meditation and insight through the practice of heedfulness,

original: vinaḷīkatāti saṃsaranti sattā etehīti “saṃsārā”ti laddhanāmā kammakilesā aggamaggena🔽samucchinnattā vigatanaḷā nimmūlā katā. Sabbā gatī samucchinnāti evaṃ kammakilesavaṭṭānaṃ
analyzed: vinaḷīkatā ati saṃsaranti sattāḥ etehi iti saṃsārā ati laddha nāmā kamma kilesāḥ aggamaggena  samucchinna ttā vigata naḷā nimmūlā katā sabbā gatī samucchinnā ati evam kamma kilesa vaṭṭānam
translated: The round of rebirths is the defilements and kamma that go on revolving with the name “round of rebirths” because beings revolve with them.🔽The round of rebirths is cut off for me, since the round of rebirths has been cut off by the foremost path.

original: vinaḷīkatattā nirayādikā sabbāpi gatiyo sammadeva ucchinnā viddhaṃsitā, tato eva
analyzed: vinaḷīkatattā niraya ādikā sabbā api gatiyaḥ sammat eva ucchinnā tatas eva
translated: All destinations are cut off for me: thus all destinations, the hells, etc., are cut off, destroyed, by the cutting off of the round of kamma, defilements, and rebirths.

original: natthi dāni āyatiṃ punabbhavoti idameva ca therassa aññābyākaraṇaṃ ahosīti.
analyzed: natthi dāni āyatim punabbhavo ti idam eva ca therassa aññā byākaraṇam ahosi iti
translated: Henceforth there is no more becoming for me. This is the Elder’s declaration of his knowledge.

original: Vajjitattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vajjita thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the verses of the Elder Vajjiya is ended.

original: 9. Sandhitattheragāthāvaṇṇanā🔽Assatthe haritobhāseti āyasmato sandhitattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: sandhitatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā  āyasmataḥ sandhita therassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu

In the dispensation of the Blessed One Sikhī,

analyzed: parinibbuta bhāvam sutvā evam mahā anubhāvāḥ buddhāḥ api nāma anicca tā vasam gacchanti

analyzed: aho saṅkhārāḥ addhuvāti anicca saññam tam theraḥ bodhi pūjāya ussāhesi so  kālena kālam bodhi rukkha samīpam gantvā vipassanam paṭṭhapetvā buddha guṇe anussarantaḥ
translated: How transient are all formations!” and he attained the perception of impermanence. The Elder encouraged him to worship the Bodhi Tree.🔽From time to time he went to the Bodhi Tree, and after arousing insight by recollecting the Buddha’s special qualities,

analyzed: bodhim vandati saḥ tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde  kosala raṭṭhe ibbha kule nibbattitvā sandhito ti laddha nāmaḥ vaya patto anicca tā paṭisaṃyuttam  dhamma katham sutvā saṃvega jātaḥ pabbajitvā vipassanam paṭṭhapetvā ñāṇassa paripākam

analyzed: bhagavataḥ kāle bodhi vandanam buddha anussatim anicca saññā paṭilābham ca anussaritvā tad upanissayena
translated: Then, by way of that support,

analyzed: attanaḥ visesa adhigamam pakāsentaḥ
translated: he proclaimed his own special attainment, saying:🔽“In the place of the Assattha tree,

translated: in the tree that was in full bloom,🔽I attained the perception of the Buddha,

analyzed: ekam buddha gatam saññam alabhittham patissataḥ
translated: mindful and clearly comprehending.🔽“Thirty-one eons ago,

analyzed: ekatiṃse itas kappe yam tadā
translated: I attained that perception;🔽By the power of that perception,

analyzed: dve gāthāḥ abhāsi  tattha assattha iti assattha ṭṭhānīye yvā ayam etarahi amhākam bhagavataḥ bodhi rukkhaḥ

analyzed: assatthaḥ etassa ṭhāne tadā sikhissa bhagavataḥ bodhirukkhaḥ puṇḍarīkaḥ ṭhitaḥ iti saḥ assattha ṭṭhānīya tāya  assattha iti vuttam sattānam assāsa jananataḥ vā apare pana assattha rukkha mūle nisīditvā
translated: At that time, the Bodhi Tree of the Blessed One Sikhī was a puṇḍarīka tree standing in the place of the Assattha tree. original: tadā buddhānussatiyā bhāvitattā thero ‘assatthe’ti avocā”ti vadanti. Haritobhāseti
analyzed: tadā buddha anussatiyā bhāvita ttā theraḥ assattha iti avoca ati vadanti haritobhāsa iti
translated: But others say that the Elder uttered the word “Assattha” because he sat down at the foot of the Assattha tree and developed the recollection of the Buddha at that time.🔽In the tree that was in full bloom means in the tree that was in full bloom with flowers.

original: haritehi sāramaṇivaṇṇehi obhāsamāne. Saṃvirūḷhamhīti suṭṭhu virūḷhe suppatiṭṭhite,
analyzed: haritehi sāra maṇi vaṇṇehi obhāsamāne saṃvirūḍhamhi iti suṭṭhu virūḍhe su patiṭṭhite
translated: and shining with green leaves the colour of gold.🔽“I grew” means: I grew well, I became well established,🔽and I grew with a dense mass of leaves, shoots and tendrils.

translated: “I placed” means: I placed in the tree.🔽“I obtained a single perception of the Buddha” means: I obtained a single perception of the Buddha, which was accompanied by the recollection of the Buddha,🔽and which was concerned with the qualities of the Buddha,

analyzed: kadā pana sā saññā laddhā kīvatāya siddhā iti āha ekatiṃse itas kappa itiādi itas bhaddakappato

analyzed: pattaḥ me āsava khayaḥ ti idāni mayā āsavānam khayaḥ nirodhaḥ adhigataḥ ti imāya iva ca imassa
translated: “I have attained the destruction of the taints”: “Now I have attained the destruction of the taints, their cessation, their removal, their non-arising again.”

original: therassa apadānagāthāpi. Yathāha –
analyzed: therassa apadāna gāthā api yathā āha

translated: “If one wishes to live in bliss” . This verse was spoken by the Elder Dhanika. What was its origin? This elder also had performed meritorious deeds under former Buddhas and had accumulated merit in various existences. In the dispensation of the Master Sikhī he was reborn in a good family

original: nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto ekadivasaṃ satthāraṃ disvā pasannamānaso naḷamālāya pūjaṃ
analyzed: nibbattitvā viññutam pattaḥ eka divasam satthāram disvā pasanna mānasaḥ naḷamālāya pūjam
translated: in a certain place. When he had reached years of discretion, one day he saw the Master and was filled with joy. He made an offering to the Master of a garland of reeds.

original: akāsi. So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde rājagahe
analyzed: akāsi saḥ tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde rājagahe
translated: By that meritorious deed he passed from one good bourn to another, and in the dispensation of this Buddha he was reborn in a potter’s family in Rājagaha.

original: kumbhakārakule nibbattitvā dhaniyoti laddhanāmo vayappatto kumbhakārakammena jīvati.
analyzed: kumbhakāra kule nibbattitvā dhaniyaḥ ti laddha nāmaḥ vaya patto kumbhakāra kammena jīvati
translated: When he had reached years of discretion, he made his living by the potter’s craft.

original: Tena ca samayena satthā dhaniyassa kumbhakārassa sālāyaṃ nisīditvā pukkusātissa kulaputtassa
analyzed: tena ca samayena satthā dhaniyassa kumbhakārassa sālāyam nisīditvā pukkusātissa kula puttassa
translated: At that time the Teacher was sitting in the shed of Dhaniya the potter,

original: chadhātuvibhaṅgasuttaṃ desesi. So taṃ sutvā katakicco ahosi. Dhaniyo tassa parinibbutabhāvaṃ🔽sutvā “niyyānikaṃ vata buddhasāsanaṃ, yattha ekarattiparicayenāpi vaṭṭadukkhato muñcituṃ🔽sakkā”ti paṭiladdhasaddho pabbajitvā kuṭimaṇḍanānuyutto viharanto kuṭikaraṇaṃ paṭicca
analyzed: cha dhātu vibhaṅga suttam desesi saḥ tam sutvā kata kiccaḥ ahosi dhaniyaḥ tassa parinibbuta bhāvam  sutvā niyyānikam vata buddha sāsanam yattha eka ratti paricayena api vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ muñcitum  sakkā ati paṭiladdha saddhaḥ pabbajitvā kuṭi maṇḍana anuyuttaḥ viharantaḥ kuṭi karaṇam paṭicca
translated: and he preached the Discourse on the Analysis of the Six Elements to the young man Pukkusāti. The latter, having heard the discourse, attained Arahatship. Dhaniya, having heard that Pukkusāti had attained Nibbāna,🔽thought to himself, “Verily the religion of the Buddha is a religion that leads out, since it is possible to escape from the suffering of the round of existences by merely hearing the Law for a single night.” Having thus conceived faith in the Buddha, he retired from the world, and while he dwelt engaged in the adornment of his hut, he was rebuked by the Teacher for building his hut on the property of the Order.

original: bhagavatā garahito saṅghike senāsane vasanto vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi.
analyzed: bhagavatā garahitaḥ saṅghike senāsane vasantaḥ vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahattam pāpuṇi
translated: But he dwelt in a lodging belonging to the Order, and developing insight, attained Arahatship.

original: Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: tena vuttam apadāne
translated: Therefore it is said in the Apadana:🔽I saw the Buddha, fair of hue,

original: “Suvaṇṇavaṇṇaṃ sambuddhaṃ, āhutīnaṃ paṭiggahaṃ;
analyzed: suvaṇṇa vaṇṇam sambuddham āhutīnam paṭiggaham
translated: The recipient of offerings,🔽The Leader of the world,

original: Vipinaggena gacchantaṃ, addasaṃ lokanāyakaṃ.
analyzed: vipinaggena gacchantam addasam lokanāyakam
translated: As I was going through the forest.🔽As I was leaving the house,

original: “Naḷamālaṃ gahetvāna, nikkhamanto ca tāvade;
analyzed: naḷa mālam gahetvāna nikkhamantaḥ ca tāvade
translated: I took a garland of reeds;🔽And there I saw the Buddha,

original: Tatthaddasāsiṃ sambuddhaṃ, oghatiṇṇamanāsavaṃ.
analyzed: sambuddham ogha tiṇṇa manāsavam
translated: The sinless one who had crossed the flood.🔽With heart serene and joyful,

original: “Pasannacitto sumano, naḷamālamapūjayiṃ;
analyzed: pasanna cittaḥ sumanaḥ naḷa mālam apūjayiṃ
translated: I paid my reverence to the garland of reeds;

original: Dakkhiṇeyyaṃ mahāvīraṃ, sabbalokānukampakaṃ.
analyzed: dakkhiṇeyyam mahāvīram sabba loka anukampakam
translated: The One to be worshipped, the Great Hero, The One who has compassion for the whole world.

original: “Ekatiṃse ito kappe, yaṃ mālamabhiropayiṃ;
analyzed: ekatiṃse itas kappe yam mālam abhiropayiṃ
translated: “Thirty-one eons ago, I placed a garland on the Buddha;

analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I do not recall any bad destination— this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.”

analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements are destroyed … I have done what had to be done.”

analyzed: arahattam pana patvā ye bhikkhū dhutaṅga samādhānena attānam ukkaṃsetvā saṅgha bhatta ādim sādiyante aññe bhikkhū avajānanti tesam ovāda dāna mukhena aññam byākaronto
translated: But after attaining arahatship, he recited three stanzas, in the form of advice, to other bhikkhus who, having elevated themselves by their ascetic practices, accepted invitations to meals in the houses of the laity and looked down upon other bhikkhus:

analyzed: sukhañce jīvitum icche sāmaññasmin
translated: “If you wish to live happily, And be concerned with the life of purity,

translated: Do not despise what belongs to the Community, Robes, alms, and lodging.

original: Sukhañce jīvituṃ icche, sāmaññasmiṃ apekkhavā;
analyzed: sukhañce jīvitum icche sāmaññasmin
translated: If you wish to live happily, And be concerned with the life of purity,

translated: Use a bed and chair As a cat uses her hole.

original: yattha katthaci vasitvā pakkameyyāti attho.
analyzed: yattha katthaci vasitvā pakkameyya ati
translated: wherever it may be.

original: Idāni vutte avutte ca paccaye yathālābhasantoseneva sāmaññasukhaṃ hoti, na aññathāti
analyzed: idāni vutte a vutte ca paccaye yathā lābha santosena iva sāmañña sukham hoti na aññathā ti
translated: Now, in order to show that the happiness of recluseship is to be had by being content with whatever requisites one may get, whether good or bad, and not otherwise,

original: dassento āha “itarītarena tusseyyā”ti, yena kenaci hīnena vā paṇītena vā yathāladdhena
analyzed: dassentaḥ āha itarītarena yena kenacid hīnena vā paṇītena vā yathā laddhena
translated: he said, “Be content with this and that.” The meaning is that one should be content with whatever requisites one may get, whether inferior or excellent.

original: paccayena santosaṃ āpajjeyyāti attho. Ekadhammanti appamādabhāvaṃ, tañhi anuyuñjantassa🔽anavajjaṃ sabbaṃ lokiyasukhaṃ lokuttarasukhañca hatthagatameva hoti. Tenāha bhagavā
analyzed: paccayena santosam āpajjeyya ati attho eka dhamman ti appamāda bhāvam tat hi anuyuñjantassa  anavajjam sabbam lokiya sukham lokuttara sukham ca hattha gatam eva hoti tena āha bhagavā
translated: One thing: the state of being heedful. For when one is devoted to that,

original: – “appamatto hi jhāyanto, pappoti vipulaṃ sukha”nti.
analyzed: appamattaḥ hi jhāyantaḥ pappoti vipulam sukhanti
translated: all mundane and supramundane happiness is as good as in the palm of one’s hand. Hence the Blessed One said: “The heedful one who practices meditation attains the happiness that is free from affliction” .

original: Dhaniyattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dhaniya thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the verses of the Elder Dhanika is finished.

original: 5. Mātaṅgaputtattheragāthāvaṇṇanā🔽Atisītanti āyasmato mātaṅgaputtattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayaṃ kira padumuttarassa
analyzed: āyasmataḥ mātaṅgaputta therassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam kira padumuttarassa
translated: Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Mātaṅgaputta

original: bhagavato kāle himavantasamīpe mahato jātassarassa heṭṭhā mahati nāgabhavane mahānubhāvo
analyzed: bhagavataḥ kāle himavanta samīpe mahataḥ jāta ssarassa heṭṭhā mahati nāga bhavane mahā anubhāvaḥ
translated: “Too cold”: this verse was spoken by the Elder Mātaṅgaputta. How did it arise? It seems that in the time of the Blessed One Padumuttara, in the vicinity of the Himalayas, in a great nāga-pond, there was a nāga of great power🔽and influence.

original: nāgarājā hutvā nibbatto ekadivasaṃ nāgabhavanato nikkhamitvā vicaranto satthāraṃ
analyzed: nāga rājā hutvā nibbattaḥ eka divasam nāga bhavanataḥ nikkhamitvā vicarantaḥ satthāram
translated: Once, when he was a king of the Nāgas, he went out from the Nāga palace and saw the Teacher

original: ākāsena gacchantaṃ disvā pasannamānaso attano sīsamaṇinā pūjaṃ akāsi. So tena puññakammena🔽devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde kosalaraṭṭhe mātaṅgassa nāma kuṭumbikassa
analyzed: ākāsena gacchantam disvā pasanna mānasaḥ attanaḥ sīsa maṇinā pūjam akāsi saḥ tena puñña kammena  deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde kosala raṭṭhe mātaṅgassa nāma kuṭumbikassa
translated: going through the air. His heart was filled with joy, and he worshipped the Teacher with the crest-jewel on his own head. By reason of that meritorious deed,🔽he passed from one state of existence to another, and was finally born in the time of the present Buddha, in the city of Kosambī, the son of a certain householder named Mātaṅga.

original: putto hutvā nibbatto mātaṅgaputtotveva paññāyittha. So viññutaṃ patto alasajātiko
analyzed: puttaḥ hutvā nibbattaḥ mātaṅga putto tu eva paññāyittha saḥ viññutam pattaḥ alasa jātiko
translated: He was called Mātaṅga-putta. When he grew up, he was lazy and idle,

original: hutvā kiñci kammaṃ akaronto ñātakehi aññehi ca garahito “sukhajīvino ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā”ti🔽sukhajīvitaṃ ākaṅkhanto bhikkhūhi kataparicayo hutvā satthāraṃ upasaṅkamitvā dhammaṃ
analyzed: hutvā kiñci kammam a karontaḥ ñātakehi aññehi ca garahito sukha jīvino ime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā ti  sukha jīvitam ākaṅkhantaḥ bhikkhūhi kata paricayaḥ hutvā satthāram upasaṅkamitvā dhammaṃ
translated: and did not do a single good deed. He was reproved by his kinsfolk and by others, and said, “These recluses, sons of the Sakyans, live a life of ease.”🔽And he said, “I, too, will live a life of ease.” So he made the acquaintance of the monks, and went to the Teacher and heard the Law.

original: sutvā paṭiladdhasaddho pabbajitvā aññe bhikkhū iddhimante disvā iddhibalaṃ patthetvā
analyzed: sutvā paṭiladdha saddhaḥ pabbajitvā aññe bhikkhū iddhimante disvā iddhi balam patthetvā
translated: Obtaining faith, he retired from the world and became a monk. Seeing other monks possessed of spiritual power, he desired to obtain spiritual power himself.

original: satthu santike kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā bhāvanaṃ anuyuñjanto chaḷabhiñño ahosi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: satthu santike kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā bhāvanam anuyuñjanto chaḍabhiññaḥ ahosi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: and after he had taken up a meditation subject in the presence of the Teacher and had devoted himself to meditation, he became one of the perfected ones who had attained the six kinds of direct knowledge. That is why it is said of him:🔽“The Conqueror named Padumuttara,

original: “Padumuttaro nāma jino, sabbadhammāna pāragū;
analyzed: padumuttaraḥ nāma jinaḥ sabba dhammāna pāragū
translated: who had reached the end of all things,🔽the Fully Enlightened One, who desired solitude,

original: Vivekakāmo sambuddho, gacchate anilañjase.
analyzed: viveka kāmaḥ sambuddhaḥ gacchate anilañjase
translated: went on his way without faltering.🔽“Not far from the Himalayas

original: “Avidūre himavantassa, mahājātassaro ahu;
analyzed: avidūre himavantassa mahā jāta saraḥ ahu
translated: there was a great lake;🔽there was my abode,

original: Tattha me bhavanaṃ āsi, puññakammena saṃyutaṃ.
analyzed: tattha me bhavanam āsi puñña kammena saṃyutam
translated: connected with my meritorious deeds.🔽“Having left my abode,

original: “Bhavanā abhinikkhamma, addasaṃ lokanāyakaṃ;
analyzed: bhavanā abhinikkhamma addasam lokanāyakam
translated: I saw the Leader of the world,🔽shining like a blue lotus,

original: Indīvaraṃva jalitaṃ, ādittaṃva hutāsanaṃ.
analyzed: indīvaram iva jalitam ādittam iva hutāsanam
translated: like a fire on an altar.🔽“I saw a flower

original: “Vicinaṃ naddasaṃ pupphaṃ, pūjayissanti nāyakaṃ;
analyzed: vicinam naddasam puppham pūjayissanti nāyakam
translated: which they were offering to the Leader;🔽I gladdened my own heart

original: Sakaṃ cittaṃ pasādetvā, avandiṃ satthuno ahaṃ.
analyzed: sakam cittam pasādetvā avandim satthunaḥ aham
translated: and worshipped the Teacher.🔽“Taking a gem from my head,

original: “Mama sīse maṇiṃ gayha, pūjayiṃ lokanāyakaṃ;
analyzed: mama sīse maṇim loka nāyakam
translated: I worshipped the Leader of the world;🔽by this gem-worship

original: Imāya maṇipūjāya, vipāko hotu bhaddako.
analyzed: imāya maṇi pūjāya vipākaḥ hotu bhaddakaḥ
translated: may I have a good destiny.🔽“Padumuttara, who knew the world,

original: “Padumuttaro lokavidū, āhutīnaṃ paṭiggaho;
analyzed: padumuttaraḥ loka vidū āhutīnam paṭiggahaḥ
translated: who received offerings,🔽the Teacher, standing in the air,

original: Antalikkhe ṭhito satthā, imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsatha.
analyzed: antalikkhe ṭhitaḥ satthā imam gātham abhāsatha
translated: spoke this verse:🔽“May your wish be fulfilled;

original: “So te ijjhatu saṅkappo, labhassu vipulaṃ sukhaṃ;
analyzed: saḥ te saṅkappaḥ labhassu vipulam sukham
translated: may you obtain great happiness;

original: Imāya maṇipūjāya, anubhohi mahāyasaṃ.
analyzed: imāya maṇi pūjāya anubhohi mahā āyasam
translated: Through this jewel-worship, experience great glory.

original: “Idaṃ vatvāna bhagavā, jalajuttamanāmako;
analyzed: idam vatvāna bhagavā jalajuttama nāmakaḥ
translated: Having spoken thus, the Fortunate One, the one called the best of bipeds,

original: Agamāsi buddhaseṭṭho, yattha cittaṃ paṇīhitaṃ.
analyzed: agamāsi buddha seṭṭhaḥ yattha cittam paṇīhitam
translated: The highest Buddha, went to where the mind was well-placed.

original: “Saṭṭhikappāni devindo, devarajjamakārayiṃ;🔽Anekasatakkhattuñca, cakkavattī ahosahaṃ.
analyzed: saṭṭhi kappāni devindo deva rajjam akārayim  aneka sata kkhattum ca cakkavattī ahosaham
translated: For sixty aeons the Lord of the Gods, I ruled as King of the Gods,🔽And for many hundreds of times, I was a King who rules the world.

original: “Pubbakammaṃ sarantassa, devabhūtassa me sato;
analyzed: pubba kammam sarantassa deva bhūtassa me sataḥ
translated: Remembering my past deeds, while I was existing as a god,

original: Maṇi nibbattate mayhaṃ, ālokakaraṇo mamaṃ.
analyzed: nibbattate mayham āloka karaṇaḥ mamam
translated: A jewel was produced for me, which was a light to me.

original: “Chaḷasītisahassāni, nāriyo me pariggahā;🔽Vicittavatthābharaṇā, āmukkamaṇikuṇḍalā.
analyzed: chaḷasīti sahassāni nāriyaḥ me pariggahā  vicitta vattha ābharaṇā āmukka maṇi kuṇḍalā
translated: Sixty-eight thousand women were my possessions,🔽With various clothes and ornaments, with necklaces and earrings.

original: “Aḷārapamhā hasulā, susaññā tanumajjhimā;
analyzed: aḷārapamhā hasulā susaññā tanumajjhimā
translated: With slender waists and well-proportioned bodies,

original: Parivārenti maṃ niccaṃ, maṇipūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: parivārenti mam niccam phalam
translated: They always attended on me, this is the fruit of the jewel-worship.

original: “Soṇṇamayā maṇimayā, lohitaṅkamayā tathā;

original: brāhmaṇakule nibbattitvā vassikoti laddhanāmo vayappatto satthu yamakapāṭihāriyaṃ🔽disvā paṭiladdhasaddho pabbajitvā samaṇadhammaṃ karonto ābādhiko ahosi. Atha naṃ
analyzed: brāhmaṇa kule nibbattitvā vassikaḥ iti laddha nāmaḥ vaya patto satthu yamaka pāṭihāriyam  disvā paṭiladdha saddhaḥ pabbajitvā samaṇa dhammam karontaḥ ābādhikaḥ ahosi atha nam

original: ñātakā vejjaparidiṭṭhena bhesajjavidhinā upaṭṭhahitvā arogamakaṃsu. So tamhā ābādhā
analyzed: ñātakāḥ vejja paridiṭṭhena bhesajja vidhinā upaṭṭhahitvā arogam akaṃsu saḥ tamhā ābādhā

original: vuṭṭhito saṃvegajāto bhāvanaṃ ussukkāpetvā chaḷabhiñño ahosi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: vuṭṭhitaḥ saṃvega jātaḥ bhāvanam ussukkāpetvā chaḍabhiññaḥ ahosi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: he was filled with remorse and applied himself to meditation with such diligence that he attained the six super-knowledges. Therefore it is said in the Apadana:

analyzed: vanantare buddham disvā attha dassim mahā āyasam
translated: “Having seen the Buddha in the forest, the bestower of welfare, of great glory,

original: “Aṭṭhārase kappasate, yaṃ phalaṃ adadiṃ tadā;
analyzed: aṭṭhārase kappa sate yam phalam adadim tadā
translated: “For eighteen hundred eons, I did not recall having given that fruit;

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, phaladānassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi phala dānassa idam phalam
translated: I do not recall any state of woe. This is the fruit of giving a fruit.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements are destroyed… I have fulfilled the Teacher’s bidding.”

original: Chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā ākāsena ñātakānaṃ santike gantvā ākāse ṭhito dhammaṃ desetvā
analyzed: chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā ākāsena ñātakānam santike gantvā ākāse ṭhitaḥ dhammam desetvā

analyzed: te saraṇesu sīlesu ca patiṭṭhāpesi tesu keci saraṇesu sīlesu ca patiṭṭhita ttā  sagge nibbattiṃsu atha nam satthā buddhupaṭṭhānam upagatam kim te vassika ñātīnam
translated: and established them in the Refuges and Precepts. Some of them died, and because they had been established in the Refuges and Precepts🔽they were reborn in heaven. Then the Teacher, who had gone to the monastery, asked him, “What is the health of your kinsmen,

original: ārogya”nti pucchi. So ñātīnaṃ attanā kataṃ upakāraṃ satthu kathento –
analyzed: ārogyanti pucchi saḥ ñātīnam attanā katam upakāram satthu kathentaḥ
translated: Vassakāra?” He, telling the Teacher the service he had done to his kinsmen,

original: “Ekopi saddho medhāvī, assaddhānīdha ñātinaṃ;
analyzed: ekaḥ upi saddhaḥ medhāvī ñātinam
translated: “One who is faithful and wise, here in the world, to his faithless kinsmen,

original: Dhammaṭṭho sīlasampanno, hoti atthāya bandhunaṃ.
analyzed: dhammaṭṭhaḥ sīla sampanno hoti atthāya bandhunaṃ
translated: who is firm in Dhamma, and endowed with virtue, is for the benefit of his kinsmen.

original: “Niggayha anukampāya, coditā ñātayo mayā;
analyzed: niggayha anukampāya coditāḥ ñātayaḥ mayā
translated: “Having chosen them with compassion, my kinsmen were exhorted by me;

original: Ñātibandhavapemena, kāraṃ katvāna bhikkhusu.
analyzed: ñāti bandhava pemena kāram katvāna bhikkhusu
translated: through love for my kinsmen and relatives, having done service to the monks,

analyzed: te kālaṅkatā pattā te tidivam sukham
translated: “They, having passed away, having died, have attained happiness in heaven;

analyzed: bhātaraḥ mayham mātā ca modanti kāma kāminā uti
translated: my brothers and my mother rejoice, enjoying sensual pleasures as they will.”

original: Tisso gāthā abhāsi.
analyzed: tissaḥ gāthāḥ abhāsi
translated: he spoke these three verses.

original: Tatthāyaṃ paṭhamagāthāya attho – yo kammaphalasaddhāya ca ratanattayasaddhāya ca
analyzed: tattha ayam paṭhama gāthāya atthaḥ yaḥ kamma phala saddhāya ca rata nattaya saddhāya ca
translated: Here is the meaning of the first verse: One who has faith in the results of kamma and faith in the Three Jewels,

original: vasena saddho, tato eva kammassakatañāṇādiyogato medhāvī, satthu ovādadhamme navalokuttaradhamme

original: ca ṭhitattā dhammaṭṭho, ācārasīlassa maggasīlassa phalasīlassa ca vasena sīlasampanno,
analyzed: ca ṭhita ttā dhammaṭṭho ācāra sīlassa magga sīlassa phala sīlassa ca vasena sīla sampanno

original: so ekopi yathāvuttāya saddhāya abhāvena assaddhānaṃ idha imasmiṃ loke “amhākaṃ ime”ti🔽ñātabbaṭṭhena ñātīnaṃ, tathā pemabandhanena bandhanaṭṭhena “bandhū”ti ca laddhanāmānaṃ
analyzed: saḥ ekaḥ api yathāvuttāya saddhāya abhāvena idha imasmin loke amhākam ime iti  ñātabba ṭṭhena ñātīnam tathā pema bandhanena bandhana ṭṭhena ca laddha nāmānam
translated: He is for the welfare of his kinsmen, i.e., of his relatives, who are called “kinsmen” in the sense of being known as “ours” in this world, because of the absence of faith as described above.🔽And he is for the welfare of his friends, who are called “friends” in the sense of being bound by the tie of love.

original: bandhavānaṃ atthāya hitāya hotīti.
analyzed: bandhavānam atthāya hitāya hoti iti
translated: He is for the welfare and happiness of both kinsmen and friends.

original: Evaṃ sādhāraṇato vuttamatthaṃ attūpanāyikaṃ katvā dassetuṃ “niggayhā”tiādinā itaragāthā🔽vuttā. Tattha niggayha anukampāya, coditā ñātayo mayāti idānipi duggatā kusalaṃ akatvā
analyzed: evam sādhāraṇataḥ vutta attham attūpanāyikam katvā dassetum niggayha ati ādinā itara gāthā  vuttā tattha niggayha anukampāya coditāḥ ñātayaḥ mayā ati duggatā kusalam a katvā
translated: In order to show the meaning stated in the above verse in terms of one’s own welfare, the other verse beginning with “Having restrained” was uttered.🔽There, having restrained, out of compassion, my kinsmen and friends who were exhorted by me, even now, not having done good,

translated: “Again” is merely a particle. “The three heavens’ happiness”: the happiness included in the heavenly world, or the happiness that is desirable.

analyzed: tidivam adhigatā ke pana te iti āha bhātaraḥ mayham mātā ca modanti kāma kāminā uti

analyzed: attanā yathā kāmita vatthu kāma samaṅginaḥ hutvā abhiramanti iti atthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they are delighting in having obtained the sensual pleasures they desired.

original: Vassikattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vassikatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Vassika is finished.

analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinantaḥ vipassissa bhagavato kāle ārāma gopaka kule
translated: Having thus made merit, he was reborn in various happy states of existence, and in the time of the exalted Vipassī he was reborn in the family of the superintendent of a monastery.

analyzed: nibbattitvā viññutam pattaḥ eka divasam vipassim bhagavantam ākāsena gacchantam disvā
translated: Having attained maturity, he one day saw the exalted Vipassī passing through the air,

analyzed: pasanna mānasaḥ labuja phalam adāsi
translated: and with a devout heart he gave him a lotus-bud.

analyzed: kevaṭṭa gāme pañca kula sata jeṭṭhakassa kevaṭṭassa puttaḥ hutvā nibbatti yasojotissa  nāmam akaṃsu saḥ vaya pattaḥ attanaḥ sahāyehi kevaṭṭa puttehi saddhim maccha gahaṇa attham
translated: in the family of a fisherman, the chief of five hundred families. He was the son of the fisherman Yasa.🔽His name was Yasa. When he had attained maturity, he one day threw his net in the river Aciravatī in order to catch fish,

analyzed: tam te raññaḥ pasenadissa dassesum rājā imassa suvaṇṇa vaṇṇassa macchassa vaṇṇa kāraṇam

analyzed: bhagavā jānāti iti maccham gāhāpetvā bhagavataḥ dassesi bhagavā ayam kassapassa sammāsambuddhassa

translated: Therefore it is said:🔽“I was a gardener then,

translated: Who was walking without faltering.🔽“Taking a lotus flower,

translated: I offered it to the best of Buddhas.🔽Standing in the air, he of great fame

translated: Accepted it.🔽“That knowledge of mine,

translated: With a mind full of faith,🔽“I attained then a vast joy,

analyzed: adhigañchim tadā pītim vipulam sukham uttamam
translated: The highest happiness.🔽The jewel arose again and again

analyzed: ekanavutitaḥ kappe yam phalam adadim tadā
translated: “For ninety-one cycles of time, the fruit that I gave then,

translated: I do not recall any bad destination, this is the fruit of giving the fruit.

translated: “My defilements have been burned away… and the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”

analyzed: chaḷabhiññam pana samānam sa parisam ā yasmantam yasojam satthā pakkositvā āneñja samāpattinā
translated: But when the venerable Yasa had attained the six super-knowledges, the Teacher, after summoning him with his retinue,

analyzed: paṭisanthāram akāsi saḥ sabbe api dhutaṅga dhamme samādāya vattati tena assa sarīram kisam

analyzed: ahosi lūkham dubbaṇṇam tam bhagavā param appiccha tāya pasaṃsantaḥ
translated: and haggard and ugly. The Blessed One, praising him for his extreme contentment,

translated: is yours alone: what lack of respect towards me occurs in you today is yours alone; you will experience the fruit of that🔽by yourself, not I. The meaning is, but as for me,

analyzed: sahassa kkhattum devindaḥ deva rajjam karissati
translated: six-hundred times he will be the lord of the devas, the king of the devas.

original: “Devarājena pattabbaṃ, sabbaṃ paṭilabhissati;
analyzed: devarājena pattabbam sabbam paṭilabhissati
translated: “Whatever is to be attained by the king of the devas, he will obtain all;

original: Anūnabhogo hutvāna, devarajjaṃ karissati.
analyzed: anūna bhogaḥ hutvāna deva rajjam karissati
translated: having enjoyed it without measure, he will rule as king of the devas.

original: “Sahassakkhattuṃ cakkavattī, rājā raṭṭhe bhavissati.
analyzed: sahassa kkhattum cakkavattī rājā raṭṭhe bhavissati
translated: “Six-hundred times he will be a wheel-turning monarch, a king in the realm.

original: Pathabyā rajjaṃ vipulaṃ, gaṇanāto asaṅkhiyaṃ.
analyzed: pathabyāḥ rajjam vipulam gaṇanātaḥ asaṅkhiyam
translated: He will rule the earth, a vast kingdom, Incalculable in number.

original: “Kappasatasahassamhi, okkākakulasambhavo;
analyzed: kappa sata sahassamhi okkāka kula sambhavaḥ
translated: “In a hundred thousand eons, one born in the Okkāka family,

original: Gotamo nāma gottena, satthā loke bhavissati.
analyzed: gotamaḥ nāma gottena satthā loke bhavissati
translated: Will be a teacher in the world, named Gotama by clan.

original: “Tassa dhammesu dāyādo, oraso dhammanimmito;
analyzed: tassa dhammesu dāyādaḥ orasaḥ dhamma nimmito
translated: “A heir to his Dhamma, a product of the Dhamma,

original: Upāli nāma nāmena, hessati satthu sāvako.
analyzed: upāli nāma nāmena hessati satthu sāvakaḥ
translated: Will be a disciple of the teacher named Upāli.

original: “Vinaye pāramiṃ patvā, ṭhānāṭhāne ca kovido;
analyzed: vinaye pāramim patvā ṭhāna aṭhāne ca kovidaḥ
translated: “Having reached perfection in the Monastic Law, skilled in what is and is not the case,

original: Jinasāsanaṃ dhārento, viharissatināsavo.
analyzed: jina sāsanam dhārentaḥ
translated: Bearing the Jina’s Dispensation, he will live without defilements.

original: “Sabbametaṃ abhiññāya, gotamo sakyapuṅgavo;
analyzed: sabbam etam abhiññāya gotamaḥ sakya puṅgavaḥ
translated: “Having directly known all this, Gotama, the chief of the Sakyans,

original: Bhikkhusaṅghe nisīditvā, etadagge ṭhapessati.
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅghe nisīditvā etad agge ṭhapessati
translated: Sitting in the Community of monks, will place him at the head.

original: “Aparimeyyupādāya, patthemi tava sāsanaṃ;
analyzed: aparimeyī upādāya patthemi tava sāsanam
translated: “Having taken the immeasurable, I aspire to your Dispensation.

original: So me attho anuppatto, sabbasaṃyojanakkhayo.
analyzed: saḥ me atthaḥ an uppattaḥ sabba saṃyojana kkhayo
translated: That aim of mine has been reached, the destruction of all fetters.

original: “Yathā sūlāvuto poso, rājadaṇḍena tajjito;
analyzed: yathā sūlāvutaḥ posaḥ rāja daṇḍena tajjitaḥ
translated: “Just as a man impaled on a stake, struck by the king’s punishment,

original: Sūle sātaṃ avindanto, parimuttiṃva icchati.
analyzed: sūle sātam a vindantaḥ parimuttiṃvas icchati
translated: Not finding pleasure on the stake, desires only to be freed,

original: “Tathevāhaṃ mahāvīra, bhavadaṇḍena tajjito;
analyzed: tathā iva aham mahā vīra bhavat aṇḍena tajjitaḥ
translated: “So too, great hero, struck by the punishment of existence,

analyzed: santaḥ pipāsā vedanā ṭṭitaḥ
translated: Impaled on the stake of deeds, I am freed from the pain of thirst.

analyzed: bhave sātam na vindāmi ḍayhantaḥ tīhi aggibhi
translated: “I find no joy in existence, burning with three fires,

original: Parimuttiṃ gavesāmi, yathāpi rājadaṇḍito.
analyzed: parimuttim gavesāmi yathā api rāja daṇḍitaḥ
translated: I seek for deliverance, as from a royal punishment.

original: “Yathā visādo puriso, visena paripīḷito;
analyzed: yathā visādaḥ purisaḥ visena paripīḍitaḥ
translated: “Just as a man who is depressed, afflicted by poison,

original: Agadaṃ so gaveseyya, visaghātāyupālanaṃ.
analyzed: agadam saḥ gaveseyya visa ghāta āyu pālanam
translated: would seek an antidote, to save his life from the poison,

original: “Gavesamāno passeyya, agadaṃ visaghātakaṃ;
analyzed: gavesamāno passeyya agadam visa ghātakam
translated: “while seeking, he would see an antidote, which would destroy the poison,

original: Taṃ pivitvā sukhī assa, visamhā parimuttiyā.

translated: having drunk it, he would be happy, delivered from the poison.

original: “Tathevāhaṃ mahāvīra, yathā visahato naro;
analyzed: tathā iva aham mahāvīra yathā
translated: “Just so, Great Hero, as a man who is poisoned,

original: Sampīḷito avijjāya, saddhammāgadamesahaṃ.
analyzed: sampīḍitaḥ avijjāya
translated: afflicted by ignorance, I sought the medicine of the true Dhamma.

analyzed: dhammāgadam gavesantaḥ addakkhim sakya sāsanam
translated: “Seeking the medicine of the Dhamma, I saw the Sakyan’s teaching,

original: Aggaṃ sabbosadhānaṃ taṃ, sabbasallavinodanaṃ.
analyzed: aggam sabba usadhānam tam sabba salla vinodanam
translated: the best of all medicines, which removes all the darts.

original: “Dhammosadhaṃ pivitvāna, visaṃ sabbaṃ samūhaniṃ;
analyzed: dhammosadham pivitvāna visam sabbam samūhanim
translated: “Having drunk the medicine of the Dhamma, I removed all the poison,

translated: I experienced the state of coolness, the deathless, Nibbāna.

original: “Yathā bhūtaṭṭito poso, bhūtaggāhena pīḷito;
analyzed: yathā bhūta ṭṭitaḥ posaḥ bhūta ggāhena pīḍitaḥ

analyzed: gavesamānaḥ passeyya bhūta vijjāsu kovidam
translated: “While seeking, he would see a skilled bhūta doctor,

analyzed: tassa saḥ vihane bhūtam sa mūlam ca vināsaye
translated: He will destroy what is destroyed, and will uproot it.

original: “Tathevāhaṃ mahāvīra, tamaggāhena pīḷito;
analyzed: tathā iva aham mahāvīra tamaggāhena pīḍitaḥ
translated: “So too, O Great Hero, I, being oppressed by the burden,

analyzed: ñāṇa ālokam gavesāmi tam atas parimuttiyā
translated: I seek the light of knowledge, for the sake of deliverance from it.

original: “Athaddasaṃ sakyamuniṃ, kilesatamasodhanaṃ;
analyzed: sakya munim kilesa tamasa dhanam

translated: I removed all existence, like a physician removes (a disease) from the root.

original: “Garuḷo yathā opatati, pannagaṃ bhakkhamattano;
analyzed: garuḷaḥ yathā opatati pannagam bhakkha mattano
translated: “Just as the garuḍa swoops down, to eat the nāga,

original: Samantā yojanasataṃ, vikkhobheti mahāsaraṃ.
analyzed: samantā yojana satam vikkhobheti mahā saram
translated: (And) the great wave shakes all around a hundred leagues.

original: “Pannagaṃ so gahetvāna, adhosīsaṃ viheṭhayaṃ;
analyzed: pannagam saḥ gahetvāna adhosīsam viheṭhayam
translated: “Having seized the nāga, and striking it on the head,

analyzed: ādāya saḥ pakkamati yenakāmam vihaṅgamaḥ
translated: The bird-man takes it and goes wherever he wishes.

original: “Tathevāhaṃ mahāvīra, yathāpi garuḷo balī;
analyzed: tathā iva aham mahā vīra yathā api garuḷaḥ balī
translated: “So too, O Great Hero, just like the powerful garuḍa,

original: Asaṅkhataṃ gavesanto, dose vikkhālayiṃ ahaṃ.
analyzed: asaṅkhatam gavesantaḥ dose vikkhālayim aham
translated: Seeking the unconditioned, I shook off hatred.

original: “Diṭṭho ahaṃ dhammavaraṃ, santipadamanuttaraṃ;
analyzed: diṭṭhaḥ aham dhamma varam santi padam anuttaram
translated: “I saw the supreme Dhamma, the unsurpassed state of peace;

analyzed: ādāya viharāma etam garuḷaḥ pannagam yathā
translated: Having taken it, I live by it, like the garuḍa with the nāga.

original: “Āsāvatī nāma latā, jātā cittalatāvane;
analyzed: āsāvatī nāma latā jātā citta latā vane
translated: “The creeper called ‘Hope’ grows in the Citta Grove.

original: Tassā vassasahassena, ekaṃ nibbattate phalaṃ.
analyzed: tassā vassa sahassena ekam nibbattate phalam
translated: For a thousand years it bears no fruit.

original: “Taṃ devā payirupāsanti, tāvadūraphale sati;
analyzed: tam devāḥ payiḥ upāsanti tāvat dūra phale sati
translated: “The gods worship it when the fruit is ripe.

original: Devānaṃ sā piyā evaṃ, āsāvatī latuttamā.
analyzed: sā piyā evam āsāvatī

original: “Satasahassupādāya, tāhaṃ paricare muni;
analyzed: tā aham paricare muni
translated: “For a hundred thousand years I served the Sage.

original: Sāyaṃ pātaṃ namassāmi, devā āsāvatiṃ yathā.
analyzed: sāyam pātam namassāmi devau āsāvatim yathā
translated: I worship him in the morning and evening as the gods do Hope.

original: “Avañjhā pāricariyā, amoghā ca namassanā;
analyzed: avañjhā pāricariyā amoghā ca namassanā
translated: “My service was not in vain, my worship was not in vain.

original: Dūrāgatampi maṃ santaṃ, khaṇoyaṃ na virādhayi.🔽“Paṭisandhiṃ na passāmi, vicinanto bhave ahaṃ;
analyzed: dūra āgatam pi mam santam na virādhayi  paṭisandhim na passāmi vicinantaḥ bhave aham
translated: Though I came from afar, the Sage did not reject me.🔽“I do not see rebirth, though I search for it in the realms of existence.

original: Nirūpadhi vippamutto, upasanto carāmahaṃ.
analyzed: nirūpadhi vippamuttaḥ upasantaḥ carāmaham
translated: Free from attachment, liberated, I live in peace.

original: “Yathāpi padumaṃ nāma, sūriyaraṃsena pupphati;
analyzed: yathā api padumam nāma sūriya raṃsena pupphati
translated: “Just as a lotus is opened by the sun’s rays,

original: Tathevāhaṃ mahāvīra, buddharaṃsena pupphito.
analyzed: tathā iva aham mahāvīra buddha raṃsena pupphitaḥ
translated: so I have blossomed, O Great Hero, by the rays of the Buddha.

original: “Yathā balākayonimhi, na vijjati pumo sadā;🔽Meghesu gajjamānesu, gabbhaṃ gaṇhanti tā sadā.
analyzed: yathā balāka yonimhi na vijjati pumo sadā  meghesu gajjamānesu gabbham gaṇhanti tā sadā
translated: “Just as in the womb of a she-fish there is never a male,🔽but when the clouds are thundering, they conceive.

original: “Cirampi gabbhaṃ dhārenti, yāva megho na gajjati;
analyzed: ciram pi gabbham dhārenti yāva meghaḥ na gajjati
translated: “They carry the embryo for a long time, until the clouds thunder.

original: Bhārato parimuccanti, yadā megho pavassati.
analyzed: parimuccanti yadā meghaḥ pavassati

original: “Padumuttarabuddhassa, dhammameghena gajjato;
analyzed: padumuttara buddhassa dhamma meghena gajjataḥ
translated: “When Padumuttara Buddha, thundering with the cloud of Dhamma,

analyzed: saddena dhammameghassa dhamma gabbham agaṇhaham
translated: I received the Dhamma-child with the sound of the cloud of Dhamma.

original: “Satasahassupādāya, puññagabbhaṃ dharemahaṃ;
analyzed: sata sahassa upādāya puñña gabbham dharema aham
translated: “Having received a hundred thousand, I bear the Dhamma-child;

original: Nappamuccāmi bhārato, dhammamegho na gajjati.
analyzed: na ppamuccāmi bhārataḥ dhamma meghaḥ na gajjati
translated: I am not freed from the burden, the cloud of Dhamma does not thunder.

original: “Yadā tuvaṃ sakyamuni, ramme kapilavatthave;
analyzed: yadā tuvam sakya muni ramme kapilavatthave
translated: “When you, the Sage of the Sakyans, in the delightful Kapilavatthu,

original: Gajjasi dhammameghena, bhārato parimuccahaṃ.
analyzed: gajjasi dhamma meghena bhārato
translated: You thunder with the cloud of Dhamma, I am freed from the burden.

original: “Suññataṃ animittañca, tathāppaṇihitampi ca;
analyzed: animittam ca ca
translated: “The void, the signless, and also the desireless,

original: Caturo ca phale sabbe, dhammevaṃ vijanayiṃ ahaṃ.
analyzed: caturaḥ ca phale sabbe dhamma ivam vijanayim aham
translated: And all the four fruits, I have thus understood the Dhamma.

original: “Aparimeyyupādāya, patthemi tava sāsanaṃ;
analyzed: aparimeyī upādāya patthemi tava sāsanam
translated: “Having received the immeasurable, I aspire to your teaching;

original: So me attho anuppatto, santipadamanuttaraṃ.
analyzed: saḥ me atthaḥ an uppattaḥ santi padam anuttaram
translated: That purpose of mine has been attained, the unsurpassed state of peace.

original: “Vinaye pāramiṃ patto, yathāpi pāṭhiko isi;
analyzed: vinaye pāramim pattaḥ yathā api pāṭhikaḥ isi
translated: “I have reached perfection in the Monastic Law, just as the sage Pāṭika did;

original: Na me samasamo atthi, dhāremi sāsanaṃ ahaṃ.
analyzed: na me samasamaḥ atthi dhāremi sāsanam aham
translated: There is no one equal to me, I bear the teaching.

original: “Vinaye khandhake cāpi, tikacchede ca pañcake;
analyzed: vinaye khandhake ca api tika chede ca pañcake
translated: “In the Monastic Law and in the Khandhakas, in the three-part and five-part summaries,

original: Ettha me vimati natthi, akkhare byañjanepi vā.
analyzed: ettha me vimati na atthi akkhare byañjane pi vā
translated: I have no doubt, in the syllables or the words.

original: “Niggahe paṭikamme ca, ṭhānāṭhāne ca kovido;
analyzed: niggahe paṭikamme ca ṭhāna aṭhāne ca kovidaḥ
translated: “In the laying down, in the re-establishment, in the place, and in the non-place,

analyzed: osāraṇe vuṭṭhāpane sabbattha pāramim gataḥ
translated: In the lifting, in the emerging, everywhere I have gone to the end.

original: “Vinaye khandhake vāpi, nikkhipitvā padaṃ ahaṃ;
analyzed: vinaye khandhake vā api nikkhipitvā padam aham
translated: “Having placed the step in the Monastic Law or in the Khandhakas,

original: Ubhato viniveṭhetvā, rasato osareyyahaṃ.
analyzed: ubhatas viniveṭhetvā rasataḥ osareyyaham
translated: Having turned back on both sides, I would emerge with the flavor.

original: “Niruttiyā sukusalo, atthānatthe ca kovido;
analyzed: niruttiyā su kusalaḥ attha anatthe ca kovidaḥ
translated: “I am very skilled in the language, and in the meaning and the non-meaning,

original: Anaññātaṃ mayā natthi, ekaggo satthu sāsane.
analyzed: an aññātam mayā na atthi ekaggaḥ satthu sāsane
translated: There is nothing unknown to me, I am alone in the Teacher’s instruction.

original: “Rūpadakkho ahaṃ ajja, sakyaputtassa sāsane;
analyzed: rūpa dakkhaḥ aham ajja sakya puttassa sāsane
translated: “I am skilled in the form today, in the instruction of the Buddha’s son;

original: Kaṅkhaṃ sabbaṃ vinodemi, chindāmi sabbasaṃsayaṃ.
analyzed: kaṅkham sabbam vinodemi chindāmi sabba saṃsayam
translated: I remove all doubt, I cut through all uncertainty.

original: “Padaṃ anupadañcāpi, akkharañcāpi byañjanaṃ;
analyzed: padam anupadam ca api akkharam ca api byañjanam
translated: “In the step and in the half-step, in the syllable and in the prefix,

original: Nidāne pariyosāne, sabbattha kovido ahaṃ.
analyzed: nidāne pariyosāne sabbattha kovidaḥ aham
translated: In the introduction and in the conclusion, everywhere I am skilled.

original: “Yathāpi rājā balavā, niggaṇhitvā parantape;
analyzed: yathā api rājā balavā niggaṇhitvā parantape
translated: “Just as a powerful king, having conquered his enemies,

original: Vijinitvāna saṅgāmaṃ, nagaraṃ tattha māpaye.
analyzed: vijinitvāna saṅgāmam nagaram tattha māpaye
translated: Having won the battle, builds a city there,

original: “Pākāraṃ parikhañcāpi, esikaṃ dvārakoṭṭhakaṃ;
analyzed: pākāram parikhan ca api esikam dvāra koṭṭhakam
translated: “A wall and a moat, and also a watchtower and a gatehouse,

original: Aṭṭālake ca vividhe, kāraye nagare bahū.
analyzed: aṭṭālake ca vividhe nagare

original: “Siṅghāṭakaṃ caccarañca, suvibhattantarāpaṇaṃ;
analyzed: siṅghāṭakam caccaran ca suvibhatta antarāpaṇam
translated: “A market place and a street, a very well-planned thoroughfare,

original: Kārayeyya sabhaṃ tattha, atthānatthavinicchayaṃ.
analyzed: kārayeyya sabham tattha attha anattha vinicchayam

original: “Nigghātatthaṃ amittānaṃ, chiddāchiddañca jānituṃ;
analyzed: nigghāta attham amittānam chiddāchiddam ca jānitum
translated: “To drive away his enemies, to know the weak and strong points of his people,

original: Balakāyassa rakkhāya, senāpaccaṃ ṭhapeti so.
analyzed: balakāyassa rakkhāya senāpaccam ṭhapeti so
translated: and to protect his army, he appoints a commander of the forces.

original: “Ārakkhatthāya bhaṇḍassa, nidhānakusalaṃ naraṃ;
analyzed: ārakkha atthāya bhaṇḍassa nidhāna kusalam naram
translated: “To protect his wealth, a man skilled in storing it,

analyzed: mā me bhaṇḍam vinassi iti bhaṇḍa rakkham ṭhapeti so
